review_content: Let me get one thing straight, people... The staff at B Historic Savannah is hands-down the sole reason I am coming back. Savannah is a beautiful town; the history, the food, the people... But it was because of Quincy Jones and Tim Rackley at the front desk of B Historic Savannah that this trip took a step up from awesome to EPIC.It's not always about getting the most expensive hotel in order to get the best service.  I booked my stay through Kayak, which utilized the price found on some unknown "getaroom.com" website. This unknown company screwed up both my and another person's reservations, but both Tim and Quincy called the company and made sure that they made us a priority. I work in customer service managing apartment communities, and I know the difference of "above and beyond". Tim and Quincy certainly went the extra mile to make sure that everything was in order for my stay.So I challenge you to find a staff that could make your stay EPIC in a hotel that is under construction (can't wait to see the renovations), busy, and who is not sent reservation info by the booking site...  Tim and Quincy not only met this challenge, but turned it into an opportunity to stand out from others, and procure a customer for life. Thanks for everything you've done, guys!!  You are EPIC!We stayed at B from the 24th-26th. There was nothing about the room that i liked. We arrived as a late check in and were told there was additional $12 per night we had to pay for parking. i thought that should be an expense of the hotel especially because they had no other parking. on the walk to the room everything was ratchet looking from the elevators to the plastic on the walls . The hotel said it was being renovated. I wish they would have started with our room first. We just wanted to shower and go to sleep. When i got into the shower it wasnt clean. There  was dirt in the shower and someone else hair on the wall.  Under the pillow in one of our beds was a brown stain no clue what that was and there were a lot of stands on that sticky carpet. Its 2015 and i didnt know there was still hotels that were connected by the door in the middle. The walls were paper thin and there was a really loud guy that was on the phone all night we heard everything and when we left the room to go get waters from the corner store this guy came out of the room and peeked. After remedying the issues ourselves we went to sleep. The next day housekeeping knocked on the door multiple times and i told the lady at that point we were still sleep and in the bed and we didn't want anything we were tired. An hour later when i was butt naked getting out of the shower the same lady walked into our room. I had to tell her again we didnt want room service while standing dripping wet coming out of the bathroom door. . 30 mins later another house keeper came to the door with a box with trail mix, water and something else in it. Im not sure why they didnt understand we were upset and just wanted to be left alone. We were so upset about everything we ended up checking out at like 3 in the morning and going to a family member house for the rest of the trip and we were still charged for 2 days,.Nice hotel.  Ever so slightly off the beaten path, but only by a few blocks. Close to the Savannah welcome center and the location where most of the trolly tours leave from.  Room was very clean. Updated furnishings. Nice bedding and linens. Bathroom was also very clean and updated. They offer Aveda products which was a treat. The common areas were lovely.  Bring a deck of cards to play at one of the tables! Overall a very good value and pleasant experience.HORRIBLE!!! A disgrace to this hotel group! This hotel used to be some other mediocre hotel but recently changed ownership. The lobby is really appealing, but that's it. The lady who checked me in was so rude! She was annoyed that she had to check me in instead of texting on her phone which she kept out at the desk and checked twice while checking me in. After check in, I went to go park my car downstairs in this tiny little garage under the hotel. There's probably 10 parking spots total and they are so tight that I couldn't even get my little Audi A4 into the spot. The garage smelled so bad of cigarettes that the smell invaded my car.  I went back up to the desk and asked what I was supposed to do about parking and they gave me a tap card for a garage across the street. I went to go move my car from that impossible spot downstairs and I was trapped between a pole on my side and a huge wall behind me. I had to make a 16 point turn with guidance to get out of that spot without destroying my car. I then went up to my room. 3rd floor, elevator opens and the hallway smells a little stale, the floor has outdated carpets, but other than that it's fine. Open the room and the carpets are disgusting. Black and brown stains all over the floor. Chipped and dirty furniture, stains on the yellow plaid curtains and a lumpy bed. Whatever though we aren't here for the hotel, we are here for the town. So we go out and Savannah is nice, we come back at night and get into our lumpy bed. The air conditioning is on, and so loud that it sounds like an airplane is landing in our room. I turn it off for peace and quiet. My fiance falls asleep fast, as usual, but I can't get to sleep. At around 1 am I try to turn the TV on, but there is no signal, just static, I tried messing with the TV a little, but nothing worked. So I just sat in the lumpy bed staring at the yellow plaid curtains for about an hour until it got so hot without the air conditioning that I was sweating. But of course the air conditioning on was so loud that I couldn't fall asleep. All in all I would have thrown a fit downstairs the morning of checkout if I wasn't so tired from not sleeping. I would never stay here. And I would never recommend it, I'm just trying to forget all about it.I can't rate a full 5 because the noise at 8:00 AM on a holiday from construction when you've been out partying all night doesn't help. They should have put guest away from the construction not the room in front of the construction area. Lovely hotel lovely staff and that's my only concern. I'll stay again only after the construction is over because I hate morning disturbance more than anythingThis place was pretty awesome for the price and location. It is walking distance from everything. We never drive our car during our stay due to how close it was to everything. The room was great size and bed was really comfy. Only thing I didn't like was the random stain on the carpet by the window, which they attempted to cover with the chair. Almost looked like a huge blood stain. There were also a few of my towels with what look like pubic hair. Not cool at all. The hotel is currently under construction they are refurbishing a lot of stuff. But I didn't hear any noiseCame to Savannah for a weekend getaway.  Spent a couple of nights at B Historic. First off, the staff is super friendly and very accommodating, but for good reason. The hotel itself has many problems. The original room we got stunk. Bad. We checked in late and were so tired we decided to ask for a new room in the morning. They accommodated us without an issue. The new room we got in the morning didn't smell, but the carpets were pretty disgusting. As well as the carpets on the lobby stairway. The tv in the room didn't work either.  When we called the front desk, the maintenance man came up immediately and fixed it.   Like I said, the workers there are fantastic. But management needs to pick up their game. There's plenty of hotels in Savannah. This one isn't too comfy.I stayed here two nights at the beginning of April and it was a great stay in the city of Savannah. I had been to Sav-town before but stayed elsewhere and far away from the city center. This hotel is situated only a few blocks away from everything (15 min walk tops!) When we got there on Friday afternoon, the woman that checked us in was so friendly and was very quick to assist us with the parking situation. You have to meter park at check in (kinda) and then they'll give you a card to get in and out of the parking garage across the street. It was really nice to offer it for a cheap fee because we had a half marathon to run that next am and needed to be efficient with being in and out. The rooms were average and I thought they could be updated a little but the bathroom was fine/clean as well. The only problem was the TV. I know, who watches TV on vacation? I do. I fall asleep to TV because it's my thing. There's didn't work at all and was in black and white. Very bizarre but an easy fix! I also got news that they're majorly renovating this summer so with that said, I will definitely recommend this place. Everyone was very inviting and hospitable! :)Nice location and reasonably priced. However, the walls here are pretty thin and I could hear some noise from the ongoing construction at the hotel. The wifi here was terrible: I couldn't even load my gmail from time to time. So if you're trying to work while you're in Savannah, this hotel might not be a good choicePrior reviews in regards to hotel in a negative way should be disregarded. Update bathrooms, clean rooms, and will def stay againBeautiful hotel that is in walking distance to the downtown area of Savannah.  It is situated right off the highway that exits onto the main road passing by the hotel. It is also a block away from the convention center. The hotel has a parking lot the you have to pay an additional $12 for. Now onto the accommodation.  The lobby/main entrance has a fireplace front desk, seating area and concierge service. Passed the fireplace is the eating area for the complimentary breakfast. All are a nice touch and very inviting feel. My room was clean and nicely decorated. The bathroom was functional and had all the amenities most decent hotels have.  I had two issues with the room and it was the loudness of the A/C unit. It gets extremely loud when it turns on, which was a problem to me when trying to sleep. The second issue was the sound from the road outside. I could hear the vehicles burrowing off the highway or down Montgomery Ave. I wanted to ask about getting both fix but I knew i was with a big group and the hotel was pack. Wasn't going to be able to move rooms and a couple other people complained about having problems with their A/C units. I stayed six nights. Split between location and the accommodation and the quality of the room, it's hard to say if I would recommend or stay at this hotel again.Cool place very historic looking area.  Just know that you don't need to pay for parking just look for a spot on the corner and your good.  Easy walk to the downtown area and waterfront. I'd come back here !!This is a beautiful hotel within walking distance to the conversion center and downtown Savannah.   We had two rooms; one for us and the other for my son and his family.   The rooms were clean, but the bed sheets were wrinkled and the bath towels were dirty.   We told the front desk and we got clean towels, but the sheets were never pressed.  We loved Savannah, but not the "B" Hotel.I really liked this hotel.  I know some reviews said it was dirty, etc.  I didn't find that to be the case at all.  Some of the carpets are stained, but it was a clean hotel.  My understanding is B Historic bought this a few years and is really turning it around.  Our room was fantastic.  5th floor, huge ceilings, we had a corner room with tons is light, nice bathroom, very quiet.  Savannah is so walkable, it was very easy to walk everywhere from the hotel.  We would absolutely stay here the next time we come to Savannah, especially for the price and would recommend this to anyone.  Really good experience!Great customer service, well located. I stayed in this hotel two nights (Dec 20 & 21) and I enjoyed it. Stylish & charming. Recommended.Stayed here for four nights. The lobby is very attractive and the front desk staff is super friendly. The beds/pillows were awesome, I slept very well. I'm also not sure what people are complaining about with the garage. We pulled up out front and were instructed to unload, then given a key card for the really nice garage across the street. Parking is $12 a night, which is to be expected in city hotel. The only downside was the house keeping. Our room was never cleaned after our first night and wasn't overly clean when we arrived.Stayed here only one night but wish we could have stayed longer. Great location and great room. Walking distance to a lot of the sights and nightlife. Parking is additional in a garage across the street. Would stay here again!Stayed one night and the room was reasonably priced, mostly clean (stain on carpet) and with handy parking for $12. Location was good for us since we were picking up a student.I've never stayed here BUT while reading reviews on other sites I noticed the hotel had changed owners and a few people mentioned construction.  So I found the actual website, got the phone number and called to verify.  (At the time I noted the nightly rate for our check in date was $99) I was greeted by a very rude reservation specialist who informed me that "whutnt no construction going in around here" and I was grossly misinformed. Soooo I ask well we were planning a visit... Gave him/her (I honestly don't know) the dates and inquired the price. I was told quite rudely (an after a very loud exasperated sigh) it would be $169.  When I said "wow why is it so much higher when your website says the same room is only $99" I was asked " then why didn't you just reserve online" to which I replied "looks like I won't be staying here thank you" prior to hanging up.   Great customer service.I stayed 2 nights with a tour group. The lobby is attractive and staff helpful. The halls smelled musty and the carpet was water stained. The faucet for the shower fell apart and I was unable to take a shower in the morning. They could not fix the shower, and we had to be moved. The breakfast was included for our tour.  The breakfast was adequate and there was always hot coffee. I would not recommend this hotel for anyone

Hotel is comfortable,  but the staff is not on their toes.   Had to ask for toilet paper twice.   We always tip the housekeeper, but this did not motivate him/her to empty all the trash cans, etc.Horrible hotel. Nasty, made me cringe.This is an old raggedy hotel that has the plate Hilton in it.Has mold in the restrooms, rooms are dirty, smells bad everywhere and the staff wasn't the best.I am a Diamond member so at the check in I asked for the courtesy snack, water.They denied saying my profile wasn't high enough. Lame excuse just to not go an extra step to oases the customer. And mind you, I spent 150-250 nights/year in this hotel chain.If you are around, don't come in here.It's not often I feel the need to rate hotels.  I try to just write positive reviews, and mainly I do because I generally frequent established and well-reputed businesses.  Such as Hilton properties.  Right?I booked this hotel for a three week business trip, but checked out after five days.  Honestly, if I hadn't been working such long hours, I probably would have checked out sooner.  I kept trying to convince myself the place was just old, not dirty...  But everyday I'd get the heeby jeebies just looking around the place.  Walk around in socks, or barefoot?  I think not.I had to leave and find a different hotel.Terrible experience. Never post on Yelp but I highly recommend not to stay there until Hilton fixes the issues there.It's summer in Savannah, GA so I took the best of the worst that was left for reservations. It's not the Ritz for certain. My ONE ISSUE which is unforgivable they let people return to the evening buffet style mixer with the same plate. No signs anywhere telling people to get a clean plate when they return. Major Health Code Fail. I actually spoke to the front desk and the guy heard me but did nothing about it.  I'm definitely reporting them to the Health Dept. Yuck!!Pass on this hotel. Booked a NON SMOKING room and I was given a non smoking room that when you open the door you are knocked down by the smoke smell. I went to front desk to change room and none were available. On the door and the one next door it has non smoking. To add insult we were looking for a plate and found a ash tray in the dishwasher. We bought odor eater and frebreze to try and help but not very effective. Sofa is so uncomfortable to sit on for long periods of time. I am a Hilton diamond member and this is the worst hotel stay I have had in a long time.This hotel gets 5 stars for their staff. Very friendly, helpful and just pleasant to be around.The hotel is very nice and clean. There is a main building with 3 floors in typical hotel style. Then a couple other buildings that have "pods" of rooms. If you don't like having an outside door ask to stay in building one. The rooms have a microwave, full refrigerator, and two stove top burners. There are also a couple grills outside you can cook on. There is a basketball/tennis court, a pool and a hot tub. The location is great - walking distance to grocery store (fresh market and publix!), Gigi's cupcakes, five guys and bonefish grill.It's also about a 10 min drive into the historic downtown savannah. And of course you have to love the free breakfast. Make your own waffles, eggs, breakfast meat, cereal, yogurt, etc. Weeknights they serve dinner.This location does not hold up to the normal level I am accustomed to for Homewood Suites.  The cleanliness is less then favorable.  The sink was slow to drain and I dared not research the reason.  Someone emptied the trash containers for the floor and decided to leave them in the hall for over 24 hours.  Six large bags of trash greeted me each time I returned to the room from the elevator.  The evening light meal was exactly that and only drinks were offered one evening.  Normal travel is work related and I'll likely pass on a retuned stay for this location.  The furniture was nice and the refrigerator was clean.  Didn't really trust the coffee maker though!WOW!!!! What a horrifying and unfortunate experience. I typically go out of my way to stay at Homewood Suites properties. I went out of my way this time & what a mistake!!! The hotel is fragmented into small buildings. All outdoor entrances & no elevators. The room was okay. Nothing major to complain about. It was the service or lack of that was downright awful. We were booked for 2 nights. After our first night, we left early to explore savannah. Upon our return later in the evening, we found the maid had been there but only made the bed. No clean towels. No replacement of coffee. The coffee pot wasn't cleaned. The garbage was taken out but no new bags in place. Old dirty glasses were still there. Basically the maid did nothing. We went to the front desk to complain & request the items were didn't have. A woman was also at the front desk. She had been there for 3 days & her room was never cleaned. Hey folks, this is hotel 101. Our first morning there was Christmas morning. We went to have the free breakfast. On Christmas morning they served tater tots & egg mc muffins. It was Christmas morning.  Maybe the food could have been stepped up for the holiday?? Overall it was a bad experience & somewhere we would never stay again. There are 4-5 other chain hotels right nearby. If you need to stay in that location, do yourself a favor & try one of those.My boyfriend and I loved staying here! We stayed on a Thursday night, then the following Friday night. On Thursday night, they served complimentary dinner and the food was pretty good. Much better than I would expect from a free driver from a hotel. And they serve dinner Monday through Thursday. I had never known a hotel to do that, so it was a pleasant surprise. Our room was another wonderful surprise. It was clean and very spacious. There were actually two separate rooms. The first room was a living room space with a mini kitchen. The kitchen included a fridge (with a freezer and ice maker), a stove, dishwasher, microwave, and utensils. On top of all that, there was a totally separate bedroom! The bed was comfortable, there was a tv in the bedroom and living room, and the bathroom was broken up into two sections. Long story short, there was a ton of space! The staff was very friendly and helpful. I had added the second night after I booked the first night, so I ended up with two separate reservations. I talked to the staff and asked if we could stay in the same room both nights, and they took care of it. They really helped make staying here a pleasant experience. I would love to come back again!Let's keep it to the point!The room was clean. The location was convenient, as I had no trouble getting to any of the places in Savannah that I wanted to see. The only big downside was that my room faced the road and, unfortunately, I could hear all the traffic passing by (even though I wasn't on the ground floor). Definitely not my ideal, since I'm a light sleeper.If I'd had a room that didn't face the road, I think it would've been almost perfect.The amenities here are really nice, and the beds are comfortable. I will however say, that part of the reason we booked here was because of the hot tub, and it broke just before we got here, and won't be repaired until after we leave. It's kind of an odd set up getting to your room, where the rooms aren't really connected to the lobby of the hotel, rather like separate buildings, with access doors on the ends. But I digress.... Did I say the hot tub was broke & it's going to take like a week to fix? I know this is the south, but man, is the part coming on a ship from china?Nice place to stay. Good location.Very clean nice set up. Flat screen in front room as well as bedroom!! Perfect for hub and I cause we watch different stuff on tv. Full kitchen if you wanna cook in. Plenty of parking...a close drive to gas stations and fast food grub! Very cozy...im loving my getaway.Well the walls are super thin. I can hear every word the couple next door is saying to one another. And now it's 2am and it's keeping me up.Nice property.  Great breakfast and dinner.  The beds are very uncomfortable.  We ended up leaving early to get a better hotel.Ok. Long hall way walks.  Smells of slight mildew and quite a few smokers.Not many other options in this area that are better.We decided to go to Savannah the Tuesday before 4th of July so needless to say, hotels were filled up. Homewood Suites had a vacancy and since it's Hilton figured it would be ok. Plus, since we have a toddler who goes to bed before us, the idea of having a suite was nice.The place was mostly updated. I say mostly because the cabinets in the kitchenette should have been replaced as should the dishwasher and microwave. They looked really dated. There was also a big space where something used to be (maybe an oven) and you could see where the sink had caused water damage at some point. Overall, the room was fine. It was clean and comfortable. The pool was perfect. Clean and maintained. What more could you ask for?The breakfast was disappointing. I tried to eat eggs both mornings we were there (first as an omlette and then as scrambled) but they were kind of cold and gross. The hash browns were gross. How do you mess that up? I opted for a waffle because you could make them yourself. Overall, it was fine. Nothing to write home about but not bad especially for a last minute trip on a major holiday.One of the worst hotel stays I've ever had. It was such a disappointment that this Homewood Suites ruined my rosey view of previous Homewood stays. There were so many things wrong with our room that the staff provided a free room upgrade, but the 2nd room had most of the same problems --- clue phone that this is a junk hotel.  Here's the shortlist of issues:  water stains all over the ceiling of all rooms, black mold / mildew on windows and ac vents, sticky bathroom and kitchen floors, dirty room -- breakfast cereal on floor upon check-in, dirty glasses, dirty bathtub, chipped paint and dirty doorframes, very loose safety latch on main door, dirty light switches....etc. And yet, they want to bill at $125 a night! Real shocker that this location gets the Hilton seal or AAA rating. Not the best neighborhood either.I stayed here under unusual circumstances; a friend's brother lives here for work, and has an extended stay suite at this hotel, which he lives in during the week. Weekends he heads back to his place in Buckhead, and is generous enough to allow his sister & friends free use of the suite. The housekeeping service was great, it might have been just that we were and weren't there at the right times, but I never saw them once, and never had to ask for anything. there were clean towels every time I went to shower, and every time I came back to the room it had been tidied. the king bed was soooo comfortable, and the free breakfast in the morning was pretty good. The room was very clean and comfortable, had a little kitchenette, and a very large bathroom. 2 flat screen tv's...I have no idea how much it would cost to stay here, but if I plan another trip to savannah, I'll definitely check it out, having had a good experience. It seemed to be within close driving distance to everything we wanted to do, as well.

This hotel is located in Savannah Midtown.  Coming here was interesting as it was difficult to find the road to come into this area, which has a few other hotels as well.  The best way to know you are at the right turn is that it's right at the Logan's Roadhouse.Once you come in, it looks nice out in the front.  Some areas are still closed off as this hotel is undergoing major renovations.  They have completed the first and third floors and are now working on it for the second floor.I was in room 327.  Overall, the room as nice, but there are some improvements to be made.  First the good though.  The beds were clean and very comfortable.  You can tell that they are new foam mattresses.  The windows from the room need replacing.  The windows were pretty bad, and it was bad enough that I wasn't able to take pictures of the room view.  Anyways, some other things that need to be fixed in the room were the USB and power outlets at the desk when you first come into the room.  Finally, one thing that needs to be done correctly is making sure the room is fully clean when selling a room.  When we went into the shower area, there were some long hairs on one side of the shower stall.Fast forward to breakfast.  The breakfast was okay for some things, but it left a lot to be desired.  The meat that they had that morning was bacon, which I eat all the time.  However, this bacon tasted like bark instead.  Also, they were out of pepper, which is normally the only thing I put on them as I don't use salt very often.  I ended up having a few bagels with cream cheese and apple juice instead.Had I not spoken with the front desk manager about the issues that were found in the room, I would have given it two stars instead of three.  She handled the situation very well and professionally.  She was glad that we said something as some issues they would not know about outlets and USB ports not working unless someone tells them.  She also addressed the housekeeping issue and assured me that would be taken care of.   Given the care and concern given, I would return here in the future after all the renovations are completed.Stayed here at the Springhill Suites for a business trip.  Great location, close to Hunter Army Airfield.  Usual SHS amenities and room layout- mini refrigerator, microwave, LCD TV, fitness center, complimentary hot breakfast, WiFi, and parking.  The hot eggs and daily protein were underwhelming, it looked and tasted as if it was made a long time earlier and left on the heater for a while.  A good number of shops and restaurants within close driving and even walking distance.  Downtown Savannah was less than a 30 minute drive.  Honored the tax exempt form, saved on the state tax- didn't realize there were so many other taxes and fees that applied.  I would stay here again, but I would try to look for another Marriott property first.  Will repeat and recommend with reservations.Great hotel. Clean rooms.The good: comfy bed, decent tv, non-tiny bathroom, reasonable priceThe bad: useless cleaning person (apparently spilled water in our room and didn't seem to actually clean anything), slow front desk service, cold hallways (must be unheated), inconvenient location.Verdict: I'll probably stay somewhere else next time.Our 2-night stay was very pleasant, the breakfast was delicious and the room was spacious with two double beds and a pull out couch. The staff was very knowledgeable with nearby restaurants and bars. The location is close to the highway making it easily accessible to anywhere you'd need to go. I'd recommend it to anyone needing a nice, relaxing stay.They are currently renovating this hotel. As it stands I am not sure it would even get 2 stars, but since they are renovating to fix the issues I will be lenient. Everything seems (and smells) clean but is just very old and shabby right now. Happy to see that they are doing some reno. Otherwise, location is nice, room rates are reasonable, and seems very quiet. Staff is friendly as well.I don't understand all of the bad ratings. The hotel is on a row of two other hotels. Room is nice, bed is quite comfortable and like any other hotel now a flat screen that swivels. Breakfast this morning was eh..cereal, pastries, fresh waffles, oatmeal, scrambled eggs and potatoes. Yes, you need to make a u-turn to get to the hotel, but it's not a big deal since the traffic is minimal. Overall, it's a nice hotel, if I'm in the area again,I would stay here again.My room was very comfortable, with all the amenities one could reasonably ask for. The staff was very helpful and knowledgeable about Savannah, and the location was a convenient drive to downtown. Overall, very happy with my stay.Second time staying here in the last year, and another great stay! It was kind of late when we got in, and we were a little lazy and just ordered pizza to the room, watched TV and stored a few beers in the nice mini-fridge. These rooms are spacious and comfortable, and I had a great night's sleep. Looking forward to the next visit!Average hotel which is good enough for me for the price.It is around 35-40 mins from Tybee island and to downtown Savannah is close to 20 mins depending on traffic. Great Sushi place in walking distance and plenty of grocery stores and gas stations around.This Marriott is the motel 6 version . The folks were nice the rooms were clean except the previous occupants left food in the refrigerator the bathroom was dimly lit the towels were threadbare the beds were comfortable the sheets were clean.As a very frequent Marriott rewards member and business traveler, I have to say that I have experienced a lot of Marriott properties all over the country.  This one definitely falls short of my expectations.The Good--price at @ $79.00 for AAA rate on a weekday.The Bad-- Super slow Internet, bad location, funky smell in my room when I first came in, dirty carpets in elevator and hallway, condition of carpet in my room, static on half the cable TV channels, very dated look, worn and scratched furniture...I will look for another place to stay next time in town.Is zero stars not an option?? When we arrived no one offered to help us with our bags or anything! Our front desk lady was less than friendly and when we got to our room the smell of mildew knocked you down as you entered the room! We tried to switch rooms but conveniently no other rooms were available! Some sketchy maintenance guy came and drenched the room in frebreeze! Can we say gross!!?? We were from out of town for a bachelorette party so we had to make the best of it! The hot tub was broken, the breakfast was gross, and it was like pulling teeth to get any clean towels or wash clothes! There was a very large water spot on the ceiling that had tripled in size by the next morning! We are now all sick! (Go figure) Very disappointed! I suggest that no one stays here! We would definitely not have if we had known how sketchy and gross this place was!! Yuck! Stay at your own risk!!!Stopped in on the way to Fort Myers Beach for a one night stay. The rooms, and pool were clean, well maintained, and the staff was very friendly. I had no issues at all. There was a lady from NYC that complained about everything including the coffee at the free continental breakfast. She claimed it was cold but i was right in line behind her and it was plenty hot. I guess some people are never satisfied. I guess she thought it was the Ritz! If you want a 5 star hotel for vacationing this is not the place for you. If you need to stay at a clean hotel at a reasonable price for a few days this is the place to stop.BTW stayed there on the way home and had service as good as before.Property needs updated.  Beds very uncomfortable. Staff was friendly.Okay the hotel is located in the worst location available. The sign sits low behind trees and if you dont know exactly where it is located you will likely drive past it. This will of course result in driving a block and a half, making a U turn, driving 3 blocks making another U turn and finally arriving at the hotel. If you intend to see anything to the left of the hotel, you will be making guess what...another U turn. The staff was very friendly,  however the rooms were not. They had advertised free wifi but during the week of my stay the wifi did not work. When housekeeping came in generally they are supposed to change the linens. Not the case I accidentally spilled a little red wine on the sheets and after notifying the front desk they said not to worry that they would be changed the following morning. Before I checked out the morning I left I returned to the room to find that the red wine stained sheets were still on the bed and had been remade. Um, okay so the next customer comes in and sleeps on my sheets so whose sheets was I sleeping on. That is unaccetable by all standards. Not to mention unhygienic. The continental breakfast in the morning was nice, it offered a wide array of food from muffins and bagels, to cereal and oatmeal. Including a hot plate of either bacon and eggs, or potatoes and meat. The pool was clean largely due to the 50/50 ratio of water to chlorine I think, the hot tub was down for maintenance, but in the 4 nights that I stayed at the hotel, no one worked on it at all. The weightroom offered very few options for working out. I will not stay at this location again. For the price I paid and being a frequent Marriott guest this was largely pathetic to say the least. Not the worst hotel I have stayed in, but not even close to the Marriott standards that I am accustomed to.Good staff.  Ice machine had bugs and leaves in the ice!  On different days!They just need to shut this down and start all over.  Probably the worst SHS I've ever stayed. Poor execution on upgrades. Really felt and looked low class. Toaster didn't work. Towels were thin and cheap. They didn't put my bill under my door so had to do that before I checked out. The friendly lady that checked me in gave this place the one star. Will not stay here again.My husband made a reservation at Springhill Suites in Savannah, Ga for my kids. They were visiting me as a surprise from Atlanta post my surgery.  Everything was fine until my kids went to check into the hotel. My husband made the reservation and he put the reservation in my son's name so that he could show identification to the hotel if needed. When my kids arrived at the hotel to check in, Springhill Suites management who was not working at the time, but was talking to the clerk over the phone refused to let them check in until my husband physically come to pay with a credit card. The kids were tired from driving from Atlanta to SC and then to Savannah and having a long day. They just wanted to check in and get some rest, but they were not allowed to. They did not want to get their dad out of the bed to come to the hotel, but their cash was refused and they were not allowed to check in.WHY WAS SERVICE REFUSED TO MY KIDS! by this hotel. My kids sat in the lobby and waited until my husband physically came to the hotel to swipe his credit card for a room that was already paid for just like the pervious stay. The clerk told my husband that his credit card would have been charged  anyway if we cancelled the stay and even if he had not come into the hotel. My kids felt humiliated by this hotel and my post surgery surprises was marred by the attitude of the management of this hotel and staff. Early the next day I personally called to complain to the manager who already knew about the incident because the clerk was getting supervision from her and was told what to do.The manager also made the statement to me that my kids cash probably was refused service because they probably did not have enough money to pay for the room. She also argued that everyone should have a credit card. WOW! I could not believe what I was hearing. No apology from this big company; just assumptionsI complain all the way to Marriott's Corporate Office several times and as of today 8/24/13 we have no heard back from the Corporate at all. Why were my kids refused service by this hotel chain. This incident occurred 7/31/13, and we are still waiting on the reason. I called another Springhill Suites in Savannah, GA concerning their cash policy and the clerk told me that the hotel just add $50 deposit to the total and the deposit is given back at checkout. A simple solution has turned into horrible situation by a manager who has lack of training or who just don't care about the people paying her salary.My kids stayed at this same hotel during the Thanksgiving holiday last year, 2012. My husband made the reservation, the reservation was out in my son's name, no deposit was made, his credit card was harged and we had no problems. What happened on 7/31/13 Springhill Suites Marriott? Marriott, we are still waiting on an answer to why you refused to give my kids a room at your hotel.Stayed here while planning our wedding...the rooms were spotless and the beds were comfortable with a high thread linen count.  The hot breakfast was clean and appetizing.  We loved it so much that we picked it out as out hotel location for our lovely day.

Average 3 star hotel. Cool hangout areas outside by the fire pit or inside by fire place if you were staying for a while. Quick easy drive to downtown. We only stayed one night but opted for the two bedroom suite since we had two adult couples. The setup was nice, with enough privacy and ample common area space. I would definitely stay here again. I read some reviews about dirty or worn areas, but we didn't experience this.The hotel itself is nice. The suite we stayed in had a full kitchen and actual fireplace (wood not gas) which was surprising. The road noise is outrageous! This is a major downfall. Bring ear plugs. Drive to the heart of things along the rivers isn't too bad. No where to walk to from this location.Nice hotel very nice staff!  I had a top floor room on the White Bluff Road side of the building and it was very loud (traffic noise) throughout the night.  I was disappointed in the location.  Although it was in a very busy area with restaurants and strip malls it was quite a distance from the Riverfront or Historical District.  I was only there one night so it was fine but if you are looking to experience either of those it is not conveniently located.I visited Savannah and decided to stay at the Residence Inn since had a kitchen in the room.  When I arrived, I thought it was going to be a typical room, but it was a lot more pleasant that I thought that it would be.  It felt very homey, like an apartment feel.  The front desk clerks all were very nice to us during our stay...very friendly.  Our room did not come with a oven, (which we didn't know ahead of time) and they allowed us to use the oven in the kitchen.  We had a continental breakfast in the mornings.  I had no complaints at all for this location.  Very nice, and I would definitely consider staying here again if I went to Savannah.  This location is definitely not in walking distance to the river, but has stores nearby if you wanted to shop or need any last minute items.Mediocre. Pretty standard for a residence inn off the main strip. Friendly and knowledgable staff-the pool is indoors and the management company could spend a few bucks on renovations. The wifi was average for hotel speeds.Before booking, I checked the travel ratings on trip advisor...it seemed okay so I gave it a chance.IMHO the Yelper have gotten this one wrong...we got the two bedroom suite for a family of five...it was a good value for the size of room....four stars on value.You will not walk anywhere from this place.  It just isn't that type of location.  Two stars for location for savannah tourists.Room was clean and updated...room gets four stars.Staff was very pleasant...four stars there.Facility needs a little update and common space cleaning...three stars on that.Great hot breakfast and happy hour...not like an Embassy Suites, but four and a half stars for that.We were very happy with our room, the service, friendliness of the staff and  the breakfast buffet. Great coffee!! The wifi was iffy so I would not pay the $4.95 to upgrade to hi speed. Perfect overnight stay on our way to Florida!Definitely needs improvement. Check-in: A few snafus here. First room was already occupied. I opened the door and was surprised to see a family in "our" room. The front desk was apologetic and sent us off to our next room. This room was facing a very noisy highway and would not work for us as Platinum Marriott Rewards members. Finally, the last room. No real view, but it was quiet and on the third floor. The Room: Verrrry small. Like a shoebox. This is e smallest Residence Inn room I've ever seen. The room was very humid and hot. It was fairly clean until we noticed a huge roach in our room. The bathroom is super tiny. The TVs had basic cable and HBO, but nothing was HD.the cable quality was very poor. The TV was fuzzy the whole time. Parking Lot: Wthi all the families driving in with their huge SUVs, the parking spaces should be doubled. The parking was pretty limited and spots were very tight. I was lucky to not have gotten a door ding.Location: Okay. It was about 15 minutes from downtown Savannah. You have to drive through some very rough neighborhoods to get there if you don't take the interstate all the way around.This hotel definitely needs some attention from Marriott Corporate to bring it up to standards.This place is really nice and clean! This was my second time staying here on my visit and both times were pleasant.  Staff was very friendly and accommodating, I will def recommend this place.Awesome experience. free breakfast/happy hour and my mom loved it.Sure it could be closer to downtown, but it is centrally located and the rooms are quite spacious (especially for the money).The breakfast is not exactly world class, but for free.99, I'll take it. The egg beaters are always present (at least in my 3 mornings they were there) and there is a rotating cast of potatoes. Thanks.The dinner is definitely lacking, but again, it is free. There is some cheap wine and Budweiser on tap, so no big complaints. It would be nice to see more veggie options, but this is the South so I wasn't expecting much.The desk in the room is great, the kitchen is well designed, the table seats two and the bathroom is fine. I was definitely surprised at the quality of the furniture, etc. If this ends up being my home for 2 months, then I'll have a lot more to say. For a 4 night stay, it was certainly worth it! I looked at smaller studios in Santa Monica than this...The free Wi-Fi is pretty slow, but that is to be expected. The building is quiet and I haven't been disturbed by neighbors. The staff was very attentive and friendly.Will never stay at a Residence Inn again let alone this one. It is built right on a major highway and my room abuts it. No sleep tonight I suspect. Plus their "pet friendly" policy includes a compulsory $100 cleaning fee. A deposit seems fair but a large, flat out charge? Wish I could tell my dog he can be as messy as he likes here. Marriott's in the dog house for certain.First off, when you are making reservations online, they make it seem like you can walk to downtown Savannah from here. No. You cannot. It's an 8 mile walk. My husband, dog, and I made reservations here for MLK weekend. We were in transit to Kings Bay and since my hubby did not have to report to his base until Tuesday, we figured it would be nice to take a break from the drive from New England to the south and stop in Savannah. Well, we got to the hotel and it is directly across from the projects in Savannah. Great. We went to check in and our room was not ready. This was not a big deal. We were just going to drop our stuff off and take off anyway! The woman behind the counter, (very friendly by the way) offered us a map and asked if we would like to take a WALK downtown while they finished our room. The dog needed to stretch and whatnot so this was perfect!!However.... no.... you CANNOT walk downtown from this hotel. It is a 15 minute drive. There are no sidewalks and on either side if the hotel is a very very busy street... NO SIDEWALKS!!! My husband at this point was pretty fed up. He was tired from the driving, he was not impressed with the location, and he wanted to find another hotel. We ended up staying because once we saw our room, he was impressed. It was a nice room! I felt right at home and became very relaxed!!The staff at night was kind of rude. I stood at the desk for 15 minutes while the woman stood in the adjoining room talking to her friend while watching TV. She saw me. But, i waited.Clean room. Friendly staff. So so breakfast. Dumpy neighborhood, though with a bunch of similar priced hotels.  Road noise in the room. Over priced on the weekend we stayed.Needs lots of help with customer service. Not pet friendly!!!!!!!! Sorry. Triple A you a wrongNice hotel.  Staff very friendly.  Rooms clean.  Near many restaurants.  Close to historic downtown Savannah.gross.  We walked in and after traveling for a while I needed to use the ladies room and clean up the kids while my husband checked us in.  Bathroom in the hall was dirty with a broken toilet.  Front door had a broken handle.That was as far as I got before we moved on to another hotel.Gross.

Awesome!!! Awesome!! Awesome!!We absolute loved this place for our three night stay in savannah.. Everyone that works here is such a pleasure. Breakfast was wonderfully made each morning and even custom made our last. He heard we wanted biscuits and gravy and made it just for us. Everett was a true pleasure to see each day and talk with as was Marcus.. Thank you all and we can't wait to stay in this gem againLOVED this place!!! My partner and I were on a road trip and stopped in Savannah. We walked in to take pictures of this gorgeous historic building. The innkeeper  was gracious enough to give us a tour. We ended up falling in love and getting a room for the night. BEST decision we made. Friendly service, amazing breakfast, and breathtaking rooms.The Gastonian staff are some of the most customer service oriented individuals that I have ever met. My husband and I stayed at the Gastonian for 4 nights and we could not have been happier. Our room was phenomenal and ready upon arrival. We had a set of champagne flutes ordered and they were set up at turn-down. The food at the Gastonian is amazing. We didn't have a single morning where we were disappointed with breakfast. The tray service was a nice touch and my husband and I really enjoyed the midday snacks and the desserts in the evening. We stayed in the connecting mansion so it was very quiet. They were making renovations but they didn't inconvenience us at all. One thing to keep in mind however, this building is over 100 years old. If you are wanting modern amenities and elevators, then this is not the place for you.The location was lovely. It is right across from Forsyth Park and an easy walk or Pedicab ride into downtown. We never felt awkward about the times when we would come in late and there was always someone at the front desk if we needed them. Overall, this is a fantastic place to spend a vacation or special occasion. We had a lovely time and cannot wait to go back.I'm a local hairstylist here in Savannah. I do A LOT of hair for weddings, so I've been to many b&b's for bridal hair appointments...Most b&b's I've been to don't really concern themselves with me, as I'm not a paying guest, which is understandable, I'm more like "staff".  But as soon as I walked in to the Gastonian I was treated as a guest. EVERYONE greeted me and offered me water.  They even had someone carry my bags to the brides room.  On our way up I even got a little history/ tour of the house, which is absolutely lovely, by the way. I've never stayed at the Gastonian, but they treated me (neither staff, nor guest) with nothing less than the utmost cordiality.  The brides room was huge and beautiful. It had antique furniture, historic charm, but simultaneously wasn't cluttered or outdated.  We also walked through a lovely back porch area with an arbor.I've always wanted to take a "stay-cation" here in Savannah. Now I know where I'd like to stay when I do. I also know where I'll be referring people to stay when they visit.NiceStaff andThe place looksFantastic. HasFree meals, wifi, and a few parking spots.Unbelievable place, we deliver bikes there, and the place is really first class all the way.  My wife and I are planning our mini vacation and this will be where we stay. As residents of Savannah this says alot. Thank you so much savannah on wheels!Excellent place, staff; easy walk to river and other Downtown sights.Spent one night at this well-appointed B&B.  Our room was just perfect with nice furnishings and a modern bath.The staff, particularly Walter, are great.  The common rooms in the main house are nice, and they have beverages and treats in the afternoon and evening.  Breakfast is very good.Look forward to returning.Where do I begin........Well.....there are no words to describe how I felt here at the Gastonian.....let's just say, today is my first day back home, and I miss this B & B sooo much. This house, is absolutely beautiful, so charming and historic. The decor is beautiful and the staff is beyond amazing.Kitchen Chef's are superb!!!!! Mario, James, Ron and Walter.....I love them all, and in just a few short days, I felt like they were my family....I really do miss them....so polite, considerate and caring...not to mention.... They can cook!!!! They made our stay, that much better. The innkeepers, Fallon and Carol, were so charming, hospitable, friendly and kind.....I couldn't ask for better customer service.....I would definitely go back to this B&B, if only just to see all these guys!!!! They truly were amazing, never experienced customer service to this degree..... I wish I could give it more stars.....this deserves the whole universe!!!! Gastonisn staff, if you read this review....I'm sending all of you big hugs and kisses from your friend Michele...here in L.A..... Miss you guys!!!!Be forewarned: For the rest of your life *every* hotel you stay at will *always* be held in comparison with The Gastonian. It is TRULY an unforgettable Bed and Breakfast with pampering well worth the cost. For our Honeymoon I researched to find the most romantic location to spend our FIRST night as husband and wife---I wanted a place with enchanting decor from a more noble past but not so "Anne of Green Gables" that it would be a libido turnoff. The Gastonian was the perfect combination with plenty of privacy for the blushing newlyweds! We stayed in The Carriage House which is essentially your own *private* two story brick apartment with a porcelain claw-foot tub (big enough for TWO) and a balcony on the second story with wrought iron furniture. The walls were exposed brick and the hand carved wooden bed was so high you had to use the stepping stool. It was absolutely lovely and I couldn't imagine a better place for our Honeymoon!I don't think The Gastonian can be described as merely a "Bed and Breakfast" since it also provides gourmet afternoon hors d'oeuvres and wine as well as various desserts and Cordials at the nightly reception. You feel spoiled by all the extras and attention! The staff is incredible with genuine concern about your weekend escape! In the morning you have your choice of pre-ordered breakfast delivered to your door (on a silver tray with coffee service!) or dine in the main hall. For the first morning of our Honeymoon I  ordered this delicious Spinach Florentine Eggs Benedict and my husband ordered the French toast. It was luxurious to just get out of the bath, wrap up in my robe, and then have breakfast waiting for us in the sunshine. It was a beautiful spring morning on the balcony overlooking Savannah and I was there with my husband smoking his pipe! The staff really goes over and above the customer service you receive at most lodgings. While my husband slept in the next morning, I went inside the main house to get myself some coffee. One of the attentive employees greeted me, brought me a plate of scones, and invited me to sit on the couch and read a newspaper while I ate and drank. I honestly cannot say enough about this amazing institution If you're looking for a weekend satiated in romantic ambiance and pampering!.17 rooms, parking around back, we stayed on a ground floor room with a beautiful and large bathroom including a cool ceiling mirror. Susan was amazing, helpful and entertaining. Make sure you ask for cake right at 8PM when they serve it COMPLIMENTARY. The Gastonian lays on a lovely block and makes you see a lot of the historic district because of its location.Beautiful beautiful room and bathroom. I was really surprised how spacious the room and bathroom was. The decor was accented around the beautiful historian home. The staff was great and friendly. They would turn down your beds leaving you a nice late night treat and a card letting you know what the forecast would be the next day. The staff accommodated you with anything you needed. The location was nice too, wasn't too far from Broughton and main attraction area. Everything was within walking distance.  I would definitely come stay here again!My husband and I came here on our Babymoon during President's Day weekend. It was absolutely wonderful! Our king size bed provided the best night's sleep (which says a lot since I was 8 months pregnant at the time). The spa-like tube was also so deep that my entire belly could be covered with water. They provided your choice of breakfast each morning, afternoon tea and desserts at night. They would even save you the desserts if you weren't going to be there in time. All of the staff were courteous and generous the entire time. They gave us food and tourist site advice, which helped and ordered us cabs whenever needed. It is in the historic district, not downtown so it is very quiet and relaxing. We thought parking would be worse. We had to park on the street and move the car once because of street cleaning, but we walked everywhere else. This is not the party type of place, but is perfect for a romantic getaway. I would love to go back!Assuming what should have been a five-star review, minus two stars for the room condition, plus one for the staff. We stayed in the Caracalla Honeymoon Suite. It is a grand and unique room, but it wasn't in the tip-top condition I expect from the flagship room at a 4-diamond hotel. The door to the bathroom didn't close, the moulding over the the bathtub was falling off, the gas fireplaces need updating (was like lighting a gas grill with a match - make sure you stand back), the tub wasn't pristine, and a minor annoyance: despite having a dimmer on the light switch, the lights didn't dim. The staff and front desk was exceedingly helpful and polite, and the breakfast was great.Adore this hotel and the concierge, Lance:) Southern hospitality at its finest, with gorgeous rooms, great food and excellent service. I'm having a ball:)Great rooms, service, grounds, location!We had been here 11 years ago and our comments would have mirrored the 5 star reviews currently posted.  This time the 4 of us independently felt that the place had gone downhill from the cleanliness of the rooms to the breakfasts to the service.  What's the old saying "you can't go home again."I doubt that we will be back or  recommend this place to our friends.We LOVED this place. The staff really took care of us and made us feel at home. A+ customer service. The house was stunning. Our room was immaculate and so beautiful. We will visit again, for sure!Stayed here for our Honeymoon back in March of 2014. The place was incredible, service was top knotch, and the food and drinks was amazing. Can't wait to go back again, hopefully soon.First trip to Savannah, first stay at a bed & breakfast. The Gastonian exceeded my expectations-beautiful, friendly staff, delicious breakfast (first experience with grits....mmmm) amazing decor, great location, huge room, fabulous bed, evening cocktail/dessert hour. Just delightful! :)We could not have been more pleased with our stay at The Gastonian.Room: We were lucky to have the honeymoon suite for a great deal. This room is not located in the main building which I though was great. It is an amazing room. Extremely large, clean and comfortable with fireplaces in both the bedroom and bathroom. The tub was amazing - although it took way to long to fill up it was great to soak in a bubble bath after a long day of walking. The bed was very comfortable but the nightstands are to far away from the bed. The TV is small in this room and oddly placed - very hard to watch it from bed. The toilet room is small and the door does not close all the way but this did not bother me at all. The turn down service was a treat and the room was kept clean by the staff.Food: We were pleased with the food. Each night you receive a menu to select your items for the next day. You may have a tray service delivered to your room or have your breakfast in the main house with the other guests. We chose to eat in the kitchen/dinning room and enjoyed having conversations with the other guests and the kitchen staff. Food was always cooked to order, fresh and tasty.  I recommend if you can to return to the B&B and enjoy the lovely wine and snacks they provide in the afternoon as well as the cordials ans desserts in the evening. Staff: The staff was very helpful and friendly they made us feel welcomed and at home through out the stay.Location: Right in the historic district 2 blocks away from Forsyth park. Nice charming neighborhood. Good restaurants within walking distance and a very nice 15 walk to the river.  Overall a most romantic stay in a charming house with lovely rooms, beautiful gardens, friendly staff and good food. A five star for sure.
review_content_20: I stayed at the Gastonian in March 2011 (wasn't on Yelp! at the time, so getting caught up with my reviews...this was originally posted on another site, but I'm posting here, too) and had a great time. The rooms were nice & well kept. The house was very charming. The staff was cordial and fun to talk too. Especially Calvin - he cooked the (included) breakfast. Not only did he do an outstanding job with the food, he was fun to talk too as we enjoyed breakfast. He is a true example of why Savannah is the "Hostess City of the South"!Included with the price was a very nice room (and decently sized), breakfast (with the option to eat in the kitchen or have tray service in-room), wine/h'or devours in the afternoons, and cordials in the evenings. The house is old, so expect to hear some floor-board creaking noise, but that adds to the charm.Definitely somewhere I'll stay again!A wonderful establishment!!I would return here again and again and again. Hell, I'd live there if they let me!!!However, they won't and I can't see myself moving to Savannah anytime in the future.But the stay there, even as brief as it was (one night) was fantastic. -The night before we had stayed at the Riverside Inn (also comfortable and enjoyable). The reason for the change of hotel was experience and wanting to see the fireworks on the river from the room, not a crowd -So back to the Gastonian. I'm embarrased to say that it was my first time in a B&B but now it won't be my last. Why on earth anyone would stay in a Marriot or Hyatt in a place like Savannah is beyond me. You keep those places for the late night drive down 95.The Gastonian and it's employees are so pleasant, and cordial with all the southern politeness and hospitality you could ask for.The place is decorated beautifully! No hotel furniture here!!Each room's pieces have been selected and arranged in such a way that it's not over the top & gaudy and you feel like you belong in a true home of 1865. Oh...you can't beat the fireplaces in every room either! Breakfast was served to me and my sweetie in our room beneath silver trays. We had opted for that over breakfast in the kitchen just cause we were lazy following our previous day out and about. And breakfast was delish! When was the last time I had breakfast in bed??? So long ago and I can't remember when.The evening before there was wine and  hors d'oeuvres in the dinning room. Of course we pretty much cleaned them out of a bottle of red! We also met a pretty cool couple from Switzerland on a big road trip down the East Coast. Seems as though they have seen more of my coast than I have!We didn't partake though in dessert and cordials later that evening. The Gastonian was just a very pleasing experience all around. Perfect for romantic couples, close to  a lot of things without being right in the middle of it. Off the beaten track so to speak.If you stay here or on that side of town, it really is a great place to bring your bike! There's also pedicabs that'll pick you up. So by no means think it's location is far away from the 'action' so to speak. You couldn't be in a better spot!As good as it gets, in a great city.The Gastonian is a well-rated bed and breakfast for good reason.  Terrific rooms with fire places, old world charm throughout, friendly and professional staff, complimentary Southern breakfast, complimentary tea, wine, and hors d'oeuvres, complimentary cordials and desserts, nice reading material and furnishings in the parlors, friendly other guests to chat with over wine or cordials.  It's all perfect.You can have your customized breakfast in your room, but it's more fun to eat in the kitchen.  Their chef is a charming lady whose been cooking for many years.  She has a wonderful banter she entertains with as she cooks.  (She was off to a Food Channel audition the day after we were last there.)  It's a great walk-around neighborhood, not far from downtown.  There's nothing we would change about The Gastonian Inn.This inn made my trip to Savannah. I was a lone traveler and felt so welcome in the inn by the staff and the other guests.It is an exceptionally beautiful building, perfectly located in the historic district and close to everything. My room was huge and had a sitting area in addition to the bed.The breakfasts were a very pleasant surprise. They were so tasty and the service was very elegant. The bonus is that there is afternoon tea and hors d'oeuvres and late-night cordials, which makes for a lovely way to socialize.I wish I could give The Gastonian more then 5 stars!  If you are looking for Southern Hospitality you must stay here!  The accomodations are clean and beautful.  The concierge is extremely pleasant and helpful.  The breakfast is cooked to order with waiter service and is excellent.  There is an appetizer/wine event daily in the evening, as well as a seperate dessert/coffee nightly.  In the main room there is a wonderful book with pictures and menus of local restaurants.  There are a lot of stairs in the Inn but the concierge is more then helpful.  Each room has a working fireplace and the turn down service was welcomed.  Our stay in Savannah was exceptional!  I would love to return and I would most definetely stay at The Gastonian.  If they'd let me completely move in, I probably would have just stayed!  The price is extremely reasonable once you see all that is included once your there!Can I live here forever? I think the rest of my days would be lovely if I could have a nice breakfast served in my room and eaten on a sunny balcony . Walter, Laura, and Boo are the best hotel staff members ever. The building is about 150 years old and gorgeous. You have a fireplace in your room for God sakes. It has some quirks, such as fold in doors to the bathroom that don't quite close all the way and creaky floors but it is older than everyone on the planet so that is to be expected. Those quirks can also be overlooked when you have a whirlpool tub and one of the most comfortable beds in the world. It is perfect for crashing onto after eating and drinking more than one should. The best part is enjoying delicious canapes served in the parlor where, with the assistance of our friends, Merlot, chardonnay, and white zinfandel, you and the other guests tend to get a little chatty and you find out a lot of interesting tidbits about relative strangers. If you can't get them to say something juicy at tea time try again after some port or brandy at dessert. Interesting tidbit: If you come here with a same sex friend people will assume you are gay as most people here are married couples. It is nice to know that people can be so accepting/tolerant . Our hotel menu was even printed up as Mrs & Mrs. ______.What a great place. I was worried about staying here because when you look at the map of Savannah, it seems like the Gastonian is on the outskirts of town. My assumption couldn't have been more off base. Granted, it's not as close to the water as some other places to stay, but for me that was one of the positives. The waterfront is touristy and tacky. The Gastonian is in a beautiful neighborhood that we got to walk through every night on our way home. The food at the Gastonian was another real plus. Every morning, afternoon and night food was served...and not wine, grapes and cheese, but homemade gastronomic delights. Our room had real character and the grounds were beautiful. Highly recommend.Very nice stay. Breakfast great (ate in the kitchen). Large nice room with large bathroom and excellent shower. Forsyth Park only two blocks walk. Excellent place for walk, jog or run. Wide sidewalks around perimeter; almost one mile around. Many walkways inside park.

review_content: This place is the best! On the last night of our honeymoon, and after a less-than-stellar experience at the Hampton Inn across town, this place delivered a great experience. I really need to say that Kwanisha made the stay extra great for us. She greeted us with a super friendly welcome, and she was actively interested in our stay. When she found out we were honeymooning, she insisted on seeing photos. It was a really engaging experience up-front. I thanked Kwanisha for her hospitality and explained briefly that our last Hampton stay was a little weak. She apologized and reassured us that we could just ask if we needed anything from her. Later that night, Kwanisha brought up a bottle of bubbly, some chocolate, and a beautiful card congratulating us on our engagement. It was a super thoughtful and really humbling gift. She went out of her way to ensure we felt special and she nailed it! The valet parking was great! We loved the king suite. It was clean, the bed was comfy, and the room was cozy without being cramped. After this experience, we are very sure this Hampton will be where we stay in Savannah henceforth. Thanks for a great stay!The hotel offers nearby easy parking. Bell staff and registration staff were very polite and courteous. Everyone is very accommodating. Check in was a breeze. Luggage carts are abundant and the elevator is centrally located. Great hotel location in the historic district of the city. Given the location, nightly weekend rates are very reasonable. The only downside to the room is it is not nearly as large as shown in online pictures. And that's why it gets four stars. Other than that, the room is great.Friendliest staff ever! I can't tell if I'm in love with people from Georgia, or this is typical for Hampton Inn staff, but the people at the front desk were super nice and accommodating. We were on our way to FL and stopped to rest for the night. We were walk-ins. My mom had found a reduced price for walk-ins online, which they accepted with a smile. We also enjoyed the added Christmas tree touch in the dining area.The Run-Down: -Friendly staff-Clean-Complimentary breakfast begins at 6am (not a gourmet experience, but hey, it's FREE)-Complimentary cookies at night (were oatmeal the night we were there)-Size and layout of room was standard-Sheets AND duvet covers are cleaned for each new guest-Can't comment on its proximity to landmarks, as we were only using it as a stomping ground before continuing on our trip, but there were many nearby places to eat (we ate at Ruby Tuesday's). While we found a deal ($89), I believe standard rooms are still reasonably priced.Sometimes the best of plans go wrong. I was suppose be staying at the Hampton Inn located at 201 E Bay Street but ended up here upon the advice that they were both very much the same. Well, similar maybe, the same no. This Hampton Inn isn't as good. The parking hassles even with valet can be nightmarish, check-in was at a snail's crawl, window views not as good, location a good mile and a half from the actual heart of the Historic District, and general interior decor not the equivalent.Worse, a number of amenities, "Out of Order."For a Hampton, it's passable, OK, but not up to par with their other nearby location.The 'Historic District' moniker is a bit misleading, especially for most who don't walk a good distance regularly. Obnoxious fridge and microwave, peeling walls, plus $15 to self-park, but otherwise just fine.Ritz-Carlton service at a Hampton Inn rate. William was fantastic and was able to offer great recommendations every time we asked for one - whether it was for pizza delivery (Stoner's) or the best tour to go on.Brad, quite frankly, we wanted to take home. lol He really went above and beyond what's expected and made sure we got where we needed to be - from check-in to check-out. I do wish that this was a little closer to the Historic District - it's just on the edge. Otherwise, we had a clean, well-maintained room. Very quiet hotel even though they were pretty full, but FANTASTIC staff.Well done, Hampton!These folks provide exceptional customer service and made my stay immeasurably better.  William can tell you just anything you need to know off the top of his head!  He and the valet even fixed my computer issues for me!  Iesha is very friendly and helpful.  These folks make you feel right at home.  Another valet, named Blue, is a very kind man.Nice people, decor in sore need of update.  Look somewhere else if you don't like warm showers & green carpet.Overall, this is a great hotel option for anyone looking to vacation in Savannah.  On the west side of the Historic Downtown area, the hotel is located within walking distance of the Visitor Center and hub for most of the trolley tours.  Any and all of the food, drink, shopping and entertainment stores are easily reached by car or foot from the hotel.  The hotel itself is very nice and the staff are all very friendly (William was particularly helpful with food suggestions).  Other features like the amenities (pool, breakfast bar, etc.) are good and the hotel and rooms are very clean.  Because the location is very close to the Historic Downtown area there is a daily parking charge of $15.  Book through one of the online sites like Expedia, Priceline or a membership like AAA and there are discounts.  I would stay at this hotel again.I have stayed at several Hilton properties and this has to be one of the worst. The hotel is humid and there is no AC in the elevators (this means close contact with sweaty tourist who have been walking around the hot downtown area and no air movement). The hallways leading to the rooms also seems to be hot and humid though not as bad as the elevator. The AC in my room sounds like a fish tank or a fountain the water noise is so loud. I am not sure why. Also, I have been switched from one room to another because carpet felt sticky. The room I am in now has sticky carpet too. I am guessing all of the rooms are that way. They said something about the Febreeze they spray in the rooms (maybe because the moisture would make the rooms smell dank or unpleasant otherwise). I come to Savannah frequently for work, but will not be staying at this particular property again. Everything from the air the floors just feels sticky. I will say that the staff are nice and try to be accommodating. It does not appear to be uncomfortable because of a lack of effort on their part.This Hampton Inn is situated in an older building that still retains much of its charm in the lobby area. My room was clean and comfortable, although the carpet was rather worn in places - I noticed the same thing in some of the public areas as well. The staff was friendly and helpful and the breakfast was typical Hampton Inn fare - I left satisfied.My only issue is with the location. The hotel bills itself as being in the "Savannah Historical District" but one needn't wander far before finding oneself in some rather rough looking neighborhoods. I didn't see any of the quaint Savannah I've heard so much about in this part of the city. If I were here on vacation I would probably seek to move, as there is not much to do within a safe walking distance aside from a few local restaurants.For cleanliness and amenities the rating would be a solid four stars. However, the location really hurts. If there was a 2.5 rating that would have nailed it for me.This was an ok hotel. I've been in worse lately which probably lets me rank it higher than I normally would. My room was really big and it had a mini-fridge which was nice except it ended up freezing all of my drinks.The staff was helpful, holding my bags when I arrived too early for check in. The elevators are super slow. The breakfast is ok, standard hotel fare, they switch it up based on the day of the week. The location is not ideal for Savannah - it is a few blocks from the heart of the Historic District, it's not super close to all the restaurants and shops you'll want to go to (maybe a 10-15 min walk). So it was fine, but you can probably do better in Savannah.We stayed here for a night while we visited Savannah. The staff was very friendly and nice and the decor of the hotel was very welcoming. The rooms were a bit on the smaller side. Breakfast was great and had a large selection and plenty of seats. It was a bit out of the way, but still definitely walkable to the river and if you are doing a trolley tour they all seem to leave from right behind the hotel. The hotel pool area looked nice, but the pool was empty (which was okay since it was too cold to swim anyways) Overall, the only thing that wasn't the greatest was the parking lot which is on the small side and so we had to park at a garage a few blocks over, it was only $15 though which was definitely reasonable. We would definitely consider staying here again on our next trip to Savannah.Life is like a box of chocolates...you never know what you're gonna get.Thanks for that line, Forrest Gump!  Since a lot of the movie was filmed in Savannah, I felt it appropriate to quote you.  And that sums up the way I feel about Hampton Inns.  Sometimes you get the chocolate covered cherry and sometimes you get the maple nougat. I wouldn't say this place is as bad as maple nougat, but it's no chocolate covered cherry. On the plus side, it was clean, had friendly people, served a decent breakfast and was fairly convenient for visiting the place (although it's a good 20 minute walk to the heart of River Street) .  The beds and pillows were quite comfortable.  Having a refrigerator and microwave in the room was great.  We had four people in our room and I think we were all pretty comfortable.On the negative side, the elevators are excruciatingly slow.  We just used the stairs after the first day.  And the gym is a joke. They had one bike, one elliptical and one treadmill.  And the treadmill was broken the entire stay.I know the two items I mentioned as negative don't seem like a big deal, but I like having a fitness center and I like fast elevators, that's just who I am, man.Overall, this is a nice enough place.  If those two issues were resolved, it would be a four-star review for sure.Charming lobby parking is a hassle but the staff are friendly. Breakfast is good but can be crowded and not enough places to sit inside, although there are places to sit out in the back. The room could do with some updating but the bed was very comfortable and welcome after a long drive.I stayed here with a tour group and it was awesome!! Very clean, super friendly housekeeping staff and the room has a nice refrigerator and microwave. Breakfast is not super amazing but it's free, food and fills everyone up and when you're staying with a big group like I am that's a big plus.The doors are a little thin in the halls the elevator is old but the location and staff especially made me enjoy my time here. Plus only a five or so minute walk to the Juliet Gordon Low house and since I'm staying with girl scouts that's a huge plus!Pretty good Hampton Inn hotel, it's like any other Hampton Inn. Very beautiful pool area, and the fitness area is separate, which is nice. The lobby is classic, but with the Hampton finish. What really gets me is THE BEDS. I slept on the pullout couch, and that even felt like one of the normal beds. Thank gosh they sell them.I rated it 4 stars because there is almost NO PARKING on site. Sure, there is a parking lot designated to the hotel across the street, but you have to cross heavy traffic.I would go any other time i'm in Savannah. GO. PLEASE?I was in Savannah for a job interview, so it was a quick trip, but such a nice comfortable place to stay.  It was fairly close to town, even though I didn't venture out much, I enjoyed my stay and the staff was very friendly and helpful.  The bed was super comfortable, the bathroom clean and nicely appointed.Last year I stayed at a Hilton property (Hampton Inn) 220 nights.   Very clean and friendly staff.   Stay off the first floor...  Traffic coming off of I-16 in at 4:00 AM is very, very loud! Front desk personal told me the next morning they would be happy to move me if would have call at 4:30 AM in the morning...  Somewhat a mood point!  Stay the Hampton Inn a couple of blocks away!Fantastic location. Clean rooms, lobby, restaurant. Two of the three elevators were out of order for much of the time while there. Had to use the stairs to save time, I would stay here again.
review_content_20: Check Bed Bug Registry first!! Yikes!I am a HUGE fan of Hampton Inn - but this was my worst ever experience in one of their locations.  I would not recommend this hotel, especially when there is another Hampton Inn within walking distance.
