Splurge for the one along Bay street.There were many reasons I was unhappy, but the real icing on the cake was that the front door was missing the handles and so you had to walk around the building to the side door, which did not have sidewalk access.Also, the noise was unbelievable.Oh, and their wifi is lousy even in the first floor rooms.  The ethernet connections are available in suite, but there's no cable... so if you go, pack your cable.The staff here is amazingly friendly, and they won my heart forever by honoring my 'do not disturb' tag while i was out. As for the more generalizable experiences: this hotel is pretty close to the juicy parts of the historic district, but it is a 5-10 minute walk to get there, so you're not right in the heart of things. The rooms are big and spacious, with free high-speed internet and a fridge. The beds are comfy, too.Ask for an odd-numbered room if you can, though, as even numbers face Oglethorpe and you can get a lot of traffic and drunk undergrad noise some nights.I'm a huge Hampton fan as you'll find with my other reviews, but this one had one major disappointment - there was no wireless even though the website said there was.  This wouldn't be so bad, except that the ethernet cable provided was 1 foot long, which put me in an uncomfortable position at the desk with no freedom to move.  Other than that the hotel was what you would expect from a Hampton, friendly staff and comfortable room - I'm just annoyed at the false advertising and the back ache I got from leaning over that desk to do some work.This hotel was such a great value! It's conveniently located in the historic district and comes with really great amenities even though it's not a full service hotel. It has a pool, fitness center, and a really great complimentary hot breakfast buffet, which includes a DIY belgian waffle station. There is also shuttle service to the Savannah trolley tour station, which is also in walking distance. Speaking of walking distance, you can also easily head over to Lady and Sons on foot if you're planning to drop in during your Savannah trip.The hotel rooms are clean and very well-kept. We tipped room service each day and she (Latoya) always wrote us a nice thank you note.The only thing that could have made this hotel better was if they offered free parking, but instead you're charged $8 / day. Other than that, I have no complaints. I'd definitely stay here again.Everything was great.  No complaints.  Will stay again.  Walking distance to many restaurants and shops.  Not on the river, but not too far.Great location in the historic district. The hotel staff was very helpful and polite. Everything was clean and it appeared recently remodeled. It was a bit tricky to get into the hotel parking lot (you need a code) so that was somewhat irritating being that I needed to park before I could check in. The location was perfect though, and I would definitely stay again.I have to admit I was a bit skeptical about booking reservations at this particular Hampton because it was on the edge of the historic district but my fears were allayed the minute we arrived.  The staff at the front desk was great and welcoming.  The location is actually very good - it's in the historic district, you can walk to the trolley tours just a few blocks away and The Distillery is almost visible from the hotel.  Our room was exactly as expected - king size bed with very comfortable linens. Every thing was clean and in good working order.  Unlike some reviewers, we had no issue with street noise at all.  We forgot our corkscrew for the wine and were able to borrow one at the front desk. (My only suggestion would be for them to have more than one :=)  The breakfast room is very comfortable - I especially noticed the large tables where groups/families can all sit together. What a practical, helpful idea!  The food was very good with lots of choices - eggs, waffles, sausage, bacon, cereal, yogurt, fruit, etc. and the coffee was excellent.  We liked that the coffee is available 24/7 and the warm cookies in the afternoon are a great touch. I would definitely recommend this hotel because of its location and the value is great for the rate.  The hotels in the very heart of the historic district are quite a bit more expensive.

hotel_name: Residence Inn Savannah Downtown Historic District
review_content: Husband and I originally booked a room for 1 night (since you never really know how a hotel will be until you get there) and immediately went back downstairs after putting our things away and booked an additional night. This hotel was wonderful. The staff was all incredibly friendly, most notably Danae (not sure if she spells it that way) with the dining room staff. She was above and beyond friendly and welcoming any time we were down for appetizers or breakfast. From 5-7 the kitchen offered free beer, wine, tea/lemonade, and a different appetizer each night. We'd never stayed in a hotel that does this but were extremely pleased and impressed with it!Breakfast was always a good spread. Their dining area is very open and the food is set up on a kitchen island and the surrounding countertops. It's very clean and inviting, much different than your typical hotel breakfast.Parking may be difficult during a busier time of year but we had no problem finding side street parking. We were also glad to find we were so close to the historic district and everything downtown has to offer. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone going to Savannah and would stay again ourselves.Ok so I really want to give this place 5 stars for the staff. The staff was awesome!!! Every time I passed a staff member they were pleasant and smiling. The gals that setup breakfast are an absolute delight, truly! The rooms are large, bright and tasteful. The bed was very comfy and the front desk is very accommodating. The free wifi ran great! The breakfast had everything we needed, eggs, sausage, waffles, fruit, cereal, yogurt, coffee etc. The valet guy greets you every time you walk in the door, even after seeing you a few days in a row, he doesn't skip a beat! In all we had a great experience, we were part of a big wedding group that had booked a block of rooms. If anyone is getting married and you have a large group of people, this place offers a great accommodation! My only complaint is that we were never notified that the hotel was under construction and that the bar was closed. But there are plenty of bars within walking distance or a short 1 mile ride away!On our long drive from Florida to South Carolina we decided at 2 am we needed a place to crash. Every hotel was booked so we got a cottage room here for the night. The lady at the front gave us a room for $149 which was a little high but considering we needed a place we decided to take it for a few hours to sleep. The hotel itself was very nice, especially the cottages. They come with a microwave,  a stove top,  refrigerator. The rooms were recently remodeled and you could even smell the new carpet.  The beds were very comfortable and the room was clean. Only issue I have and not sure if this is usually like this but the smell as soon as you step outside the rooms was awful. It smelled like a dumpster. Everywhere else is Savannah smelled normal but for some reason this location was terrible which was unfortunate because there is a really nice patio we wanted to sit on and enjoy the cold weather. Hopefully this was just temporary.This is a great hotel in downtown Savannah just a few streets from the action. This hotel is located just on the border of what I would consider the safe walkable Savannah. The staff was friendly, especially the breakfast staff. The rooms were clean and roomy. I loved the mini kitchens with everything you need for an extended stay. However, when in Savannah we love to eat out so we didn't use it much. The beds were comfortable and the rooms got nice and cold. Things were quiet at night too so we all got a good nights sleep. The pool is nice but there is not hot tub, which would have been nice on a chilly night. There is, however, a nice fire pit area that overlooks the pool. Alongside the pool are separate cottages that looked very quaint. The free breakfast was a great way to start your day. This was your typical free hot hotel breakfast with most things premade in warmers. They did have one waffle maker that always had a line. The lobby had lots of comfortable seats but not enough table and chairs for dining. Often there was not enough places for people to sit while eating. Overall a nice hotel for a reasonable price. I would stay here again for sure.As a Marriott platinum rewards member, I have stayed in many hotels by Marriott. As always, no disappointments. But, I want to point out that I loved this location.You have the train museum next door. You're within walking distance of restaurants and the Savannah squares. I stayed in a cottage across from the fountain, which was frozen! I got a really nice picture of it. The valet staff was very professional and helpful. The lady at front desk was very friendly and housekeeping did a fabulous job cleaning my room. But let's not forget the bartender!!  My friends and I had a great time with the bartender, she was engaging everyone in the conversation and throwing jokes. We met new friends and ended up grilling with them! Overall, the location, staff, amenities and the customer service definitely deserve 5 stars.This place was amazing. Built in an old historic building, it has six houses out in back of the hotel that they use for lodging as well. When I checked in the front desk told me that I was in one of the cottages much to my surprise. I went out the back door to find several buildings that had eight rooms in each building and they were magnificent. Around the rear exterior is a white picket fence with a garden and Terrace amongst them. This is a property you must check out while in Savannah. I will definitely return with the family.Tip: Arrive early in the evening for managers special drinks and dinner.This hotel is really beautiful.  The breakfast was excellent and the staff is very friendly and helpful.  The hotel is moderately priced for a residence inn and is located in the heart of Savannah. The hotel is pet friendly for a fee and the rooms are large and comfortable.Excellent Hotel with huge rooms!  Nice free breakfast in morning.  It's not super fancy but clean, polite staff, and good location.Upon my arrival at the Residence Inn in Savannah, I was a bit concerned since it seemed to not be right in the center of everything - luckily, the Residence Inn - Historic District is right across the street from the beginnings of the historic district and therefore very easy to walk to.  The Savannah Visitor's Center is also a short 3 minute walk from the hotel.The hotel is very clean and all the rooms have the basics of what one needs from a good hotel while traveling.  As with most Residence Inns, the rooms are large and spacious.  They provide you with basic toiletries (no body lotion, though) and all the amenities necessary for cooking a meal in your room if you chose to do so.  They have a nice outdoor pool.  The daily breakfast is actually pretty good and changes daily...eggs, buttermilk biscuits w/ gravy, bacon, waffles...along with cereal, yogurt, pastries, etc.  The Manager's Reception (M-Th) is great - how can you go wrong with a provided happy hour at no extra cost?!?!?The service here was extremely friendly and I would definitely stay here again on my next visit.Pet friendly (for a fee), awesome friendly staff, great location, convenience store next door and down in the lobby, free beer and wine from 5 to 7 and super nice valet parking made this the best hotel stay we have had during our whole trip! Definitely recommend that you book through an online service because it cost more when I called for a price from the front desk...Large Rooms. Stay in one of the cottages. The staff is great. Breakfast was good, standard for that type of accommodation. There is a belgian waffle maker that I appreciated. It was very quiet there. I appreciated having a kitchen and a living room area to be able to stretch out. The bed was very comfy. There is some off street parking around the back if you are lucky enough to get it. My car was fine the whole time I stayed. I would definitely stay there again. It is really close to the SCAD museum and an easy walk to some of the dorms. It was also easy to get pretty much anywhere we needed to go.Great for a family.  Clean, spacious, and updated rooms with a friendly staff and free breakfast and evening happy hour to boot.  Perfect visit to Savannah!So here on business long term. WARNING!!! They allow dogs.... Therefore my room had FLEAS. And I am allergic to animals. The staff seem friendly but not very Accommodating, they can also be rude. the carpet needs to be changed. there is an inch of dust behind the night stands along with a chip bag and general gross stuff. They do have free beer at a certain time. No hot tub... The overall experience... OK.... Advice, clean better and more often. Oah yeah, the breakfast Is not good at all.Truly a great hotel with nice amenities. Hey...a bar next to the lobby ain't too shabby. The free breakfast was the best we've had in a long time. Standard fare but done very well. Done by a wonderful lady as well who came out and greeted everyone with a warm 'good morning' and even bigger smile.She alone made the stay wonderful.I would like to start off by saying that I grew up in Northern VA and then relocated to Charleston SC. Where I lived for over 6 years... so I know what Southern Hospitality is:) I had one of the BEST experiences I've EVER had at this hotel. My husband and I came down from a Tues-Fri visit and stayed here. The only downside was the parking however during the week we had no problem finding a free spot on the road (instead of valet $12/day) But even the valet was super nice (gated with cameras/well lit). The staff was by far the best part of this hotel. Crystal and Kristen were both super helpful! The hotels breakfast was great also has a happy hour with complimentary beer/wine/food!!! Will most certainly be coming back to stay here soon! Large rooms with full kitchen, great little courtyard seating area, exercise room etc. For the money having 2 meals a day provided plus friendly staff is a BARGAIN. Hotel is within walking distance to downtown area bars and food about 10 minutes awayIn a nutshell: My husband and I stayed at this hotel two different times in the space of two years for weekend Savannah getaways. Both times we were 150% satisfied with everything about our stay. Over the last several years we've stayed in many different Marriott hotels but this is definitely one of the best experiences we've ever had. The Staff:First of all, I have to mention the staff. My experience with hotel staff is that they can be cranky, sour, short-tempered, or - most times at best - simply indifferent. Not so at the Downtown Marriott Residence Inn! Both times we've been there the staff has been INCREDIBLE. And I really mean that! They are friendly. They say good morning with a smile in their voice. They ask if you had a good night's rest. They're super helpful and accommodating and they definitely make you feel like they're welcoming you to "their home". Definitely A+. The Rooms:This hotel has one-bedroom, two-bedroom, and studio suites available. We stayed in a one-bedroom suite and were very happy with how clean and well-appointed it was. The bedroom was big enough for us to comfortably fit our one year old's portable crib next to the king sized bed. And we really appreciated the fact that it allowed for complete privacy with the closing and locking bedroom door. The living area of the suite was comfortable and attractive with a large desk and office chair in one corner and a high-backed arm chair and sofa grouped around the TV. The pull-out sofa would be great for anyone who needed to sleep a third person in their suite. (There is an extra set of bedding provided in the bedroom closet just for that occasion.) The kitchen was small but cute with gorgeous cabinetry and beautiful soapstone countertops. Our kitchen contained a full sized refrigerator, a convention oven microwave, and a two-burner range. Pots, plates, cups, and other basic cook and service wear were stocked in the cupboards. We appreciated the modern finishes to our room and found the entire suite attractive, modern, clean, fresh, and very functional. The Amenities: -BUFFET BREAKFASTIn one word, their free hotel buffet breakfast is *impressive.* We stayed three days and each day there was a little something new. A sample menu might include:-Hot potato, sausage, and green bell papper "hash" (the potatoes were not coated with anything and the entire medley tasted fresh, so I don't think it just came from a freezer bag)-Sausage patties-Scrambled eggs (tasted a lot better to me than the typical "from the can" hotel scramble)-Hot cooked grits-Individually packaged yogurt-A fresh fruit, granola, strawberry syrup, and plain yogurt "bar"-Muffins-Bagels-Toast-English Muffins-Fresh waffles-Cold cereal and milk-Oatmeal-Fresh apples and bananas-Orange and Apple Juices-And just about every kind of condiment you could think of -BARI can't really comment on this because we didn't ever make use of their evening cocktail bar, but I will say that it looked like a nice set up and the bartender always smiled and said hello as we walked passed. -ONSITE RECREATIONThe hotel features a central patio and pavilion area with two BBQ grills, a super cozy outdoor gas fire pit, a covered gazebo, and a good sized outdoor swimming pool. I only wish we had had more time to enjoy them all! They were all very lovely and well-maintained. -EXERCISE FACILITIESThe exercise room was bigger than I would have imagined with a large selection of fitness equipment to choose from. Unfortunately, I didn't use any of it, though, so I can't comment beyond that. ;)-PARKINGParking is not free at this hotel ... but a lot of that is due to the fact that it's just off of downtown Savannah and parking is at a premium there. The upside, however, is that even though you will be charged $12 per day for parking, it is VALET service and your vehicle will be stored behind a secure, gated, barbed wire enclosure when it is not in use. The valet service is super prompt and we actually really enjoyed being able to just drop our vehicle off at the door. So in the end, I don't really see this as too much of a negative. Just factor it into your costs.The Location:The location of this hotel is definitely nice. It's not super premium by any means, but if you're willing to walk 10-15 minutes, you can make your way to just about any of the attractions in downtown Savannah from your doorstep on foot. And if you're not into walking everywhere - the FREE Savannah bus line makes a stop right in from of the hotel as well. The street that the hotel is just off of (Martin Luther King Jr. Blvd) is a little busy, but one crosswalk will take you over a block and it's a relatively quiet and pleasant stroll under the oak trees from there.  So enjoy your stay in Savannah ... and let me know if you found this review helpful! Thanks :)This hotel isn't super fancy, but I found it to be very comfortable and accommodating, especially for business purposes. The kitchenette was a big plus, and housekeeping services did a nice job of keeping everything clean and stocked. The location is a little awkward if you don't have a car, but it's a close walk to everything downtown (just be cautious walking in the area at night). There's a 24-hour convenience store next door, which is helpful.Staying in Savannah at the Residence Inn.  Great city, good location.The people working at this hotel are the friendliest, most helpful employees I have met in quite some time.  The front desk clerk, the valet, the maintenance staff and the barmaid - all a credit to Marriott.  A real pleasure.  JExcellent pet friendly hotel--sometimes places that take dogs are gross, but not this place. Ask for one of the cottages...it's like a big studio apartment.  Quiet, clean, excellent staff. Grounds are spotless (except for where the usual morons haven't picked up after their dogs).  Guys at valet parking were helpful and very welcoming.   Good location, about 10-15 minute walk to main area of historic district, but trolley stops at hotel frequently.  Whole place just has a good vibe.  Bonus for railroad buffs like me:  right next to Georgia Railroad Museum.As a business traveler, I've stayed in many extended stay hotels over the last year. About 90% of my life seems to happen while I have two suitcases unpacked in a 1 bedroom suite.This is the best extended stay I have ever stayed in. I spent a month holed up in Savannah on a work project and the place was a home away from home. Breakfast was of a higher quality than other marriott free breakfasts, bar was open when I needed it, building was well laid out, room was large and comfortable.The staff put the place over the top. Got to know me and how I liked to be helped. Really cool people.Valet parking, nice patio with fireplace, really good price. I had an excellent stay.
review_content_20: We stayed two nights while working in Savannah. We travel often and try to stay at Residence Inns most if the time. This is so far the best Residence Inn we have stayed in. The staff was great, the bar was nice to have and everything was well maintained.We stayed here a few weeks ago to attend a graduation at the Marine base.  Ziphora and Kristin went above and beyond to help is with booking another night on points to avoid us having to switch hotels.One of the nicest Residence Inns I have stayed in.  Very spacious rooms (at least in the cottages) and quiet location. Good breakfast fare too.Amazing hotel.  This really could be a full service Marriott, it is much nicer than many of them.  Easy check in.  Parking on the street.  What else could you ask for?I'm so sorry that it has taken me almost 2 years to post this forthe Residence Inn Savannah, but here it goes.I worked on the movie "The Last Song" in Savannah, GA from May 2009-September 2009.So needless to say, I was in the city for quite some time.When I received word from Disney that I would be working out of townin Savannah, GA I had no idea where the Production Company wouldput me up.When I arrived, I could not believe how clean, beautiful and well-keptthe hotel was presented. From the front desk staff, to the housekeepers, to the managing staff....what a professional place to stay.Donnie the general manager was very nice and pleasant. My job required that I pay the hotel bills for our cast/crew members, sowith that said I had to deal with the management very closely.Donna Krohn and I had phone conversations 2-3 times per week, and she was very helpful, knowledgeable, and professional.Each and every morning, breakfast was presented in the hotel lobby.Amazing!!!!And the staff was so nice..If I needed a cab somewhere, I could always call down to the frontdesk, and they would call a cab for me.The gym was very clean, and had enough equipment to geta great workout.The pool was clean as well, and offered relief from the Savannah heat.There was also a BBQ on the property and we used it a few timesto relax and BBQ in the outdoor area of the hotel property.The location was a plus, and I could walk to any/everywhere that Idesired.Bottom line-the entire staff from management to valet was AMAZING!!!!!Thanks guys,DanielI want to tell you about my experience at the Residence Inn by Marriott in Savannah, GA. I stayed there 6/29/13 to 7/3/13 with my 12 year old daugher. We were there for my daughter's dance competition. This is the second year that we've stayed there. We checked in on Saturday and right before going to bed, I opened the night stand and found a condom box with one condom in it. I also found an opened wrapper with lubicant all in the drawer. I was so mortified by this that I did not sleep in the bed. I used the pullout couch, which had pee stains on it. At this point, I had to weigh my options of which was worse. It was also very uncomfortable for my daughter to find condoms in her room. We were both extremely grossed out by this. The next day, I notified the manager which I had to wait quite awhile for him to see me. He offered to change rooms or comp my room. I had already unpacked all my belongs which was a lot. He also told me that the customer before me had been there a month. Now, I am getting even a worse picture in my mind of the room. I decide to search the room thoroughly and I find a bar napkin with a girls number written on it. I am completely grossed out by this point. The guy in the room before me has been staying here a month bringing random girls back to his room having sex. The worst part is obviously the hotel staff did not clean the room properly. The next thought is what else did they not clean. I had the room recleaned while I was there. After all of this, when I was checking out, I requested a late check out. My friend had just asked and the attendant said yes. However, when I asked, she rudely said no. I tried to explain that with everything that I went through with this hotel, don't you think you could accomodate me? But the answer was NO. After this experience, I will never stay at a Marriott again. I travel quite a bit with dance competition and we always have several options. I will never choose Marriott again.this hotel, undoubtedly, tainted my view and memories of savannah georgia.   when people talk about southern hospitality w/ that lovely twang, they surely did NOT mean this place.  when my husband had to travel there for work recently, i tagged along w/ our kids.  we checked in here because the pictures looked good and we are members of marriott.  as for location, it might be considered w/in the boundaries of the historical district, but quite far away from the nightlife and everything worth seeing w/in the city limits.  you will need to walk everywhere if you want to see the good parts of savannah.  the hotel might look good in the pictures, but the rooms are tired and not well kept up.  we stayed 3 long painful nights here.  the rooms were dirty and  all of the dishes and pots were dirty.  the hand towels had stains and the carpet needed to be vacuumed.  their housekeeping are just really, really bad or they need hire a new crew.  i had to do laundry and the tiny room was just filthy.  the bar and lobby is dark and uninviting.  their idea of a work/business center are 2 old computers that are up against the walls and forget about privacy to check on things like your bank accounts.  everyone can see what you doing or typing.  the chairs for the computers are so old, you sink down when you sit.  as if any of this does not make you run away from this place, you have to meet the staff.  oh boy!  most of the ladies in the front desk are locals w/ serious attitude.  they are rude and do not make any effort to perform the basic functions of their jobs.  during the evenings, the staff will congregate in the tiny lobby area and act like it is their own personal living room and talk super loud about anything and everything.  one night, they had their friends hanging out in the lobby and they were too busy yapping than to bother w/ helping guests.  when you need something, you have to wait in between their conversations to get a word in.  i am not sure how people speak in savannah, but the staff at this hotel reminded me of a really bad rap video. i was on the computer late at night, the night girl at the desk spent most of her time on the phone talking w/ her friends, instead of working, as loud as possible and her gutteral and ghetto language was just unreal.  i had to peek my head around the corner to make sure it was not some teenage kid on the phone at midnight.  their idea of a hot breakfast was some frozen potatoes and disgusting frozen meat.  i am not sure if my dogs would eat the food.  i plan to call their corporate office to share my experience and let them know about this location.  be aware of this Residence Inn and stay away!

review_content: If you want the Old Southern Charm experience, this is the place to go. Located at the beautiful Jones St lined with trees and cobblestones, it was just majestic walking to and from the house. We were lucky enough to score parking across the street so we just walked the whole time going around. Front desk was friendly and helpful! We got a basic room it was really cozy with views of the courtyard. Small bathroom but works well and is complete with the basic amenities you might need.My favorite part was the cocktails before dinner and dessert with coffee after. It was a great way to meet new people! There is good, free breakfast at the courtyard every morning too! I wish we could've stayed longer and will definitely stay here again.This was my first B&B stay and won't be my last.  I chose the ETH purely on chance.  The hotel that caught my eye was actually their sister property, The Gastonian, but it was booked. We were not disappointed.  We were greeted at the curb by a very friendly bell staff who welcomed us and made us aware of the parking situation (curbside parking only and there are street sweepers on the weekends). He even filled the parking meter after I moved my car to the proper spot. The front desk staff at the ETH was a god send.  I was proposing to my GF this weekend and they pulled out all the stops to make sure I had everything I needed.  The weekend would not have been the same without the staff's help.  They accommodated my photographer as well.  Check in and check out took a total of 5 minutes combined. The property offers free continental breakfast, a nightly wine and cheese social followed by a nightly snack and coffee hour.  The food staff at the ETH is amazing. All the foods and desserts were delicious.  There was also free soft drinks whenever you requested them. The house has free wifi and satellite cable.  They also offer a nightly turn down service and help booking any reservations for tours you may be interested in. No words can explain how beautiful this property is. Their website does not do the property any justice.  They have a beautiful courtyard with a koi pond and fountain. It is truly amazing and it's within walking distance of everything in the historic district.The property also offers a "stay 9 nights and get the 10th free" program in association with 3 other properties in the city.We plan to visit again, and you should too!Old old old but lovable. The staff is superior and seem like they love to serve their guests. Not just some of the staff but everyone who we had contact with. Breakfast was excellent and the hours were extended. Be sure to ask about local places to eat or things to see. The afternoon wine and snacks were nice and a chance to jaw with other sojourners. At 9 pm they have decaf and in house made deserts. Another gab session. If you expect all the modern features in this old hotel you might want to stay some other place.Down sides; Internet kept cutting out, parking is on the street. The town of Savanna apparently prides its self on being parking fund raisers on out of town guests.Amazing home and excellent staff, we will definitely return to the home and I highly recommend anyone looking for a quaint bed and breakfast experience to give them a try!!Our room was pretty small, but beautifully appointed and opened out onto the courtyard which offered pretty views.  The service was also spectacular.  Every person we talked to that worked here was a delight.  We hit the wine and cheese hour one day and I was impressed with the spread - lots of different cheese, some dip, some pasta salad.  The dessert at night was also impressive although we didn't stop by too much for that.  I wasn't blown away by breakfast.  I think they call it an expanded continental breakfast which it most definitely is.  I didn't love the seating area for breakfast either.That being said, location was great, staff was great and it was overall a good experience.  I would definitely stay here again.One of the most, if not the most charming BnB I've stayed in. We picked it like shooting darts on a map, but we got lucky. It was one of my best hotel experiences. It has character & the staff treats you like a vip guest. Their wine hour, breakfast and cool beverages during the day are better than most restaurants. It is with great hesitation I write this review, I don't want this place to be booked up next time I return to Savannah. If you get lucky enough to stay here. It's also one of the haunted houses in GA.Can't say enough positive things about the Eliza Thompson House! The location is great, allowing me to walk to sites of interest and to restaurants. The accommodations were charming, comfortable and clean. The premises is inviting, especially the garden court yard with its fountain and seating area. The staff was so friendly and helpful! Would return again without question!Love, Love, LOVED the Eliza Thompson House!My husband and I took a weekend trip to Savannah (and just like other commentators, we've wanted to go since reading Midnight in the Garden of Good and Evil). This was also our first B&B experience.The location couldn't be any more perfect. It's right in the middle of the historic district, so we were able to just park the car and walk everywhere. Regarding parking, there are meters on the street and the city sweeps different sides of the street each night, but there are signs indicating which side each night. The meters are also free on the weekend, but cost on M-F.We stayed in the R. Bruce room and it was wonderful. The ceiling was so neat (as you can see in the photos). It felt like a dream. Service was great...certainly nice to come back to Andes mints each night. Bathroom was okay...but what do you expect when you have a house that old that was converted to a B&B in the middle of the 20th century?Breakfast was good. My favorite part was the biscuits (which were apparently not homemade, but still delicious). The food rotated each morning but it was basically an egg dish, meat, biscuits, grits, muffins/bread and yogurt/fruit/granola. The heated inside area was a little tight, but I'm sure we could have taken advantage of the courtyard as it wasn't THAT cold.We had the hors d'eourves one night (wine, deviled eggs, toast with a spread, cheese and crackers) and the desserts (cream puffs and cake and coffee) as well. Nice touch!I would definitely recommend staying at the Eliza Thompson house on your visit to Savannah.This is one of the best B&B's that we have ever stayed at. Nice and quiet even though its right at the corner of Bull St. And W. Jones. Everything is geared to making their guest feel comfortable and completely at ease. I gave the house 4 stars but Kelly deserves 5 stars and probably 6. She was just stellar. Nothing was too difficult. If we made a request it was done then and there. Overall, this is a great place to stay. Highly recommend.Very nice place to stay in the Historic District of Savannah.  The interior of the house is lovely and comfortable.  The rooms inside of the house are so cool I hated to leave.  Breakfast served from 8:00-10:00 is about the same every day, varied only slightly by what was in the eggs -- sausage or cheese and zucchini, etc.  the wine served with a different cheeses and snacks every evening at 5:00 in the study was a fun social event with my fellow tourists.Overall I loved it.  I only wish that I had been able to book a room inside of the main house instead of the carriage house.  My room was fine, but not amazing like the bedrooms inside of the house -- for the same cost.  I did have a lovely view of the fountain and the courtyard, which was spooky at night with all of the statues.  Very cool.The staff was incredible and very accommodating.   It made for an amazing little adventure to one of the most beautiful cities I have ever visited in the US.No complaints at all, historical, perfect location, Friendly, accommodating Staff. Great value. Highly recommended.This inn is located within one of Savannah's old historic homes. The inn is just adorable and has all the old Savannah charm you are looking for when staying in an old historic inn. Historic Savannah tradition of serving breakfast is served out on the courtyard every morning and consists of homemade biscuits, some sort of egg dish, potatoes, bacon, cereal, grits, yogurt, and fruit. Much better than the average continental breakfast and pretty tasty. The courtyard is beautiful and peaceful and my husband and I spent a lot of time just sitting and hanging out in it. We stayed in a more standard room, which was a bit on the small side but we knew what we were getting when we chose it. They have larger rooms available. They also serve lemonade all day in the parlor and have wine and appetizers from 5:30 to 7pm. This was so. Ice, although the wine could have been of a bit better quality. We were very pleasantly surprised when we got back from dinner our first night and saw that homemade desserts were also served in the parlor.  The staff were so helpful and accommodating. Every one of our needs was taken care of. Kelly, the manager at the front desk was just a dream. So friendly and making sure everything we could possibly want was taken care of. The inn is centrally located so you will have an easy time getting around Savannah. It is also located on Jones Street which my husband and I couldn't stop walking down. The oak lined street was beautiful and charming. Each house was unique and clearly about a century old. I would recommend staying here to anyone. Such a great stay here.I wish I could give 2 and a half stars. 3 just is too many but 2 doesn't seem like quite enough.  When we first checked in the woman was helping another couple. Completely understandable. However, instead of telling us "I'll be right with you" or something else along those lines, she ignored us. We stood there awkwardly for about 10 minutes. The room was okay. I found a used tooth pick on the night stand - so that was pretty gross. Also, the room didn't have much character. I felt like I was at a hotel instead of a B&B. I wanted to book a B&B because of the character of the rooms. I would have booked a hotel closer to the river & cheaper had I known better. The outside patio was very beautiful. A lot of greenery and fish in the pond.  Let's get to breakfast..it was also okay.. The sausage seemed like microwave sausage, the bacon was pretty dried out. The eggs were burnt on the bottom. It was edible, but not great. Honestly, my favorite food item was the toast, if that tells you anything. The wine and cheese was pretty good - they had more  hors d'ouerves than I was expecting. The staff was all very friendly. The cook came out to make sure we liked the food. ( I'm too nice to tell her it was "ehh okay" to her face). Overall it was a "meh" experience. I won't go back there. I absolutely LOVED Savannah though, and thankfully we weren't in our room other than to sleep and get ready.This place was cute and felt luxurious.  The staff was polite and the location was great.  The room was very clean and beautiful.  Comfy bed.  The only negatives were the cheap wine and cheese and the walls are very thin.  They don't allow children, so that was a plus for us.No complaints. Wonderful staff, clean rooms, good breakfast...love they have a nightly social gathering with wine and appetizers. Savannah has so many great things to offer and this place allows you to enjoy everything. We didn't mind the walk down through the squares to bay street. Even though our room was next to the breakfast area, we definitely weren't awoken by the early risers! Would stay here again if we every return. Very charming!Book the Lindsey room.  Really beautiful, one of the 2 original rooms in the house with a gigantic king bed. Definitely the best room in my opinion. Breakfast was better than expected. A really nice selection served buffet style (which I prefer to a plated breakfast as is the case at some other B&B's). On the day we were there they had a yummy baked egg dish, hash browns, sausage, ham, grits, warm biscuits and an assortment of breads and muffins. Also, some cold cereal options as well as yogurt with fruit and granola.  Coffee was very good as well. The dessert and decaf coffee spread at night (I think between 8-10) was an extra special touch.  We will definitely return to this House. Pretty special.The room was so comfortable, there were no ghosts and the wine and cheese they had in the parlor was perfect. I Love Savannah!Such a wonderful B&B to experience Savannah from. My girlfriend and I had a great time staying at this comfortable, quaint B&B. While the location is a little further from the river than other accommodations, it also immersed us deeper into old town Savannah than we might otherwise have experienced.I should also note that I'm a noise sensitive, light sleeper but had no problems with noise here and felt well rested each morning.We would recommend Eliza Thompson House to friends.I have a black soul for hotels, and this WAS my first Bed and Breakfast, so take these things into account with this review.  First and foremost I would like to say the Staff was incredible and a delight.  I had absolutely no complaints whatsoever from a customer service standpoint.  The problems come with the actual amenities provided by the B&B itself.  The rooms and beds are quite small, especially for a couple of the "Girthier" persuasion.  If you are expected accommodations like a chain hotel, you will not find it here.I freely admit I was probably not the target demographic for this place and that should be taken into account when considering my words.In addition to the room they have a somewhat meager breakfast offering that could at least be said to put food in your mouth but little else considering its 50% of the Breakfast in Bed And Breakfast. In the evenings there is a wine a cheese offering and a dessert offering which was decent but serves mostly to allow you an excuse to talk to the other patrons.Overall I am not, as I said, probably the target audience for the cool B&B crowd. The Better Half seemed to enjoy it, but I would probably have rather stayed in a nice Marriott.My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary last week and it was wonderful! We enjoyed every minute! When we arrived they were busy with another guest but we were greeted and offered wine and cheese while we waited to check in. Warm, comfortable atmosphere and super friendly staff. The coffee and desserts each night were awesome. Breakfast each morning was delicious and the courtyard was beautiful and calm which started our mornings off just right. The lady at the front desk helped us decide where to have our anniversary dinner and made us the reservations. She was really friendly and very helpful. The Inn feels like a home away from home, not a hotel. From the minute we walked in the door we were treated like friends visiting rather than customers. All the employees were wonderful from the man who showed us around the Inn to the women who set up the breakfast and people at the front desk. Our room was very cozy as well. They gave us an amazing anniversary getaway and we couldn't have asked for more!
review_content_20: I was in Savannah for a weekend getaway to celebrate a friend's birthday. Everything about the Eliza Thompson House was wonderful!  From the moment we turned onto the tree lined, cobblestone street we were swept away by the charm of the place. The staff was friendly, attentive and eager to assist with directions and suggestions on how best to enjoy Savannah. The Chatham room, which is where we slept, was clean and tidy. I'm always concerned about hotel bathrooms but when I surveyed ours, I was relieved to see that it was in great condition. The B&B is in a good location. In fact, I left the car parked the entire time because we were within a short walking distance of shops and other interesting sites.  When we didn't want to walk we simply hopped in a cab took a shuttle bus. Back at the house, the chats in the parlor over wine, sherry and hor d'ourves were a highlight of our evenings. Made even better when we connected with a lovely couple from Seattle. I'm so glad we decided not to stay in a regular hotel. The Eliza Thompson House made our visit to this charming southern town more authentic. I look forward to the next time!After a recent business trip to Atlanta, I decided to head over to Savannah for the weekend. Eliza Thompson House was recommended to me as a bed and breakfast in a picturesque location. It didn't fail to impress. It's located in Savannah's Historical District, filled with stately homes, beautiful trees, interesting shops, and walking distance from SCAD. Check-in was easy, and I went directly to my room to relax after the four-hour drive. My room was the Eliza, located outside in one of the garden courtyard rooms. At check-in, I was told there is a complimentary breakfast in the courtyard between 8:00-10:00 a.m., an evening reception between 5:30-7:00 p.m., a turndown service and dessert and coffee at 8:30-10:00 p.m. Hungry, I took a leisurely walk over to a gastropub for dinner. Afterward, I sunk into my comfortable bed and immediately fell asleep. Breakfast the next morning consisted of serve-yourself coffee, orange juice, tea; a breakfast cassarole (salsa and egg was served both days), sausage links, fresh biscuits, seasoned hashbrown patties, a selection of breads, grits, and fruit compote. I recommend you arrive early for breakfast for best selection as things definitely get sparse by 9:00 a.m.. Everything I tried was tasty. As it was mid-Fall, there was (heated) seating indoors and patio seating outdoors. The evening reception was served in the parlor and included both white and red wine, a cheese dip so tasty I was required by law to go back for seconds, cheese cubes, crispy crackers and bacon/cheese toasts. There wasn't much seating left inside, so I walked outside and sat by one of the fountains. The property itself is gorgeous, with black wrought iron decorating the various levels of the terrace and surrounded by mature trees draped in spanish moss. It's located in an old house, so you should be prepared to be woken up by the water pressure of other guests taking showers, and chatting along the terrace while they are heading out. It wasn't super-loud by any means and there's something nice about being woken up by happy voices in the morning. Parking is on the street and street cleaning "alerts" are handled by the staff well. They keep an eye on where you park so you don't have any problems and provide you with any assistance you may need during your stay. Though I would imagine if there is an event downtown, parking may be a challenge. Free Wi-Fi. Overall, I really enjoyed my two-night stay and hope you do, too!Staying at The Eliza Thompson House was my first B&B experience. The place is very charming, the staff are all incredibly nice and helpful, but if you're looking for the usual hotel room feel, you're not going to find it here. The room we stayed in was quite small, and it's a bit difficult to go from a king bed at home to a full bed that you're not familiar with. None of this is the fault of the inn, and I knew fully well what I was getting in to. I was visiting Savannah for my wedding, and I wanted something romantic. I got that and more, but I'm afraid I am just too modern for another stay with Eliza. Props go to Kevin, the gentleman who helped us with our luggage and each night's turn down service. He was amazing!One other the to keep in mind is that the House does not have their own parking lot, so it is first come, first serve street parking. With that said, we didn't have any problems finding nearby parking on our Sunday-Tuesday visit.A great stay in a fine place in a great location.  The young woman at the front desk was special.  The place is quiet and comfortable.  We were in town to eat so all the food was not necessary.  I overheard people talking who ate the full breakfast (quite a layout - unlike many B&Bs), grabbed a lunch somewhere, ate the 5 p.m. snacks with the free wine and later returned to enjoy the 8 p.m. desserts.  In other words, you can stay here in fine accommodations and not blow your budget at the restaurants.  Of course, that would mean missing out on so many fine Savannah restaurants.  Everything in the historic district is proximal to Eliza Thompson House.The Eliza Thompson house was the best bed and breakfast that I have stayed at. The bellman and the staff were more than accommodating.The rooms are very nice, we stayed in The Savannah Room.There is a wine and cheese hour in the evening. Followed by dessert later on. But the breakfast... Oh so good.The breakfast is served bright and early and hot! Fresh out of the kitchen. They have a great southern egg and bacon casserole , sausage, grits ,hash browns and more . It's set out on the patio looking over the beautiful gardens and they have nice heat lamps too. They feed you so much food that you can skip eating lunch and save some money. Savannah is a great walking town so we had lots of places where I could walk off all that heavy food.The Rooms at the Eliza Thompson house are BEAUTIFUL. And very private. I actually had a room below the bed and breakfast with a private entrance. It was nice because I didn't have to worry about waking other guest up going in and out.There is a local trolley that will also pick you up outside of the Eliza Thompson house for easier access to the downtown area.The street that Eliza is located on is one of the oldest streets and one of the few that is still all brick. It's beautiful ! There aren't enough words to describe all the great things about The Eliza Thompson House. If I go back to Savannah one day there is no other place that I would ever stay.Having dreamed of visiting Savannah for years (yes, I confess, starting with a reading of Midnight in the Garden of Good and Evil), I was looking for a place to stay that would really make the experience.  I chose well when I chose the Eliza Thompson House.  The house is lovely, located on the picturesque and historic Jones Street.  Just pulling up you know you are in the Savannah of your dreams.  We decided we wanted to stay in the main house and ended up getting booked into the Johnston Room.  This room, at least during the time of our stay, didn't seem quite as nice as some of the other main house rooms, and was long and narrow, but was still nice with plenty of room and with a very comfortable bed.  All the staff was very courteous and helpful.  The breakfast included hot breakfast items and while not necessarily the best breakfast I have ever had, was still better than any other included breakfast I can recall having recently.  The location is outstanding if you want to explore the historic district (as we did).  They are located about a couple of blocks from the Mercer-Williams House and it is only couple more blocks to Forsyth Park.  The Eliza Thompson House is a perfect base to explore all of the various gorgeous squares and historic buildings of the unfairly beautiful Savannah.  In the event you have a car, given the age of the neighborhood, there is only street/metered parking.  However, you will be able to purchase a parking pass at the front desk which will allow you to park at the metered parking near the B&B.  When we were there, we managed to find parking very nearby without difficulty.   We would definitely recommend staying at the Eliza Thompson House.My girlfriend and I stopped at this place on a Sunday night on our way back home.  I have stayed at the Gastonian and this is a sister property, which was suppose to be nicer.  Upon check-in we were greeted with a warm welcome and a generous bellman that helped with luggage and offered vast info about the place and Savannah.  There was complimentary wine and cheese and then dessert an hour laterThe room we stayed was nice, bathroom a little small and outdated.  The next morning we woke up and was expecting a phenomenal breakfast and wow what a disappointment.  We came down at 9:30 and overheard the breakfast attendant complaining if it was 10am yet.  Walking around they offered some kind of egg/quiche/casserole thing then had some skimpy French toast.  They also had cereal, fruit, yogurt, and grits.  Chain hotels for lesser price offers more for breakfast then they did.  Overall the place was nice, but breakfast needs improvement.We love this bed and breakfast and have stayed here 5 times....every time we return to Savannah. Kevin, the bellman is fantastic and willing to help with anything you could need! The courtyard is just beautiful and the nightly wine, hors d'oeuvres, desserts and coffee are great and a nice way to meet people who have traveled to Savannah from all over. Breakfast in the courtyard is also very good...especially the egg casserole. We will be back for sure!This B&B is truly a gem. Gorgeous setting and great rooms! Very clean and extremely friendly staff. They sure do try to fatten you up there! Big complimentary breakfast every morning with all the trimmings, free wine, cheese and hors d'oeuvres each night, and also free dessert each night too! All delicious. Only 2 small complaints. 1- the fact that they didn't put curtains over the blinds on the french doors to the bedroom. So if someone wanted to, they could stand outside and watch you sleep (creepy, but never really worried about it). This doesn't apply to the rooms in the original house though. 2- pillows that were WAY too soft. Unless you like those really mushy pillows that don't hold any shape, bring your own.  Knowing that, I will gladly stay there again and again (and bring my own pillow).Absolutely outstanding bed and breakfast! Beautiful rooms and courtyard! Excellent location, walking distance throughout Savannah's historic district, Forsythe Park, etc. Terrific service! Delicious hot, country breakfast every morning and cheese and wine every evening! Great price! We can't wait to go back!I am not even sure where to start with this place.  It is definitely charming at first glance...However, the rooms are something to be desired.  It seems to be that they are rarely cleaned.  Our bathroom floor was filthy.  The toilet was dirty.  The shower head had SO much build up on it...it was disgusting.  On top of that, the bath tub had black marks and some one else's hair in it. The blankets that were supplied looked like they had newspaper ink on them...We told the front desk about these issues the next morning and were assured that it would be taken care of.  However, upon returning to our room that afternoon, it seemed that nothing had been done.  The bed had been made, but with the same the blankets that were there before.  Our coffee cups were still sitting on the dresser with dried up coffee.  Sugar had been spilled on the night stand and it was not cleaned up.  The robes issued by the hotel were balled up on one of the chairs and not hung up.  The bathroom had not been touched.  I went down to complain and the front desk lady became really defensive.  The next day, it was the same thing...except THIS time the blankets had been replaced, but the OLD blankets were balled up on the chair with the robes...It was unbelievable!  It was really unacceptable.  I would never recommend this place to anyone...It was dirty. The people were rude and it was DIRTY...did I say that already?  Well, I can't say it enough! Yuck!

review_content: Wow! What a great stay for our anniversary trip! From the moment we walked into the lobby I was impressed. They let us check into our room early, there was a very nice man there that showed us right where to park, and helped us with our bags. When we walked into our room we were sooooooo excited! It was like a mini apartment with a kitchen, and a huge room lit up with so much light, and a great view of the river. At first we thought the bed was our least favorite part of the room, but we were pleasantly surprised by how well we slept! (we are not good sleepers at all) We loved the Wine and cheese at 5:30. We even met some of the other guests, which made it feel homey. The ice cream was a great touch also. This hotel had so many positives. I would definitely stay here again. I would however suggest to the hotel to maybe add some kitchen supplies (pots, pans, plates, silverware, etc. although there are so many great places to eat you might not need them) Other than that, a perfect stay!*edited to add the horrible experience I had after I left (of course).I accidentally left a very expensive shoe (I forgot just the one) there on 1/16 and called up to ask if what their policy was about forgotten things. They said they contact the person regarding the lost item when they found it. They did not do this with me. I had to ask them to look for it and they finally found it. The woman I spoke with took down my address and said she'd send it. A week later I still hadn't heard anything or received anything. I called back. They said the girl I talked to had quit and just left it. Of course. So I asked if they would mind sending it, PLEASE. I called back yesterday (2/10) and they said it had been sent. I asked for a tracking number because I still hadn't received it. The person on the phone, after a brief conversation about not keeping records of things sent out USPS (and paid for by me) put the phone down. A very, very, very rude man came on the phone. When I asked why I was speaking with him and who he was, he refused to give me his name and told me they don't keep records, they couldn't help me and hung up on me. I called back and he said 'OH, SORRY, we must have gotten disconnected.' By the tone of his voice it was very obvious it wasn't an accident. He again told me he couldn't help me, he didn't have records of them sending me my stuff, etc. I asked for the number to their home office and shockingly received it. Called them and within MINUTES (I kid you not) they had called me back with my tracking number. AMAZING.Forget this hotel. No matter how pretty it is, if your customer service is bad you'll never get my business again. No thank you.Stayed in this wonderful hotel in 2004, and couldn't wait to come back....we stayed in Suite 409, the S.S. Savannah.  Everything was as I remember, even though the grand ole place has been updated....staff makes your stay effortless, and the hotel is sparkling clean.I think that Hank the resident ghost moved my "expensive" shoe from my suitcase on the last night there....Thank goodness I saw from the corner of my eye, a white bag just slightly peeking out from under the bed....there is no way that shoe traveled that far even if it fell out....just finished reading another post about someone forgetting one shoe earlier in the month.I booked this hotel through kayak and was pleasantly surprised! The room is spacious and clean. The staff has been an absolute delight. When we first arrived to our room, the front desk called about 10 minutes in to make sure everything was good for us. At 5:30 they offer complimentary wine and cheese. Also before bed they do a "turn down" service and put Klondike bars in our freezer! The complimentary breakfast was good as well. Overall, I am very pleased and would definitely return. The location is awesome!This is an excellent place to stay whale in Savannah. This Inn is right on the river and you can watch the ships come in to the harbor from your room window or from the windows of the dining room in which a pretty good breakfast is served everyday. Nothing better than buttered grits in Georgia!The rooms are huge, and beautiful. hardwood flooring throughout. Exposed brick walls, large wooden beams and large windows facing the river. There is also a fully functional galley style kitchen if you want to cook...but you're in Savannah man! Why in the world would you want to cook when you are surrounded by awesome restaurants?!? And unlike other hotels they do not leave a little chocolate on your pillow when the bed is turned down. No! They leave ice cream for you in the fridge! WOOHOO!Speaking of the staff, they were all excellent, very friendly and helpful. One small thing I noticed (that I loved) was that whenever we had a question or even addressed the staff, they stopped doing what they were doing & looked us in the eyes when they answered. Southern Hospitality folks!The rates were not that expensive and were well below what some other places were charging. I don't think you would be disappointed if you choose to stay here while in town.Best hotel in Savannah, when compared to their local competition (Gastonian, The Bohemian, The Mansion, The Cotton Sail).  This is based on their huge room size and based on the fact that they are located VERY close to the river walk.Love this hotel! A large space with a functional kitchen! Gives you the feel of having an apartment in Savannah right on the river walk! My wife and I keep coming back here...it is charming, convenient, and the staff are lovely and always accommodating! Room 202 is the best! it is even fun to write in the guest book they provide you with to write about your stay Savannah and your time spent at the Olde Harbor Inn. 1 Star off because it can be a bit noisy in the halls and from Joes Crab Shack but that is really hit or miss! we will definitely be staying here again!Great location. Within walking distance to East River street with shops, bars, and restaurants. Room is very spacious. Living room is separate from the bedroom and there's a kitchenette. Pet friendly is a plus, and they provide turn down service complete with a ice cream treat! Even a doggie bag with treats. Wine and cheese happy hour at 5:00. Supposedly haunted by ghost named Hank- so far only have some flickering lights but will follow up if we get anything good to report. Love it so far.What a charming gem of a hotel.The hotel overlooks River St central to most things. We were given a suite with kitchen, lounge, bedroom and bathroom with river view.Room 309. When we arrived you have to go down Lincoln Ramp and take the first right . I missed this and ended up driving along River St parking in the 2 hr parking and walking up the steps to check in. Dominic who is an excellent ambassador for the hotel came back to the car with me picked up the bags and directed me to the free parking at the end of River St. I read a few reviews knocking the parking but it was easy. The rooms very clean, the breakfast buffet was nice,they offer a cheese and wine horsdouvres and a daily Klondike bar each. To stay in a central place with great staff was priceless.Highly recommended. I held back 1 star as I didn't see the ghost.This was a beautiful inn that my boyfriend surprised me with for the Fourth of July. The inn itself is quite lovely and has a modern and historic look. We checked in and parking was simple as there were spots available near our room. The front desk was extremely helpful and informative and surprised us with a gift;) We were told breakfast started at 7am-9am. Then around 5pm-7pm snacks were provided such as wine, cheese, desserts, and little hors d' oeuvre that vary every day. That is sweet!!! When we opened the door to our room it was as if we entered into a private underground apartment. We absolutely loved the spacious rooms and opened up the freezer to find two Klondike ice cream bars! I then walked into our master room to find two robes laying on our bed with a note to enjoy our ice cream and the weather for the next day. I walked into the living room to find a bottle of wine, two glasses and a box of chocolates that my sweetie ordered ahead to surprise me with. I was impressed and ecstatic. The location of the inn was very convenient as it was just a walk a way to river street. Restaurants and souvenir shops were everywhere and a ferry to get to the convention Center if needed to. I will forever love this olde harbor inn. My boyfriend proposed to me on july 4 in the inn. I have to say there was no better way to end our stay in romantic savannah georgia, olde harbor inn with my fiance!!!I'll be back..... Get ready HANK!!I have no clue if this place is haunted or not. But. It did keep me up all night for two nights in a row from all the ghost stories I read in the room's guestbook. I am a wuss. The staff here is southern friendly. Everyone from the doorman to the front desk lady were wonderful and welcoming. I came with a big group, and they remembered what we did each day and suggested new spots to check out each morning after the continental breakfast. The best two parts... the ice cream sammies that magically appear in your freezer when you come home after a long night of drinking mint juleps and eating pralines. Yummers. And. Wine and cheese hour. Courtesy of the hotel. I great way to start the night of fun or the night of ghost hunting in the loft area of your room.Olde Harbour Inn delivered great first impressions for us.  The check in area is beautiful and a clean country modern type style.  We were also impressed with the size of the room. (Room 302).  high ceilings with a long hallway passing a bathroom and kitchen opening up to a huge bedroom and sitting areas.  (Our room was carpeted.)I'd originally wanted to stay at the Brice, but the rate went up the night before we booked.   I then chose the Hyatt and then did a free cancellation when I saw the Olde Harbour Inn.  (That will give you an idea of the types of hotels we were considering.)The location is very convenient to the river street bars and restaurants, and given that it was Oktoberfest weekend, we still found parking on the cobblestones very, very close to our room.  (Room entrances are in clusters accessible off the street, with 1 keyed door serving as an entry way to a small foyer to access 3 rooms.)Turn down service results in crunch ice cream bars in the freezer - a welcome touch in the evenings!  The bed was very comfortable with multiple sheet layers. The hot morning breakfast buffet is complimentary with the room and had plenty of options to choose from.  We were also pleased with the evening wine and snack reception, also included.  I also made use of the room's coffee maker which was clean.  Hubby would have preferred a larger TV, but I'm grateful that it gave me better odds of getting him out sightseeing and away from the games on TV. :)I'd made the mistake of searching to see if the hotel might be haunted (most of Savannah is, it seems), so my overactive imagination made me sleep lightly when I read reports of Hank.  I think I was sleeping  when I imagined my covers being pulled towards the window (opposite direction from my sleeping husband) because when I checked, nothing appeared to be shifted.  That doesn't seem to line up with the reports anyways.  Like I said, overactive imagination!  We were able to hear the street cleaners in the early morning hours as they made multiple passes cleaning the streets on Sunday morning and the floor above us did creak which wasn't helped by the guest above us having their dog with them to constantly move around.  It IS an older building, so those things are to be expected.Overall, it is a charming hotel.  You can tell the owners have worked hard to create a pleasant staying experience. :)Loved this hotel. The rooms were more like a suite. The decor was beautiful. Yhe bathroom was small, but adequate. The kitchenette would have been useful if we had been staying for more than a day. They provided complimentary bottled water, and Klondike bars at bed time. We could hear the horn of the boats on the river and some of the street noise, but for us it only added to the charm. They even provided a complimentary breakfast with fresh scrambled eggs, bacon, grits, various breads, coffee, juice, cereal, oatmeal...the works. We will definitely return.I really liked this little hotel/ B&B.  Great location, especially for catching the ferry over to the convention center.  Great walkability to just about anything - restaurants, shopping, the river, etc.No mints on your pillow here - you get an ice cream bar in your freezer instead! (The rooms have kitchens.) The staff was very helpful and kind.  The room was clean and had everything we needed - TV, internet, lots of room and a cute concept of a "Room Diary." It's in one of the drawers and all the guests write in it, giving ideas of things to do, places to go and kind words about the hotel.  Really cute.Oh, and there's a free wine happy hour every night in the main building. Woo!!True Southern Hospitality!!!My husband and I stayed here a few weeks ago and had an incredible visit. The suites were extremely spacious, very well appointed and decorated, featured a full kitchenette, and overlooked the river. I truly felt at home and relaxed.  The location was great- right along East Bay Street, but off enough to the side to be quiet. It was a short walk to the restaurants and pretty city squares. Despite being on the water, it was surprisingly quiet- I only heard one barge coming through in the morning. The hospitality was fantastic. Not only was there a delicious hot breakfast, but there was a happy hour with wine, soft drinks, cheese, and assorted tasty snacks- they put a lot of effort into creating varied and pretty snack bites. The lounge was warm and inviting - the perfect locale to meet new friends. On top of that, the turn down service even featured ice cream!The service was outstanding as well. Rates were very competitive and parking rates were much lower than most places around. Thanks to Rachel who went out of her way to accommodate us on a very busy night, and to Kevin who truly went above and beyond to help us find some free parking!  I would definitely stay again.The staff here is super friendly! Our room was clean and the turn down service and ice cream was a nice touch. They do a wine and cheese reception with light hors d'oeuvres. The first night was a couple different kinds of macaroons and a tuna salad in a light pastry. The second night was a cucumber slice over a piece of cream cheese covered bread and chocolate chip cookies. The breakfast was much more than I expected. We had a scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, biscuits, cereal, grits, oatmeal, bagels, toast, danishes, and yogurt. The staff were always very friendly. When we arrived it started raining while we were checking in - one of the staff grabbed us an umbrella as we didn't have one to get to our car and then helped us unload so we didn't have to be in the rain as long. They gave us a full tour on check in as well. The room was spacious and we couldn't hear anything from our neighbors. The bed was comfortable and plenty of everything was provided.This was our first trip to Savannah and we chose this B&B because of its location, price, breakfast, and evening wine. The location was fantastic (based solely on that, I would have rated it 5 stars)!! The breakfast was ok, they had sausage and biscuits but no eggs ... a bit strange. But the sausage was definitely tasty and the biscuits were warm and flaky. I guess my only complaint regarding the breakfast was that I wish they'd had more options. They had cold cereal (but I can't consume dairy) and yogurt (again, dairy) in addition to the biscuits and sausage. The evening wine reception was ok. We have stayed at other hotels that had this and in comparison to the others we have experienced, this one was so-so. They do only have wine (one red and one white, so you may not enjoy it if you are picky about your wines), some cheese, and some very tasty sandwiches and cookies. It is definitely nice to have this available. We were hoping to talk to more of the guests at the reception to get insights into what we should do. But, in the end, it was nice and appreciated!Where the Olde Harbour Inn truly shines (besides location), is it's staff! They are FANTASTIC. Extraordinarily helpful and accommodating, they did everything they could to make us comfortable and ensure that we had all the information we needed to be efficient tourists and have a good time. Hands down, possibly the best staff I have ever met in hospitality!Where the Olde Harbour Inn lost stars with me, was in the level of cleanliness of the bathroom. The tub had hair stuck in the drain (visible), there was (permanently?) stuck dirt on the hair dryer that is attached to the wall, and it just felt overall a bit grimy. I'm sure if we had mentioned this to the staff, someone would have probably come down to take care of it. However, everything else was so spectacular, and they were so nice, friendly, and accommodating, that complaining about something so insignificant at the time did not seem necessary. Had my travel partner said something to me, I probably would have, but who knows ... maybe I'm just overly picky about certain things? I really don't have any complaints about the Inn. It was wonderful, and I would certainly stay here again. The one thing I do want to mention, is that the bed ... can creak a bit. This was our first time in a B&B, so maybe this is to be expected because they are actual bed frames and aren't attached to the floor, but knowing ahead of time would have been appreciated. So there it is. Oh, and if you can, request a room that is not on the ground floor. There is nothing wrong with the ground floor (ours was on that level), but staying on a higher floor and having a view is always nicer!We arrived around 4:00 on a Sunday.  Greeted by two very nice staff members.   Positives: Very large room.  Unique antique feel.  Free wine/cheese/cookie cocktail hour where we chatted with other guests.  Very informative staff.  Close to all the River Street shops and bars.  Convenient parking.  Clean room (at least as clean as it could be while still maintaining the historic feel). Pretty decent breakfast.  Nice robes. Negatives: Shower water was slow to drain.  Low shower.  Ugly carpet.  Outdated decor. View from our downstairs room wasn't great due to construction going on outside our room.  Parking was $12 for 48 hours.  Room smelled like cleaning products.I'm a little vexed by how well they are reviewed elsewhere, but after seeing the fellow clientele I realized if you are thirty you aren't even halfway to the average age, and frankly a savvy selection of review baiting bribes (Gratis wine and ice cream, which is a smart and excellent touch) I feel like expectations might be different for the younger more active yelp set.I will get straight to the important bit, the elephant in the room we aren't supposed to talk about... Do you want to have sex on your vacation? You can hear your neighbors Snoring, Whispering, Breathing, and Talking in hushed tones, etc. That's okay, no crazy acrobatics tonight, just gentle missionary and bite your lip... Bam Bam Bam, The headboard slams hard against the brick walls unsecured, the bed frame (It's a petite hardwood conventional bed frame like at grandma's house) wobbles comically no matter how gentle the antique bed is operated, the broken wooden slats slam against each other on each rebound so both wall and box spring are getting in on the racket. All in all a gentle session sounded like a comical hollywood sound-effects level headboard pounding of sleazy motel, all this coupled with paper-thin doors where your neighbors felt separated by a curtain (The clear visible gaps in the door frame being a likely culprit).The historic parts are great and beautiful and spacious, love the hardwoods and brick walls with exposed beams, but the hotel elements look built in the 80s or 90s and are getting worn. The bathroom was mildewing and most spigots and drains were broken and clogged. The furniture is faded and some elements sticky, for $200+ I feel like these expectations are not out of bounds.Recommended for exhibitionists with a "Don't wake Grandma" fetish and Grandmother's who don't mind being woken, for me, not the romantic getaway I was hoping for.For the location, price, service and comfortable rooms, ya can't get anything better in Savannah, period.  I've been visiting Savannah for 20 years now and decided to stay at the O.H.I. for the first time a few weeks ago for 3 days.  I'm just sorry I never stayed here before.  I can't explain how many nights and money I have wasted on other places in the past.  Thanks to all the hard working folks at the O.H.I. for making my stay so wonderful!  No ghosts bothered me at all.  :)O.H.I. secret:  Look for the "Pam MacDonald" sign-in book floating around the rooms.
review_content_20: Nice and spacious rooms in a great location!  Great updates in the lobby area and the manager was very sweet and helpful.Oh my!  This place was near perfect!  For starters, it's located next to beautiful Emmett Park.  We enjoyed being able to appreciate the park from through our window or by simply walking out of our door.  The hotel was cozy and elegant.  It had a nice vintage feel to it.  The hotel staff are RIDICULOUSLY hospitable.  Erika, at the front desk, was especially accommodating.  Erika had the answers to all of our questions.  I ask for a water fountain, she introduces me to an endless supply of cold water bottles.  That was just the start of it.This place offered free wine, cheese, crackers, and finger sandwiches.  Turn down service with Klondike bars.  Seriously?  Could it get any better?  The breakfast was pretty good, too.  I recommend cutting the biscuit in half and sticking a sausage patty in the middle.  Besides having to shower on my knees, having my feet and ankles hang off the bed, and having to duck while walking around the loft, this place was perfect.  I guess, to appreciate this lovely and historic inn, you can't expect it to be built for people taller than 6ft.  ;) I really have no complaints.  If you think the location and the architecture are appealing, you should come check out the hospitality of the staff!  Shazaam!We won a gift certificate for a complimentary night here and really enjoyed it. The staff was friendly at check-in. Our room wasn't ready, but they stored our luggage and reserved a parking spot for us (parking is apparently free on the weekends). We left the car at the hotel and we went about our day. While on the far end of River Street, it's in a great location within walking distance to anything and everything. We picked up the keys around 5:00. They had already placed our luggage in the closet of the room. The room - my lord the room was huge. We had a room with one queen bed. You enter the room and there is a long hallway, bedroom and bathroom to the immediate right, followed by a kitchenette with full size fridge, and then a spacious living room. I was incredibly surprised at the size of the room. It was tastefully decorated in "period appropriate" decor - very "old Savannah" and charming. I wouldn't say "luxurious" - but charming for sure. We didn't partake in breakfast or the evening reception and in fact, didn't even take advantage of the Klondike bars they left in the room - but all are nice touches. I would love to have the opportunity to stay here again. It was a fantastic experience all around. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again or recommended it to a friend.The staff was wonderful and helpful but the room itself had a lot of problems. The electricity was weird. TV that shut off randomly and the hot water was inconsistent. One day the maid did not show at all and another day the cleaning was really bad.
