The price was right but  Not sure if I would return.LOVED this hotel. We came during the week and stayed in the king suite. Clean, charming, exactly what I imagined my B and B experience in Savannah to be. GREAT location on River St in the historic district, within walking distance to tons! Staff is very friendly, helpful, honest and informative. The bellman greeted us instantly and brought our bags to our room while we checked in. The complimentary hors devours with wine and cheese, and the breakfast were great. Great TVs, cable, plenty of towels supplied in bathroom, great turndown service with next day weather reports and Klondike bars. This place was awesome, especially for the price and location. We LOVED it. First timers especially, people should Definitely stay here!WoW! The staff was really great. Erika at the front desk made things happen. And Theron was great as well. Couldn't have been more pleased with the service. I was also impressed with the size of the suites. Ours had a full bedroom, living room and kitchenette which was awesome. Great location -- right on river street and within walking distance to almost everything.We returned from a stay at this property today, and I felt compelled to share my disappointing experience (particularly since the innkeeper was unavailable for the duration of my stay and chose not to contact me throughout even though I complained to front desk staff on 2 occasions). The location was great except for tons of stair and no elevators, but they advertised this on their website so I certainly can't fault them. Unfortunately, they also advertised a DVD player in the upstairs loft BR and these were critical factors (separate loft and DVD player) in my selection of the property for my visit with 2 kids under 5. When I called to notify the front desk that we had no DVD player, first I got a busy signal for about 15 minutes, then had to call from my cell phone. The front desk person at that time (very friendly and professional btw) apologized and told me that they wouldn't be able to provide one until the following day since the property was booked. The very next day they did indeed provide one. The next (last) day our room was never serviced by housekeeping. When I called around 4 pm to ask them to service it, Sky (different front desk person) indicated that housekeeping was gone for the day. I asked to receive some sort of credit due to the customer service issues that I'd experienced and she indicated that since the innkeeper (Cristin) was gone, she wouldn't be able to authorize that. I came down to the front desk to ask her to reach her to address it, she (Sky) called while I sat there (told her about the housekeeping issue, mentioning a DVD issue but never explaining it since she says it was addressed so it was a non issue to her). After they spoke for a few minutes, she jotted down notes on a post it and asked me if I wanted the bellman to make up my beds. I told her that I didn't; I'd rather just get fresh towels and toiletries and get some sort of acknowledgment from mgt of the poor customer service. She didn't seem to understand the latter and definitely treated me as if I was a huge inconvenience to her. She left to get the towels (or so I thought) AND NEVER RETURNED. When the bellman (very nice) asked me if I needed help, I explained that she was helping me. Other guests came in to check in and they were waiting behind me. After I'd sat there for quite awhile, I asked the bellman if she was coming back. He said he'd check. He asked me if my issue had been resolved, and I told him I wasn't sure bc she spoke with the innkeeper and instead of telling me the resolution, just got up and left. He left to find her and returned to tell me that the innkeeper authorized her to take $30 off my total bill. I asked why she didn't tell me that and he said that she'd been feeling ill earlier that day but wasn't sure why she'd left. Ironically, when I came by the front desk later that evening to ask for a restaurant phone number, she gave it to me never acknowledging her earlier disappearance and utter refusal to resolve my issue. The mistakes that happened during my visit were not truly severe in my opinion, but Sky's attitude and the innkeeper's clear indifference were terribly disappointing. These should not have been significant issues and could have been easily resolved with just a speck of customer service and social skills in my opinion. I must admit that upon checkout Ericka granted me a half night's credit which was gracious but more importantly she seemed to acknowledge that mistakes had been made and offered sincere apology along with a commitment to improve -- too bad I couldn't have gotten just a bit of that sooner.Unbelievable!!!! Loved this place!! The service was out of this world (thanks to Kevin).A little pricey but it's worth it to get a riverfront room the size of a small apartment (seriously, it had a full size kitchen in it).  Evening wine and appetizers were good, but I had to checkout before I could try the free breakfast.  Take pictures in your room, I got some unexplained light orbs in mine....creepyThis is the perfect B&B for a nice weekend getaway. The prices start at about $250 a night but they are reasonable considering that you get a suite and a tasty southern style breakfast. It is situated right on River Street near the water. You can get all 48 hour parking for $8 and I recommend trying One eyed Lizzy's restaurant nearby for a casual tex-mex style lunch. By the way, apparently there is a resident ghost on the premises but we didn't encounter him during our stay.

review_content: We picked this hotel on a whim as we were looking for a decent place to stay without breaking the break while visiting in Savannah. All the hotels in the historic district were out of our budget, but we found this hotel online, booked it and drove over to check in right away. The front desk staff were prompt and friendly. I asked for a first floor room, away from the road, to accommodate our baby traveling with us and they were happy to oblige. We would have preferred 1 king bed rather than 2 doubles, but we were told that was all they had available at the time.There was plenty of parking available right in front of the room which was very convenient for unloading all bags. The room was clean, bed was comfy, seemed like they had recently renovated as well. The only thing that could stand improvement was the shower. The water pressure was so wimpy and the temperature was not very warm. Wah! Overall though, we were satisfied as it was quiet, comfy and had all the basics needed including TV, fridge, microwave, etc.We tried to go for the continental breakfast in the morning, but we didn't show up til 9:30 and it was over at 9 (I thought it went until 10). It looked like your basic hotel breakfast of eggs, pastries, oatmeal, coffee, etc. Checkout was a breeze and we were on our way to explore the city again without any problems. Would recommend staying here for travelers on a budget.We got a room that had been infested by bedbugs.  We noticed a couple bites after the second night, but didn't think it was bedbugs.  After the third night, I was covered in bites.  We checked the bed and found multiple bedbugs!  We took pictures and called the health department.  I brought it to the attention of the front desk staff, who was not at all concerned or helpful.  She was completely unapologetic and actually quite rude about it.  I called the manager later, and he was just as unconcerned.  They did give us 1 free night, though I felt we should have been comped for all 3 nights seeing as we slept 3 nights in a bedbug infested room.  And that does not even factor in the over $500 we spent because of the infestation, including getting new suitcases, laundering and dry cleaning all our clothes, visiting urgent care (I had a bad reaction to the bites) and getting anti-allergy medications.    Will never stay here again and recommend everyone else avoid it.One of the cleanest and best maintained BW we've seen.  Although when I called to confirm the clerk I reached was curt and impatient, the desk staff were all helpful and friendly during our stay. Compact economy rooms but comfortable with effective maid service and the hot water was fast and plentiful. It's not a beautiful area and it's a 15-20 minute drive to the historic district but the price was right. It's worth staying at --- saving your money for the pricey restaurants and tours. There's a good cheap diner across the street-- better than the motel's bare bones breakfast. There's a great restaurant not too far -- the Sweet Potato Kitchen-- inexpensive and superb. One of the biggest features of Savannah is the HUGE amount of pawn shops everywhere. It's a sign, I guess, of persistent poverty.When I go to a hotel I have pretty basic expectations. Reasonable price, no roaches, and no hookers. At least no visible crimes occurring. This BW was a very reasonable price. They also offered a military discount.The beds were very comfortable. They actually had non-smoking. It was very quiet, checkout and check in was very simple. A lot of people complained about airplane noise. Seriously? You're in a city. I live by an airport and Langley Air Force base. Imagine the noise I incur daily. This place was a lot nicer looking than the La Quinta Inn down the street. I would stay again.Good, clean, quiet and friendly staff. The breakfast is free and good. Lots of choices and the eggs and sausage was above average. I would stay here again. Nice pool too.I had a different experience here than what is described in some of the other reviews.I stayed here two nights and had no complaints.  The room and facility was clean and well maintained.  There was no evidence of any bugs or any kind of infestation as is mentioned in some other reviews.  The room was quiet and comfortable and I had no problems sleeping.  I did not once hear any airplanes from the nearby air force base.  The free wifi, by the way, was excellent with a very strong signal in my room.This is a motel style property where the parking is right next to the rooms and the rooms open up directly to the outside.  There are two floors.  If you are concerned about staying in a hotel with rooms that open directly to the outside, this isn't the place for you.  However, I did not see that the area was sketchy or gave me any concern.The prices here are much lower than what you would pay in downtown Savannah, and yet the motel is an easy six mile or so drive into the city down Abercorn St.I actually liked the area it was in because there was ample shopping opportunities nearby.  There were several large shopping centers with Publix, Kroger, and Fresh Market nearby.  The rooms in the hotel come with a refrigerator and microwave, so if you're on a budget you can get food in these markets to supplement your dining out.  The rooms also have coffee makers in them, so no need to run off early in the morning to a Starbucks or other coffee place.  There are also numerous dining choices in the immediate vicinity if you want to eat out without going into the city.  The dining choices in the area are more in the line of the chain restaurant.There are also some other similar type hotels in the area.  I would really recommend this motel or this area if you are trying to save money on hotels.  It's a little bit out of the city, but not so much that you feel you're spending too much time driving during your holiday.Horrible service. The front desk staff hung up on my grandparents when they called for directions and said "What, haven't you ever stayed in a hotel?" when she couldn't find their online booking. When my father and mother called to speak to management the same girl hung up on THEM. She proceeded to make my 70-something grandparents leave the hotel because they had their reservation "didn't exist" and "wasn't paid for," even after my father faxed her a copy of the confirmation AND even sent the credit card a second time. Management supposedly won't be in untiltomorrow, and now my elderly grandparents, who have been driving for 12+ hours today have no place to stay. Absolutely mortifying.Air condition cleaned NEVER did not work hot water just like warm.. Horrible bleach smell to everything.  Sheets maybe 100 thread count...Dated but in great shape, beds and room comfy. The breakfast was good for hotel fare with a delightful southern belle operating the ding area.Easy to find location and for driving around.Shuttle to all the tours was great, saved a lot of leg work on cobbled streets.As retired Navy man I enjoyed the Army choppers roaring back to base next door, Fort Stewart, home of the 3rd Army. I love seeing my tax dollars at work.Hoo yah! ( that's Navy for Hooah!)we were very put off when we arrived to check in, because the hotel clerk said she did not see our request for an ADA or first floor room.  i checked my reservation request and it was clearly there. this was the very first time something like this happened at a best western, or anywhere, for that matter.other than that, a nice property. breakfast selection was very good. the towels need replacing...everything else was very good.they said they would email me a receipt...we checked out april 22, we're still waiting.Things worked out for us !! Thanks for the move hotel staff that made the arrangements work!!!Comfortable beds, clean rooms. The best bet for an incredible price in Savannah. I always lodge there when I come and visit Savannah from Atlanta. Easy access to downtown, Tybee, Whole Foods... It is almost my second home. I buy blueberries and almond milk that I store in my room fridge so I can enhance the breakfast and make it more wholesome!Great hotel! Very clean, comfy beds, VERY well maintained. A good breakfast and very friendly and helpful front desk. And at a great price too!! I will be staying here again.For 70 bucks a night, this hotel is as good as its gonna get if you are on a tight budget, but yet do not want to compromise safety. It is 15 minutes away from downtown Savannah/ River Street and 30 minutes away from Tybee Island/ Fort Pulaski/ Beaches. It is around the business district so expect some traffic when you come out during rush hour time. Late in the evening, there are 3 24-hour food joint you can go to: Waffle House, The Diner (across the street) and ...  - Denny's - i think - ... Don't rely much on the free breakfast as the only protein in there is boiled eggs. The rest is bagels, croissant, plain grits from a packet, yogurt, cereal, bananas- coffee and juice... nothing too exciting really ...The room itself was quite decent. This is actually one of the rare occasions that a "non-smoking" room actually didnt even have a hint of stale cigarette. The room came with a fridge, microwave, and a blow dryer which are so essential for budget travelers like myself. The bathroom and the room in its entirety is clean. We didnt even get to use their TV, but it was your good ole flat screen- they did offer HBO. Check out was a breeze as all we needed to do was dial 0 from the room phone and tell them we are on our way out. Parking was easy, and they do have an outdoor pool - but then again, I am never into that stuff. All in all, a really good deal. I recommend :)I stayed here for one night and my this place wasn't so bad. I only paid $58 because I got an online deal from Expedia. It was clean and you get a free breakfast. The breakfast wasn't much though.. Like there weren't any sausages or scrambled eggs or anything. Just cereal, waffles... Plain stuff. The room had a microwave, large TV, &mini fridge though. Not bad for $58...I also forgot to mention, this place is nearby EVERYTHING it seems like. Oglethorpe Mall, lots of stores, and restaurants too.If you have ever dreamed of sleeping on a runway then this is the closet you can get and still stay safe as the runway to an airport is located 100 yards and the planes fly over at all times. The lobby will welcome you to Savannah with a toxic smell that is unlike any other. The room is nice, the black mold in the bathroom is not. Every morning around 9am a man would walk by with a leaf blower and make sure the motel was clean though no observable trees with leaves are near the property. The motel architecture is the nice, all centered around a pool that's very charming, as is a nice shell gas station pawn shop and title shop all located within stones throw. A local at a dining establishment told us this hotel was the #2 hotel for prostitution in Savannah behind the Econolodge which is located right across the street. To the Best Westerns credit I never saw one so seemed pretty safe. The maid service was very nice and helpful. Overall not a nice hotel just but seems to be on the upturn.If you want easy access to a waffle house and a pawn shop, this place is for you, but they do have free WiFiWonderful clean room and bathroom. The grounds are immaculate. Very friendly staff. Loved the people at the front desk. Helpful and very accommodating. The breakfast was excellent. Everything from fresh fruit ,waffles ,eggs ,sausage , yogurt ,bagels, cereal, bagels and cream cheese, sausage gravy and biscuits. Will stay again.rooms have a fridge and a microwave... but, they also have HORRIBLE Pillows, non-functioning Internet, and the person at the front desk was an unhelpful ass.Yes, they're cheaper than most, but that's for a reason, I would suggest you look elsewhere.Best Best Western I have stayed in, in decades.  It's an older facility, but very very well maintained and updated.  Huge staff works hard, and they run a tight ship.  Pool is old school, in a good way, with a 8 1/2 ft. deep end.  Saltwater, no chlorine.  Grounds are groomed, with proud gardeners.  We normally stay at pricier hotels, but this is one cool time capsule.  We got a room on Priceline for under 60... Girl at desk was very friendly, and helpful.  All the freebies, and fridge is a good size.  The b'fast is the standard for these places... Great cable.
review_content_20: I stayed here for 4 days recently for a family event, and I have to say if your looking for a cheap place to stay and don't care about bugs, this place is for you. I found many roaches in my room, crawling in the bathroom, walls, and even in the middle of the night went to check my phone on my nightstand and yep, roaches!!!  My mother who was staying in another room, different building on the property also experienced roaches in her room. She contacted the management and asked if the rooms could be sprayed and they told her not a problem.. (this was the 2nd day of my stay). I didn't see anyone come by to spray the rooms, and didn't find any dead roaches, only live ones, so either they lied and never sprayed the room, or they weren't using the right stuff. Also, this hotel is located right under a military airstrip and if you are looking for peace and quiet, this is not the place. My 1st  two nights staying here, military aircraft was flying over (probably just a few hundred feet above the roof) and they were ear piercing loud jets, helecopters and propeller planes. This continued some nights untill around 10pm and was an all day event for my 1st 2 days of stay. The rest of the nights the runway was less active and it was much quieter. Another thing, I don't know what kind of poor excuse for a comforter this place has, but basically the comforter is in a cover, and not attached properly. You will find in the middle of the night, the actual comforter will slide off the bed and you will only be covered by the comforter cover, and when you go to pull up the rest of the comforter that is lumped in the cover, its like a half filled sandbag that you are trying to warm up under... Not good! One plus was the free breakfast which actually had a decent amount of food. Eggs, waffle maker, a few different juices, toast/bagles were offered for free every morning, and even though they tasted horrible, at least there was a free breakfast.A few positives were things included with the room... The room had a good sized flat screen tv, a mini fridge, non smoking rooms which was nice, but pretty much standard now for most hotels so not a reason to give thumbs up. Overall If I was driving through and needed a place to crash, and didn't care about bugs, then this place would be idea for a quick nightly stay, but I've been to many other hotels, even other best westerns, and experienced much cleaner environments.Also a mentionable.... I did wake up with bites all over my legs and a few days later these bites were still visible. I wore a pair of shorts a few days later that I had slept in at the hotel, and felt constant crawling/biting sensation on my legs. Not sure if this was from the hotel, but with the lack of cleanlyness, I could almost bet that the place has bed bugs or no-see-ums. I also was not the only one in my family that had bites on them, and they stayed in different rooms.The prices are amazing for what you get....except for the fact that my room came with a broken microwave..and the floor was flooded when I took a shower...and the toilet stopped working towards the end of my stay LUCKILY.  I want to say that it has been renovated and it looks nice, except for the functionality of everything.  Possibly, it could have been a fluke.I wasn't impressed... Yes, they are cheap and have a refrigerator, microwave, and Internet... However, it wasn't worth it.  The  service at the front desk was unpleasant. They did not deliver items to the room, so we had to go outside and walk all the way to the reception area every time we needed something. The coffee was horrible, so we had to buy coffee every morning. In the weekdays breakfast ends at 9, so we didn't even eat the complimentary breakfast. I would recommended spending a bit more and going somewhere else!Roaches in the bathroom, scum all over the shower, stained chair and ottoman. No complimentary extra towels if you need them--they make you write your name down at the front desk to get towels! I've NEVER been to a hotel that makes you do that! Not to mention my boyfriend is covered in bites and we don't know where they came from. Not doing it again...EVER. The breakfast is sad too. Cold pastries, waffle maker, and cheap coffee. Pay extra and stay somewhere else.

hotel_name: Doubletree by Hilton Savannah Historic District
review_content: Was really impressed with this place!  It is in the heart of the action in Savannah--close to everything!  Very clean and well decorated.  The valet was very friendly and fast, especially for as busy as they were.  The rooms were spacious and clean.  The food at the breakfast buffet was nice.  Pros:Close to EVERYTHING!  Very well decorated.Incredibly friendly staff.Nice touch with the cookie at check-in.Cons:You have to pay $25 per day to park your car.The food was rather expensive--the breakfast buffet is $17 and although good, not worth that much money.The hotel is conveniently located in the historic downtown area within walking distance of the market and shops. The valet was great and so was the front desk.  They offered us a trolly to put out luggage in and then take it up ourselves, which is the first time I've had to do in a hotel. Our room was next to the conference rooms and we could hear their talks and applause and even the chairs being moved afterwards.The noises from outside were very loud in the room to the point that we could hear a could arguing outside and I can even tell you why they broke up. I loved the location, unfortunately I was not able to sleep well during our stay :( thus the 3 star review.Some of you that follow me here on Yelp may know that my home away from home in Savannah used to be the Hilton Desoto.  Well, that is no longer the case.  From the moment I was met by the valet, to the warm chocolate chip cookie at the front desk, to the magnificent view out my room's window, I was realized I had found my new Savannah home.  As a Hilton Honors member, I was treated like family throughout my stay.The room was amazing, comfortable, and relaxing after a long work day.  The bathroom was a bit small for the price point, but it was very clean (which is extremely important for me) and upgraded with nice granite counter tops, tiled shower and huge backlit mirror.  But enough about the boring stuff, lets get to the niddy-griddy: The people!  As I mentioned before, everyone from the valet to the front desk personnel to the bartender and finally Shelby, the Food and Beverage Manager, were all warm and inviting people.  They laughed at my bad jokes, gave recommendations for drinks on and off the menu; and did I mention the warmed chocolate chip cookie?  If you were unfamiliar with Doubletrees you may not have realized there is a restaurant within the hotel.  That would be a shame.  Though it is somewhat hidden and tucked away, it does exist and I highly recommend it.  The food was awesome, filling and fairly priced.  As for the drinks, I love a good Old Fashion.  It is surprisingly difficult to find a bartender that can make them good... consistently.  Well, Julie (I believe her name is) can make a mean Old Fashion!Moving back to the room now for some extras just to make the stay more comfortable.  On the desk I found ear plugs (individually wrapped of course), a white noise maker and the lamps had USB plugs to charge your devices.  They literally thought of everything to make you feel like you are home.I only have one negative comment:  The air conditioner.  I like the room to be a bit cool when I sleep.  Well every time the A/C would kick on it sounded like a diesel engine cranking up.  If it weren't for that, I would have given all 5 stars.GOOD:- Check in cookie. Obviously needs to be listed first.- Friendly valet.- Charming, hilarious bartender. He was just great. And dealt with my beer snobbery well.- Front desk agents. Very nice and accommodating! Chatted with one about what it's like to work in hotel guest services. Nice nostalgic moment!- Shampoo.- Earplugs. You will need them.- Location. Close to River Street's shops/restaurants/bars.EHH:- Noise. Good god, noise. After the first night, we changed rooms. And still, there was noise.- Slow internet that needed to be refreshed each day. But hey, it was free.- I got hurt (face-planted on River Street), rushed back to the room to clean myself up, and the temp was reset to 60 degrees in there. Not cool, housekeeping!Solid hotel. I'd stay there again if I ever go back to Savannah.And I need to go back to Savannah.We had a fabulous experience this weekend!  Dre at the valet stand was amazing, and the ladies at the front desk were super friendly and helpful.  Couldn't be happier with our experience!  Best customer service we have seen in a while.  Everything was very close to the hotel and we were able to walk to River Street and the Civic Center.  Great location and even better people.If you are looking for a hotel with character, and not a typical Hilton chain, then this is the place. Lovely hotel redone in the heart of Savannah with friendly staff to boot. To seal the deal they have nightly complimentary drinks to tempt you, and we were lucky to experience a perfect drink that is a speciality of theirs.  Although if you are looking for a quiet spot,  this may not be the spot, but who would get a hotel in the heart of the city if you need that.....there are always ear plugs if needed!!!!!Amazing hotel!  Everything from check in to check out was wonderful. Friendly staff. The valets always called us cabs when needed. The minute you walk into the doors it smells wonderful. The room was very clean and the beds are extremely comfortable. Thanks for a wonderful stay!  I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Savannah.Staff was welcoming. DO NOT GET ROOM 224! Even after a few drinks the trucks and motorcycles will keep you up all night. They have a sound machine but that just adds to the mess. Location is perfect and close to everything riverfront and the market place. But if you want a restful night of sleep get an inside room. Valet folks were extremely helpful!The buffet for Thanksgiving, Christmas and New Year evening are awesome.  The food, beverages, and the yummy desert coupled with the fabulous  service helped me make great memories with my family and friends.This hotel is located in the beginning of Bay street and is fairly convenient to most places. The rooms are a very nice size with new bathrooms,  a nice work area/desk and a comfortable bed. The only drawback for some people is that it has a full shower instead of a tub, works for me but probably not for everybody.This hotel is in a great location and close to City Market as well as River St. Very beautifully decorated and very clean. All the staff were kind and courteous. The only complaint I have is the overwhelming air freshener in the lobby. Because of my sensitivity to perfumes I was unable to sit in the lobby or bar to enjoy more of the hotel.Great hotel in all, and in a great place in the middle of everything in Savannah. The interior is really elegant and looks amazing. They dont really tell you the extra fee's and charges at check in which would have been nice.The beds are good and the room is large.It's not the best doubletree but it's not the worst. Parking is valet and expensive, breakfast is not really anything special and the "gym" is smaller than the hotel room. We only stayed as a pit stop, so the location is great (near the highway). There's fresh coffee and tea station in the lobby which is nice . Service was good.The hotel and accommodations are all excellent. We had a wonderful time staying here but before you make make a reservation be aware of many hidden fees. Vallet parking = $25 a nightWifi - $5 a day. (There is a basic free WiFi that comes with the room but the Internet speeds compare to that which were standard in the mid 90's)Security Deposit - $50 per night. This will be returned after your stay if nothing was damaged within the room but it is billed to you on check in. They do serve breakfast but it does not come with the room. Other than the hidden fees this hotel has been excellent. The rooms are well cept and modern. The service is very quick and everyone is friendly.Very nice stay! For $117/night the room was extremely spacious with 2 queen size (super comfy!) beds. I received great customer service. Best part: walking distance to River Street! The only con is the valet parking that you HAVE to do if you want to park at the hotel. The parking was $25.This hotel is amazing! They booked a very clean and spacious room while we were driving into town. We booked a whirlpool tub, which is a MUST after a long day! The restaurant was the only negative. Room service stops at 9 and took FOREVER. Then, the shrimp scampi linguine came without any noodles! And also without bread, which was on the menu. The pork chop dinner was delicious. Aside from the restaurant, we would give the hotel staff, room appointment and cleanliness 5 stars. The concierge was also knowledgeable and friendly! Take the trolley tour that hotel recommends! We would definitely stay here again & hope the kitchen staff is better equipped for us next time.This place is incredible.  Awesome views of the historic district and everything is in perfect walking distance.  The hotel itself is gorgeous and well kept.  The entire staff is super friendly and goes out of their way to make you feel welcome.  Two people who deserve extra kudos are Constance and Penny at the front desk.  First impressions are important and the two of them went above and beyond the call of duty to ensure the beginning of our trip was fantastic.  Thank you so much Constance and Penny for your great customer service! Because of your service I look forward to returning here again.The hotel is lovely. The front desk staff were courteous, polite, and super helpful. The valet parking personnel were totally sweet and awesome! I stayed for only one night at the end of several day trip to the area and, for the most part, the stay was great. I had many choices when deciding where to stay in Savannah and chose The Doubletree because I have stayed at Doubletree hotels in other cities and because I joined their rewards program. Imagine my surprise when I arrived and was informed of the new policy (which took effect this month) that persons booking through a third party do not get rewards points! I didn't even get free wifi! That really sucked. It left me with a sour feeling about staying there. The location is nice with a great view of the bridge, but I could have stayed at a comparable hotel on the waterfront! There are two other hotels on the other two corners of the street, either of which had the same views and may or may not have given me no extras. No rewards points and no wifi because I booked through a third party was like a cloud which hung over the stay. Now that I know this, I will keep it in mind when booking in the future. I stayed at a Doubletree in TX, a few months ago, which was also booked through a third party (package deals are easier for this consumer) and I received my rewards points. I'm not sure if most people prefer to book flights, hotels, and rentals separately, but removing the rewards when it's done seems like a bad idea.How do I know DoubleTree made a deep impression on me? Because every time I start fantasizing about  vacation my first thought is, "I wonder if they have a  DoubleTree there?"It's rare on vacation to have SPECIAL MOMENTS occur *IN* the hotel as well as *OUT.* The hotel wasn't just the designated, "This is where we sleep and get dressed" spot, we actually CREATED memories that actually MADE the vacation even better!We only paid $82 a NIGHT for a DoubleTree Hilton Hotel and we couldn't believe what a STEAL that price was! It was even cheaper than the Holiday Inn Express! It was our mantra for the entire vacation. "Can you believe this is $82 a night?" PROS: - The beds felt like marshmallows wrapped in sheets! They were outrageously soft! I was tempted to investigate what kind of mattress they used to buy myself at home!-  We must have been in Get Smart's "Cone of Silence" because I didn't hear a peep from the street below, the interior hallway, the neighboring guests, or even the staff!-  One of the highlights of vacation that didn't cost us a dime was using the lemon scented shampoo to use as makeshift bubble bath. We turned off the lights and then just relaxed in each others soapy arms, letting the warm water melt away all the worries and cares. Next time I'll have to splurge on a whirlpool bath AND bring candles from home. That would be even BETTER! - The decor of the hotel seemed to be inspired by color and grace of the flower Bird of Paradise as well as British occupied Bombay. The entire building had a fresh scent and an airy, bright look!- We had the hot tub all to ourselves in the morning! BEST. VACATION. EVER!- The hotel is a stones throw from the River and a five to ten minute walk anywhere in the historic district we wanted to go.CONS: - No Bathrobes. (Not a big deal it just would be nice to have one as a cover up going to the pool.)- The coffee in the room AND downstairs in the lobby was undrinkable. It tasted like burnt water. However, the tea selection was great!The vacation was a whirlwind of pleasure from treating our taste buds to scrumptious Savannah delights, enjoying the sexy hot tub and the makeshift bubble bath, as well as reading in the park or at The Coffee Fox. It was the best vacation EVER. Thank you DoubleTree for making our vacation so special! We love you and Savannah!Nice hotel at a great rate in a really convenient location in the historic district. It's not the most modern hotel, but everything is nicely taken care of and fits in well in the historic district. There's a nice space to pull your car in and unload rather than struggling on the street. And there are a limited number of refrigerators available for rooms, so if you want one call and ask quick!
review_content_20: A little construction? A LITTLE CONSTRUCTION?? How about telling your guests when they're booking that jack hammers will be coming through their ceilings. FYI - the entire 5th and 6th floors are closed due to 'renovations', but the sound can be heard throughout, and into the street. Checked out faster than I checked in, had to scramble for a new spot to stay. Vacation!Only parking is valet at $25 a day. The lobby had a very overpowering perfume shop smell that will make you nauseas! But other than that it was comfortable, didn't have they're food. Why would we when there are so many restaurants in walking distance?! But we did get free margaritas at 5:00 which were very tasty! And did I say free?Girlfriend & I took an impromptu trip to Savannah and booked a night at this Doubletree last minute.  Considering the location and a sub $200 a night bill:Location: A. walking distance to River StPrice: A the least expensive hotel close to River StAccommodations: A it was clean, had free wifi and the rooms were at little average but the shower was very good and the beds comfortableDownside: parking. They will tack on $18/ night for valet parking. But it's still cheaper than anywhere you'll find in walking distance to River St. We will likely stay they again when we return to Savannah!The location is great!  The hotel is right on Bay Street and you can walk to the riverside shops and restaurants Amanda you are on the edge of the Historic district with valet parking so no worries!  Parking is tight in the historic district so this is a big deal.  The room was larger than average and I was not on the honors floor so that was nice extra.  Beds were comfortable.  Note that your great location on Bay Street means that you have the noise of Bay Street so if it bothers you ask for a room on the back side of the hotel.  The staff from valet to front desk were very helpful and friendly.  They also had a nice sitting room with a fire in the hearth.  Great for reading or chatting.  The only down was the pool is under major construction.  This a great spot for business travel or a fun weekend!The rooms here seem to be pretty standard for a Doubletree, in terms of size and appointments, with the exception of the four post bed and the lamps made from old books. Not many of the rooms here have balconies, which is a bit of a disappointment -- and the balconies on the corner rooms are small and wedge-shaped. This is what we ended up with.  It was nice to have, but I wouldn't have wanted the upgrade if it cost me any extra. I would also have liked a refrigerator in the room.  In the past at other locations (even Hampton Inns) I've been able to call and have a fridge brought into the room when one was not included.  I didn't try this here, so that may be a possibility.The soap/shampoo/conditioner stuff smells really good, "Crabtree & Evelyn Citron".  I'm not a connoisseur of such things so that's all I can really tell you. There is a bar area downstairs amongst the several nicely appointed common rooms, and the bartender there was friendly. Another room has a big comfy couch in front of a fireplace.Breakfast is buffet-style, with pancakes, waffles, and omelets made to order.  There was plenty there to fill me up, but I wouldn't say that the food was too memorable. At the normal price of $15 per person, you're better off skipping the breakfast in favor of an in-town option unless you get the breakfast for free through the HHonors benefits.Finally, valet parking (which is mandatory, you cannot park yourself) is $15 a day, so don't forget to factor that into the price.  I wish the Hilton properties that do this would stop and at least factor the charge into the advertised room rate.  Better yet, drop the charge altogether because we all know it's a meaningless crap charge.Wife and I were there for the ladies marathon on Sat 3/28. Stayed 3 days in this beautiful hotel. Upon arrival valet immediately removed our luggage placed our bags on carts, and waited til we checked in. Deion our valet was super courteous, and helpful.   He took our bags upstairs and unloaded our belongings, and hung up our clothes bags. The front desk was just as attentive. The room was clean and nicely appointed. Beds were very comfortable. One small issue was the bed  sheet was rather small for a king size bed. Couldn't tuck in the ends at all, so after a nights sleep we had to retuck the sheets as best we could. First 2 nights were quiet, less the street noise from traffic if you get a room facing busy Bay St. But we still slept quite well. Now comes the 3rd night and low and behold the guest in rm 412 started fighting at 2 am. We finally complained around 3:30 and management quickly sent up security. Was quiet for about 5 min and it started again. This time management sent the police to have them removed from the premises. Finally it's quiet but it's also 5-5:30. Not much sleep. We decided to just get up an check out about 8:30-9. Front deck comp us just $25 for parking, but said we should call the GM later. When we got home I spoke to management and they asked what would make me happy. Of Coarse I said one night deducted from my $700 bill would be nice. Didn't get the ladies name but she said consider it done to the tune of $213. Thought I'd be in for a tough time but she was extremely understanding. Not their fault two guests had no consideration for other guests. Will always stay here whenever we visit Savannah, which is usually once a year. Thanks to the staff again for making our stay one to remember. And by the way great coffee.I have stayed here numerous times. The hotel is in a great location and it is very clean. The staff is also helpful and friendly. I also love the warm cookies at check in !The beds are incredibly comfortable and I want to steal the pillows. The staff k is very friendly and helpful. The hotel itself is within walking distance of all the fine dining you could want. The breakfast is buffet style and is 16.00, which is a little pricey...however the food is really good. Try the quiche!!! highly recommended.Awesome beds!!!  Quiet room and super friendly staff!!!  Steps from city market and river front!  Well worth the price.While this Doubletree is still in an awesome location and is still a beautiful hotel I had so many issues with it on a recent stay that I have to lower my rating of this hotel, which makes me very sad as a loyal customer and HHonors member of the Hilton brand. I checked into my room and everything was going great. I got my free cookie and guest welcome package (2 waters) from the front desk. The room looked great and had all the amenities that I've come to expect of this and other Hilton hotels. Then that night I lost my credit card while I was out at dinner, which will be important later in this review. After getting back from dinner I called my credit card company and reported my card lost. I then went to bed which is when the trouble began; I was awaken by an awful smell like raw sewage coming into the room from a nearby paper mill. Although I know this isn't the hotel's fault, they should still have some sort of filter on their AC that would prevent outside smells from trickling into the room; especially when they are charging over $150 for a night. Then the next morning were issues with the valet parking. I called valet to retrieve my car and the lady there wanted my valet ticket number which I didn't have because the previous day the valet didn't give me a ticket but just took my car. I told her this and gave us a description of my car which they were able to find after a short period. When checking out I complained to the front desk about the smell that came in my room and woke me up the previous night. The lady working the desk just said that was not their problem, that the plant causes that smell. No sorry, no free cookie, no nothing from here. As I walked out to leave she called me back saying that my credit card (from earlier in this review) had declined the charges for valet ($15), I explained to her that was probably because I reported my card lost after checking in and paid her the $15 valet parking fee in cash. After getting in my car it smelled like cigarettes; not sure if they smoked in my car of if it was the plant. After returning home I called Doubletree customer service to tell them the complaints I had with the hotel. They said they would contact the general manager of the hotel and that the manager would have to get back with me. A day later I get an email apologizing from the hotel manager about my complaints and once again blaming the plant for the smell that night. A couple of days later I log in to check my credit card. Well, well the $15 for valet parking did go through so I called to complain about. I contacted the hotel which said and shows on their statement that they did issue a refund to my lost card for the $15, but it never made it to my credit card company. I called the credit card company that has not received any sort of refund for the hotel. I then contact the hotel again that insists that they refunded the $15 and that there was nothing else they could do for me. I now have to put the $15 overcharge in dispute with my credit card company wait. This use to be such a great hotel, but not sure what the hell is going on with it now. From now on when heading down to Savannah I'll just pay an extra $20 a night to spend the night at the Hyatt across the street, which hopefully won't lose my car, smell, and overcharge me.nice place to stay with  updated rooms! the only flaws was the loud music  at the city market and the lady at the front desk with the bright red hair (didn't get her name) who's answer to questions she didn't know was " I don't know I've been off all week so I haven't seen the renovated rooms."I've never stayed in a Hilton before. So I was pretty excited when I learned this was the hotel my university's group had booked as our lodging back in October. Frankly, I was expecting the toilets to be made from gold based on the Hilton reputation.Wrong. So wrong...There was seriously nothing special about this place. The decor didn't even match... I've stayed at Holiday Inns, Best Westerns, etc. for the fraction of the cost and had the same-if not better- experience. And they offered a FREE continental breakfast. $15 for a "Southern style buffet" that was just mediocre.True, the staff was really nice, and that makes a difference. The location is good, too. But these are the only real positives.Here's a list of my other grievances:-No fridge, microwave, etc. (Don't plan on eating that famous Savannah food later...)-The coffee maker in the rooms was nice, but there were only two cups and enough coffee for one person.-Bathroom essentials were lacking in quality and quantity.-There weren't even enough towels for myself and my roommates.-We also had to wait a few hours after our check-in time until our room was ready. I understand things happen, but this was the cherry-on-top for my letdown of a hotel experience.My advice: There are some other great hotels in the historic district just a few blocks away that are cheaper and are, in my opinion, better. If you don't mind walking two or three blocks, save yourself the trouble and book elsewhere. From my experience, I recommend the Thunderbird Inn (my personal favorite), or the Comfort Inn.This is a beautiful hotel, right in the heart of Savannah. My wife and I truly enjoyed our stay and the warm cookies! The staff was very friendly and accommodating, it's valet only, which was slightly confusing because when we arrived there were no signs of where to park, however; we had a great overnight stay and the room was more than adequate!Staying at this hotel at a room for over $160/night before taxes/fees was a huge disappointment. The room did NOT have- a fridge- working phone- the standard bathroom kit with shower caps, q-tips, and so on- robes- working iron/remotely functioning ironing board (see below why it was important)I was getting ready for a wedding and needed an iron since I flew in from DC and packed my outfit. The first iron dropped its bottom as I lifted it. I called the front desk on my cell phone since the room phone wasn't working to ask for a different one. The replacement phone poured water on my dress as I attempted to iron it.The next morning we heard a pipe burst left many of our friends without water. Eh.Ever since my first visit to Savannah a few years ago, every time I have gone back, I always stay at this hotel. The staff has always been very accommodating and the location is perfect for historic district.Let's make this quick, as we're all busy people here.Hotel location is great. Walking distance from the River Walk, for some fine tourist trap time, if that's what you in for. The Rooms are clean and beds are very comfy. If you're lucky they will give you a view of the bridge that is very nice. Breakfast buffet is nice and with enough variety to make it worth it. The bad: They charge you $25 A NIGHT to use the valet service and park your car, and you won't find alternatives there, as Savannah is terrible for parking on the street. I think it would have been more honest to add it to the room price. It just feels like one of those bail-and-switch things that just piss you off. With that said, the warm cookie they give you when you check in is nice.Great location for all restaurants & shops in area.When we booked room over the phone, I asked for big bath tub in my room, but I got handicap room by mistake. Unfortunately hotel was fully booked so we had to stay in the handicap room but hotel have us complimentary breakfast tickets for apology. Breakfast was buffet style & not many choices. Free so ..it was ok. If you have to pay regular price of $14.95 for this breakfast, I won't recommend!  Hotel was old but clean & well maintained I had to leave 3 stars because elevator is REALLY REALLY slow.Such a great hotel!  I loved my little suite but the best part about this hotel was the staff.  I'm not sure that they knew what they were getting into by hosting a group of 2000 "runners" this past weekend, but they handled everything perfectly and with a smile - from the never ending supply of beer in our hospitality suite to graciously offering laundry services when we all walked in covered in swamp water and mud.I think that they enjoyed our shenanigans as much as we did.The Doubletree was running a great special, so it was time for a road trip. The hotel is very nice and in a great location, near River Street. So you are in the thick of the action. The hotel was clean. The rooms were fine. Nothing out-of-the-ordinary. The staff was friendly, and they let us check in early. The breakfast buffet is a little pricey. It's slightly better than your average, mid-range hotel buffet, but I would eat elsewhere, if you can.The biggest thing I hate about going to a Hilton is the fact that some of my money may find its way into Paris HIlton's pocket. Makes you think twice.HHonor Diamond member here...Booked a King non-smoking room 4 months in advance....Was given a double smoking room..."Mark" the manager was of no help in recitifying.And bless their heart...it tries to be a nice hotel...but I would try the DeSoto a few blocks away next time.
review_content_40: On a whirlwind trip to Savannah, my colleague booked this hotel through Priceline. We got it for a steal of a price: $80 per night. The hotel is clean, gorgeous, and located in the heart of the Historic District. Our room was on the sixth floor, the top floor. We also had an odd numbered room, which had a beautiful view of the park and old church across the street. Upon arrival, we had a swift check in and the concierge gave us complimentary bottles of water and fresh baked chocolate chip cookies: a Doubletree signature. During our week-long stay, we dined at the hotel's restaurant for breakfast. Our business booking allowed us free coupons for the buffet. Even though we misplaced some, the front desk was more than accommodating to issue us new ones. Breakfast itself was acceptable with lots of Southern cooking: fried grits, three kinds of egg frittatas, bacon, two kinds of sausage. A few healthier fruit dishes would have been a treat.Our double bedroom was spacious with modern decor and a white cotton washable duvet. My colleague and I both had the best night's sleep here, and even dozed through the alarm one morning. Doubletree is definitely a home-away-from-home!The location of the hotel worked great for us, as it was in walking distance of many local restaurants, parks, and unique shops. City Market is just around the corner as is the riverfront. Plan on doing a lot of foot travel. The only downside to the hotel is that since it is within the Historic District, parking is sparse. Doubletree charges $17 per day for parking and has valet.There aren't really any other options for self-parking, so in addition to the daily fee, you have to add a tip for the valet service. However, I believe all the other positives of the hotel outweigh the parking; besides, Savannah is a walkable city!If you're looking for a great place to stay for business or pleasure, Doubletree comes with my highest recommendation!I love the location.  Everything is walking distance.  Very friendly service.  We asked if they had a refridgerator to keep our leftovers in for the night, and they brought a minifridge up to our room within minutes.  I love getting a warm cookie when I check in.  The room was ok.  Big bed but no desk and no counterspace in the bathroom and not much room to move around.  We got a corner room so we heard no noise from other guests.  Typical breakfast buffet, but that costs extra.  It's valet parking and that costs $15 extra per day.  There is a small assortment of complimentary toiletries at the front desk if you forget something.  Nice pool deck on the second floor.  This is one of the few hotels in Savannah with a hot tub.Although there were a couple things I didn't like about it, the good things outweigh the bad.  I would stay here again.The hotel has given us an early check-in twice and a late check-out twice.  They were very accommodating when we had a room that the air wasn't working properly in, they immediately switched us to another room and comped our parking for the day!! Excellent guest services.  The breakfast and lunch buffets are wonderful.  I will definitely stay there again!Ohhh my gosh, I love Savannah. It's SO beautiful and has such a unique charm to it. You'll never want to leave. And this hotel was the capstone to a wonderful week in the south.The hotel is very well-equipped, with friendly staff, a starbucks on the main floor, very nice suite rooms. Everything you can want. AND it's RIGHT on the water, so if you're lucky enough to be on the right side, you can see the iconic ferry boats cruising down the Savannah River.At night, walk down the water side and have your pick of tons of restaurants, bars, candy stores and the like. It reminded me of a cross between the AC boardwalk (but waaaay nicer) and New Orleans. It's so incredibly romantic, too -- complete with kids selling single roses on the boardwalk. Too bad I was with my boss... AWKWARD!Anyway, loved it. Think I'll retire here.Thought the customer service was outstanding!  Great location!  I was very impressed with the room for the price we paid.  Any staff we came in contact with was friendly and helpful. Most importantly, the beds were so so so comfortable!The is is a prime location for seeing all the touristy hoopla of downtown Savannah.  You can walk to anything worth doing easily. For that alone it's worth the asking price. The hotel is very nice , the staff is very friendly and the room was awesome. We booked the bed and breakfast special. So the price included comps for the buffet.  The beds are big and comfy. i slept like the dead! The bath tub was big enough for full submersion. So I indulged in a long hot soak. The supplied coffee was surprisingly tasty. And of course the DT cookies are the jam!The breakfast buffet was a lot larger than I had anticipated. There were a ton of choices and everything that I tried was pretty good for heat tray food. The only downside is the 15$ add on for parking, It wouldn't have been an issue if the valets had been available any of the times we went back for our car. We had to hunt them down to get our vehicle. Inconvenient but not a deal breaker.I stayed there one night and would definitely go back - the valet parking person, Eric, was awesome - recommended places to go; spoke with me every time I ran in to him - made me feel welcome and part of the family.  My room wasn't ready but he parked my car (extra charge for parking -- $15) and took my bag to my room - it was there waiting for me when I got there a few hours later.The room was amazing - big bed that was beyond comfortable.  All the staff were very helpful. Its in a good location.The only thing I didn't like was that the tub was so shallow.Friendly staff, clean rooms. Beds were extremely comfortableThe staff was fantastic!  We arrived late in the evening and their staff provided excellent service from our check-in to our check-out.  I had a complaint in our room however, it was handled immediately.  In result, we were accomodated in a upgrade and not charged the difference for our inconvenience.  They pride in customer satisfaction and our party was very satisfied.  Keep up the good work and I hope to visit again.I almost stayed at the Westin, which was hooked to the convention center (which is why I was there) and I am SO HAPPY that I did not stay at the Westin.  My stay was wonderful.  And that warm cookie upon check in makes a nice after midnight snack when you are coming back from a fun night at Savannah Smiles, walking distance from the hotel.When I made my reservation they only had a room with 2 doubles available, but upon check in, they were able to upgrade me for no extra charge to a beautiful and spacious suite with a large soft bed and their signature 'sweet dreams' pillow on top.  I had a nice roomy workspace with free internet connection and the one day I ordered room service (for lunch) they were prompt and the burger was delicious.  I also enjoyed the full breakfast buffet, which was a bit on the pricey side (about $12.95) but it hit the spot, and was a quick way to fill up before a long work day at the convention across the river.I am not sure if the water taxi to Hutchinson Island is free all the time, but at the time of my stay, the water taxi was a 5 minute walk and completely free to the convention center/Hutchinson Island.The only part that I did not particularly enjoy was that your car had to be valet parked, which is wonderful, especially when you are me and have a hard time parrallel parking!!!  BUT on the morning of check out, EVERYONE was checking out, which resulted in having to wait about 30 minutes for your car - if they knew that everyone would be checking out that morning - I wish they had more staff.Other then that, I had a pleasant stay, very good location, walking distance from everything, and I look forward to staying there again!This was suppose to be my honeymoon!  We ordered room service and both my husband and I got food poisoning.  We were so sick we had to pack ourselves up and drive home while we had to stop every 30 minutes because we were so sick.  They did comp our room, which they should have since they caused this experience, but they never apologized for ruining my honeymoon.  The General Manager and his staff were so incredibly rude, I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.  So sad since they could have made this a better experience even after we got sick.Well located in Historic District.  Good room and service, including free Internet service in lobby. After returning home, when I reported an item I had left in my room, the hotel promptly returned it. Hotel has a restaurant, where we had only breakfast. Other meals are available. It also has a rooftop pool.

review_content: I stayed at this Marriott once before and have had a lovely time both times. The room I had was clean, everything worked nicely, I didn't see any bugs, and it was very quiet and peaceful. The staff was very attentive and helpful. The morning free continental breakfast is fresh and delicious, and you can even have homemade waffles! Plus they have freshly baked cookies every day, and lemonade too! Overall it was a very nice experience. While this is not a 5 star hotel, I gave this a 5 star review because of the value I had staying here. The nightly rate was reasonable, I felt safe and it was walking distance to Publix, clean, had free breakfast and free wifi, and excellent front desk customer service. Keep in mind that this is not near the Historic District/downtown/River Street so if location is a big deal to you it might be a little inconvenient to have to drive downtown every day. However if you don't plan to be downtown your entire trip, or plan to go out drinking at night frequently and don't want to stumble back to your hotel/get a cab, I'd highly recommend this hotel! If you're like me and on a budget and want to stay somewhere with great value I'd say this is a great deal for your Savannah trip. I'd definitely come back on my next trip to Savannah!We stayed here over St. Patty's Day weekend and spent 15,000 points a night for Friday and Saturday, a much cheaper option than staying downtown for $350-450/night. Considering this is basically a motel, there isn't too much I can complain about. The room was clean, the ladies working at reception were incredibly helpful, the breakfast wasn't too bad, the wifi was free, and housekeeping didn't wake us up.The location isn't great, but shuttles and taxis will take you downtown for $10/person. That was the rate over St. Patty's Day weekend though so they may be cheaper under normal circumstances.Staff was very friendly and knowledgeable, room and breakfast was not up to company standards. I posted pics of the dirt and dust left on the lamps; and dirt and rust in the bathroom. Breakfast items were lacking, no fresh fruit or meatnThe room was fine. The elevator is in a very awkward spot right inside the door with another door into the lobby. There's always confusion when the doors open and you have to figure out which way the people coming off are going so you know where to stand to not be in the way. The maids are incredibly rude. On more than one occasion in the awkward elevator area, in a situation when you would expect an employee with a big cart to move to the side and let you pass with your luggage, they kept barreling through forcing us to jump out of the way to avoid being hit. Next time we'll pay the little bit of extra $ to stay downtown and avoid the rudeness.Recently, we stayed at Fairfield Inn in Chattanooga and was so pleased we thought we would stay again after finding a great rate deal. First of all access to the rooms is exterior and upon arrival their are a group of people hanging about out outside. ok not a big deal. Entering the lobby you have to squeeze into a glass enclose next to the elevator ummm AWKWARD! During the remodel I hope the address this! Check in staff were cordial at best and to give them the benefit of the doubt they were extremely busy. Wait, we are in the South where southern hospitality is suppose to reign supreme right? Room checked in and off we go back to squeeze into the little space to use the elevator to go upstairs to our room. The room is clean this is good! Time to sleep.Sleep? No Way... people running up and down and you can hear every sound there is no sound proofing in this hotel. It would be better sold to a Motel 6 that have Marriot on their name. I have not finished.. Its Breakfast Buffet time... again its extremely busy and they have a very small seating area... and not enough places for the crowd to seat. The staff which are barely visible must be having a horrendous time in the kitchen because the food is not stocked to keep up with the demand,Not the Fault of the hotel by any means I witnessed people picking things up and replacing them to which I then took them and threw said items away! Seriously! People don't handle things at a Buffett! Gross!!! Not even the plates or cutlery if you do use it or toss it! Read this if you want more on that topic wp.me/p43oJF-5H Please read it!Lastly the coffee or should I say water... We brought Starbucks Via with us knowing that the coffee would not be great and Via would be a good alternative. however either the creamer or the water was very off!!! Leaving our Vias non-drinkable! they had the funkiest taste we determined it had to be the water because The Man did not use creamer! We have stayed at far worse, however we will not return to this hotel, and will seriously reconsider staying at other Fairfield Inns.FYI We are Frequent Marriott guests.I just visited trip advisor and saw management had responded to many months of positive reviews but not negative. This earns them -1 star for LOUSY CUSTOMER SERVICE in social media forums.Definitely a motel and totally not worth the 129+tax for one night. Very disappointed!Had a very short stay here last week. Checked in late (around 11:30) and was expecting the typical Night Auditor check-in. The process was quick but the woman was very nice and friendly enough for the hour.The set-up is strange. Floors one and two have exterior corridors. The third floor has interior corridors. We had a third floor room. The room was standard with the bathroom being a bit small. Or at least it felt that way because there was very little counter space.Our ceiling looked like it had been patched multiple times which doesn't all give the best impression on a rainy evening. My roommate didn't feel like her shirts were clean.Breakfast was available right on time at 6:30 the next morning. Plenty of good offerings including waffles and biscuits and gravy. We ate and hit the road again.Overall a quick stay. In general I would say everything was A-OK but it wouldn't be my first choice if I were to return to Savannah.This hotel has much to improve! The bathroom was gross! The toilet seat was the wrong size so it was like sitting on bricks! Solid water stains throughout the tub, spotty linen, and incompetent staff! I prepaid through cheap tix and they charged my card again! I have had to call three times to get these charges reversed! This place has seen the last of me!!Visited Savannah for less than 24 hours. Arrived on a Sunday after 1pm and left the next day after 10:30am. Very short visit. Hotel looked outdated from the outside but okay looking inside. The rooms were fine for what you pay for. I like that they have makeup remover towelettes for the ladies. Wasn't a being fan of the hotel soap. Had a funny smell to it. The free breakfast was okay too. Wish they had more healthier options.Nice an affordable place to stay while in Savannah,not to far from Hunter Army Airfield.Basically, they publish great coupons and refuse to honor them, even if customers comply with absolutely all stipulations on the coupons. So, this place is a total scam.I purchased a groupon for this location. According to all published information, the groupon was valid on the date I wanted to stay, and I was reserving the room prior to the expiration date.When I called the hotel, they told me that I could only stay for full price on that date, the groupon would not be valid. This brought the rate from $69 to $125. They claimed this was because too many people had tried to use a groupon that weekend (but rooms were available, mind you!). There was absolutely no information about such a possible situation in the groupon. Next, I called corporate headquarters for Fairfield. They informed me that the local hotel could refuse accept the groupon at their discretion at any time. Also the groupon would not be accepted during a single weekend in the entire month that I wanted to travel. At their "discretion" meant that the groupon was absolutely never valid. Luckily groupon was able to reimburse me.I would never stay at this place because they publish coupons that that don't mean to accept.This is a hotel wanting to be a Marriott. The breakfast was horrible. The room was extremely small a first for me in a Marriott. The bathroom was terrible the toilet was so low to the ground that we thought it was a child's training toilet. The shower curtain smelled awful. The mattress cover had stains on it. I will never stay there again!!!It's definitely not the nicest place to stay in Savannah & it's a bit far from the historic parts of town, but it's affordable and clean. If we're in Savannah again for the weekend, we'll definitely consider it just because it's affordable, not too far from uptown, and centrally located if you're trying to get to Wilmington Island or Tybee.We stayed here for one night when we came into town to see the sights of Savannah. First of all, this place is a screaming deal for one night. For $75/night plus tax, we had a room on the third floor with a small fridge and microwave and a smallish bathroom as well as a king size bed (no closet). Second, for what it is, the place is clean and quiet and the staff is very nice. We had a continental breakfast, which was typically average fare (cereal, hard boiled eggs, toast, yogurt, make your own waffles and biscuits with gravy), and it was tasty. I would recommend this to anyone who wants to stay in a quiet place outside of town.This is basically a motel with free coffee and breakfast. So if that is what your looking for them this place is fine but if your looking for a marriott hotel then you will be disappointed. Linens were clean. Bathrooms are tiny. the sink is in the same room as the beds.We found this hotel in a discount book we picked up traveling through SC. We called while traveling and made the reservation confirming the discount price with a helpful employee. We arrived to meet a friendly and efficient front desk employee. The price was what was advertised and confirmed by phone. The hotel even smelled clean and was pleasantly decorated. We were pleased with our room. The hotel was very convenient to the expressway, Starbucks and Cracker Barrel.The only thing I would add is there was no blanket in the room.We booked here because over the Memorial Day weekend 2011 the downtown hotels were all booked solid. we had a two-night stay here. First, I have to say the staff are courteous, and the continental breakfast good. Also, their laundry room is conveniently located on the second floor and is very clean. The parking space are plentiful, unlike the downtown hotels.However, its WiFi Internet did not work! To me, that ruined the stay. I told the staff twice that either their server is down or the signals so weak that I could not access the Internet, but no one seemed to work on this issue. I had no problem logging on to the Hilton affiliated hotel WiFi down the road (hhonors network), but since I wasn't staying there I could not use it. In the night of the second day the WiFi finally worked, but it was spotty at best, requiring constant reloads. I took my laptop to the lobby and it was the same. I might add that my Acer laptop has a very sensitive WiFi detection unit and it can ferret out even the weakest signals. It was worse than the days of the dial-up connection! I gave up at the end, and relied on my iPhone's 3G to get on the Internet. (By the way, they do have a wired computer in the lobby for the guests, but it was occupied most of the time)I suppose the motel is OK if you don't need the Internet, but if you do, go somewhere else.I stay here on my way between Boston and Orlando during the winter and it is my favorite overnight stop. Everyone who works here is extremely nice and welcoming and the rooms and areas around the hotel are very clean and comfortable. I never wake up in time to get the free breakfast, but I'm usually lucky enough to be in my room when they come by with the free snack cart in the early evening. You can also grab a free bottled water from the front desk whenever you feel like it.If security is a concern, ask for a room on the second or third floor. While the first floor is open to the parking lot, the second and third floor are both accessible by elevator only and you need your keycard to use the elevator.This is also a great location for visiting Savannah as you are only about a 10 minutes drive from the historic district.Booked this hotel because of a Groupon offer. I checked the hotel online before I purchased the coupon. The pictures depict a nice and very clean hotel. After driving for 12 hours, I wanted to cry when I saw this place. There was a sign on the door letting us know that they place was being renovated and they apologized for the current condition. The gentleman who checked me in was very friendly and incredibly courteous. Since the lobby looked (somewhat....the chair at the computer desk had lovely electrical tape on the arm rest) like the pictures on the website I thought, "Okay, no problem. This is going to be fine." WRONG!My sister and niece went up to the room before me while I parked the car. When I came into the room they were both just standing there looking a little freaked out. My sister told me not to worry and that it was going to be okay because we were just spending the night and leaving first thing in the morning. The first thing you notice is the heavy smell of damp/mold. The room looked nothing like the pictures on the website. I mean NOTHING. The carpet was dirty, the shower liner was moldy and also covered in soap scum, there was hair in the tub and floor and the bed skirts were really wrinkled and the bottoms were completely frayed. I called the front desk and the gentleman was very apologetic and immediately offered to move us. He even went to check the room himself before he had us move. While this room looked a little cleaner and the damp smell not as heavy, it was only a fraction of an improvement overall. The room also did not have fridge like the first one did. What it did have was one big honking dehumidifier that sounded like a dying animal when we turned it on. I tried to find another hotel, but it was past midnight and unless we drove another two hours we were out of luck. So we sucked it up and spent the night. I'm not sure when this hotel went from (according to the other reviews) clean to filthy, but I just can't wrap my head around the odd disconnect between the very friendly front end staff and the rest of the employees. Clearly, some don't give a what when it comes to having pride in their work or what they are offering for services or accommodations.This is a great secret. This facility is not an ordinary Fairfield Inn. It is better. Spent 3 nights due to business. It is an easy tide to the historic district, less than 10 minutes and don't forget Tybee Beach. Outdoor pool, several exercise machines, but hey, just use the stairs. Very secure. Clean, how about spotless and shinning. From the minute I checked in every one was helpful, delightful, and very conversational. If you forget you laptop/tablet, don't worry the lobby has a PC, and the hotel is wi-fi. Need to fax, they handle it at no charge. ManAger offered to scan the documents and email to me in a PDF. That was a big, WOW moment. Not to mention, one block was a LOFT clothing store, Fresh Market, Publix, ABC, Five Guys, Bonefish Grill, and more. Here is the best part, they had customer appreciation night and grilled hamburgers and hotdogs, with the fixings and potato salad and fruit salad. Breakfast was expanded.
review_content_20: Great clean hotel at a great price! Family enjoyed our stay!Outside looks a bit dated and it has exterior "hallways" but the interior seems recently renovated. Clean, decent, up to date room. Ac was a bit funky... Made the room feel damp. Loud noise around 9 or 10 pm that freaked me an my husband out. I think it was a plane. Didn't expect that. Good free breakfast... Biscuits and gravy, delicious belgium waffles (make em yourself in the waffle iron), variety of cold cereals, oatmeal, fresh fruits, juices, coffee, some other baked goods, yogurt, Jimmy dean microwaveable sandwiches. Friendly staff. Check out is at 12.

hotel_name: Baymont Inn And Suites Garden City
review_content: Dont let the desolate area fool you, this place is decent enough to stay in if you are visiting Savannah. Our room had a very comfortable king sized bed, huge flat screen tv, microwave and refridgerator. The bathroom was clean, and the shower worked wonderfully. Breakfast was amazing, lots of options! The only thing I felt that went wrong was that the maid came to our room at 10:50am when check out was at 12 noon. I dont like being rushed. There was a do not disturb sign visibe on our doorknob. I kindly told her we'd be done by noon. Other than that, they have shuttles to Savannah attractions, and all the pamphlets you need if you want something to do.Changed rates from quoted price of $65 then bill you $80 says there is a new revenue tax....other hotels aren't aware of by the way. Due to a reservation issue they didn't have a room for me for my extended WEEK. Charged me $180 for one night in this no frills hotel in February. Night desk was nice but had no power to fix anything after a rude discussion with the manager. I left there and stayed in pooler ga way cheaper with nicer hotels for another week at a set rate of $55 a night..don't stay here when 10 minutes away you have nicer areas.Really nice hotel. When we first saw the neighborhood we weren't expecting much but we were pleasantly surprised. The room was large and comfy (king size bed) The room was clean and fresh. However, room 124 is located right across from the entrance for the pool and ice machine which means lots of foot traffic and noise. The ice machine is loud. We booked our room with hotels.com and decided after to extend our stay so we booked again. The staff was able to keep us in the same room for both bookings. The staff is very helpful and friendly. Breakfast is basic but good and satisfying. The hotel is just minutes from downtownWe stayed here for one night because we made a last minute decision to stay in Savannah an extra night. I would give one star, but I was only worried about two things: cleanliness, and a bed. They were clean as far as the eye could see, but the bed was horrible. We were up all night. It was like someone folded the mattress In half and the indent stayed. Or a very few hundred men laid directly in the center and left a hole. It was kind of like a sinking ship. Just trying to crawl back up to the sides of the bed. Good thing my boyfriend and I don't mind cuddling. If you don't mind a rough NIGHT then this if the place for you.Stay 8/18/15-8/19/15. Firstly, our family was moved 5 times in less than 12 hours due to a refrigerator not working which was frozen completely solid with a thick sheet of ice from top to bottom on the back wall ( my son has IDDM and we HAVE to keep his insulin cold!) which is imperative for us...then the second room they wanted us to move to because the night clerk JR said theres no way to switch out a refrigerator at 11:00pm (we arrived after 10pm) stunk like a mix of nasty gym socks and clothes and sour pickle juice...ugh...and after opening the door we immediately had to close it!! So...off to number three! By this time it was midnight and we didn't get settled in until 2:30am but happy we had a working fridge for the insulin!! At around the 3 o'clock hour I woke up coughing and not breathing well because the room was sooooo hot! It was 76 degrees and the air conditioner was sounding like chatty chatty bang bang!!
