It had also leaked out onto the carpeted flooring directly beneath it where I had all of my shoes mind you, and which were all now soaked!!! Soooo calling the front desk again who assigned us a FOURTH room with yet again no working fridge!!! Sooooo my husband pulls out the fridge and underneath was an opened tube of hydrocortisone cream!!! When he pulled out the fridge to check it the tube squirted out the cream all over the carpet beneath the fridge which was filthy and I had to clean the used hydrocortisone cream off the carpet! Awful! Then behind the fridge in this fourth room was a large canister of coffee creamer!! We had to move fridge #3 into the 4th room! Next was a "free" upgrade to a larger suite which remained at 76 degrees because the thermostats are locked and preset to cut off after 30 minutes of no movement in the room!?! We thought we could deal with just the heat of the room after all the moves and this was room #5 so we tried to settle in after finally being reassured a night would be credited for us (after pushing it because they only were going to give us a 50% discount for the bad night!!)! also, didn't mention that we didn't get moved to room #4 until 6:00am! Soon breakfast time! Right?!? Well, sort of! Whenever we placed toast in the toaster and gosh forbid used the microwave at the same time it would trip the octopus strip sitting right behind the toaster and I had to keep cutting the strip back on myself!! Uuugh! So we thought we were going to finally get some sleep...right? Wrong again! The maid, unannounced barges in the room with all 4 of our family members sound asleep and begins cleaning the bathroom! She then walks into the sleeping area and I was scared to death and I sat up in bed which scared her and she just said oooooh sorry and ran out of the room!! Soooo off to room number 5.... The great upgrade, we were thinking that sleep time was finally approaching us when on Wednesday August 19, 2015 while laying in bed my adult daughter noticed a bug crawling on her white shirt. It immediately crawled onto her chest. We took photos and identified it as a bed bug and notified staff who came in our room and saw the bug and took it with them. They actually did not want to give a receipt or refund as we checked out! The night duty clerk, JR stated that they could do nothing about it and as for us we would have to stay the night until the morning and in that same room!! He also denied it in front of people standing behind us! This is THE MOST UNCLEAN HOTEL I HAVE EVER STAYED IN! DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!! WE DECIDED IT WAS FINALLY TIME TO LEAVE!!! Plus when we tried to check out the night clerk started yelling at me, standing up pointing to a note on the wall yelling that there was nothing he could do about giving us a receipt showing we checked out after telling me on the phone 20 mnutes earlier that we would get a refund for the next 3 nights we were not going to be there. When he stood up and raised his voice at me, my husband put hs hand on the counter and told him to slow down talking to me, his wife, that way and the night clerk started shaking and violently squealing for us to get out of his hotel and all just for asking him a question about our receipt and asking for a copy of us checking out!!! He ran in the back so weird like and called 911! It was like a Saturday Night live comedy sketch with yelling from the clerk! Unbelievable! Needless to say we WILL NEVER STAY THERE AGAIN!!!We stayed here the night before running a half marathon in Savannah. It was reasonably priced, right on the highway and not far from downtown. At first glance, everything seemed fine.My friend and I got a room with 2 queen beds. I woke up in the middle of the night and noticed something moving in my bed. It was a bug. I hate bugs so I woke up my friend, thinking it was just one bug but needing her emotional support for me to get rid of it. Nope, turned out there were 3 bugs that I found in my bed and 2 in hers, as well as a palmetto bug (aka a cockroach) on the wall. We lifted up the sheets, didn't seen any bugs so I don't think they were bed bugs. There were all different kinds of bugs... Needless to say we didn't get a good night's sleep before our half marathon.Everyone kept on writing about the "shuttle" like it's such a "convenient" service. Lol. Let me share my experiences with you in regards to this. Don't rely on the shuttle during three of their busiest time of the year, which is: New Year's Day, July 4th, and St. Patrick's Day. You will be waiting forever for your ride back to the hotel.Unfortunately, my husband and I tried their shuttle service because everyone was mentioning how "wonderful" it was. Well, on July 4th, their service was terrible and very poorly managed. First of all, fireworks in Savannah was scheduled for 9pm and they posted 9:30pm in their hotel. How do you not know this information for such an important event? If your hotel was new and you were new in the business, that's one thing. We spoke with a few folks from the hotel when we were all stranded waiting for the bus (2 hours) and some of them were angry that they missed the fireworks because of this mislead information.You basically get dropped off at the "Hyatt Hotel" and get picked up at the same location. It takes about 20 minutes (one way without traffic) each round.My husband, son, and I were lucky that we headed out early to explore Savannah and asked a local man when the fireworks was supposed to start so we made it on time. It was spectacular and worth watching! I highly recommend Savannah for vacation, just not at this hotel if you can afford a better one. We paid over $100 bucks a night, stayed for 2 nights. Basically, this is NOT a hotel, it's a MOTEL quality. Anthony Melchiorri from "Hotel Impossible" should visit this hotel.They posted a shuttle bus schedule, this is where it gets REALLY interesting. They scheduled it hourly and for some reason they didn't service their shuttle around the 10pm session. So you get the shuttle from 6pm to 11pm, EXCEPT the 10pm hour. Does this make sense to you? The fireworks ended around 9:45pm, why would you not pick up your hotel customers at the 10pm hour? Especially, those of us with children? Around 11pm the shuttle came and of course there were 30 of us sitting in front of the Hyatt hotel trying to fit into this 1 mini van that fit about 7 people, LOL. The motel has 2 vans. I'm not upset at the staff who worked at this hotel because they were all working hard and they were very professional with me, when I was pretty tired and pissed off by the time we got back to the hotel, which was 12:30am (I'll tell you more later how we managed to get home). The manager might as well put robots behind the counter because NOBODY could call the shots since NOT a single manager or ASSISTANT manager was on duty during the 4th of July weekend?! REALLY?! How the hell do you run a business without a "boss?" The manager wasn't available ALL weekend (one of the busiest time of the year) or intelligent enough to appoint an assistant manager to take care of customer concerns, because the lady behind the desk insisted that there was NOTHING she could do.Clearly, a second shuttle bus was needed to be sent out, but NOBODY was "high enough rank" to call the shots on that. Umm...really? It's a no brainer you know which events are the busiest time of the year where you locate your business and don't you want to make a profit for your business?! That's fine, you need to manage your motel better and hire people that can actually take care of things and problem solve. If your staff can't do it, then do it yourself.How did we manage to get home? My husband, 4 years old son, and I were sitting on the curb right outside of Hyatt. It was 11:45pm and my son was getting tired and sleeping on me. A lovely gentleman ran over and goes, "Hey, would your family like to share a cab with my wife and I? We'll pay for it. You have a kid, he should be in bed, come with us. We would like to help." Talk about the kindness of strangers...amazing! I felt really bad when I found out that they were on their honeymoon and this was the lame shuttle service they got on their honeymoon! I should have gotten their motel number and send them a basket of goodies. I probably will never see them again, but I wanted to make sure that my story was told and to let the MANAGER KNOW (I'm being respectful by not calling your name out, MANAGER), please take care of your staff and don't set them up for failure. If you had inform them properly on how to take care of things on a busy weekend because I'm sure this wasn't your first 4th of July, then things would have been less stressful for everyone. From a leader to a leader and from the bottom of my heart, "take care of your people and your people will take care of you." Without our staff, crew, or employees that work under us, our leadership means nothing if we can't guide them properly to achieve success or in your case, great customer service. No hard feelings, good luck to your business. To the amazing strangers that I met from this trip, you were the best part about this experience. Thanks again for your kindness.I had a great time at this hotel. We flew in from San Francisco and spent Halloween (and the following week) in Savannah. It's like, 3 miles from town. Maybe a 8 min shuttle ride at tops depending on traffic. Even if you take a cab into town it's only like, $12 at tops. Not bad at all. The staff was very helpful and friendly. We had a room with one king size bed and everything was perfect. They also can pick you up and drop you off at the airport for free. Just make sure to call ahead and schedule it/ let them know at the desk. We will be back!Not a fancy place, but clean with a comfortable bed, new linens, and friendly staff. We had a complaint when we checked in (the bath tub wasn't properly cleaned), but when I alerted the front desk staff to the issue, someone was cleaning it within 2 minutes, and apologized for the oversight. We left a note for housekeeping the next day asking for extra towels and coffee and they were both provided for us. The room appeared recently renovated, stone countertops and a tile tub surround, dual flush toilet in the bath. The outdoor hot tub was down while we were there which was a disappointment, but the pool was up and running with a fun little waterfall faucet that looked new. The neighborhood is industrial, but feels safe. Overall a pretty good stay for the price.Hotel was about 2 miles from the city center and there was a free van ride over that could be arranged (although we didn't use it). Beds were nice, bathroom was good. The pool was closed for renovations so not sure how that was. Area around the hotel was industrial, but the price was good for being so close to the city center.Hey all your Girl Scout Troops planning your troop trip to Savannah! This hotel is perfect for troops (families too). The staff is VERY nice & accomadating to large groups, the rooms are nice, breakfast was good (something for everyone). And you cannot beat the price of the rooms! It is about 10 minutes from the Historic District, but well worth it.$98 ($110 w/ tax) for 1 night around Columbus Day. located outside of town in more industrial / strip mall area, but short drive to historic savannah, plus a shuttle. The condition of the hotel was disappointing, there was a smell in the a hallway that could turn your stomach, blood on the curtains, and the smoke alarm in the room was literally laying in pieces (battery, plastic cover, wires sticking out of the wall). don't sleep in either, the free breakfast is from 6-9am -- pretty stingy hours for families or folks on vacation. surprisingly bad for a chain hotel -- price can be reasonable, but definitely look harder if you want value.Just stayed in this hotel for 3 nights this past week for our trip to Savannah. While my husband and I were initially ~spooked~ by the grisly seeming looking location, the hotel itself is wonderful!! The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, the rooms were clean and our stay was quite enjoyable. As others have mentioned below, the hotel is very close to downtown Savannah and the free shuttle makes it easy to get down there and back without worrying about parking (or who's gonna be the DD!) The breakfast was just your average free breakfast and the hours were restrictive (6-9) but it was good and made for a good start for the day. Also the free cookies are 6pm are a fabulous touch! All in all, this is a great hotel for the price (we paid less than $75 a night on Expedia) and you will be pleasantly surprised!! :)We recently stayed at Baymont Inn and Suites and we thought we were getting a great deal! We booked our room a week in a half in advance. It was for $70 a night. We got a confirmation sent from the hotel that the reservation was made. We decided to come in a day early so we booked that one night on Hotels.com for $60. The first night was great and that is where it ended! The next day we went to explore Savannah and when we returned our room key was deactivated. We went to the front desk to find out that our reservation that was booked a week and a half earlier was canceled by the front desk staff. We then found out that they rebooked our reservation for $20 more for each night. We were told by the front desk staff that they could not do anything about it and we would have to wait to talk to Suneel, the manager. They did not tell us a definite time he would come in, sometime in the morning. Well, they charged us double the original rate at this point because they didn't know what they were doing! Then we had to interrupt our breakfast and our visit to Savannah to stay on the phone with Suneel to fix the problem. We explained that we needed a refund for the amount charged and after having to basically demand the refund from Suneel, he CHARGED US AGAIN!!! Now at this point we were charged $300 for a two night stay! We chose Baymont because of the great price! Suneel was horrible. He at one point told us to come back to the hotel and get our bags to leave his hotel! I couldn't believe it and please realize we were by no means being rude, irate, angry, or anything toward him. We jut wanted our money back. We checked out Sunday and the issue is still NOT resolved! We will NEVER stay here again and will NEVER recommend any one of our friends to stay here. It is not worth the hassle. Honestly, the ONLY problem was our interaction with Suneel. He needs to go back to customer service training. I am appalled at the way we were treated by him.This place was awesome! We stayed here for a wedding downtown, and it was so much cheaper than anything in the city, however, the quality was nothing less. Yes, it isn't walking distance to downtown Savannah, but there is a free shuttle that runs pretty frequently back and forth, and even a taxi ride is only about $12 bucks. There is also a free airport shuttle which was very convenient. The breakfast was way better than any free continental breakfast I have ever seen, complete with fruit, make your own waffles, yogurts, juices, eggs, etc! And this is not to mention the cookies that come straight out of the oven in the evening. Complete with a computer and printer access, and a nice pool with a great hot tub, you can't go wrong. Even after we checked out, we were still able to use the facilities for the rest of the day, including the shuttles, and last but not least, the staff was great, ESP BIG MIKE!!!! :)Very pleased with our 2-night stay here this weekend. Hotel was extremely affordable and located about 5 minutes from downtown Savannah. Complimentary continental breakfast and shuttle to the downtown area were nice touches. The room itself was very spacious (though the bathroom was a bit tiny) and featured a 40" Panasonic flat screen, very comfortable king size bed, and small kitchenette with microwave, fridge, and coffee maker. 15 minutes after checking in the front desk even called up to our room to make sure everything was acceptable. The entire staff, especially the maintenance guy/shuttle driver was super friendly and made us feel welcome. I would definitely consider staying here again when visiting Savannah.This hotel is only a mile or so from downtown and it's much cheaper than anything closer. It's clean and they're very nice and helpful. They've got the usual free breakfast and pool and all that jazz. If you don't want to blow a stupid amount of money on a room you won't be in for more than sleeing then I definitely recommend this hotel.My family stayed at this hotel during our recent visit to Savannah. The hotel is very good for the money. The staff was very pleasant, our rooms were cleaned very well and overall we were happy with it. Downtown was about three miles from the hotel and very easy to get to with the shuttle the hotel provides.Check in was quick and easy, but as soon as we got in the Hotel staff tried to sell us a tour of the City. I later found out that the company from the tour company places employees as hotel staff to push their tours. I thought it was a little cheese, but I did not buy the tour anyways. There were cookies when we got in but I think these were also planted by the tour company.The hotel was good, clean, well priced, and close driving distance to most of Savannah. There are no close restaurants in the area but driving to the city for dinner was fine, as parking really had no issues as it's free parking after 5pm on the place we parked.The continental breakfast is a bonus as we traveled with 6 people comes out to be a savings of 30 dollars a day. Nice touch on the tv's that they were all flat screens. My two young kids under the age of 10 really enjoyed the pool.The cons: The A/C unit seemed a little noisy, but since you sleep so well after being so tired is really not an issue. The beds are pillow top so if you really like soft beds you would be in heaven, I hate them bad on my back.Great location and price. Room was clean and up to date. Breakfast was okay, mostly carbs, so be prepared. Love the availability of the free shuttle to downtown.
review_content_20: The front desk receptionist was terrible. Everything was fine until I mentioned that i had a dog with me, and was told there was a $60 additional fee, not the $25 that was stated online. The room was actually pretty nice, until my mom found a cockroach in the bathroom. She thoughtlessly killed and flushed it down the toilet before I could show it to the front desk. I told the same receptionist who really couldn't care less, much less apologize. It seemed like she didn't believe me, I'm sure a lot of ***holes make up that complaint to get a discount but I am fully aware that my stay is non-refundable.  She just responded nonchalantly, "oh, thanks for letting me know".  The hotel is pretty close to downtown Savannah, but the area is sort of industrial and ghetto. I booked the place because I thought it was cheaper than staying downtown, but since it ended up not being any cheaper, in hindsight I should've just booked a nicer hotel downtown.My daughter's Girl Scout troop stayed here during their recent trip to Savannah.  Accomodations were great.  Rooms were clean, building is well maintained, pool was clean, and each room had refrigerator and microwave.  The evening maintenance man (Kent) was a wealth of information.  He advised us on where to park in Savannah and when parking fees were charged, what to see (St. John Baptist Cathedral was not on our list of to-dos but on his advice, we squeezed it in and were in total awe), where to eat, and multitudes of other tidbits of information.  We would stay at this hotel again.

hotel_name: Hilton Garden Inn Savannah Historic District
review_content: Family road trip and this is our 2 Hilton garden inn we stay at! Gotta say it was very clean and the staff was great! Our concierge Ed recommended the best tours with old Savannah tours! And I also yelped them it was great! The hotel was clean and I should of Taken a picture of the water fountain Omg! It glistened I've never seen such a shiny water fountain! 5 stars plus!The breakfast was great it's buffet style and the best part was the French toast! Wow!Location: It can't be beat. It's in the heart of Savannah's historic district and is walkable to everywhere. If you don't want to walk, you can Uber for 5 bucks. Amenities: The gym and pool area are great! The gym had treadmills, elliptical, stationary bikes, free weights, and medicine balls. Everything is in newer condition and clean. The pool goes to 9 feet deep and has ample seating and views.Breakfast: Wow. This breakfast buffet (that comes with your room) has everything. Scrambled eggs, omelette bar, bacon, sausage, turkey sausage, biscuits n' gravy (THE BEST OF MY LIFE), fresh fruit, cheeses, smoked salmon, pastries, bagels, croissants, oatmeal, hard boiled eggs, assorted juices....am I missing anything? Probably. Room: I had to take into account that this is an older hotel. A lot of fixtures are old and rusted. The shower curtain definitely needed to be changed to a new one. The beds weren't made with a fitted sheet but a bed sheet, a comforter, then another bed sheet. We had a leaky toilet the second day we were there but it was fixed within 5 minutes of us calling downstairs. I would have given this hotel 5 stars if they did some updated renovations to the room.Don't use the valet parking at this hotel. They do not know how to park and will damage your vehicle.  Then they do not have good lighting to check out the damage when they bring you the vehicle back. So if you want your vehicle damaged and them tell you it's not your problem, then use this hotel it's for you.  Already informed my company to not book anyone else into this hotel or any of their other Hilton hotels . Most of the valet drivers looked to be 18 to 22 years old. Would you trust someone that age with a very nice vehicle much less a clunker .The staff at this hotel are incredible accommodating and courteous. The hotel location is fantastic for all things touristy!!  Breakfast is ok, but service is better. My only complaints are that the rooms and linens and starting to show some wear and rooms facing the street are excessively noisy.We really enjoyed our stay at Hilton Garden Inn while in Savannah. There is a $25 per day parking charge if you have a car, which is just an extra expense to add to the room, but it is valet which was great. All of the valet's were very nice and speedy- and did a great job as well on crazy days with lots of check in and check out. The staff at check in and check out were great- very friendly and helpful. They also have a concierge- but we did not need to use her while in town as we had our plans ready- but we did see several other people using their services and they seemed pleased.Our room was very clean and in a good state when we arrived, and the cleaning service was excellent throughout our time there. This location is great- right by the city market- which has lots of shops and food available- and is a short walk to many other destinations in Savannah. We actually only needed our car once and that was because we were running late. I would definitely stay at this hotel again as the staff, services, and rooms were great.We had a room on the top floor with a balcony overlooking the river. If you ignored the cheap hotel across the street, it was a great view. Room was nice, relatively updated. Did not enjoy housekeeping trying to enter twice on a day I was checking out. Great location, able to walk almost anywhere. Friendly staff.Great atmosphere in the lobby area. The desk staff was helpful. The bathroom was stocked with lotions, shampoo, mouthwash, and make-up remover wipes. The view was not much to look at. The shower was well-pressured and I enjoyed the hot shower.4 stars for quiet rooms and location... I walked every where I visited in savannah when I stayed here.  Minus a star for expensive breakfast and lack of charging options in the room.I have a track record of not picking the best of hotels during our travels mostly due to trying to save a buck or two.  I don't look for the barely in business dumps but I do stray away from places that push toward having too many dollar signs (call me cheap but I don't want to drop two bills for a room that I don't plan to do anything in other than sleep).Being that the hotel was located in the Historic District, we couldn't be happier to be close to all the action, restaurants and sights we wanted to see in this area... plus most of it was walking distance. Parking is "mandatory valet" service which is $18 per night (NOT per visit)... but you know your car is safe being that the parking garage is beneath the hotel and no one can just freely walk around in there.  I should know, I went into the garage to fetch something from the car and one of the valets asked what I was doing in the garage in a mater of minutes.The lobby of the hotel was lovely and had plenty of chairs, tables, couches plus a dining area and a concierge... and SUPER FRIENDLY... and I mean everyone (front desk staff, valets, maids, everyone) always ended every single encounter with "Have a nice stay" OR "Hope you're enjoying your time here".I thought it was interesting that they had no vending machines;  instead they opted to offer guests access to their mini-market located beside the front desk (behind a wall so guests don't have to see it.  Nice when you want something more than a cold soda or water.And our room was as impressive too... clean, comfortable and a balcony to view the Talmadge Memorial Bridge, the Savannah River and the gorgeous Savannah City Hall (the golden dome).If I was forced to make a complaint I could only think of two.  (1) the pillows were full sized but sink to nothing when you place your head on them.  And (2) my balcony view also included a view of the dumpy Quality Inn across the street (but I forced my eyes on other focal points).Speaking of the Quality Inn (a chain that surprisingly does offer decent locations around country)...   that hotel wanted $25 more dollars each night....  they may include a continental breakfast but it's the old-style hotel (room doors exposed to outside balcony walks, just two floors and no elevators).  I'll save the money, give up breakfast and stay in this classy hotel any day over the Q.Great bang for the buck and surprisingly cheaper than I expected.  Inside and out, the hotel is impressive.  This Savannah hotel was my saving grace... making up for a real doozy I chose in St Augustine Florida and another poor choice I made in Charleston SC.Saw reviews about bad customer service.  Staff could not have been nicer or more helpful.  Location is great.  Room with a balcony.  Not easy to get in Savannah.  Only downfall was room was a tad outdated,  but very clean.  Yay housekeeping!They were extremely accommodating and friendly. Cleanliness was great and all the little details were in place (coffee and fresh fruit always available, helpful concierge and valet, fast wifi, clean fitness room and pool) that made our stay that much more comfortable. We were staying at the "thrifty" choice in the historic district and ended up switching to here after one night. With prices almost the same, the quality here is especially that much more pleasantly surprising.Staff is four stars. Room cleanliness, same. Great, very clean fitness center. Good breakfast. ($15 for complete breakfast.)Why not give it four stars overall? NOISY. Very, very noisy. Even getting a City Market-side room, it was noisy. We could hear the kids in the room above getting up early and playing, and every person walking down the hall. Thin walls. Oh, and the leaf blower at 5AM. Ouch.The hotel is clean and well located, within walking distance of Market street. The lobby looks old and tired. The small bar is not inviting.  My biggest turn off was the $25 charge for parking at check in. The hotel across the street had free parking and this was not a busy weekend or seasons.  Plus it is Savannah, not Chicago or Miami or LA, where I've paid $25 for parking.  The room was large, clean and with a nice view of the river.  The shower had very little water pressure and the water wasn't hot enough. I'm a Gold Hilton Honors member and was a but disappointed by this hotel.Great value for the price. Courteous efficient check in, and free wifi and bottled water for Hilton Honors members. Rooms are updated and clean. Keurig coffee makers, microwave and fridge in the room!  Breakfast buffet with eggs to order in the morning. Best grits and perfect eggs Benedict. I've never had such friendly service at a hotel breakfast. This staff is top notch. Wish I could have gotten names...I would have sent a note to Hilton corporate !My favorite hotel in downtown Historic Savannah.STAY HERE!! YOU WILL NOT BE DISAPPOINTED!!! Great place!!!! The place was clean and the staff was friendly!! It's in a perfect location! Quick and easy walk to all the hot spots!! We will definitely stay at this place again when we come back!!I am a  Hilton Diamond member and I was not pleased. The only reason why I gave 3 stars is because of Trina - the concierge. She recommended a good tour for us to take.  She was about the only one that was helpful at this hotel. Seriously!The front desk was less than par. The one girl when we checked in was quite rude. We didn't even get our room cleaned the first night. This hotel needs some major upgrades.  The outdoor pool is gross and the hot tub had hair floating in it!Ok - now thinking about it I recant my 3 stars and must provide a 2 star. This breaks my heart to do so since I'm such a loyal member of Hilton Honors. Next time we will definitely choose another hotel other than Hilton. Sadly.The location was good, but that was about it. Service needs major improving!!I would choose this HGI again.Pluses:  convenient location near the river in Old Savannah, clean rooms with comfortable Hilton beds, happy hour 7-9 pm with discounted drinks provided you choose well drinks, outdoor pool, underground parking, tasty made-to-order breakfast with healthy options such a sliced grapefruit, balcony rooms with river view on the West side, and friendly staff.Minuses: Even after asking, no self parking at $18 per day, no draft beer, and no discounted drinks during happy hour except for well drinks.Tip:  Choose the rooms on the West side for both River View and Balconies.If you think this review with photos is useful, funny or cool, I'd appreciate ur feedback by clicking below.Not what I've come to expect from a Garden. Room furniture showed significant wear. Grout in bathroom was grayed from dirt and traffic. Tub drain/stopper was rusted. Tub grout cracked and needs repair. There was hair on the bathroom floor that was not mine (when I noticed we'd already unpacked and were getting in the shower at the end of a very long day). Bed and pillows were very comfortable. Traffic outside was very, very loud until 3a (windows and curtains closed, we even used a sound machine on full volume). The location is convenient, but at an expensive price and loud/interrupted night of sleep. I would not stay here again, but instead would consider a midtown hotel that is quieter, less expensive, and still located very near the historical sites.We enjoyed our 2 day stay. This is in the heart of the historic district. Everything is convenient and most within walking distance. The consigliere will give you a map of the historic district and help you plan events.The breakfast is hearty. You can order omelets, French Toast and a few other things or eat off the buffet. Of course, there is grits and biscuits to accompany your meal. The servers are polite and helpful too! There is free Wi-fi service in the entire place after you login. Yelper's gave us plenty of places to eat within walking distance.  For lunch walk to Papillote, a French place. Also try Rancho Alegre. We drove to Rancho Alegre, about .7 miles away, for dinner. At Savannah Bee Company, we had the free honey tastings and bought some for ourselves and a few gifts. That was fun and different!In addition to the basic room price add valet parking ($18 daily), Occupancy Tax, State Tax and Downtown Lodging Fee ($1.00 daily).I'm sure this would normally be a great hotel, but this was definitely the worst hotel experience I've ever had. Upon check in, we walked into our room and it was still being cleaned. Mind you, we checked in at 9:30pm. Also, there was no hot water in our shower, our key card kept malfunctioning, and the front desk staff was very rude and unprofessional. Our neighboring rooms sounded like they were filming a porno. I emailed Hilton directly and it took them two weeks to respond (I got a confirmation email saying I should expect a response no longer than 48 hours). The response was that they forwarded the email to the property manager and that I should have to wait another 48 hours for a response. It is approaching three weeks and still no response. Hilton Garden Inn policy is: if you are not satisfied, you don't pay. I am filing a dispute with AMEX today. Don't stay here, there are plenty, cheaper options downtown in Savannah.
review_content_20: I was not impressed by the Hilton Garden Inn. Upon arrival, I learned that this hotel does not provide inclusive parking, but charges $25 to valet the car! After ex pressing our reluctance to pay such a heavy price EVERY time we come and go from the hotel, the parking attendant offered to park our car for $10 "under the carpet." Completely shady! When dealing with the front desk, the staff was monotone and bored, offering little greeting and absolutely no enthusiasm! I definitely would not recommend this hotel. Although centrally located in the historic district, choose a hotel without such hidden fees and poor customer service.The rooms are just ok but here are the pluses: great polite service, super comfy bed, nice amenities (neutrogena), and the best darn hotel breakfast I've ever had.Easily 4+ stars! During a recent trip to SCAD, we roomed here and thoroughly enjoyed this location in the heart of the historic downtown district. Everything we needed, except a convenient drug store, was within walking distance of the hotel. SCAD, numerous restaurants, the river front area, retail shops, coffee shops, desserts, ice cream - all easily walkable! The hotel is extremely quiet, even with the music and late night activities wafting up from the streets below. For me, the beds are comfortable - my back did not start aching the following day which is often the case. The rooms are extremely well maintained and the valet service is outstanding! The gentleman who greeted us on arrival was spot on - helping unload our bags, park the car and then he wheel our travelings to our room - nice surprise. I must also compliment the front desk staff for going above the call of duty with directions, recommendations and solutions for not having a drug store nearby. I guess I'm spoiled by having 24/7 Walgreens on what seems like every corner in the larger cities. The hotel's buffet breakfast was reasonable given the location and quite tasty! This included a hot made-to-order buffet along with cold items such as fruit, cereals and baked goods. You could also order a custom omelet and other items. It was so refreshing to see a hot breakfast available as many hotels have gone to all cold and DIY waffles - but not here! The waiter service was first class, engaging, helpful and attentive. Overall, a very positive experience.We were super happy with our stay here. The hotel is located right near the river area on Bay street, we were pretty much close to everything that we wanted to see. The girls at the front counter were courteous and helpful both during check in and check out, the valet guy hooked us up with a cab to the airport, even switched the times for us without it being a hassle. The room was clean, up to date, had great views of the city, and comfy beds. We didn't use the fitness center or the pool but you can see them in the views from our room. My husband booked this through hotels.com I think so prob got a better price but we couldn't cancel, which was fine because we didn't need to. We had a good night's stay here, def recommend to anyone looking for a hotey in the area.I loved staying here on my recent trip to Savannah for my sister's bachelorette party. This hotel was clean, quiet, and convenient to everything we wanted to see and do in historic downtown Savannah. Everything about the reservation process and our stay went smoothly and without any random hitches. They were extremely accomodating and allowed one of us to check in early ahead of the rest of the group so she could decorate the rooms for my sister's bach party. Even though I thought they were little expensive our stay was well worth the cost. The beds were comfortable and the view from the 4th floor was beautiful! I recommend this hotel to anyone who asks me about our trip to Savannah. The concierge service at this hotel is also extremely helpful and the $12.95 breakfast is AMAZING and worth every penny.I also really liked how they had a little table set up in the main lobby that was constantly stocked with water, tea, and coffee. It was so convenient to be able to grab a drink whenever we happened to be passing through!Five stars here! Without a doubt one of the nicest, cleanest and quiet hotels we have ever stayed out.Located in the historic district of Savannah, you are within walking distance of many shops and restaurants; the breakfast buffet was pretty good, and the coffee is great.The only draw back would be no external sink, only one in the bathroom.A great room, I would definitely recommend it!Money was stolen. I stayed at the hotel during Memorial Day weekend. It was my first time in Savannah and Ive been working hard to finally afford Hilton hotels for my recent trips. I had high expectations of the hotel and the city given the great reviews. I wasn't disappointed with the city or the hotel until I forgot my mother's wallet there due to a misunderstanding. When I got home, I called and asked the hotel employee to look for the wallet and sure enough it was found where we left it in the room. The room was already cleaned at that time and had no new occupants since we left. The hotel employee mailed the wallet to us within 2 days as promised. However, a large amount of cash was gone except about $10. Good thing the cash was enough for the thief to spare the $500 LV wallet. I took my 57 yr old mother on this trip because she works too hard and never gets to go anywhere. She loves the hotel and Savannah so much that she was already recruiting family for the next trip. Instead of making her happy she is now very sad because her hard earned money is gone. It's not easy for a first generation immigrant to make money. We are very disappointed in that hotel employee that we want everyone to beware of their belongings when staying. Other than that, I enjoyed my stay there. Great location, great smiles at the front desk, and helpful valet staff. $25 parking fee seems to be the norm for hotels there so I'm not going to complain about that. I'm just asking the manager to at least investigate and get rid of that employee. That person shouldn't be in the hotel business not to mention the reputable Hilton family.I'm not entirely sure how I ended up staying here. I'm usually more of a Hampton Inn girl, but I guess that it was already booked when I reserved my room for the weekend of the Savannah Rock and Roll Half Marathon. I know that I picked it for the location. You simply can't get a better spot in the city, particularly in terms of night life - just a block off river street and a block from City Market. Unfortunately, some of the noise from city market did hit against the beautiful picture windows of our 6th floor room, but I was so exhausted that I didn't mind too much. And it ended by 11pmish I believe.The rooms are pretty nice, particularly with those windows. The bathroom door is awkwardly close to the room door, particularly if your sleeping companions leave the bathroom door open when you leave the room. But there is a mini fridge and microwave, so that's nice. It's not really set up for working, without easy plugs at the desk, but then again, who expects to get much work done when they're staying on Bay Street?Parking is valet, which is worth it since parking in downtown Savannah is no picnic. The breakfast is decent, though not as good as some other HGI's that I've been to. Also, there are happy hour specials at the bar, but I didn't get a chance to partake. Since I was there for the race, I didn't need to bother with the fitness center, which I believe is on the 2nd floor. Only half the employees were helpful, but that fits for a location that's so popular that it doesn't have to rely on excellent staff.I'd go back, but I think I'd try to get a room at the Inn at Ellis Square or the Hampton first.#Yelp365 - 318/365My mom and I stayed here for four days and three nights - it was a great experience! It was quiet, clean, and convenient! It had a laid-back, light airy environment. The location was great, a street away from the river front walk, and a street away from the action on the other side. The beds were made every day while we were there; they were comfortable and clean. The bathrooms were a good size. We didn't use the pool but went and checked it out, it was a nice private little pool on a second floor outdoor balcony/courtyard with a hot tub and a few dozen sun chairs to lay out on. I wish we had an extra day to relax and lay out there! I would definitely come again! The staff was happy, polite and helpful; the valets were quick and nice. Thanks Hilton Gardens, we had a great trip.Definitely 5 stars, everything was perfect. I was in Savannah for a conference, and the staff was phenomenal. We never had to wait long for a shuttle to take us to the convention center. And when we wanted to shop at a mall, they helped us call a taxi. When we needed an extra blanket, or towels, or lotion, it was instantly brought up to our rooms within 5 minutes.There was free wi-fi, free printing, and there was always coffee and tea available downstairs. Around noon, they had lemonade, and cookies! And it's location is perfect! right across from it, is a little square with small shops and restaurants. The riverfront is also pretty close. My stay in Savannah was too short, hope to be back someday, and when I do, I know where I'll be staying ;).Right on the river, walkable to any location in the historic district, with convenient valet parking. My queen bed room had a nice armchair and ottoman, also a kuerig coffemaker and a mini fridge which is always appreciated when travelling. Three big fluffy white towels that while not supersoft were also several levels above the sandpaper towels in many basic hotels. Staff were friendly and incredibly responsive.Great location and good price. Very clean and staff is friendly. They have a concierge if you need one and they also offer free coffee in the mornings. I would stay here again.Out of all of the holiday inns I have stayed at, the staff here, including the valet has been the most helpful and pleasantVery nice hotel in a great location for tourists. I'm here for business and found the hotel clean, friendly, and efficient. I would stay again for sure. Very close to river street and the city market.The really great part of our stay at this establishment was that the hotel let us check in when our train rolled into town at about 8am. But alas and alack.. it all went down hill from there. Mom and I were on our second annual Amtrak Vacation, and this hotel was one of our options. Yes, they offer an "accessible" room, but the layout is inconvenient, i.e. no towel racks near the sink AND the crappiest hotel shower in one of the darkest bathrooms we've ever seen. The front desk staff literally will not give out any advice, not even the nearest coffee!, without turfing you to the "concierge". The concierge is paid by Old Savannah Tours, so guess whose tickets they sell ya? Even when one of you is in a wheelchair and those shuttles and trolleys ain't accessible, and neither is the Tour company. At all. (Go with Savannah Dan's walking tours, seriously, he's the bomb). Kid you not, a random (but totally awesome) stranger in a wheelchair rolled up to us in one of Savannah's beautiful squares and handed Mom a guide to accessible Savannah, but not our concierge. And really, bartender? You couldn't remember me from one night to the next when you average around 3 customers per night? And Mom and I get plastic cups, not glass like the men at the bar? Dude, you might like your job better if you tried harder. As for the hotel restaurant, please do yourself a favor and skip the all-you-can-eat buffets. Yick.I am at a loss to explain why this hotel is included in Amtrak's vacations when they don't seem particularly interested in the tourism industry.In other words, it's a totally serviceable hotel in a convenient location with some service-oriented work to do. If it weren't for Emmit and the bellhops (thanks for all your help, guys), we would have been unhappy!This hotel is a great deal if you want a clean, nice room with a comfortable bed, you want to be close to pretty much what Savannah has to offer and enjoy having a hot shower right when you want it. I am not a fan of paying to park though and that is why I did not give this place a 5 star review - well that and the fact that they charge $10 for a breakfast buffet that you can get for free at pretty much any Comfort Suites/Ramada/Best Western, etc. However, we did enjoy our 2 night stay here and would definitely stay again if we are ever in Savannah again!Very close to historic amenities. However, since you can walk everywhere safely in this city, one doesn't need to be in this noisy, busy area of town. Over priced restaurants are allllll around here. Good food, but really??? Best bet is to stay in central city and enjoy the quiet parks/amenities and then set out for your day. Hotel check-in and mgmt. staff liked to pass the buck when glitch occurred in our reservation. Beware of internet reservations and having anything changed once you arrive, whether your fault or their's. "I'm sorry" was heard often but not sincerely. Problem resolution came hours later, after going over someone's head to go over someone else's head to only have to go over their's. Had to keep a reminder of looking at credit card statement verifying we would not be double charged. We weren't.Valet is $20 day which is not what is stated on web site.This is in a great location and is reasonably priced. The hotel is very clean and the staff is beyond helpful. We had a balcony room overlooking the pool area. We had no complaints about noise, but then again, we weren't in the room that much. It is Savannah, after all. They also give you lots of fluffy pillows. Too fluffy. I had a crick in my neck for two days.Affordable. Clean. Friendly staff. Pool and hot tub. Convenient downtown location. No problems at all. Valet parking is stupid but it's hard to avoid when staying downtown. I will definitely be back!Do Not Stay! They tried to charge us for things we never even got, then got mad about it when I brought it up. Place is dirty and smells. The front desk help is lazy and cares less about customer service.. Especially Mariah! She's a real c---!
review_content_40: For a last minute deal we got a great price with a water front view and a great staff that made you feel like you were home. I definitely would stay here again when I go back to visit bc you are right in the historic district where everything is.This place has a great location for a weekend in Savannah.  It's easy walking distance to River Street, City Market, and the best of Savannah's Historic District.Some HGIs are a bit hit or miss, but this was a hit.  The rooms came with a mini fridge and microwave, if no minibar.  Everything was very clean, and the staff was great about splitting the charges.  The little pantry store had emergency provisions.  (Yes on wine, no on sewing kit.  But they also sold individual CD-ROMs with cases, instead of a bundle of 100 that I don't need.)Great hotel for a great price! Downtown Savannah, within walking distance of most of Savannah's must-sees. Our room was the Bay Street side, so we were worried we might not be able to sleep well with the traffic, but we had no issues with the noise. Always enjoy staying at Hilton Garden Inns.This was a relatively pleasant stay but I'm also extremely easy to please. I don't complain about a whole lot. The valet, Armonde, was probably the most friendly part of the experience. We did, unfortunately, encounter a rather rude and attitude-filled front desk attendant but she did redeem herself later on when she seemed to be in a better mood. It was also somehwhat awkward that we could clearly hear the TV in the room next to us, that made it kind of difficult to sleep. All in all it was a nice hotel.What a lovely stay! The staff at the Hilton go above and beyond to make your stay comfortable. The facility itself is stunning - with a lovely 2nd floor outdoor pool and hot tub, workout facility, and restaurant. The hotel is located in the heart of the historical district and only blocks away from the riverfront, city market, and Paula Deen's Lady and Son's restaurant. I would recommend this hotel with enthusiasm!    * Liked -- Great customer service, clean and classy facility, great accommodations.    * Disliked -- A bit pricy ($100+), but well worth it.The staff at this hotel is very good and friendly and makes up for some things beyond their control.  This was my first trip to Savannah.  Our room the first night was on the Bay St side of the hotel (front).  At night the noise was no problem, but early in the morning, like 7:00 on your vacation, semis and motor cycles started driving by and can CLEARLY be heard in your room.  I spoke to the general manager at the front desk and he moved us to a different room that was much better.  The breakfast each morning was very good and plentiful again with excellent service.City Market is right behind the hotel and the river shops are just across the street.  Make sure to give yourself extra time with the valet service as it always seemed to be backed up.Overall our stay here was good and enjoyable.Very nice hotel located in the heart of Savannah, very convenient to just about everything.  My husband and I stayed here on our honeymoon and we were very pleased.  The staff at the front desk is very friendly and accommodating.  Our room was very clean and comfortable.  I would definitely stay here again in the future.Excellent location in downtown Savannah. Clean and excellent service.Easily the worst wallpaper I've ever encountered.  The pale green stuff in the hallways looks psychedelic under the fluorescent lights.  The bathrooms have clearly been upgraded with granite counters that look just awful next to the overly patterned cream and coral wallpaper.Clean, affordable, centrally located, it has AC, the staff has been generically friendly (must be their "can do" training), it's good enough.  I'm just wishing room service ran past 11 now that I'm realizing it's 11:04 pm, and not 8:04 pm.  Drat.  (*next night update: tonight I come to find out it actually closes at 10.  Maybe I was still foggy from the cross country flight the day before, but I could've sworn she said 11.  Either way - super disappointing.)  And I may not have a mini bar (boo, I want an overpriced half bottle of crappy red wine), but I can change the firmness of my bed!  It's not a sleep number, but I have a little dial I can mess with and you can believe that I'll be screwing with it for at least 10 minutes before the novelty wears off.I'm really enjoying the episode of South Park my neighbor is watching.  Sounds exciting!  Also, I have no idea how close I am to the kitchen up here on the 5th floor, but the smell of breakfast woke me up.  Mmmmm.*day three update: a phone call requesting a fork was met with, "I'm on my lunch right here, I'll have to see if I can find someone to bring it up."  Suggestion: maybe you guys should keep a set or two of cutlery in the room if you're going to offer microwave meals in the lobby and have microwaves in the room.  Did I ever get that fork?  What do you think?Great location... Stay here to be close to everything Savannah, GA has to offer. Check in was super easy and the staff is very accommodating. Even though there was a large party staying the weekend, they upgraded us to a balcony room. After day one, the upgrades just kept coming... We went to breakfast at Goose Feathers and strolled around Savannah for about 2 hours only to come back to the hotel to find that all of our stuff had been moved to a 2 room suite with a balcony. The service in this place is by far the best I have ever experienced at any hotel. Could not ask for better. You can literally walk to everything in the historic district. The only thing that could be a little less expensive would be the $15 a day to park, being that the historic district is just outside and you can walk to everything, the car is useless unless, though still less expensive than flying here from Orlando. If every we decide to come back to Savannah, we will be staying at the Hilton Garden Inn again.Great location clean comfortable hotel super staff definitely the place to stay in Historic Savannah

review_content: I stay almost exclusively at LaQuinta Inns. This property is middle of the road. I am an Elite Rewards member so I am not sure if the quality of the room was better than others. I am not sure about the price as I used my points to stay here. I have stayed at nicer LQ's for lesser points thiough.The room: It was clean, sheets smelled clean and fresh, the bathroom was clean with no hairs or other signs of uncleanliness. Shower was hot and the sink was clean too. The toilet area was a bit small to sit down in as you have about 6 inches from the door and 6 inches from the tub. Plenty of toilet paper, soaps, shampoos and towels. The lighting in the room was ok. The switch adjacent to the exterior door did not work and bathroom/shower area light was not bright.The TV's settings were a little dark which you could adjust and the volume was limited to 25%. So I really did not enjoy the TV. The room itself was spacious enough for the 3 of us.The parking: The parking is not very plentiful. I had to drive around a lot to find a spot for my GMC Acadia to fit in. Although the spaces are very narrow and even though if you could park square in between the lines, it is difficult to even open your door wide enough for you to get in and out of your car. What this a chore though was that people do not park square in their spaces. Compact cars do not have much of an issue but if your vehicle is any larger than that, good luck on finding enough room for your car. Door dings will be common here.The front desk and breakfast: The front desk was great, friendly and accommodating as always at LaQuinta Inns. Check-in took me 30 seconds. Breakfast was good but the breakfast area is too compact. They need to enlarge it for the amount of rooms at this property. Too many people in too small of a space. Food was fresh and plentiful It was stocked with waffles, bagels, muffins, fruit, grits, cereal, juice, coffee 5 different teas and 4 different types of bread for toasting. The breakfast attendant made sure things were stocked but her attitude was a little negative but at least she did her job.The pool: The pool was warm and clear. The pool attendant was a little rude and gruff. He could have been a little more polite when we were told that the pool was closed.I stay almost exclusively at LaQunita Inns.Wow...Did LaQuinta franchise to a " Ghetto Stay"??The lobby is kinda nasty... The carpets and wallsIn the hallways smelled of things I only envisioned in a 1980's David Lynch movie??? When was the last time the wall were painted ? That wall texture was quite unusual ?? Hmmmm?Best of all it felt like dogs are allowed because theK9 artwork left on our room carpet was a VanGogh unto itself!Pretty sure the Chapel in Rome wasn't painted in dog urine on the carpet? But our compliments to the artist!Finally.... We liked the on location police officer on site to protect and serve .Yuck ... NO A/C either!In the stink o meter it ranks a solid 9.5...We cleaned the roaches out of our ice bucket!The room was filled with doggy smell. My son complained that he couldn't sleep well because of the smell.Other service and facilities, such as breakfast, bed, front staffs and location, are okay, but I will never stay the hotel again.NOT WORTH THE MONEY. At almost $100 a night, this is more of a motel - not hotel. After providing nothing comforting for our stay, we were then kindly woken up at 10A to drilling outside our door for over 45 minutes that we had to call the front desk to beg for them to stop. False advertisement of photos and not worth the money. Spend a little extra, and stay in downtown.This place is amazing! IF you like your bath tub to have black stains in the bottom and rude customer service! For instance our room only came with 3 bath towels and when I called the front desk to ask for more the lovely lady at the front place me in hold to talk to her co worker about her vacation she's going to take to Disney land, after my hold I was told that the lady cleaning the rooms had towels and was "out there somewhere" and to go find her myself. After I lengthy search I found her and asked for four towels, one for myself, two for my children and one for my husband so we can dry off after a swim when I asked for the towels she promptly responded with "why u need fo fo" I was so impressed with her language skills that I had to walk away. When we got to the pool the outside was nasty dirty towels were laying everywhere, trash, cigarette butts and dirty band aids. The FREE continental breakfast was cold and stale and served on filthy counters. The rooms where however decorated nice, and the beds were comfy. But my first impression ruined this hotel by the lousy customer service. None of the help is nice or friendly and they look miserable doing their jobs which makes me wonder if they're doing their job or just half assing it. WILL NEVER STAY AT ANOTHER LA QUINTA AGAINAlways try to stay at LQ when traveling with pups. I think they are a great mid level chain that's not trashy but not super pricey. We have had great service so far. Room was nice and clean. Small free continental breakfast. My only complaint was a little noisy because door is on outside. I could hear other guests and outside but it wasn't too bad. I love that we got package of dog treats at check in :)This place is ghetto, from dirty floors to having to lay a towel in the bathroom tub, because the tub was too dirty to stand barefoot. Room smelled like mold. On the positive side the air conditioner worked well and the staff seemed nice.After a long couple of days traveling to Savannah to see my son stationed at Hunter, I was traveling from the west coast. I got to the LA Quinta midtown, I arrived early and I mean early well before 9am on the day of my arrival - they were still serving breakfast. I held out little hope for an early check in request, to my surprise not only did they check me in early - they made me feel welcome and like it was no trouble at all. The desk clerk went out of her way with a smile on her face and was happy to help me. The room was clean and comfortable. The bed very nice and the recliner in my room found me taking a nap in it within about an hour of getting into my room.All in all this place is a bargain compared to most of the places to stay in Savannah. If you want a 5 star hotel and the price that goes with it then stay downtown on the water and you will get that. But if you at looking to stay some place that is in my opinion a bargain - affordable, clean and safe then this may be your place. All of the staff I encountered were friendly and kind. At the end of my check in, the desk clerk even shook my hand and said "Thank you for your service sir" knowing I was a veteran, that extra touch and moment she took made my day even better and a little brighter. They went above and beyond in my book to make a tired old man after a long couple of days feel welcome and appreciated.00034While like many others have stated, this hotel is old and not as nice as the la quintas that many of us are used to staying in. The rooms were kind of gross, but the bed was still a comfortable la Quinta bed. The carpet was badly stained so I tried not to walk around without my shoes. The were plenty of stains throughout the room that I noticed. With that being said, it was a conveniently located, decently priced 2 nights in savannah that allowed us to bring along our dog. House keeping left us pleasant notes and the front desk clerks were so professional, kind, and productive. So where the rooms lacked, the customer service was superb. I believe the gentleman's name was Louis at the front desk. He was able to get people's needs taken care of in a very quick and efficient manner with a genuine smile on his face. Those lasting impressions really matter with us.The floors are so dirty. Our baby was crawling on the floor & when I picked him up he had black all over his legs. It's nice that we could bring our dog & cat, but it's so dirty!I had recently stayed in another La Quinta while visiting Tampa... with ZERO issues, ZERO complaints, ZERO problems, it was CLEAN, the staff were FRIENDLY and the place looked WELL KEPT.Based on that visit I had no reason to expect anything less; or at a minimum, I had no reason to expect any sort of disaster.Arrival was no issued; easy to find, plenty of parking, walk over to the check-in counter. The check in clerk issued us a room and with bags in hand we walked over to our first floor room. It took all of 10 seconds for us to know we were in for a doozy. Opening the door had this strong mold or mildew smell hit us like a Mack Truck. OMG, what the hell is that stank? We didn't even enter the room.My complaint to the check-in clerk was taken in but he sure didn't seemed surprised in the least and to top it off he offered no apology or explanation; just that he would get us into a better room. The new room was on the second floor. "Walking there" was our next issue. The stairway is outside and the steps are not concrete; they were severely rusted metal stairs. Rusted enough to make us actually concerned of falling through them. At least the room didn't have that scent of death (although it didn't smell all that sanitary either, kinda like a moisture issue in the building). We woke in the morning, checked out with a more apologetic counter person and headed out. We were so turned off by our stay that I immediately got on the phone with the hotel customer service phone number and complained how shocked we were with this location.They issued us a "FREE FUTURE VISIT" voucher, which I was in no rush to use... I ended up giving it to a family member since I was so turned off. I did stay in another La Quinta after this experience and guess what... it turned out to be crappy too (read about it too if you dare).... yelp.com/biz/la-quinta-i...This is the third hotel on my 7 day vacation and the best out of those 3. For the price. It's clean, enough. The bathroom is small and the tub is chipped. Minor mold. But you get what you pay for. The beds are actually comfortable. Pillows could be bigger. The staff is very accommodating. Brought a roll away bed almost immediately upon asking and sent maintenance to fix a drain that was a result of user error. They even called us to check on our room. The breakfast selection was small. Offering little bagels. Muffins and make your own waffles. Would use la Quinta againBooked me in the same room as an extremely sketchy individual. Pulled up with our bags and saw him walk right into our room. Then the checkout lady was much less than pleasant. Overall, dirty, sketchy, disorganized.Totally an example of you get what you pay for. It's great there is a hotel for those traveling with pets, other then that I saw very little perks of this hotel. First off the shower water Temps are awful, it was either super hot or freezing. The AC units never shut off so they run all the time but it's better then hearing it click on and off i guess. The breakfast is nothing to be wowed by, its cereal or waffles and that gets old if you and here an extended period like we were. O and to top it all off some random person was able to open our door while we were getting ready and half dressed. We then had to take everything we didn't want stolen to the car each day. Front desk gave us new keys but who knows if it was a worker for the hotel because we couldn't chase after him. So not very safe for the amount of gentlemen that just hang out in the parking lot most of the day and night. Our room was also not cleaned one day and when we asked for towels because of this we were told to go chase down a worker. Our AC unit was covered in mold. Our room was no cleaned most days and if it was all they did was straighten the sheets and give new towels, they didn't even empty the trash cans.We chose this motel despite some of the poor reviews as a midway stop between Virginia and Florida. We were traveling with our dog and this motel accommodates pets without the non-refundable pet fees other hotels make you pay. Their was no sign of bug infestation in our room. The room was clean and the beds were comfy. No strange odors. The staff that greeted us was friendly and professional. Plenty of hot water for showers. However I will say that I'm 5'6" and the shower head was barely above my head. If you are looking for top notch accommodations or have pet allergies this is not the place for you. It was a typical motel. If you want a microwave and a fridge you need to request a room with them, as not all rooms have them. We were in a hurry to get on the road the next morning so we did not have the breakfast there. It wasn't to far for a nice visit to the riverfront, just follow Abercorn street down town. La Quinta midtown served it purpose for a place to sleep and room for our dog too!Homecoming!!! The hotel was pretty good. It served its purpose. It was a place for me to lay my head. Make sure you don't get room 163. You will hear running water coming from somewhere else during the majority of the night.Someone was smoking pot on the 3rd floor; a/c didn't work; sheets smelled like urine and were wet. The desk clerk was the only worker in the entire hotel, so she couldn't handle all of the issues. Police were NOT called for the pot smokers nor were they asked to leave; sheets weren't changed and a/c wasn't fixed, so after 45 minutes, as the marijuana smell started coming into our rooms, we demanded our money back and left. When we asked for a refund--because we weren't staying in a hotel where people are doing drugs--she wouldn't give it to us and even lied on the phone to her manager about how long we had been there. This was THE WORST hotel experience ever!!! We ended up staying at the Comfort Suites, which was MUCH better. NEVER will I stay at a La Quinta again. EVER!We stayed here a week before moving into our house. The room was clean, and nice. It's in a safe area, convenient to most of SavannahThe employees were not overly friendly, bt not rude either.Our air conditioner, despite saying it was 60 something in the room, never really went below 80. It was hot in the room and we talked to them about it a couple times, but they always said there was no where to move us to.BEDBUGS :( Walk away from this bug-infested hotel. I checked in fair-skinned and checked out rash-covered. I am forced to give them a star, because their bugs have my blood. So the star is for my poor blood. The hotel gets starless :( rating.Just your good basic hotel. Nothing fancy but clean.
review_content_20: Okay hotel, very nice about an early check in but had to pay for two nights. Not that clean but it's okay. Close to most major stores, mall is a few minutes away. Parking can get tricky. Thought they would make the beds in the morning and change the towels but they didn't. Other than those things everything was ok.I have no idea what everyone else is talking about. I got a room here for an excellent rate and the staff was friendly, the room was totally clean and smelled fine, and the beds were comfy. If I was looking for some 5 star qualities of course this place doesn't match up, but for a 2 star hotel, in midtown Savannah for under 60/night... this is bloody perfect.Filthy rooms. I was put in 106, nothing else available for handicapped person traveling with me. I posted photos of room 106. Absolutely awful! Should be 0 stars! Do not stay here, pay $25 more and go to Hampton InnTV was not working properly, phone was broken, smoke detector was ripped out of the wall, front desk was rude. Totally not recommended at all!!The room was filthy! The sheets had obviously not been changed from the previous guests and the towels were dirty! There was black hair in the tub and on the bathroom floor. The room had not been vacuumed and there was a yellow ring in the toilet that was not a stain....it was from lack of basic cleaning! I was almost physically ill. The manager was very nice and came to the room when we called the front desk. She had the room cleaned and the linen changed. She said maids had quit and one was sick but agreed that it was unacceptable. She cut our room rate from $129 to $75 per night....still not worth it. We were looking to leave the place, but were almost late for an appointment and were staying 2 nights. Never again! I booked with La Quinta because I have always liked the cleanliness of their hotels. I contacted the corporate hotel management and they apologized and said that they were currently operating without a manager at that location and were getting ready to renovate the whole place! Then they should close until they are ready for guests! That was an unacceptable response!Not sure why there are anything negative said regarding this hotel. Absolutely for the price you get the best hotel money can buy. I just paid $58/night and got a flat screen 32 inch tv, got to take my dog, fluffy towels, great air conditioner, nice breakfast bar and a huge bed with lovely comfortable pillows and more pillows. It is an ok area. Not skummy at all. Starbucks across the street and a straight shot down Abercorn to the river front. In fact we headed to Atlanta and found another La Quinta and I would give this one a 3. Same deal but carpets aren't as nice.Friendly staff. The rooms are old and could be cleaner. I HATE a/c units that kick on and off all night. They do that here. The tv has a sleep sound enhancer. Use it to cover noise from outside.Hotel is a little older but staff was very friendly and room was clean. Location isn't bad and price can't be beat. Only real complaint was "free high-speed internet" isn't much faster than dial up.Not that nice. Found beer bottles behind the pull out couch. The sleeper sofa was awful, like sleeping with a bar pressing into your back. Motel was not that clean. Don't recommend this place.Stay elsewhereThis review would have been a good solid 2.5 stars, maybe even three. Up until the point I found a live slug in the bed. Let me say that slower for those of you who think you mis read......A LIVE SLUG. To start off the price was right, and thats the only reason I booked it, I had plans to stay at The Holiday Inn Express, but when I went onto Travelocity and saw this for literally $90 less a night, I could not resist. I am normally a fan of La Quinta when going for a low end chain. THis La Quinta is in a decent location, about 4 miles from downtown, and near shopping, and food. The area seems a little shady, but not scary (as always...valubles out of sight). The room was adequate, but had a bit of a mossy smell, and wasn't outright dirty, but wasn't as clean as I would have liked. The free breakfast had yogurt, bagels, waffles and eggs, cereal and juice. Basically, the cleanliness left something to be desired. The real kicker was on checkout noticing something blackon the sheet, getting closer and seeing a little slug gyrating about. At that point we left Would I stay here again.NO way. But is it the worst hotel ever? no.

review_content: We had a five star stay at the beautiful Hamilton Turner Inn.  The room was spacious and comfortable.  The service was fantastic.  We had a gourmet breakfast every morning.  Their yogurt and homemade granola were heavenly.  Ask them for the granola recipe.  It is a must have.  We stayed for three days and had eggs and biscuits, decadent blueberry pancakes, and scrambled eggs and cheese.  In the afternoon they had freshly baked cookies and brownies.  In the evening red and white wine was served in the living room with a selection of cheese and crackers, hot beef empanadas, and a vegetable platter.  When we returned from our dinner on the town a carafe of port was awaiting us in the living room.  Wonderful hospitality and well worth the price.  Most beautiful inn in Savannah.Lovely inn! Delicious breakfast, yummy cookies at night, beautiful room!  Great location!The Hamilton-Turner Inn is a historic inn located on a beautiful quiet square in the heart of Savannah's Historic District.  While we stayed only one night, I watched multiple trolley tours stop in front to mention this place.  For an old grand Southern mansion, it's remarkably well maintained.We stayed in the Juliette Gordon Low room, located on the third floor.  As others have mentioned, if you have heavy luggage or for other reasons don't want to take stairs, this might not be the best room.  They appear to be multiple first floor and basement level rooms as well.  But we found the Juliette Gordon Low room to be clean, cozy, and comfortable.  They have wifi throughout the building and DirectTV in the room.  Checking in on Yelp got us a bottle of Cava which was nothing special but still a much appreciated gesture.Other amenities include a large first floor dining room, where breakfast is served but which we also commandeered at dinner time to finish off our lunch from earlier in the day.  They also have baked goods in the afternoon, a wine and appetizer social in the early evening, and Port at night.  The people who took care of us at Hamilton-Turner Inn were outstanding.  The guy who handled our check-in helped us find street parking around the corner and brought in some of our groceries from the car, before eventually escorting us to the room and bringing leftovers to the basement fridge.  The innkeeper, who we met the next morning at breakfast, was also a very gracious host.My only issue was with the breakfast, and this may be a matter of personal preference.  They have a breakfast entree each morning (which they post the afternoon before) and during our stay, it was a described as a "Southern-style Croque Madame."  While other guests appeared to really enjoy it (one asked if he could lick the plate), I found it to be insanely salty.  It's as if they poured salt on the ham, the eggs, and the Hollandaise sauce before putting it on a biscuit.  I could only eat about a quarter of the dish before giving up.  My g.f. was equally unable to tolerate more than I few bites.  Thankfully they also offer homemade granola, yogurt, and fresh fruit so we sated ourselves on that before leaving.Overall, a great place to stay, quiet and comfortable, easily walkable to all of the major sites in historic Savannah.  High marks for the service, particularly the guys working in the afternoon and evening.  I'd stay there again, but maybe request a lot less salt in the breakfast.Hamilton-Turner Inn is a great B&B in downtown Savannah.  The rooms are perfect B&B rooms, and if you are lucky Mr. Foo the resident kitty cat will stop by.All the rooms are well done, and the setting is perfect for the area.  There is no elevator, so if you need one this is not the place for you (check out the President's Quarters).  If you can afford this B&B this is absolutely the place to stay when you come to Savannah...and you should absolutely come to Savannah.The B&B is quiet.  The inn is historic.  It's the first home in Savannah to have electricity.  Breakfast is served every morning on the first floor, and it's not a menu but something original every morning.  There is no parking, but you don't really need a car in Savannah.There's only two places I would stay in Savannah and this is one of them.Staying at the Hamilton-Turner Inn was SO wonderful!! We stayed in the Noble Jones suite and could not have been happier with our stay. The location is fabulous, close to the water front but nestled on Lafayette Square with tons of options for food, shopping and entertainment nearby. The inn itself is stunningly gorgeous, built in the 1800s and full of character and charm. Wood floors were nice with cushy throw rugs for comfort, huge king size canopy bed and a fancy, clean modern bathroom with a GIGANTIC shower, beautiful claw foot tub and double sinks. The room was clean, bright and honestly so beautiful. (Built in window shutters on 12'+ tall windows - so much character!)The staff is so friendly and go out of their way to make sure you have everything you want/need - you feel like a friend of the family visiting. The included breakfast was great, but there are no options so you get whatever they are serving that day.  The little things were wonderful staying here - delicious cookies with turn down service, next day weather and local activities for the day on a card every evening, tons of towels and free water bottles. We will absolutely stay here again next time we are in Savannah. Highly recommended!!!If you are looking for a 4 star B&B experience, this is it. We stayed on the third floor and had a view of the fountain in Lafayette Square out one window and St. John's out the other. There were chocolates and champagne in the room when we arrived. I went with friends, but this was still a nice touch. It was very quiet and comfortable. Breakfast was nothing short of impressive and the Inn keepers were very attentive. One our second night, we went on a pub crawl so that third morning we went to breakfast in our pjs and the lavish robes they provided. I felt like a riff raff but the staff welcomed us and was quick to offer extra coffee ;) They gave recommendations on what to see and offered to make arrangements for us. The location was perfect and made it convenient to walk all over the city. The Hamilton Turner made our trip to Savannah really special!Such a beautiful house! We were only stopping over for the night but what a treat it was to stay here. Far exceeded our expectations. The staff was so welcoming and knowledgeable. Also the location was perfect and picturesqueBeautiful place and great location but....The A/C didn't work correctly both nights even after I told the person at the desk. There was a puddle of water in the bathroom floor after each shower due to the glass not going down to the tile. The sheets were so worn they had pilled. We could hear every conversation from the Eli Whitney room (we were in the Habersham room)Our room wasn't ready when we checked in. So the  gentleman took my number and said he'd call when it was ready. He never contacted us. During breakfast on Monday the lady serving referred to my wife as "not an egg girl" because she didn't care for her Eggs Benedict runny.
