And she dissed the statement of us going to Tybee Island for the day.Be advised the Habersham room is below ground so there is no view.I almost rated this review 3 stars but I didn't because I don't want to rate it on my lack of liking the place.  The Inn itself deserves more but I personally wouldn't go back.  I'm a bit jaded since visiting Mast Farm Inn and this place was a little too stuffy for my liking.With gold inlay dishes and very prim and proper everything, I just couldn't get comfortable.  I like a more laid back environment where I feel like family.  All that being said, the spaces and the house itself is beyond belief.  It's a great throwback to yesteryear and a true example of what it must have been like to be a wealthy landowner in Savannah GA.Stayed one night at his B&B, but that's all it took to feel the warmth of the owner and guests.  We were in the ground/basement-level room, which is small (~10' x 10'), but it was well organized and decorated.  The bathroom is surprisingly big in comparison to the room and has more of a modern style (perhaps recently renovated).  We also had our own private entry.  They serve cold and hot breakfast in the morning.  The breakfast was average, but the friendly hosts and guests made the experience special.  Strangers actually smiled and said "good morning," shocking this New Yorker. Street parking was plentiful when we were there on Labor Day (Sunday-Monday).  The Inn is centrally located, so you can walk to most attractions.  Although we were in the ground/basement level with brick walls, the Wi-Fi signal was strong.Well done with this B&B.  I'd stay there again.Magnificent!  We stayed 3 nights in the Ogelthorpe suite.  Southern hospitality at it's finest ~ excellent breakfast is included in the price.  Centrally located with easy access to everything.  There is no elevator, so keep that in mind when making your reservation!We stayed in the John Habersham room for 1 night. Do not stay in this room. It smells like feet or a wet dog in area right outside the bathroom.  I have to hold my breath every time I walk by. For the price we pay and being ranked #1 on Tripadvisor, I did not expect this.  So the stars goes down Bc of that.  I do like the private door in and out from the garden/basement area. Great service. Great location. But we are here to sleep. So the room has to worth the $$$ we spent. I may come back but probably choose a different room and hope to not get the same stinky experience.The home is absolutely gorgeous and the area is beautiful. The price is a little expensive, but was worth it in my opinion. Right in the middle of everything, but far enough away to be a bit away from river street. Lots of little things were included: little sweets, wine in the afternoon, a nightcap, etc. The breakfast was awesome- homemade granola, yogurt, great cheese, blueberry French toast, thick cut bacon. Would definitely stay here again.I don't give 5 stars often but this place deserved it. The location is perfect - right in the historic district. The Inn is very pretty, inside and out. The service was really good. Morning breakfasts were good - though not healthy. Afternoon cookies, evening wine and late night Port every day - what's not to like. We stayed in the Oglethorpe room and found it to be quite nice. Highly recommended all the way around.Great B&B! the room was beautiful, the breakfast was excellent, as were all the other refreshments available throughout the day. The staff was exceptional. It was very convenient to have a stop for the free city-wide shuttle service just directly across the street. I would definitely come back. It was a great honeymoon!This place is top notch all the way not only beautiful inside and out but the staff is just as warm and helpful as you could ask for. This is our first time in Savannah and we have loved it we will be back. Oh and the chef made breakfast every morning is 5 star worth itself!! Great place great people worth every penny.Wonderful place to stay in Savannah! It's definitely worth the price, the inn keepers and staff are so wonderful and helpful. This is my first stay here but it's the first of many. This will be the only place I stay in Savannah. You know it's good when the locals say this is their favorite place... during my visit, I had 3 locals (all at various times throughout the trip) say they would pick H-T if they were to stay somewhere! The breakfast, evening wine and the nightly port are a nice way to socialize with the other guests and learn different things to do around town. The food is delicious, just wish I could have tried the french toast that another Yelp-er mentioned, I was only here for 3 days though. I can't say enough good things about this place!My husband and I stayed for three nights over Christmas 2012 in the Isaiah Davenport room. The room was charming and we enjoyed the private entrance.  The Dunlops and their staff are gracious, attentive, and very helpful. We enjoyed the comfortable room, excellent breakfast, pleasant company, and great location. Everyone made us feel welcome. We had a lovely visit!While in Savannah we stayed at the Hamilton Turner Inn.  All the hotels were full and this was the last place available in the area, it was also cheaper than the hotels.  We were there for the inaugural half marathon so we assumed we would not be able to get a place in down, but to our surprise we found this gem.  This place sits right on Lafayette Square and is absolutely gorgeous from the outside.   I have to admit the house did have sort of an odd smell to it, but I had to remind myself that this place is so old that it was the first house to have electricity run through it (History tip one).  Being that it was the first house to be able to turn lights on, Hamilton actually put in floor to ceiling windows so his neighbors could see it had lights on (History tip two). The room was decent, we stayed in the basement area and the bed was comfortable. The trickiest part about the whole stay was the shower.  It was an old fashion shower and there was not a lot of room in there. But oh well.  The owners and staff were super nice and helpful. I thoroughly enjoyed the Port night cap waiting for us when we returned from a hard day of tourism.   Also be sure to make reservations for breakfast the following morning, because it is really worth it. I would definitely stay in this location again!Excellent!! Nice rooms!! Great staff!! Perfect location!! Walking distance to the river front and restaurants
review_content_20: If I could give 0 stars I would. We stayed in the carriage house. Lovely room. We got in around 4:30 and I immediately could hear the people above me moving. This went on for about 10 minutes. We had to walk over to the main house to ask them if they could do something about the noise above, trying to nip in the bud what could be bad at night for us. The mgr. at first said there was nothing she could do. She came over about 20 minutes later and told us she heard nothing and the people weren't even in the room. We proceeded to go out to dinner. Came back at 11 and went to sleep.  At approximately 1:00 am I was woken up by loud walking upstairs. Since there was no phone in our room we walked over to main house. No one on duty but numbers for the owners. We called them. First time he hung up on me. Second time she said I was making the noise. At the same time out toilet chugged so we told her. In the am there was a note saying they were in the carriage house at 3:00 am and heard nothing. By then the upstairs people were sound asleep as opposed to me being wide awake. I proceed to bathroom at 8 am and there's a flood. Go back to main house. Mgr comes over with a check and tells us to leave. He said we caused the flood. He was belligerent. And started throwing our coats from the closet on the bed. I called the police because he was being aggressive and I felt unsafe. And ironically I asked to use another bathroom and he said there was one behind our room door  I opened the door and that one was flooded as well.  So i guess i damaged 2 bathrooms in spite NOT.  After he called me some choice names we got the car loaded. It's a sorry state where you accuse your clients of damaging their own bathroom.My husband and I have stayed at many inns, but we knew we had arrived at a special place when we arrive at the lovely Hamilton-Turner Inn.  The service was impecable, from the moment we arrived until we sadly had to leave!  We both felt the attention to detail, was evident everywhere we looked.  We stayed in a lower level room with an exit to a lovely patio area, so we had the best of both worlds....privacy when we wanted it but only a few steps away from fresh lemonade and cookies or a delish breakfast.  Our only complaint is that it had to end.My husband and I stayed here for three nights in January and had a great stay. Susan, Will, and Abby were immensely helpful in suggesting places to eat and tours to take and made a number of reservations for us. It's clear the staff is as willing to chat with you as much or as little as you want. When we checked in, we were upgraded (free of charge) to a bigger room. It was spacious and the bed was super comfortable with the most indulgent sheets I've ever had the pleasure to sleep in! Before a yummy breakfast each morning (the stuffed French toast was incredible) coffee and newspapers were available in the living room. In the afternoon sweet tea and refreshments were waiting for us when we got back from several hours of strolling the historic district. Prior to dinner each night, hors d'oeuvres and wine were waiting for guests to enjoy.In terms of location, the Inn is on one of the most lovely of all the squares, right next to St. John's Cathedral and across the way from the Andrew Low House - it's an easy walk to River Street and all the action and I'm really happy we stayed here and not along the more well know Forsythe Park which is bounded by busy streets.I've stayed at a number of B&Bs through the years and this one is definitely among my favorites. When (not if) we go back to Savannah, we'd definitely stay here again.I stayed here for two nights in the Juliette Gordon Low room, which was the only room available. It was in a corner on the third floor, nice room, beautiful decor. There is no elevator, and it is nearly 60 stairs up, so make sure if mobility is an issue, ask about room location. Its a great location, walking to everything. Breakfast was nice, as was the tea, evening wine, and night time cookies and port. It was a beautiful place, and I would return.

review_content: This hotel was great!!!! The staff was amazing! From the front desk staff, house keeping, and staff in the dining room. Our rooms were clean, beds comfy, and location was fantastic. Your are only about a 5 minute drive to the historic district and you have a grocery story right across the street in case you want to grab snacks, etc. for your room. My only complaint was the organization of the breakfast. The weekend I was there was the weekend of a children's soccer competition and the food and wine festival. So it was crazy busy. However, they did not keep order as to who arrived first, and they constantly ran out of food. I mean the wait times were ridiculous. There was also one gentleman who was working his butt off, and his co-worker was a complete slacker and stole tips off the table. It was a bit ridiculous. But when you were able to get food cooked by the cook, it was delicious.Parking was a bit hectic as well.Overall, I'd say stay here. Great location, clean rooms, and good onsite food.Would not stay again ... The rooms were nice, had the jacuzzi rooms for myself and spouse plus one for my parents.The breakfast option and frustration over the slow service is why I would never visit again. The service was so slow we left and found somewhere else to eat. This was after orders were placed and the kitchen seed to not care about anyone.I got so frustrated I ended up reaching over the counter and serving myself sausage and bacon, only to get yelled at by the cook. The same cook who was not too pressed to get orders correct or served timely.My suggestion - stay at the Springhill Marriot closer to Downtown, same price for the rooms (had to pay parking though) and the free breakfast is a good selection.We stayed only one night in this hotel, but we have nothing bad to say,we did not expect much but we were surprised, great location nice rooms good cleaning. Good hotel! :) The Staff was really friendly. The room was super big and clean. Recommendedtripadvisor.com/ShowUser...Lodging here is definitely worth the money! My wife and I stayed here on February 14, 2016 after a long weekend in the Smoky Mountains. We chose to stay, to break up a 12 hour drive back to Florida. The property is centrally located in the richly historic, mid size, town of Savannah, Ga. This hotel boasts a clean and sleek atmosphere while also providing relaxed and comfortable amenities in the common areas and your private room. The check-in process was fairly quick (given it was busy) and uneventful. Our room was clean and comfortable and offered a small living area and two queen beds. The bathroom was spacious and the ever-important water pressure was perfect. After a quick de-briefing from a 6 hour drive we both headed down to the hotel lounge. The bartender was a very nice woman who was doing the job of three people! She never complained and was very attentive to our needs. After a few cocktails we ordered a salad and a chicken alfredo dish to share. These plates certainly exceeded our expectations. Our experience with typical sub 4 star hotels in the in house dining department have been less than satisfying. This hotel has a very good made to order restaurant and the food was delicious, served hot, tasted fresh, served on real dinnerware and was reasonably priced. The prices may seem a teeny weeny high but the amount of food you get is worth it. We left the lounge/restaurant very satisfied and a little tipsy. The beds are comfortable and very clean as we slept like babies. The check out process was quick and easy as we did express check out. The neighboring business is under construction and what looked like what could be a problem never was and our experience was never impacted!Originally planned to stay at the Hampton Inn (100 feet away), but I had made the mistake of not reserving a room the day before at that price, and the price had shot up to $180.00 for one night by the time I showed up. --- So I walked 100 feet over to the Hilton Garden Inn and they had rooms avail for closer to 80.00 :-) Standard Hilton Garden inn with the nice lobby, free breakfast(for HHonors Gold members), and updated rooms. For under 100, cannot go wrong! ((I mean you could pay a little bit less for a non-chain discount hotel in Savannah, but then you might be walking into the bathroom and find that 6 or 7 of your small uninvited 'friends' are having a little party in there!)) So yep, do the Hilton Garden Inn. Great Hotel at a Great Price!The hotel was just okay. They do not have a free breakfast option, which is not shocking but they pester you about eating there anyway. My husband and I were placed in a handicap room where we could hear everything the people next to us were saying and doing, which grew extremely tedious. Also, no one told us about the adjustable bed, so I had to snoop around the mattress after coming to the conclusion that no bed should be so firm without some way to fix it. Overall, I'm unimpressed.Super clean. Check-in was a little slow but it was busy and the people in front of me were being super obnoxious.I only stayed one night, as I was going to another hotel in the Historic District the rest of the weekend for a conference, and for $110 I was completely satisfied. Bed was great, awesome water pressure in the shower, and the bar (although pricey) was nice. Didn't eat there, walked across the street to Bonefish.I'd prefer free breakfast but this seems to be getting more and more rare around Savannah.This is a great hotel to get night rest. The staff is very nice and hotel is very clean. We have enjoyed our stay. Our room was spotless. If you want to get away from all the noise of downtown this is the spot to be.We did not like this hotel. The walls are too thin because we could hear the people in the other rooms. Our room was also closest to the ice machine and it made loud noises throughout the night. Sleep for me was not as good as it should have been. The thing we did like is that there is free parking.We just came from the Hilton Garden by the Airport and move here today to be closer to our kids dorm. I got an email to checked in via eCheckin on the internet and it said I can choose my room. This was not a good Idea after I did that. At first the sound of checking in via internet was great and able to choose your room. I logged in and chose my room and I double check to see if I still have the King Bed Suite, I even have screen shots that it says I have King Bed Suite. After I confirmed and check back to my room preference, it gave me just the King Bed room and not the King Bed Suite. Even though all of the rooms suggested from picking your own room showed it was a King Bed Suite. So I quickly called the hotel and spoke to Avis and she changed it back to King Bed Suite. Thank you Avis for getting us back to our reserved room. No more eCheckIn for me, because the rooms you are offered to choose from is not the rooms you reserve during reservation. I'll just do the normal wait in line and check in for me.Now that we are here, the Staff are friendly and attentive to your needs. Wireless is a little bit slower than the one at the airport. We will be here for a few days and lets see how it goes with our stay. I hope we don't have to send a note to the Hilton general manager for issues. I'll update this in a few days and finalize the review.1) First night was good and the room was clean but has a very slight mildew/smoke smell. We left in the morning for breakfast and came back early and the room was clean by 1:30pm. So far so good.Came back from a show, crabbed a small bottle of wine and came to the room. The room still had the very slight mildew/smoke smell. I guess its because its been raining and the hot/moisture in the air is bringing the smell out. Just had to get use to it, even though i can't stand second hand smoke.2) Second night was good also. We left in the morning to get some breakfast and was gone most of the day. The staff was friendly while we were on our way out saying good morning with a smile. Came back to the room late and parking was ok for a Friday night. Everyone must be out still out in the city having fun. The room smelt ok and welcoming. It did not rain today so the room was ok.Well its almost midnight and I guess the people are back in their rooms. The room next door has their TV on so loud I can hear it through the thin walls. The are also talking loud but I cant understand what they are saying. I hope they don't stay up to late making all that noise. I would complain but by the time the staff would notify them, they may go to sleep already. Lets see what happens in a half an hour or so.3) Third night was... (pending till I get back home)Ok for under $100. Stayed during a business trip. Hotel is extremely clean with up to date rooms. Gym has free weights, a weight machine, and several treadmills, bikes, and ellipticals that are quite old. Nice looking bar and restaurant, but did not eat. Quite, with comfortable beds, but internet is very slow. Frustrating when you have work to do. Would have given better ratings if 1. Breakfast was free 2. Internet was faster and 3. Gym updatedWe booked this hotel to stay one night in savannah. It was what you would expect out of a Hilton garden Inn for the most part. The rooms are relatively updated and the lobby is nice. It's not right in historic savannah but it's neat enough to be convenient. We had a room with 2 Queens and a pull out couch. The reason I'm giving it two stars has to do with pull out couch. We pulled it out and it was horrible. Not only could you feel every spring, but you could also see stains on the mattress. We decided to call the front desk and ask for extra blankets to make it more comfortable. We could not get the front desk to answer and had to go down to the lobby to get help. They agreed to bring a roll away bed and extra blankets. That seemed like a reasonable solution until we saw the roll away. We put it down on the floor and it was covered in dark brown stains. It was absolutely disgusting! I posted a picture for you to see. I wouldn't say never to stay here because the actual beds were fine and the room was generally clean, but I would expect a Hilton hotel to replace a roll away with so many stains. I'm a bit disappointed.They were completely booked on a Saturday night so we had to stay down the street. The rate did go down $20 for checking in on a Sunday rather than Saturday so take that into consideration. The staff was nice for the most part but check-in isn't until 4pm and they will make that very clear. The facilities are very clean. Nice look lobby and breakfast area but the meals cost ~$10/person. The parking lot is SUPER small. We had to part about 100 yards away at the Hampton inn one night and the TV's audio didn't match the picture so we couldn't watch Tv. Overall nice hotel but room for improvement.Booo! I don't plan to ever stay here again! I stay around 100 nights a year typically at HGI all around the country. Normally I am thoroughly pleased. Here in Savannah at the HGI midtown it started the same way. Nice lobby, friendly staff, clean elevator and room. Super comfy bed. AC works great, big flat screen tv. That's great because I travel with my ps3. I connected the hdmi cable, powered it all up and......hmm, how do I change the tv to HDMI? You can't, and the front desk wouldn't help. I travel a lot and typically have 5 hours every evening to kill. I play my ps3 or xbox. If I can't do that I will stay elsewhere. I can't think of any reason why a hotel would deny me access to this. They're not losing any money. Nobody is going to watch 5 hours of pay tv every night. I'm upset and disappointed. I wish I could stay here and am pretty sure in the past this wasn't an issue.Looked like a nice upscale place, but on arrival they told me they had overbooked, even tho I had a confirmation number! I had to stay around back at the Hampton which worked out fine with the grandkids.Within it's class, it's a clean hotel that suits my needs, that's why I gave it five stars. You cannot compare it to a resort or a high-end hotel... Poor comparison. I use it for business and always receive friendly service from desk staff and bartender. Rooms are always clean. You can walk across the street for a restaurant or groceries... And Starbucks. There's even a few stores for shopping next-door. This garden inn serves lunch and dinner, although I've never eaten here If you are visiting savannah, stop being cheap and go down town. This hotel is perfect for business travelers, overnight travelers. If you are a tourist, you would want more amenities. This has a decent hotel gym and a hot breakfast. Pool is a typical lame outdoor pool within this class of hotel.In town for business. Stay at Hilton properties a lot (HH-Diamond). Staff is friendly, room was clean, but I was next to the ice machine. Not what I expected for the status. Parking is very limited as are the TV channels.Came here on a business trip paid for the company. Nice and clean operation, very friendly and professional front desk, Ty at the desk when I picked up my electronic key.Good room with comfy room and bed. Only drawback was some hair in the sink. This is not the end of the world, but something that should not happen at a Hilton property.Free wi fi if you are a Hilton member, which I am. But system blocked hbogo.The staff was friendly and genuine, the entire hotel smelled fresh, the atmosphere encompasses everything someone could enjoy. The location is a little distant from downtown, but the price:location ratio is one of the best anyone can find!Problems:*Toilet paper was dispensed from a jury-rigged contraption underneath the sink. It took me a few minutes to find it.*Channel-changer had many sticky buttons, obviously not regularly maintained.*Interior door handle was pivoted 90 degrees, angled downward. Very awkward.*The ice machines on the bottom few floors did not dispense ice our entire weekend.Likes:*Staff was friendly & happy to assist with anything.*Refreshment hutch was unique and well-stocked by housekeeping.*Concierge provide valuable advice on hot-spots & transportation.When we return to Savannah, the Hilton Garden Inn Midtown is a definite choice to stay at!Great so far! Limited parking but nice staff! We went in May, and we had access to their outdoor pool as well as the indoor pool in the hotel behind theirs.
review_content_20: we were hear at new year's. We have small children so had to come back from town early. The bar was closed. Poor show, but forgivable on New Year's Eve. But the next night, the bar closed early too. Good job I'm not an alcoholic. Come on Hilton. Either have a bar or not, but don't slum off early (8:30).Nice hotel, good location. I come to Savannah somewhat regularly and have been making the rounds to different hotels. This location is good, especially if you aren't looking to be downtown. It is within walking distance of a Publix and some other shops/restaurants. We opted for a king bed and whirlpool tub, which were well worth the extra money. The room was clean and nice. The hotel staff was very friendly and even called prior to check in to verify what time we'd be arriving, etc. The hotel was very full while we were there due to Georgia Southern's graduation, and we didn't get a lot of noise or anything. Wi-Fi's free, but our connection on the 5th floors was a bit spotty. There is also a pool, fitness center, business center, and a bar/room service.The parking isn't very good. When the hotel is full, as it was this weekend, there aren't enough spaces and you have to park at the Hampton Inn's garage next door. It's not terribly far, but annoying enough. Also, the elevators were a bit slow. They really need a service elevator, and people need to stop being so darn lazy and taking the elevator down 1 floor!! Talk about "this is why you're fat!"They were not full, but still put me on the second floor next to the ice machine and elevator (HH member, no discount, put in the worst room in the place).  Avoid.  You can do better in Savannah.Well the room was quiet and location is great BUT was there for a swim meet. We leave Early - 5:30am so when I awoke to no running water at 4:45am I was told there had been a leak and the water would b back on at 5:15. Hmmm- 3 people hot muggy Savannah needing to showering in 15min. Well- 5:15- no water. 5:20 a trickle to brush teeth but no shower pressure. I asked to have my bill adjusted- I was offered 2 free breakfast. Hmmmm NO. The staff was nice- the managers were rude acted like I was off base to request an adjusted bill for $200 a night stay. ( yes- I booked late a crazily paid to much!!!) I left with no adjustment  but was emailed by front office manager with a sorry and a here's a lane room discount! I'm tired of discussing it- clearly they win this way. My friends keep asking why I stay at Hilton's- we constantly have issues. Oddly usually involving water! Well guess I will finally move over to Marriott !

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton Historic Savannah
review_content: Great location and excellent staff! Came here on business and was greeted by the Valet staff (valet parking only option here). I handed off the car, they gave me some instructions that I didn't remember and away I went. I was greeted as soon as I walked in the door by the front desk peeps. They were almost as energetic as me!! I got checked right in and they told me that the Manager's Reception was going on there there were free food and drinks... OK!!!I wandered up to my room and dumped my bag and banjo on the bed and high tailed it to the reception. I was greeted with some free beer and food!!  LUCKY!!!!!  They were pouring up some Sweetwater 420 (delish!) and they had some marinated/baked chicken and veggies for food. It was not bad at all! I was surprised.The room was very clean and comfortable. I had a great view of the riverfront. This was not my first stay at a Four Points, so I was accustomed to the amenities. The location is great. You're right at the end of the "strip" where you want to be in Savannah for some night life. Easy to walk to the restaurants and bars and back. I definitely recommend this hotel is you're in the area!!!!A common complaint about the hotel are the billing errors. Keep an eye on your banking account during your stay.We enjoyed the hotel.  The room was clean and the staff were friendly.  We did have the issue where the Hotel charged us almost $2000.00 for our stay from our checking account, but Sheraton made good on the mistake and we got a good discount.I would've given this hotel 4 stars, but sadly the room rates were $350.00 per night where they normally were $100.00 .  This hotel is $100.00 per night max.First impression where is the front door? Found it off to the side and texted hubby where to go having dropped me off and parked on side of hotel.  There is no sign indicating the front door!Probably THE smallest room we have ever had! I think our bedroom at home is larger and that says something! Smelled a bit and couldn't figure out what it was.For the bad:Room sizeSmall drawers and not enough of themShower with no tubNo room at bathroom sink for itemsNo comfy chair to sit at. Computer chair onlyHard to control heat/air. We finally turned both off.Valet only at $18 a day.Positives:Nice size flat screen TV lots of channels and pay per viewFree water !! Decent location within walking distance to things!Great cleaning staff for the rooms.Great staff overall.Overall OK- but if we went again we would probably try somewhere else.I am someone who travels a lot for work. This is the first time I have ever walked out of a hotel. Staff is very rude and we were blown off since we pre-paid through their website. Also was treated badly since we were not with the group that was coming in. Since I pre-paid I lost the money but found a better hotel in town. We will never step foot in this place again. I am someone who doesn't like to give bad review if a review at all but this was just awful. The only thing they were willing to do to help the situation was give me a free breakfast at their breakfast buffet. Look at my next review to find a better hotel in town.Great location to stay. Only one and half blocks to City Market which is great! About 5 blocks to River Street. Hotel staff is friendly and room was clean. We had an incident where they charged our debit card, that was only supposed to be used for incidentals, $1260! Needless to say I was not a happy camper when I opened my bank account to find their error. The 3 night stay was supposed to be $700, so no idea where they came up with that amount. Had to spend half hour at the front desk with them and the bank getting it corrected. If it wasn't for their major mistake, I might have given the hotel 4 stars because of the location and clean room. It also didn't help we stayed the weekend of the marathon when a typical $100 room was jacked up to $350!!! Definitely not a$350/ night hotel. We wanted to get away so we caved, but I do not suggest paying for than $150 for this place.I stayed here for a wedding weekend in Savannah.  The staff is quite pleasant and the lobby of the hotel is clean and renovated with the charming allure of Savannah. However, the actual rooms are dated and definitely need a make over. My particular room had an odor.  The beds had horrible mattresses that were ill-fitted. On a positive side, the room was clean. But I honestly wouldn't stay here again solely because of the poor quality of the room.4 Points rates a 4 star!  (5 in the bargain hotel ratings!). This place is great. First, location is magnificent. On edge of historic district and walking distance to most of the interesting Savannah sights. But it gets better. The hotel is a beauty and the photos posted by the hotel are accurate (if not slightly unflattering to the actual).Valet/bellhop and checkin service friendly and efficient. Beautiful, big lobby befitting a hotel in Savannah (or Manhattan for that matter) Rooms-lots of unexpected extras included in rate which is already very reasonable. Free wi-fi, LG wall mounted LED TV, VIEWS, generous closet and drawer space, clean updated bathrooms, nice, ambient + ample lighting, full length mirror and mirrored coat hanger, free coffee and coffee maker, free bottled H2O and free amenities include travel sized Scope! Bed is nice and firm, better than avg bedding in a tastefully decorated room all around. I'm a hotel snob and have experienced 6 star resorts that cost $1000+/night but I've never seen such nice little extras before in a budget hotel anywhere. Kudos to Four Points Historic Savannah for pulling it off. PS Almost forgot the room service menu with $10 full breakfast!!-REALLY! (the works incl coffee&juice!, choice of meats, potatoes, eggs, toast or pastry/English muffin etc.  (20% tip, $2 serv chg, and tax added after but it's an amazing, unusual find for room service). Rest of menu similarly priced. Compare all this to customary $15-20 wifi, $50 room service bills for similar food,, and other "nickel and dime you to death" features of luxury hotels costing 10x more,! This place is a breath of fresh air!I gave them 5 stars because they do have nice people working here... We had a baby with us and most rooms do not come with a mini fridge. You would have to rent them for $10 a night. They gave it to us free of charge for 2 nights; that just means they truly care about their customers. I completely appreciate it.I booked the hotel through priceline and got a great deal with a nice view of the lake with double beds. The cleaning lady was super friendly and attentive to us. The room was nice and clean. The only peeve I had was the sticky floors, but I had my sandals so I didn't mind. There's a bistro inside the hotel so it's convenient to get something decent to eat if you're stuck with no car. Their towels were super soft by the way. :) We enjoyed our stay.Great location, awesome staff, comfortable rooms. I bought our room on Priceline and was a little hesitant after reading the reviews, but I could not have been happier with our stay.  The front office staff as well as the valet staff was out of this world. So nice and accommodating during every encounter.We were happy to have a room with a mini fridge, and the complimentary water is a nice touch. On the evening of my birthday, after returning from a night on the town, we were surprised with a bottle of champagne, strawberries, and a card from the staff. That really set the tone for an amazing stay. The rooms were nice, the property is clean, but the hospitality is what will bring me back.Reasons it didn't get a higher rating;The parking issue could have been solved if they allowed self park on the vacant lot next door. They said the parking below the hotel was secure and it wasn't.The location, price, rooms and service were more than adequate.The Four Points by Sheraton - Historic Savannah is located on the western edge of the historic district. The area around the hotel to the west is a little seedy, and the hotel/valet parking entrance (which is actually on Bryan Street) isn't clearly marked and is *very* narrow - I almost couldn't fit my Acadia around the bend in the entrance way between the brick pier and the parked cars.Inside the hotel is very nice and is clean. The room, however, is *very* small; the bed and desk take up almost the entire living area. The closet is also small. The hotel does offer complementary bottled water and a decent coffee maker in the rooms, and WiFi service is also free (although since we have our own hot spot we never use the hotel service).You have to use valet parking here ($18/night); there is no place to self-park.It's a short walk to City Market and a slightly longer walk to the River Street shops.Overall, this isn't a bad place to stay. I'd definitely look for a package, though; don't think I'd want to pay the going rate (we got this through Priceline).Great location just one block walk to City Market area and all the restaurants, shops, bars, etc. Stayed here with a Groupons Getaways deal. Would have been disappointed if we had paid full price, as the hotel room definitely wasn't as nice as the photos portrayed. The lobby was very nice, seems they've renovated all of that area and need to do a little to spruce the guest rooms up.Looks can be deceiving! From the outside & lobby, the hotel seems fine. BUT once we got to our room-what a change! Our room smelled like sweaty armpits & was very damp & sub par. We stayed here for a conference & had I been able to make other arrangements, I would've.. The Andaz or Westin is great.. Don't stay here. The pool had green algae, water bugs in the pool & No towels-even after I requested them-no towels!! A little shady around the hotel... Only valet parking. I would NEVER recommend this place! Hey hotel manager, FYI, u need a facelift in the rooms & nobody like a smelly room.Location is about the best thing this hotel has going. I'm beyond disappointed with the overall up keep of this particular Sheraton...did not hold up to the 4 star rating. The lobby is as everyone has stated. When I tell you that I wished I'd been more attentive to other reviews about cleanliness and this horrible smell. To be honest the staff didn't impress me at all, very nonchalant and attentive to the needs of the guests. I had to ask for towels and do you think you can clean the dirty ring from around the bathtub.I have previously stayed at other hotels a little further away from the river that were in better condition with friendlier staff and cheaper.I wished we had more time when we stayed in Savannah.  The hotel was nice and our room was clean.  The hospitality of the staff is phenomenal and they didn't want us to leave.  We got a good deal for one night and it is located close by everything downtown.  We walked to the historic area and most places was less than 15 minutes away.  The only gripe is the valet parking, which is $15 a day.  Don't the hotel make enough money as it is?  Sorry, I had to knock a star off for that.  We recommend staying here to anybody that wants to be close by everything.We stayed here for a couple nights while visiting Savannah. The hotel is in a perfect location. We walked everywhere easily. Across the street is City Market and behind the hotel is River Street.Check in was easy, we arrived around 11am and were able to check right in. The young man offered us suggestions of tours and maps. The room was on the smaller side but manageable for 2 nights. It and the hallways looked recently redone. Housekeeping was friendly and delivered a tidy room. The complimentary bottle of water in the room was nice, though I'd suggest 2 bottles instead of 1. The room were were in could of used a full length mirror since the only other one in the bathroom was short. We chilled by the the pool for an hour each day when no one was around. Towels were easily available outside the entry door. Parking is a $15 valet charge only, you may be able to find cheaper in a lot but in and out will cost you more. Street parking is metered with 2 hour limits until 6pm.The location of this hotel is perfect. It's on the edge of the historic district and you can walk right over to River Street, City Marker, and Brighton Street. The staff was so hospitable - I've never felt more comfortable at a hotel than I did here. Everyone made conversation with us and we felt so welcome - as if though we were truly their guests. The breakfast buffet was delicious and convenient before we headed out for sight seeing. The omelette station was amazing - so fresh and delicious! The concierge made great recommendations for our trip. The staff even heated up our leftovers from restaurants, which we stored inside the small refrigerators in our room. Our view was of the bridge and the river - loved it!The only downside was that the wi-fi was super slow, but I can compromise that for the kind of service that we received.Lovely hotel in Savannah.  Very nice rooms, great location, friendly and professional staff. I look forward to staying here again when I return to Savannah.The hotel looked attractive and beautiful online, so my boyfriend and I booked a room through Kayak.  We wanted something close to the historic area that was in walking distance. When we arrived, we both were surprised that literally right behind the hotel was a lower income neighborhood. We didn't feel safe. There is minimum parking available at the hotel, just street parking that's right near this neighborhood. It's $18 to valet park your car. Total rip off.The lobby is beautiful, but when we got to our hotel room---there is no comparison.  It's completely out of date, has a sour odor that appears to be in the carpet, and the bathroom just looked run down and not all that clean. The room is small and doesn't appear they clean the actual blanket on the beds, just the sheets/pillow cases.  We were on a road trip down the east coast and stayed in many hotels along the way, this hotel takes the cake it just being a big let down.There is no microwave, fridge, or anything complimentary except a free bottle of water in our hotel room.  We couldn't wait to leave the next day!  And yes, the staff is friendly...however we both thought it was a rude a staff member knocked on our door at 9am to see if we were still in the room for cleaning purposes. Check out is at noon and she could check with the front desk to see if the room was vacant. After exploring the historic area of Savannah, there are hotels that are closer to the area and may be $20-30$ more expensive-- it's worth it in our opinion to choose one of these other places.The Four Points by Sheraton Hotel in the historic area Savannah, Georgia, is an absolutely fantastic property. With a great location and a smaller, boutique feel, this hotel is possibly the best in Savannah.What stands out most of all about the Four Points is the staff and their incredible service. Every staff member we encountered, from the property manager to the valet, makes you feel welcome. You get the sense that the staff truly appreciates each guest. I cannot say enough about the staff - outstanding, to say the least!The hotel itself is beautiful inside. This is not a huge walk-a-mile-to-your-room hotel. It has five floors, with an outdoor pool on the second. Our room was very nice and clean. High ceilings, modern amenities a spacious bathroom. Very comfortable. Don't let the outside appearance deceive you! The outside of the building isn't anything special, but is well kept.There is a small restaurant in the Four Points that has a very good breakfast buffet, including cook-to-order omelets. There is also a small, casual bar with a relaxing ambiance. On Wednesday evenings, which was one of the nights we were at the hotel, the hotel staff has a poolside cookout with complimentary beer and wine. The staff, once again, does a great job interacting with guests and making everyone feel welcome. This may be a seasonal promotion, and worth your time if you're there on a Wednesday night. From the hotel, it's an easy walk to River Street, the squares in the historic district and to City Market. Next time you are planning a visit to Savannah, consider staying at the Four Points. Overall, it is a great hotel. I don't have a single negative thing to say about it. I'll certainly return to this property!
review_content_20: The worst customer service ever!!! We booked our room thru reserves and they changed the price at arrival. Told us if we had a problem with that to call the 800 number. This hotel is in the ghetto!! We saw five different people being arrested in two days at the gas station next door. We will NEVER stay here again!!!Would rate it three and a half if I could. It's nice here but nothing impressive as far as the accommodations are concerned. The staff and customer service is pretty great though.We were only here for a night, but I was pleased! We had a very late check-in (2am) so when we got there, the door was locked and it took someone a while to realize we were there. Also, the valet guy was MIA, so my husband was kind of ticked. We had just completed a 16 hour drive from Groton, CT, so he was quite cranky and just wanted to get to bed. The room was nice! The breakfast was amazing!! I think we will be back on our next trip through!This place is near City Market and convenient to River Street if you don't mind walking a few blocks (which apparently some people do). The staff is very friendly and accommodating and overall the rooms were adequate. I did notice the occasional stain on the carpet and upholstery in the lobby, but generally the place is clean and well kept.The price was reasonable ($89 per night from Priceline during the off season) but I regretted it when I found out they charged $15 a night for mandatory valet parking. After tips, I'd spent nearly $60 on parking in an area where there is plenty of parking. I guess you're paying for security but I would have taken my chances.If I had my pick, I'd stay at the Bay Street Holiday Inn Express, which has free continental breakfast, reasonably priced parking next door, and is literally across the street from River Street.Clean, friendly staff. Valet parking $18 per day. Free bottles water. Nice clean, pool. Small fitness room. Beds a little on the firm side. If you don't like very soft pillows, bring your own. Air works amazingly. Flat screen TV, coffee in rooms. Fridge in selected room not all. Large walk in shower.Overall the hotel is nice.  Seems new.  The location is right on Bay Street and MLK, making it within walking distance of everything you probably want to get to.  Our room was really, really small.  I laughed when we opened the door.  I thought the bathroom door was going to lead to some sort of sitting area.  If you don't plan on spending a lot of time in your room, it's tolerable.  They have complementary bottles of water, a rarity in hotels.  Valet parking is mandatory, which is $15/night.  There are better hotels along Bay St, but when you book with Priceline you don't get to choose.I booked my hotel for St. Patrick's Day weekend a year in advance. Upon arrival at 3pm I was told there were no more parking spaces available. My husband had to ride around in bumper to bumper traffic for an hour and a half searching for a parking space. He wound up paying $35 per day to park away from the hotel. We were with several other couples that were also staying in this hotel. after checking in and visiting the other rooms and then getting settled into our room we found our room to be much smaller than the others that paid the same $237 per night that we did.  We did not have a refrigerator in the room or a remote to the tv and had to fill the ice bucket up to keep our drinks cold.   I called to the front desk and told her my issues she said that they normally don't put people in that room but they were completely booked for the night. I was surprised being that we made our reservations a year in advance! I talked to the manager on duty and she said that Graham, the GM would call me back to discuss my issue the next day. After 2 days I never received a call so I contacted him. He informed me that all rooms were the same size which is not true. He acted like he didn't want to help me even though I paid the same price that the group I was with and they had a more luxury room with a refrigerator and  much cleaner. He said that he would look into it and call me back. 2 more days passed and never received a call so I called back and spoke with the front desk manager that said he agreed to refund me $20. I was not happy with the refund amount or the way that I was treated by the GM. The front desk manager was very nice and apologetic. When I questioned about the parking he said that they had more rooms than parking spaces which makes no sense. The hotel is a great location and walking distance to all activities.Very affordable! The lady who checked me in was very pleasant and attentive to my needs. I was allowed to check in early and check out late the next day due to a late afternoon flight. The Maritme museum is next door to the hotel. The riverfront is across the street and the Savannah College Art & Design is walking distance. You might only need a taxi if the weather is bad or you can't crawl home. Plenty of bars in the area. I will stay at this hotel again!I enjoyed my stay at the Four Points. It's in a great location, the rooms are clean and the staff is friendly.  A couple of minor points:1.) The room service cards are inaccurate.  They tell you to dial these extensions, when in fact, you're supposed to dial 0.  I thought my phone was broken. When the tech came up, he saw the card and promised to bring it to the GM's attention.2.) They really need to stop putting syran wrap on some of the hot dishes.  I arrived after a long day and ordered room service that first night because I was too tired to go out and find dinner.  My burger tasted like plastic.  I know that it was intended to help keep the food warm, but there's got to be a better way.Great location but awful cleaning service. They didn't refill our shower shampoo dispenser and we came back to a bed not even being made. I'm not a neat freak but I'd at least think they would notice leaving a dishelved bed.Room was smelling; I think because of the carpet. The blanket was a little old and they should replace it. Hotel is convenient to downtown though.Awesome location.  Blocks away from City Market and River Street--and The Velvet Elvis! Hell-O!The room was clean, the halls were nice, the cleaning staff was friendly.Nine dollar all-you-can-eat breakfast buffet with fresh fruit, Soy Milk, coffee, teas, waffle maker, and a guy who made omelets.  If there was any amenities you needed, or if something wasn't to your liking, talk to the staff.  They were incredibly helpful in every respect.We gave the omelet guy a fat tip for being such a bad-ass.If you're here for any type of special event near downtown Savannah--of even just to stay the night, I totally recommend this hotel.NPWH = Nice People Work HereThat's really all I can say for this place.  Yes, the staff here is friendly, but my stay here this weekend left me underwhelmed.  My room was on the Starwood Preferred level.  Great, except that the bathroom wasn't cleaned before I checked in (providing new towels and wiping down the counter doesn't constitute being clean).  The room was large, it had a large flat screen television, and a very comfortably king sized bed.You can't beat the location as you're only about a block or two from River Street and everything Savannah has to offer.  You can definitely beat the price as there are several other hotels almost next door that are less and seem to offer more (a view of something other than a roof would have been nice).Outskirts is the best description for the location, any further from the historic district & I would have felt cheated. Cons- (If it's a big deal, yes one block west is a section 8). You all but have to use valet $15 & our room had a funny smell. Other than that if you get a great deal this place is worth staying. Pros- Everyone was friendly & helpful. Our room was clean (minus the smell) & well stocked. You are next to the beginning of the riverfront  area & most/all of the resturants & pubs are within walking distance. Got a deal? Stay here.Great location, but I have to give it 2 stars because our room was dirty! Several random stains throughout the room that made me speculate that the rest of the areas that appeared clean weren't that clean either. We were staying in a Starwood Preferred Guest room on the top floor, so if our room looked like this, not sure what the rest would look like... There was an overall musky smell throughout the room floors, although the lobby areas looked/smelled great. On top of that, I saw a HUGE dead bug on my hall... which was still there a couple hours later when I returned to my room.In addition to the cleanliness issues, the valet parking was $15 a night, which I think is a little bit high.LOCATION: On the edge of the historic district very close to attractions such as Riverwalk and Broughton St for shopping. AMENITIES: They have a small pool and gym which were of good quality. On Wed evenings they have a free cookout at the pool with free grilled hot dogs and beer (Sweetwater 420) which was very nice as Wed is when we happened to check in! Free newspapers at each elevator. Free bottle of water each day and complimentary coffee each morning. There is a fridge in each room that is empty and not stocked with overpriced alcohol. Complimentary wireless internet. There is also a computer lab hooked to a printer but we did not use any of that. Not much for upgrades with SPG. We were not able to get the green option in exhange for SPG points as they do not offer that.  ROOMS: Clean and sufficient with flat screen tv's and a comfortable bed. No complaints. We go a room with a view of the bride over the river which was nice although it also did over look the ugly parking lot in the back.PARKING: They will tell you that valet is mandatory in order to charge you $15 per day but if you go down the street there is the Whitaker St Parking deck where you can park for $6 per day with the visitor's parking pass that can be purchased at the Visitor's Center on MLK.  They can't make you park there! Sheesh.PRICES: We paid 4K SPG points for each night so we stayed for free! SERVICE: No problems here. Service was very good. CONCLUSION: Overall nice stay without any problems.  Clean rooms, good service with nice amenities. Not super fancy but of good quality.I am an SPg member, but somehow I am on the second floor in a room with double beds. The jacuzzi was gross with mold and other water mold all over the jets, and the grout between the tiles ranged from black to yellow.  The bed covers looked so old, I was afraid to sleep in the bed. I decided the only safe part are the sheets, but tried not to touch the covers. For a honeymoon, this is not ideal at all and I am upset I used extra points to get a "deluxe room" because I am not sure what is so great about this. I am scared what the regular rooms are like. I stayed at a four points in Chicago and I guess it really set my expectations high.(Most of) the employees were very friendly. The person at the front desk really tried to push us to use the valet garage parking (valet only - $15/day + tip). Even though we found street parking, they still tried to charge us for parking for both nights we stayed, though they rectified the bill quickly when prompted. The rooms are nice, nothing special. The surrounding area isn't really inviting to look at, until you realize you're directly across the street from the edge of the historic district and can walk to a number of cool places, including the river. Overall, unless its price was really a lot lower than the other hotels, I wouldn't stay here again.Great time. Fantastic location. Friendly staff!The staff, especially the valet (Sam) were very attentive and professional.  The room was exactly as pictured, the pool area was very nice, and bottles of water are free from the concession area right  by the front desk.  Our room was a double with an awesome flat screen tv, a mini fridge and its own wall thermostat.  The desk was huge and it had an extra pull out side table.  Awesome.  Although at first we thought the neighborhood was a bit seedy, we soon realized that all of the historic district is dirty-eque (harmless homeless asleep on park benches, etc.).  We could walk to the middle of shopping in the historic district in 15 minutes easily from the hotel.  The fire alarm went off due to a smoking clutch parked in the garage at 10:45 p.m.  My sister and I filed out of our room along with sleepy children and roller-laden ladies.  The staff had us back as soon as the problem was checked out and cleared and were so apologetic.  Plus dinner is served in the hotel dining room from 5-10 and the bar is right across from the restaurant.  Cute place, great price, prime location.  We will be back.  The valet park the cars in underground garages.  No safer place for your car, I promise.  Parking on the street would not have been a good idea in this town.P.S. stay away from Tybee Island.  Dirty water, RUDE people, also as it turns out shark infested.  In 2006 a 7 yr old girl was attacked in 3 feet of water.P.S.s.  If you need extra towels, stop at the door by the pool on 2nd floor and grab some.  They had plenty.
review_content_40: At first the hotel looked very nice. The hotel is in downtown area with hardly any view. The room was just a little larger than a walk in closet. The valet charged $18 per day for what they said was underground parking. I then found my vehicle parked outside on an empty lot that was not secure at all. While staying here my senior citizen father was threatened by a vagrant man because he wouldn't buy something from him. The next morning as the family was headed toward our destinations we had to avoid the cleanup of a stabbing that had recently occurred. I usually stay at the Westin but they were full this time because of an event. They referred me to this location because it was their "sister" hotel. The price for both were the same and this hotel does not come close to the same quality. I would rate the other location as a 5 star. If you stay here good luck. When I brought all this to the attention of the hotel staff they simply said "sorry"Be careful if you book here! I used a deal-finder booking website to get a room for cheaper. I checked in a 7pm and was told that all of their king rooms (which is what I reserved) were already taken. On top of that, the room they gave me was right above the busy street and hadn't been fully cleaned. I called down to the desk, and they promptly sent up a non-English speaking woman who had no clue what she was supposed to do in my room. I had to show her where things needed to be cleaned. The staff was very friendly, and their $10 breakfast buffet was pretty tasty and a decent price for downtown Savannah. Also, it is right on the end of the historic district, so DO NOT take a direct left if walking from the hotel. It turns into a shady area very quickly. Plus, you either have to pay the $15/day valet parking or try to find a spot on the street.This hotel is by itself, across the street from the Doubletree.  I was lost and called for directions.  The hotel staff said it was next to the Doubletree parking lot.  It is NOT.  I drove around in circles a few times before my partner got out of the car and noticed the Sheraton across the street with a small sign that said Four Points.I guess the omelette maker only shows up on weekends.  I never saw him/her.  I did not like the hot items on the breakfast buffet and would not have breakfast here again.  The rooms are relatively clean but mine felt claustrophobic and dark.  There is not much lighting in the room.  There was room to walk around the king sized bed but not much more space that that.  My room had a desk and desk chair but no other chairs.  I asked for a quiet room and they put me next to the pool which was nice and quiet.  You do hear people closing their doors in the hallway.  Boom, boom, boom.  Sometimes it was ridiculous.  The rooms were pretty clean and the beds were comfortable.  I had no trouble sleeping.I got this hotel on Priceline.   I would probably not stay here if I had to pay full price.  There is a Best Western and Quality Inn a block down the street.  I'd probably stay at one of them instead.While I was there, the computers "went down" for several days.  Apparently they couldn't take any credit card charges.  They could book charges to your room.  It seems rather strange that they could go so long without a working computer system.Wifi was free, which was great!Room was clean, but the housekeepers had a tough time keeping up with that.  The beds were very uncomfortable.  The staff made up for all of that.  They were very helpful.  It was a little further away from the downtown than I would have preferred.Stayed here multiple times and I would come back again. Very close to many restaurants including Paula's.Hotel located just blocks from the River Front, but is located on the intersection of two busy roads; I could hear cars revving their engines and taking off from the red light all night long.  While the first floor/entrance is very updated, the rooms are a bit dated, but comfortable.  A bar is in the hotel, but I didn't try it.  Blackout curtains did not black out.  At check in, they said they were a green hotel, but I didn't really get that feeling during my time there.It's a shame because the hotel is in a nice location and the hotel facility itself is probably a solid 3, but I had the worst customer service experience ever at a hotel here and won't step in this hotel again if someone paid me.  First, the maid service would come in very early, like 7am without knocking.  Our room didn't have a "do not disturb" sign, we called the front desk and asked for one, we were told the maids would leave on in our room that day, but they never did.  That was annoying, the people running the valet service were down right rude.  They broke my keys apart, only gave me my car keys back, when I asked where the rest of my keys were, the gentleman shrugged and walked away.  Spent an hour tearing the car apart and the valet closet looking for my remaining house keys.  Found them far underneath the passenger seat.  So annoying.  Because you can't stay here without dealing with the rude valet service.I recently stayed here for a long weekend with a few friends as we worked to plan one of the girl's upcoming weddings. First things first, the location. Not bad. Felt as if it was right on the outskirts of "Historic Savannah," but in walking distance to many of the sights & River Street, etc. Check-in was a bit slow, and the employees all a bit rude - with the exception of the bartender & valet. By the way, valet is the ONLY option - so add about $18 to your bill, each day. Our room was pretty standard, what we expected. Nice blackout curtain & TV. The bathroom was so-so, although they only stocked three of each type of towel & there were four of us - I had to call twice, each day to get enough towels for our group. Aggravating. They also have a free bottle of water on your day of check in. However, when we came in late one evening, totally parched & in need of water, there was NONE to be had. Not at their little "convenience" stand which was the only place to grab a drink/snack in the hotel, except for their overpriced restaurant - which had been closed for hours. There was literally a few packs of crackers, chips & a cookie & the only beverage options were beer, wine & regular Coke. When I asked about a bottled water/water fountain/vending machine I was told that there was nothing in the hotel. Nothing. On my way back up to the room, frustrated, I noticed that the bartender was cleaning up for the evening. I asked her about getting a water & explained where I'd already gone to ask, she went away & came back with four mini bottles of water, at no charge. She was very accommodating & understanding, and we left her a generous tip. So, bottom line, other than the so-so location and friendly bartender, this hotel isn't worth much. The service was quite sad, and there really are no other positive factors worth mentioning. If you're looking for another, fairly inexpensive option, I would try the Holiday Inn Express next time - mainly because of their superb location & consistence of service.Nice location. Helpful front desk, surprisingly. Small room but expected amenities were in place.  Located on the edge of all the "action."We stayed after getting a great deal on a room at the last minute from a deal site.  I was a bit worried after reading some reviews that it was near a sketchy neighborhood, etc. but once we got there we realized that it was in a great location to historic downtown Savannah and River St.  Sure there are hotels that are right on River St. but a 5 minute walk wasn't bad.  All the staff we met there were very warm, friendly, and helpful.  They offered a roll-up bed for us since we just had a king size bed room with 2 adults and 2 kids.  The valet parking does cost but we just parked across the street from the hotel where there is free parking and didnt have an issue.  The pool was great but not the best for smaller kids since its lowest depth is 3 1/2 feet but it was a nice place to cool off at the end of the day.  The room was very clean and well stocked.  The bed was a bit hard but I sort of expect that from hotels.  The only issue I had was the noise because our room faced Bay St. and a lot of trucks go up and down that street at all hours.  One night the trash truck came right below our room at 1am!!!  Also, for two nights in a row the housekeepers vacuumed the hallway at 9pm.  Thankfully it didnt last long but it was annoying.  Lastly, the wi-fi signal is not very strong and kept cutting out.  There is a breakfast available but we instead chose to walk a few blocks to a local cafe & bakery.  We would definitely go back again if we got a similar deal.Great location, attractive enough, nice concierge. The king room was the smallest I've ever seen, the furniture has been miniaturized to make the room look larger.  The bathroom was tiny. The room shakes whenever anyone on the hall closes a door. Our room was NOT cleaned on the only full day of our stay. I called down to notify them when we returned to the room at 5 and when we returned at 11pm it was still as we left it. At that point I just requested new towels. Only two pillows on the bed that weren't decorative. The valets were not what I'm used to when I come to Savannah, very inattentive and immature. Many other reviewers complained that they had to pay $15 per day for hotel parking but other downtown Savannah hotels charge more than that so no biggie. I would only stay here again in an emergency. It's a hotel with a motor lodge mentality or a maybe a motor lodge masquerading as a hotel.

review_content: My husband and I stayed at The Cotton Sail for the first time over Valentines weekend, and we couldn't have been more pleased! We generally visit Savannah/Tybee several times a year, but this was one of our favorite trips. We stayed in a River View Deluxe King with Balcony on the 5th floor, and it was absolutely tops. They've done a wonderful job maintaining the integrity of the historic architecture of the building, while incorporating all of the modern creature comforts we're accustomed to. I saw that there were some negative reviews on rooms on the 5th floor due to noise from Top Deck. I can report that we had no issues with that in our case. However, as we were checking out, it appeared that a couple DID have an issue with the noise on our floor and were requesting a different room. I can report that the hotel staff was nothing but gracious and accommodating and made whatever moves necessary to make sure they were happy and taken care of!The price for valet parking was a bit steep, but for us it was worth it. The hotel is located so centrally in the historic district that there is literally no need for a vehicle during your stay. My husband drives a large truck, so the gentlemen handling it offered to keep it curbside right in front of the hotel, rather than trying to maneuver it into a different parking area and risking damage, which we appreciated. Overall we had a fantastic first stay here, and I'm sure we'll be back!It's midnight and I don't see sleep in my near future at the Cotton Sail Hotel. My husband and I have a room on the 5th floor, which is directly beneath the rooftop bar called Top Deck, which has been playing booming, pounding music for the last couple of hours. I hear party-goers outside and it is just the day after Christmas (well, technically 2 days after, since it's past midnight now).When we arrived, we were pleasantly surprised to see how close to River Street and the general downtown area. You can walk to many places from here and if you park in Whitaker Street Garage, you can avoid the $25 daily valet fee. Our short trip started out well and we were impressed by the beautiful hardwood floors in our room, as well as the clean and modern appointments in our room and those throughout the hotel.But beware, if you are looking to sleep at all at night. I can't speak for the other floors and wish I'd seen the TripAdvisor and Yelp reviews before so that I could have refused a room on the 5th floor. The noise I hear outside can probably be heard from any of the floors, but the dragging of chairs, people dancing/walking in the bar, and the incessant pounding of dance music immediately overhead is enough to drive one over the edge. The beauty of the hotel, its convenient location, and even comfortable bed do not make up for the infuriating noise that impedes slumber. I highly DO NOT recommend this hotel.Stayed her in early November as an anniversary trip. Started out wonderful. Great spot, great room, great location. Then it happened. Roaches in our room. Now that is awful in itself, it's an old historic building so I get it. The probably have paths worn in that their roach ancestors have used. And that's not the reason for my poor review. It's what happened after that did it. So firstly I try to kill them myself (and yes there was more than one) and they both scurry under large furniture. So my wife calls the front desk and it now night so the manager on duty, Duane, speaks with her and after my wife expresses her concern he ask "what would she like me to do, come and kill it" so it's at this point my wife is starting to loose it. I didn't hear his reply myself obviously because my wife had the phone. Anyway they send the house keeper. With a rag. And we ask if she has Raid because they are still alive and we want them dead. She was not prepared for that answer. So she panics. Again cause of live roaches. So she runs off to try to find some Raid. 15 minutes later and no returning housekeeper the wife and I both go to the front desk. Duane is there and my wife expresses my concern again and adds the piece about the house keeper and the rag to clean up. (Oh and to add insult to injury we see the housekeeper who is suppose to be looking for raid leaving for the night as we are walking to the front desk)Duane proceeds to ask again, in my presence this time what he is suppose to do and proceeds to give us instructions on how to kill the roaches. This is where I step in. Having heard it with my own ears. I calmly explain to him I know how to kill roaches. That is not the problem right now. We have 2 roaches that are in a room can't be reached by us. Your house keeper came unprepared for what we needed done. And oh she just walked out. I calmly explained that 1. As much as I was paying for the room for 5 days his response was way beyond unacceptable. And 2. His level of urgency to the situation needed to have the following hierarchy medical emergency, fire in guess room, and a guess expressing a concern particularly since us coming there is helping pay his salary. They discounted our stay. But that more than cemented this bad experience for me. I would never stay here again.I know this took me a while to write this review but I really wanted to write this in a calm state of mind. But this experience was too vivid to forget.Everything was outstanding from the minute we got out of our car until we left!  We had a room with a balcony overlooking the River and it was fabulous.  We had no problems with noise or anything and we were on the same level as the concierge.  The rooms were clean, beds comfy, and loved the glass shower!The Manager was the friendliest guy who explained the entire set up of the hotel, how to get down to the River Walk, up to the Roof top bar and restaurant, and check in was a snap! The Valet attendants were ridiculously sweet and helpful and I truly felt like we were guests at this hotel.  Southern Hospitality to the Max!This was the perfect place to stay in Savannah IMO.  On the River, walking distance to so many places, trolley pick up for tours, and very safe.  Oh, and as we were checking out at 10 AM, someone came in early and guess what? They let them check in early! I had a big sad face when we had to leave but we will be back and we still stay longer next time!Thanks Cotton Sail for the perfect first time experience in Savannah!Absolutely love, love,love the Cotton Sail! The customer service is top shelf and they always take grand care of me, will stay no where else when I come to Savannah.This hotel is very beautiful and modern,  great location also.   We valet parked (hurt with a $25 per night charge to park! Charged at checkout)  but we didn't need the car for the two nights there, we walked every where.  The hotel was clean and modern, the rooms very nice and comfy.   I loved the bathrooms they were decorated cool and the shower was refreshing!   My friend was a pain in the butt and kept calling the front desk to ask questions and request things. ... and they were great!....answered all her questions and sent someone up to give her a guide to the tv (lol told you she a pain) The rooftop bar/lounge also decorated beautiful and cool place to hang out!My Fiance and I decided to take a weekend trip up to Savannah this weekend and as it was the last minute, we decided to stay at a place that we've been at before as we didn't have time to research other establishments and I can honestly say that I'm glad we did. Everything seemed far more efficient than last time--from the valet parking to the service in general.  We arrived early and called to see if we could check-in early and were enthusiastically informed that we could. It took less than five minutes to set up parking with the valet and upon entering the hotel, we had our room key cards in our hands in less than 10 minutes where as it took over 45+ mins on our original stay. We were housed in a deluxe room with a king bed and balcony on the fourth floor and had no issues with footsteps overhead due to the fifth floor separating us from the roof top lobby.  If anyone is to stay at this hotel, stay away from the fifth floor at all costs! I'm still amazed at how quiet it was on the fourth floor compared to the fifth.Room and the view was spectacular, but we were also tricked into the room on the 5th floor under the rooftop bar. So crazy loud.  Such a bummer. Everything else was great. Make sure you don't accept those rooms!!We loved this hotel.  Our room was riverfront, and had two huge floor to ceiling windows and beautiful hardwood floors.  The view at dusk was spectacular, and we opened the windows to hear the saxophone player in the square below.  The beds were very comfortable, and the room was spotless (thank you, Simone).  The hotel has valet parking, and an elevator down to the riverfront.  It's close to all the historic attractions, and many good restaurants.The amenities in the room are very, very basic.  There were small tubes of shampoo, conditioner, body wash, and lotion.  Starbucks coffee in the room, along with a couple of tea bags.  Free Wi-Fi.  That's the extent of it.  No book with info about the hotel, dining, etc.  The shower was cool, but there was nowhere to put soap or hang a washcloth.Other reviews mentioned noise.  We didn't have an issue, but could see how it might be a problem during the busy season.  We loved it here, and would stay again the next time we visit Savannah.Awesome hotel right along the river in the heart of historic Savannah. Very close walking distance to all the sights and restaurants of old town. The rooftop bar is great and offers awesome views of the river. The staff is great though the valet was a bit lb the slow side and there was no bellman to help with bags at check in. The gym was not huge, but had everything you need and was nice and quiet. The room was very comfortable and quiet, even with the gym and elevators across the hall. The cost for parking at $25 a day is a bit steep. The Cotton Sail makes the perfect base for exploring Savannah. Very cool, trendy, modern, but comfortable.Every moment here was wonderful. Each staff member was helpful and hospitable. The location was perfect and the room was breathtaking. The price for a king size bed with a water view and balcony was reasonable. I need to explore the rooftop next time. However, we are already trying to plan our next trip back.I stayed here over the rock n roll marathon weekend and was highly disappointed with the hotel. I had read reviews talking about the noise level, so I specifically asked for a quiet room and they put me on the 4th (lobby level) floor, practically IN the lobby. I heard people all night long hanging out in the lobby, going in and out of the elevator etc and was not able to sleep at all. Certainly not ideal for the night before running a marathon. My room was also cramped and dark and there was no room service or mini frdige. Will not being staying here again.One of my favorite places in Savannah. The conceirge Patti is awesome. We deliver bikes and pick up guests there all the time for rides and trips and from the moment you get there they are taking care of you. Keep up great job guys you have a beautiful hotel and staff .....Savannah On WheelsGoing again for the Thanksgiving weekend. 4th stay since November last year. Love, love, love this place. We always stay in a room with a balcony. Such an amazing location!  The hotel is clean, very clean. And smells great. The only reason I might not recommend this hotel is because I don't want to risk not getting one of our special rooms!  The big cargo ships going by are really a sight to see.Beautiful hotel, great location and a helpful, friendly staff. Rooms are beautiful and modern with hardwood floors and exposed brick. Do yourself a favor and ask for a room with a balcony. The rooftop bar is a separate company from hotel, but it has a great view of the river & bridge, awesome drinks, good food, and friendly staff as well.Exceptional housekeeping staff, polite, friendly, and professional.Knowledgable concierge.Shannon and rest of front office will go out their way to make your vacation everything you want it to be. This was our first trip to Savannah but not our last, and we will definitely be returning to the Cotton Sail.We booked two rooms overlooking the river - one for our kids and one for us - and arrived several hours later than expected, around midnight.  After apologizing for the absence of any signage showing how or where to park in front of the hotel, the desk clerk directed us to a local bar and grill to grab a quick meal.  By the time we got to bed it was well after 2 a.m.  Our room was cramped and poorly designed, with the TV extending from the wall to almost the foot of the bed.The next morning our son was awakened at 11 a.m. sharp when a hotel employee tried to enter his room without knocking.
