Perfect location, wonderful staff!TeeJay at the front desk is one of those rare folks who combine experience and expertise with the right amount of professionalism, all while wielding a considerable amount of influence at the hotel.  He went above and beyond for my family and made our experience an excellent one. (six stars for him)I can honestly and genuinely say I hate this hotel. We stayed here for a friends birthday. She had never been to Savannah and my friend and I have been there well over a dozen times. We typically stay at the Holiday Inn Express and have never had a problem. This hotel had a kitchen in the room so she wanted to stay here.. We knew we weren't going to use it, but it's her birthday. Let's try it out...The staff was RUDE!! It started from the second we checked in (it was just an attitude like she hated her job). Then when asking simple questions about there sketchy parking (I'll get into that later) she literally says, "Don't it say it on the card." Okay.... I will say the cleaning staff was nice. The concierge seemed nice too! Front desk, rude every time we interacted with them... Oh! Except when someone tried to steal our credit card info and we got our car broken into.. They were nice then. I'll get into that.....We got a call in our room at about 4am from the "front desk guy" saying their computers crashed and they needed our credit card number that we payed the room with. Our friend thought this was sketchy, so she went to the front desk and the lady working said "no one here has called your room it's just me." Oh, okay.. So what we figured out is some random called the desk, asked for our room at 4am, she transferred the call and then he played his front desk act. This isn't the front desks fault per say.. But I travel regularly for work and have stayed in Savannah many many times. This is a first!To top it off our Jeep was broken into in the parking lot directly behind the hotel (not the parking structure). We do not leave valuables in it because, it's a Jeep! But after the rudeness, the credit card incident and now the Jeep... Never ever will we stay here or recommend it. Absolutely terrible... I wouldn't stay here even if I only based it on how I felt treated by the staff.. :(I didn't even have to stay at this hotel to understand that I would never go there. I called because I have a dog with me. Margaret at the front desk who apparently is a manager is incredibly rude but doesn't listen to you go elsewhere if you have a pet it's not worth itSuper mean lady at the front desk. We didn't even check in. I called five minutes before and they said they had rooms and then we got there and she said there were no rooms.  BSI was trying to check in and was told to come back in an hour. An hour later I was told to come back in an hour.I checked out today after completing my 4 day trip to Savanna. The hotel is in a great location right as it sits between numerous bars and restaurants located on River and Congress. Had the service not have been horrible at night I would have given it 3 stars. It wasn't one bad employee having a bad day, every night  the service desk was occupied by a miserable woman. I asked for a late night dining suggestion and was told no. Funny how a quick Yelp search showed numerous open restaurants in the area. My worst experience was the lobby after going out for Halloween. The same women was obviously annoyed with people returning to the hotel in the late hours. My friends and I were quietly eating in the lobby when we said hi to a group of friends who walked into the lobby. The employee sighed loudly as she slammed her computer mouse down. Besides this employees poor service the hotel had several other flaws. There was mold in the shower, hair in the bathroom floor and stains on the carpet. I really enjoyed my trip to Savanna but when I return I will not consider staying at this hotel.
review_content_20: I'm giving this place 2 stars just for the location right in the historic district, across from River street, and the free breakfast (even though it was below average.. I just like the idea of free food). For starters, the staff wasn't very friendly or helpful. The beds were uncomfortable, the bathroom was very small, + the internet connection was spotty during the day, and at night it was near impossible to get online. The only thing I did enjoy was the little kitchen with a fridge to store my water bottles.It took me a very long time to get comfortable in the bed, but when I finally started to enjoy my sleep.. THE SMOKE ALARM WENT OFF!! AT 4 O'CLOCK IN THE F***ING MORNING! I COULDN'T BELIEVE IT! I grabbed as much of my stuff as I could and zombie-walked outside of the hotel with all of the other sleepy, annoyed guests. Finally, firemen showed up and turns out some inconsiderate a-hole was just smoking in his room at 4 am when it clearly states non-smoking on every door. Maybe I just got unlucky, but I do not recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in the Historic District. The Brice (although much more expensive) looked way nicer.This Staybridge  Suites location could not be better, sitting on Bay Street and offering up good views of the river side of town. I typically stay at the HIE right down the street, and it always been a great value, and I expected this Staybridge Suites location, being a sister property, to at least equal HIE.Stepping inside around 10pm, I was greeted with a smile and all of the info I needed for my stay, so congrats on being customer service oriented. Also, the lobby area is unique and inviting, as it's a restored older building.The room was acceptable, but it had a few issues that needed attention. For $200 per night, I don't want to see unfinished Sheetrock patches, trash behind furniture (nightstand), and unplugged lamps and alarm clocks when I walk in to unwind. The linens and towels were fine, but some detailed cleaning work needed to be done in the suite; dirt in the corners of the tile, dirty faucet handles, and streaked counters.This is not a bad hotel, as a matter of fact it's a good hotel with a great location, but they need to step up their game with the rooms.Oh yes, the breakfast was perfect by the way; I had loaded oatmeal both mornings!Very nice staff. Excellent location. Nice fitness room. But mediocre rooms. Overall not bad, but probably better places.Friendly staff they all are great people will do anything for you. Breakfast very morning and Tuesday's Wednesday and Thursday they have social night food and beer and wine for the guests if u go to Savannah you need to stay here. Cannot wait to go backYou can't beat the location of this hotel. It is nestled in the heart of the old city, a block from River street and walking distance to shops, parks, restaurants and bars. I will definitely consider staying here next time I return to Savannah.We spent 3 nights here and had a great stay. Our room wasn't large, but was clean, quiet, and had the most comfortable bed. I loved the kitchen it included. I expected a kitchenette, but it was much more complete than that. It had a full refrigerator, microwave, a dishwasher and came with plates and utensils. One of my only complaints was that we had an interior room that looked into a tiny courtyard rather than out into the city. I would request one of the exterior rooms if you would like more natural light. (If you prefer to not be able to tell the time of day while in your room an interior room should suit you just fine).The complimentary breakfast every morning is very complete: eggs, cereal, sausage, coffee, tea, waffle maker, fruit, cake.... really no complaints. Parking was $12 a day at a lot half a block away from the hotel.I love this place. The accomodations are very well priced. The rooms are clean. The staff friendly and best of all the location is a street from the River in the heart of the historic district. They also have private parking for $12 a day.The rooms all have a kitchinette. Some rooms do face the interior and have windows with plantation shutters. It is a very nice look but if you do not wish to fave the hall the staff with change your room if there is availability.They serve a continental breakfast every morning and it very decent. In the afternoons they server wine/beer and salads with other snacks. Savannah is always hopping so a midday snack is great for those who wish to dine later in the evening.They do not have a pool or hot tub but you will be so busy out walking the city that this is not a big loss. :)Great experience! The hotel was spotless, our room was comfortable and clean, and the staff could not have been friendlier. Great location too, in a city that is already very walkable. The hot breakfast every morning was delicious as well!We were directed to stay here as part of a room block for a wedding we were attending. Great room rate, with comfortable beds & pillows.  Nice clean bathroom, cool a/c! I am currently 8 months pregnant and found this bed to be surprisingly comfortable given my state!! Kudos! Our room #219, had a great view of Bay St. My husband is a very sensitive sleeper and only woke once due to the street traffic... Perhaps a higher floor would have helped.Our suite had a fridge, microwave, coffee pot & sink. The layout did not feel cramped at all. Mornings provided a complimentary breakfast bar complete with eggs, bacon, pastries & cereal. Dining was in the cutely decorated lobby area. Pet friendly!I had high hopes for this place based on the reviews and location. Horribly disappointed! TeeJay was friendly and helpful but our room wasn't ready until 5:00 when check in was at 3:00. I could have overlooked that except the night staff were incredibly rude! Maragret/Mack treated guests like they were a bother, never greeted anyone when they walked by and acted like we were a huge burden. We visit Savannah about 2 times a year and have never ever had poor hotel service. This hotel has tons of competition and is doing a good job of losing guests. The beds are old, springs squeak every time you move. Walls are super thin and you can hear every conversation in the halls and doors all slam. This place is also dog friendly, which is fine, except when two dogs bark non-stop at 1am and 3am, echoing throughout the entire building. The rooms are also humid and when the AC kicks on it sounds like you are standing next to a Learjet. The room was clean except some left over soap in the shower. I'm giving two stars based on location alone, that I'm glad it wasn't filthy and that TeeJay allowed us to park in the lot before out reservation began. We will spend our money at the Kimpton (pet friendly) from now on, where guests are appreciated and all of the staff go out of their way to say "hi" and ask if you need anything. Definitely do not recommend StayBridge.Great location for savannah river street. Clean rooms and very comfortable bed !! Stay Here lolWe have had some great experiences with Staybridge Suites, so chose this hotel when planning a 2 night stay. It is a fairly nice place but doesn't measure up to other Staybridge Suites where we have stayed. The breakfast is excellent and rooms are well appointed, clean and comfortable. Most staff make a decent effort to help. But there are certainly issues at this hotel.First, you need to park in the back lot or adjacent parking garage. The garage is creepy at night and although the hotel clerk assured us there was security, we never saw any. There is no way to secure laptops except to tak them with you. There are no in-room safes, as there are at many other Staybridges, and the safes at the front desk do not accommodate laptops. This was disconcerting since the hotel security doesn't seem to be stellar- the back entrance door does not shut so anyone could come in from the alley and go up the back stairway to rooms. But DO NOT STAY HERE IF YOU NEED COMPUTER AND WIRELESS ACCESSProblems occurred although there is supposed to be high speed wireless in the rooms, we had terrible trouble. Our cellphones and computers would access the wireless, but sporadically and then drop the wireless after a few minutes. The front desk said that he was having the wireless router rebooted but that didn't help. There fore, we could not work in our room without using the DSL, which was DREADFULLY slow and only permitted one of the two of us to use the internet at a time.Because we had some important business to conduct via the internet, after breakfast, we went to use the 'business center' which is actually two screens and printers on a counter. Problems abounded-one printer was out of black ink and almost out of colored ink- both screens were set to this one printer and the other printer could not be used as default without effort for every document needing printing and then the printing was not formatted properly on some documents-both printers were almost out of paper and there was no paper available in the area-the software seems to be corrupted or some common features haven't even been downloaded properly - I couldn't open ZIP files, PDF files-One  Desk staff person tried to help but although we were both computer savvy, weird problems kept happening. - the staff person in charge of the computer center came by and tried to help but knew little about computers. When he called the support center, he handed me the cellphone to talk with off-site support! I had already spent an hour trying to get work done. And now I was supposed to stay online while support accessed the computer and walked me through he problems! NOT.I do not think an already inconvenienced hotel guest should be the one sitting on the phone with off site support. This hotel needs to have someone onsite who can manage to keep all computer systems working properly. This is not a guest's responsibility.The noise made by cleaning staff in the hallways in the afternoon is unacceptable. This isn't a bad hotel, but for a Staybridge it was not up to expectationsTime to update review, today is 3-17-2014.  If I stay here again at a later date, will update yet again... tc- - - - - - See below - - - - - -Okay , maybe I could squeak out 1 and 1/2 more stars but the front desk has completely poisoned my attitude.  Only been here for 5 hours and this hotel that wants to be like the other big boy hotels in downtown Savannah can't seem to staff 2 people at the front desk, no matter what time it is.  Judging from what I see much of the staff that should know better seem to be hiding on permanent break somewhere in the bowels of this re-done building in the historic district of old Savannah.  There is NO excuse for not taking care of customers at the front counter in a timely fashion, (unless they all walk in at the same time).  I usually find it hard not to afford 4 stars for a Staybridge anywhere.  This is all about poor management, not the rank and file.  Sorry if your short and your a manager, roll up your sleeves and jump on those customers.  Simple. - - - - - -Other than this major annoyance, yes because it's a rebuild historic building, so the rooms are slightly smaller than most Staybridge hotels, the AC works great, we have all the kitchenette trappings we will ever need, the beds are fine and the internet does actually works though slowly etc.  So if it were not for my rant on a major flaw where the customer meets the business, I probably would have given the full 4 stars.  - - - - - -I have 3 more nights here, great location,  I'll amend this review in a few days.- - - - - -It now seemed that two people can be spotted at the front counter for about 2 days in a row, though off and on.  That was progress.  The chief building support engineer (or Jack of getting all things done, no matter what his job description) seemed to have gone into customer service overdrive by day 3 of our stay.  He was doing everything from meet and greets during all social events along with his usual laundry list of hotel issues.  Kudos to this can-do attitude.   Other issues:  On day 3 in the early afternoon, boom(!), the fire alarms go off in the building, yes they are very loud as they should be, however upon inquiry by several guests other than myself we  simply hear, ' false alarm ' .  Okay, could be dust or heat near a sensor somewhere or some other sequence of events, don't know.  However if nobody knows what the cause of the alarm is then I tend to fall back to that old time honored Help Desk mantra, "Loose Nuts on the Keyboard" .  Or the problem could be between the computer and the keyboard etc.  Still we have no way of knowing. Speaking of keyboards.   As we occasionally passed by the front counter where customers meet the business and we frequently noticed that it could take only one customer to cause some kind of kluge at that work station front counter.  It's always the computer system is down or not working correctly e.g. software issues, slow computers, other front counter issues, issues like I have already mentioned, as in get two people monitoring the front counter even from a back room at all times even if by closed circuit surveillance to partner and assist work flow.    So if the computer system is slow, fix it, or as I might suspect, that there could be a dearth pile of training issues that could be addressed with much improved results in this area.  So the front counter and also for customers a faster internet speed are the only two real issues that affected our stay.  True Savannah was approaching the big St. Pat's day celebration the following weekend and that does have an effect on hotel issues, but anyway, speed up the i-net and front counter, both need a boost.  Why another star,? for at least a 3 star rating.  Well I got to experience the gratis customer laundry service, gotta love that and it's the right price! Also gratis social hour beer and genre munchies on Tue, Wed and Thu's.  Also the staff was pleasurably courteous to us and other customers consistently.  Can't fault them here.Room was nice and clean, loved having a fridge, stove, dishwasher, microwave, and kitchen utensils! It was like I brought my apartment with me! Staff was friendly, prompt and courteous; I appreciate their zeal with which they greeted us (I'm definitely a morning person; perhaps non-morning persons would not enjoy this as much, ha!). Even the food prep staff were enjoyable. Ms. Euris looked at me one night this week and said, "you /are/ coming to have quesadillas tonight, aren't you?" I almost felt like I was at home, or at a boarding house, with a momma looking over my shoulder, making sure I was getting my three square meals. Breakfasts and dinner receptions were solid and pretty good for complementary meals. Breakfast spreads included grits, scrambled and hard boiled eggs, yogurt, cereals, baked goods, waffle makers, fresh fruit, oatmeal and sausage or bacon. Dinner (Tues-Thurs) varied from night to night, but I was refreshingly surprised that they had Red Hare (beer local to ATL) on tap in addition to Bud Light. Cool points to Staybridge Suites. Add all this on top of the EXTREMELY convenient location? Yes, yes, yes, yes. I will definitely be returning.Great hotel in a perfect location.  The staff were amazing and made us feel so welcome.  The breakfast was wonderful and the rooms were very clean and had all the amenities we needed.  I have to give a special shout out to William the manager and Margaret who worked at the front desk.  They went above and beyond with their hospitality!I have to preface this review by saying that I used my Priority Club Points for this stay so I can't really comment on prices as I really didn't look. I'm a big fan of Staybridge. I travel fairly extensively and and stay in them whenever the opportunity presents itself, especially when traveling with my wife. We appreciate the space their suites generally provide, especially when we well be somewhere for more than a couple of days. The lack of this space is my only real problem with this property. This property should never have been branded a Staybridge. That branding brings with it a expectation on the part of customers who have stayed at other Staybridge properties that these rooms simply do not meet. In fact, I considered our first room tiny and cramped. It lacked a workspace other than the kitchenette counter. No normal chairs only stools. and barely enough floorspace to maneuver around in. Our second room (there was a leak in the first on day 2) was slightly better. It lacked a counter but had a desk and significantly more floorspace. These issue are due to the restrictions placed on the build by being in the Historic District, so it is not entirely their fault. But they would have been much better served foregoing the "kitchens," freeing up that space and branding the place a Crowne Plaza. OK, with that said, the place has a fabulous location. Easily within walking distance of much of the Historic District. The beds were quite comfortable and rooms clean and fresh. We had none of the housekeeping or bed type issues encountered by some others who have reviewed it here. But perhaps the most appealing aspect of this property is the staff. I have stayed in well over a thousand hotels all over the world over the years, from 5 Star to motels and the staff at this hotel was, by far, the most pleasant, polite, and accommodating that I have ever encountered. And this goes for the maintenance staff, buffet minders, front desk personnel and managers who were constantly wandering around asking if there was anything they could do to make our stay better. Now that I know what to expect, I would most likely return when in the area again.Yeah, I know. There are a ton of fancy hotels and B&Bs all over Savannah, but for the location and overall value, I was very happy with Staybridge Suites (part of Holiday Inn properties). Pretty much everything is within walking distance of the hotel, including plenty of dining and shopping along Bay and River Streets, as well as the numerous sites in the Historic District. The hotel is bigger than it seems and the room with kitchenette was neat and clean. They also host an evening reception in the large lobby, if you're so inclined. Parking, either directly behind the hotel or in the neighboring parking garage, is only $12/day, a great deal considering nearby metered street parking is very limited from 30 min to two hours. A great find at a great price!Ideally, I would like to give this hotel 4.5 stars!This place is really great!  We came here for Labor Day weekend.  This was my first stay in a Staybridge Suite and I'm definitely coming back to this one. The location can't get any better than this (for the price): right on River Street, maybe only a few blocks away from the center of things.  Everything is within walking distance.  I came to Savannah last year and stayed in a cheaper hotel outside of the historic district, but ended up spending the difference in hotel price on parking fees in the various parking decks.  This was perfect!  The parking right behind the hotel was very convenient and I found the $9 a day very reasonable.We had a room on the first floor with view of the street, which I thought was very neat.The room was very clean, the beds are comfortable, and the shower pressure was excellent (one of my biggest pet peeves in hotels!).The free breakfast was great, considering the long lines I witnessed outside of some of the popular brunch spots.The only minor annoyance to me was the staff setting up the breakfast.  We had to be somewhere very early in the morning and were hoping to get breakfast just 5 minutes before the official opening time at 7:30am (on weekends).  However, the ladies setting up the breakfast were guarding that buffet like their jobs depended on it and even though food was already sitting out, they told us we couldn't get any of it yet.  I also got yelled at when I grabbed a bagel with my hands, because I couldn't find the tongs.  Give me a break!!  I also was disappointed that they ran out of waffle batter on Monday morning.... that was the best part!!!So, maybe next time I'll make my own breakfast, if I have to be somewhere in a hurry... I'll definitely be back again!!!The hotel has a pretty decent sundowner reception (Tues-Thurs) from 5:30-7:30 pm.  Totally awesome deal for budget travelers!!  It changes up per week though.  I had a hot dog, burger and side salad for dinner tonight. Check the Yelp photos for a calendar of food being served.Right off Bay St. Walk across the street and you are at River street and the water front. Old TV didn't have HDMI inputs, at these price, time for upgrades!  They were upgrading some rooms, carts for tools and stuff in the way outside the room all day.  The roof ladder was down for 2 days blocking part of the emergency exit stairwell.  The room was clean, a fridge, stove, dishwasher, microwave, and kitchen utensils! They have a nice complimentary breakfast in the morning, and coffee all day.  Couple of Manager specials 2 evening we were there, food and drinks during Happy Hour. Small parking lot out back, over flow is on top floor of the parking garage a little farther down the block.  Staff was friendly and helpfully.Situated right off River Street, it is hard to beat this location in the historic district. It was our first time in Savannah and the perfect place to stay to be near it all. The room was nice. It had plenty of space for us and included a kitchenette, which I didn't think we'd need but actually came in very handy with leftovers from our delicious Savannah meals. Our view onto the street and park was perfect, complimented by the frequent taps of horse carriages strolling by. The lobby was really nice and huge, with plenty of tables to sit and work or relax with a cup of coffee. The complimentary breakfast was surprisingly good compared to other free hotel breakfasts I've had. The staff wasn't overly enthusiastic, but friendly enough. One of the employees helped select our restaurant the first night and made an excellent choice for us. I'd happily stay here again. It would be a great place for extended stays as there's laundry service, a gym, a business center, and of course the kitchenettes. I heard they have a cocktail hour on some weekdays, but unfortunately we weren't there for that.
review_content_40: Staybridge did an adequate job of re-purposing this historic building. Though smaller than the typical hotel room of the day, our 2 bed suite was clean and comfortable. The beds were quite cozy and the hotel was quiet. The complimentary breakfast was fully stocked and the concierge was very friendly. Access to River St. is just across the street via a good set of stairs. Also, this location is near east end of River st. so you don't have to go far in BOTH directions. Only staying one night we didn't get to take advantage of Straybridges sundowner reception, but I have on extended stays at their other properties and have been impressed. On one two week stay I took advantage of it most nights as an alternative to eating out in a restaurant.Parking sucks - to be expected in a downtown location.Location! Location! Location! Clean, comfortable beds, great service, nice people, free parking, free wifi, free breakfast. In front of river walk, walk distance to many bars, restaurants, shops, etc. What else do you want?My meeting here at this hotel is been handled very unprofessional, would not recommend this facility for any kind of business meeting. My meeting was to start at 8 AM setup is still not complete and it's 930Made a reservation online.  Showed up at the hotel and by 3., they didn't have a place ready for me and my wife.First of all I have to compliment the staff! They were so friendly and nice, and informative about recommending places in the area. I was greeted every time I walked into the lobby, and they remembered me each time-referencing prior conversations. The rooms were nice and clean.They had a nice complimentary breakfast in the morning, and coffee all day.The location is amazing and parking is reasonable compared to other hotels.Nice room and great service.  TIP:  Ask for an outside room, otherwise your window will look into the interior of the building which is both creepy and claustrophobic! Morgan at the front desk was a doll!I found Staybridge Suites, Savannah Historic District, to be mixed. First, the name is inaccurate as what I had was in no way a suite but was one smallish room with a kitchen in the corner, an arrangement I found trashy and reminiscent of a cheap rooming house.  Second, some things are excellent---location is good and breakfast was generous, so this review should not be taken as 100% criticism. STILL, we come to, Third: I was inconvenienced by confusion. One evening my room was accidentally registered to someone else, a man who arrived with a key and opened my door before the desk could realize the mistake and warn me---I had just gotten out of the shower (I am an old lady and was traveling alone). A few hours later I was awakened by a maid entering my room with her key---later she apologized and said "I just got mixed up---I wanted another room".  When I then called downstairs about all the confusion, the girl on the desk refused to give me her name. Later, when I finally got back to sleep, she phoned and woke me (again) to tell me I would get a free night as apology for the confusion.  I never heard any more about that and my bill was not reduced. The next day I got a stern and dismissive call from a manager telling me I was not to worry for my security as Staybridge Suites is secure (after my room had already been breached twice).  When I checked out several days later, I asked the concierge to call a taxi for me for the next morning, but next morning no taxi showed up and he turned out to have called a startup company that Yellow Cab later told me "has only two cars". So my general impression of this hotel is that it hasn't got its act together, and I doubt I would stay there again.Boutique-style rooms with nice little kitchenettes. We stayed on the Bay Street side with a nice picture window view of the downtown activity and pretty little square. Great beds and very clean. Had a problem with our TV and they quickly fixed it. I'd recommend for a downtown Savannah stay. Close to SCAD. Reasonable. Excited about the complimentary hot breakfast. And, our concierge is knowledgeable and helpful.Clean, free breakfast buffet was nice with occasional free dinner like nachos.Nice kitchen with stove top, microwave, frig with supplied popcorn and dish washer.Small gripes: Free wireless connection keeps on cutting out requires numerous "forget SIDD and reconnect".   The TV is a bit blurry (not HD quality) and the TV remote has limited range.The location can't be beat.  The hotel is close to absolutely everything.  We were disappointed to find out that the king suite we reserved was unavailable and we were stuck in a double instead for our trip.  The room itself was nice and clean.  Unfortunately, we were right on Bay Street, so the road and sidewalk noise could be a little annoying at night or in early morning before we were really awake.  The hotel is dog-friendly, which was great for us.  Outside of a crying dog waking us up one morning, you wouldn't have known there were other dogs in the building.  Other than the king/double mixup, our only real complaint were the other guests.  Some people were so horribly rude.  Put breakfast or a sundowner reception in front of some people and they just lose control, I suppose.  The staff was super friendly and the breakfasts were good.  Would definitely consider staying again.This was a very nice hotel and you couldn't ask for a better location. Since we were going to be visiting for a while, we needed a suite-style hotel that provided kitchens. Those types of hotels, at least the affordable ones, are usually way out in the middle of nowhere, but not Staybridge. The rooms were very nice with very adequate kitchens. They have a happy hour in the lobby, which is a beautiful room with huge windows facing Bay St. The breakfast was pretty lame unless you like scrambled eggs and bacon and danishes and all sorts of heart attack inducing foods. The staff was really helpful and parking is included (for a fee) just behind the hotel, which is amazing when you're staying downtown. For the price, it was a really nice place to stay.This is a no frill hotel, however it seems to have more frills then most others. I was able to get wi-fi throughout my stay, there wasn't any trouble with it. It just required me to log in again each time I closed the computer. They also have a business center that you can utilize if you don't have your laptop with you.They also have free breakfast for the guest, and they didn't charge me extra on the 5th person. I particularly liked their guest area with the fireplace. It was very comforting, warm and definitely one of the better ones I have seen in a while.The staff was friendly - particularly the night shift, with the occasional one or two (kitchen) that couldn't bring it to themselves to say excuse me when they were in the way. Fortunately, you don't need to deal with them on a one on one basis. I definitely will consider staying here again on future visits to Savannah.Check in was fast. The front desk staff offered to move her car so a guest could park closer as it was raining. All of the cleaning staff were so cheerful. Good free breakfast. Nice room our view not so good but if you were on the front side of building it would be sweet!  Great hotel for the money in a great location!This was a fantastic choice. We got a great government/military rate and the location was perfect.  It was near everything and safe.  You do have to pay for parking which is to be expected in the downtown area.  The breakfast is great and the evening food and drinks was great also.  I have not met a ore friendly staff in a long time.  Maids greeted us warmly in the hallways, while looking at brochures a couple stopped to give us advice and answer questions, the front desk was courteous and quick, the management was visible and walked around checking on everyone, and the concierge desk was on top of things.  Our room was standard with a little kitchen and desk.  Clean and everything worked well. We did get a handicap accessible room for some reason and the way the shower was set up wasn't great since it got the whole bathroom floor wet, but it wasn't a big deal.  I would definitely recommend this place to others.Very nice hotel and great location. This place is walking distance to all of the major city attractions, is across the street from the waterfront and is also nice and quiet. I highly recommend. Also has more character than the other chain hotel options nearby.I stayed here while in town on a business trip and had a great experience.The staff was helpful and pleasant with everything and the room was perfect. I also enjoyed the location as it was close to the spot where I could catch the ferry to the convention center.Overall a great experience.Loved our corner room two walls of windows facing the street.The rooms were clean and you can`t beat the location.$9 for parking overnight which is the least I have ever paid in a city.I can't speak for other rooms however.This place is all about the location.  Otherwise it is not great.  Very small but telling point, the cleaning staff couldn't be bothered to set the clock in the room.  No tissue.  Interior room with a view of other rooms.  Not again.Nice room, switched me to a window room---there are rooms in the interior that only open to the hallway---yuck!   Nice front room, great fireplace.  Wonderful food setup---breakfast and snacks at night.  Only issue was the free wi-fi.  It would be okay and then cut out.  A real issue.  I see from other posters that this has been an issue before.  I am going to give three stars because of this.This hotel is awesome! You should definitely consider staying here!My parents and I stayed there last fall when I was moving to Savannah to go to SCAD. We went a few days before move in day to get acquainted with the city. We booked the room through the SCAD Travel Department (they can get discounted hotel rates for SCAD students, FYI). It is in a great location, right across the street from River Street, a very fun, semi-touristy place full of eating and shopping. And Downtown Savannah is very small and you can walk anywhere you need to go. There were 4 of us in the room and it was plenty comfortable for us. There were 2 queen (I think) beds and a kitchenette with a full size fridge, microwave, and stove. The staff is as nice as could be and everything is very clean. There is a happy hour for guests with drinks and snacks and breakfast in the morning. All in all, it was just perfect for us and I highly recommend it and would stay here again.
review_content_60: Loved this hotel!!! The staff was unbelievable.  Doesn't get any nicer or friendlier than the people that work there.  We recently stayed there and it was our first time in Savannah.  The location is excellent.  Right across the street is River Street.  But you are within walking distance to everything.  The rooms are clean and spacious.  You've got your own little kitchen, which is good when you've got kids.  The breakfast is pretty good too.  And if your traveling with pets, this is the hotel for you.  They are pet friendly.  I will definitely stay here, if I'm in Savannah again.Checked in to a non smoking room that smelled awful like smoke. Had to leave because they were full.Parking somewhat limited, but cheap. Inner hallway rooms are a bit dark, but spacious. We traveled with two dogs, so I think they reserve some of the lesser locations for pets. The free breakfast was ample and fresh, and the lobby is really comfortable.  And the location cannot be beat. We'd stay there again!Good location but no water view. The only problem was the wireless Internet barely workedWhat a great location for this hotel-right across from River Street.  The staff was always helpful-kindly offering directions, recommendations, and help when they could.  The room was great and we had a nice street view.  The valet parking is really not worth it-$12 per day and they park your car in a garage one block behind the hotel.  It was much more reasonable to park out front on the street and for 50 minute increments (25 cents for 50 minutes).  On days when we left the car parked all day, it cost no more than $3.  Animal friendly-a lot of people had their dogs with them.

review_content: What's not to love about this hotel!! Upon arrival on Friday night, we were greeted by a gentleman who assisted us with our luggage and waited at the front desk and showed us to our room. The staff was very friendly. The hotel is perfectly located in the city, very close to pretty much everything we had planned on doing. Parking for the hotel is a city garage located across the street behind the holiday inn, not a far walk at all. I was very pleased with the hotel and staff I will be staying here again. Oh I forgot to mention the free wine at night between 5-6:30. If you've never been here I highly recommend!Entrance & lobby at street level but is actually the 4th floor.  There is the 5th floor above and 3 floors going down facing the river and ending at the cobblestone street which a popular walk with restaurants along the way.  The original 2 floors we were built in 1812 from ship ballast stones and used for a cotton warehouse.  In 1987, the conversion was made to the hotel.  Room - High ceilings, 4 poster bed, comfortable mattress, carpet old & dingy.  Service was friendly and good.  Every day at 5 pm, there is a wine party on the 2nd floor serving all the white & red wine and sparkling wine you want.  This was a popular spot.  Breakfast is not provided, however, many options w/in walking distance.Love this quaint historic hotel!It is situated on Bay street on the River side and it is just so cute and quaint.  When we checked in they even upgraded my finances parents room! The desk lady was so nice and friendly.  Steven (the bellhop) went above and beyond! He not only helped us secure parking spots, but helped give us tips to avoid parking tickets and helped us with our bags to our room.  Our room was nice and roomy, clean and COLD :) The bed was a little firm but nothing too terrible. The happy hour  from 5-6:30 was a steal with free drinks and small snacks.The only downside was my Fiances parents room was so hot. His mom called a few times about the air and it ended up cooling down some at night but was still warm. It could have been that its an older hotel or it froze, I'm not sure.  Either way I would totally come back here the next time we are in town,Historic Savannah charm with ultimate southern hospitality! My favorite stay was the Waldof Astoria in NY until I stayed here!!! Rooms are more luxurious & romantic...at half the cost!!The hotel lost our paid reservation....management (Janice) & staff cleaned us a suite, comped our parking, gave us a bottle of champagne, & allowed us a 4 pm check out....now THAT is customer service.100 Stars!!!! I will ABSOLUTELY be back!!!!!Charged TWICE FOR MY ROOM, I WILL NEVER COME BACK!!!!!! DO NOT PAY WITH YOUR DEBIT OR CREDIT CARD HERE!!!!!! PAY CASH! We booked online paying for our 1 ROOM upfront though expedia $500. When we arrived THEY asked for our card and charged us another $520+! We called the front desk and THEY said "The charge will drop off". THEN, before we left they charged us another $50 for our upgrade... we called after we checked out and asked why am I paying $1000+ for 1 room for 2 nights?? She said "You paid for your room upfront online, I don't know why he charged you again. You will have to call later when the accountant is here".  Well, apparently these people don't know how to do there job when handling credit/debit cards. I'm so angry. I loved this place too, but I will NEVER come back for that reason.A group of coworkers and I stayed at River Street while visiting Savannah.  Quickly after our arrival - I learned that this one not the usual run of the mill hotel.  It had a very southern (almost New Orleans) feel to it with the balconies, decor, and accommodations.  It is right along the Savannah River, but the side I was on faces E Bay Street (which seemed to be a popular 'touristy' street).  The room appeared to be in working order and was clean.  The bed was a little odd, but I slept fine.WiFi was a little sketchy and unreliable.  Otherwise - no major complaints with the room or amenities.The staff was very friendly.  The location is perfect if visiting Savannah for a weekend or short stint.  Very close to various shops, restaurants, and other sites.  It was a beautiful location, and I would definitely consider booking River Street if ever visiting Savannah for future personal/business trips.Convenient location for this upscale historical hotel near all the major attractions Savannah has to offer! Our room had a nice view on the river. The place was safe, kid-friendly and clean. The valet parking was compulsory.Historic hotel on River St in historic district of Savannah. Great location. We parked the car and left it in the garage during our stay.  We walked every where. The room was very pretty over looking the river.  The hotel has a beautiful 5 story atrium. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay.Beautiful affordable Inn right on River St! Get a room with a balcony if you can. Wood floors and fireplace in the room. Restaurant attached to building so it can be a little noisy. My room was absolutely beautiful and it was so convenient to stroll out at night and go right upstairs to the room. I wish they were pet friendly. Great customer service and great stay overall.Unfortunately our stay at the River Street Inn was not a good one. My wife and I retired early and set air conditioning to less cooler setting after a few hours a strong musty odor woke me up. I ended up setting the thermostat back to 68 degrees to eliminate the odor. I didn't feel like transferring to another room in the middle of the night. The next morning I noticed the towel rack was pulling loose from the wall, the floor by the commode was dirty and I started looking and noticed the flexible pipe behind the commode had what appeared to have black mold on it, the ceiling vent was filthy. Looking down on the floor in the bath I also happen to see a dead juvenile roach. The staff was very friendly and A complimentary wine and cheese at 5 PM was very nice. But the bad far outweighed the good. Would not recommend to anyone.Historic...beautiful...and wonderful location for walking distance to to many squares, restaurants, city market, bars, and everything else this great city has to offer.Great price...so I thought, but you get what you give. I looked all over the website for where to go and procedures, but nothing prepared me for this stay. I had the hardest time finding the place to checkin. Don't trust your GPS or you'll knock your car out of alignment on the cobblestone road. After two phone calls, I finally found the front door. I had to double park to checkin. Took my bags up to the room and came back down to drive to the parking lot, which required a left turn on Bay Street at 5:15PM. Ugh. Parking garage was full. Not kidding. Finally got in. Walked back to RSI to find my room key doesn't work. Still not kidding. Everything was clean. Bed super uncomfortable. Pillows not supportive. Bed spread was very old but clean. Restaurant was ok. Checkout the next morning: coffee yuck. No more hot water for tea. Had to be at work soon, but there wasn't anyone at the desk. Waited. Finally went around the side to see a man sitting at a computer. He muddles up with his dirty shirt and I checkout. Only to find I have to go get my car and COME BACK TO RETURN THE PARKING PASS. BOO. Just say that up front, please. I'll never stay here again.We had a great stay here!  Beautiful rooms and great service by the staff.  I have been to Savannah several times, and this was my first stay here. I will most definitely be back. We had a great view of river street and all of the craziness. The wine social was a great touch in the late afternoon.  Thank you to everybody for making us feel at home!Wow, was my first impression when I walked into this hotel. Absolutely stunning. The staff has been super friendly and helpful. Not to mention it's like stepping into a time warp.  Reminds me of those Christmas movies from the 60s to the 90s. The wooden staircases and bricked wall room are some of my favorite details from this place. The Riverwalk is charming and has so much to see. I will be back for sure.Hotel was cute, historic. Great location, although note you have to park across the street in the parking garage which is an additional $15 per night. View was great, we had a room with a balcony, so that was a plus. With that being said, however, this historic hotel should let go of their "historic" mattresses, because they are terribly hard and uncomfortable! One of the worst nights' sleeps I've ever had in a hotel. There were a lot of things that needed updating. The alarm clock was for the old iPod, and thermostat was outdated. In my opinion, the room needed some updates and also needed some TLC. I liked the place, it was different, but after staying in other historic hotels and bed and breakfasts, to sum it up, save your money, and go somewhere that spends a little extra on the details.Here are the pros:*GREAT location, one of the best in the city.*Respectable service, generally helpful staff but not always a professional staff. I heard staff members cursing & in general would say the staff does not seem happy to work at RSI.*Wonderful, historic building, with charm - even if in need of upkeepHere are the cons:*Mattresses in all the rooms are on their last leg. This is all mattresses in every room. They are all the same. According to management, they are being replaced in 2015*Overall condition of the rooms, whether it be paint, light bulbs, bathroom tile, the condition of the carpets...basically anything that needs general upkeep, is in need of serious TLC if not a complete overhaul. *This is not the fault of the property but caveat emptor: the street noise level is significant & the smells from the restaurant below waft into your room if you are located toward the river side. Neither is pleasant.Generally I would say this is mediocre value for you money. When they complete their renovations, I would venture a guess that the property will be far more alluring. But to be fair to the property, and in the big picture, this property has lots of company in Savannah. Numerous properties are in need of renovations. To avoid this, stay at a newer property, although none of them have the historic charm of RSI. However, I would NOT recommend this property to anyone right now. If you are staying in Savannah for 3 days or more, the best move is vrbo to rent a condo or home. When I read other reviews here, I sometimes wonder how much experience people have with travel & hotels. I believe most experienced, or significantly experienced people, would agree with my assessments. FYI, our room rate was $180 ++ per nightMy husband and I stayed at the river street in for 2 nights.  The location is phenomenal, right in the midst of the happening scene.   Clean rooms and very romantic decor.  The cons are the lack in amenities and slow service.  After 3 phone calls and 1.5 hour wait I finally received an iron and ironing board.  Also no room service or hair dryer.  Certain aspects of rooms need improving for example the closet doors don't fully open due to carpet and some light bulbs didn't work.Unique affordable historic inn close to downtown. Had everything we needed and the staff was very accommodating. We liked being on the street level so we could come in and out without going up and down the stairs. The bed was pretty good but could use an update. Parking is a little out of the way and costs fifteen a day so prepare for an extra charge.Love love love!!!!! Best spot on riverstreet , views wonderful , guy st front desk very nice and knowledgeable but we didn't catch his name , chocolates they give u are delicious :) comfy bed and nice room and almost forgot the best free wine and snacks social hr ! & if your not a wine fan you can get a beer for $2!!I stayed at this hotel on a small one day trip to Savannah with the folks. My husband and I reserved both rooms via Expedia. We were given the option of City view or River view. City view came out to $139 for the night and the river view was $160. Upon arrival we paid for parking $15 until checkout, unlimited in/outs. The parking garage is across the street off Abercrombie St. And really is the city parking garage. We checked in late about 10:30pm. The front desk agent was very nice and accommodating. The halls were nice, wooden floors. You need your room key to use the elevator, this is to keep non guests out because there is an entrance and exit right out to the Bay. This entrance/exit was very convenient, it leads you right to all the cool shops and restaurants/bars. The rooms were neat and clean. Yes the rooms could use a nice update like fresh paint, and wallpaper, but other than that the rooms were fresh. Feel safe ladies there is a hair dryer, nice little coffee machine with flavored brews and half/half, also really nice hair and body soaps! I think they even sell them as gifts if you want a larger version. The bed mattresses were nothing to faun over, and it would have been nice if they were fluffier but I didn't lose sleep over it. All in all it was a great stay without complaints from me and my family and I believe we got what we paid for. I would recommend it to anyone asking.
review_content_20: This was a perfect choice for our quick trip to Savannah! We were close to the action but didn't hear any of the noise once we headed to bed. Our room overlooked the river and was so pretty. One wall was old brick and the furniture was antique. (No worries, the bed was super-comfy!)My only complaints are these:-The woman working the registration desk had ZERO personality and could not have been less welcoming.- No in-room coffee pot is a big miss.Everything was great here! Close to the action of river street and great location to the city squares. Soaps weren't always refreshed and there were no chocolates in our pillows-maid service wasn't the best but nothing terrible. Happy hour was short so we never got to it. The room was nice and big. Pillows are seriously terrible so bring your own.Great location, but has some old building issues. We picked this place since my boyfriend had been here before, so it seemed like a good choice. Original room was great and spacious but I woke up the first morning to a drenched carpet runner because the air conditioning unit has soaked the ceiling above the entry and was slowly dripping onto the carpet.  They moved us, but only after I insisted. The back up room had a broken door (wouldn't close), mold on the ceiling of the bathroom, and was significantly smaller. I don't think I'd come back, other than for some ghosts...I was in town for work and all of the typical chains were sold out due to a conference.  When I looked the River Street Inn up on the interwebs, the pics looked nice, but I was a little anxious about the actual experience.  Those nerves were completely unfounded...I loved this place.  The Inn is right in the middle of all activity and most historic areas of Savannah.  The hotel itself is like walking into the past...but the service is top notch.  I'll definitely be back.The only drawback for some is that several busy bars and restaurants are directly below the hotel.  The hotel takes up the 3 and 4 floors, but bars are on floors 1 and 2.  The noise is noticable but not enough to keep you up at night.River Street Inn provided a fantastic stay.  The service at check-in and check-out were great.  It is a historic hotel next to the river and the common areas were visually interesting.  My stay was in a two room suite on the 4th floor with a city view.  The room was tastefully decorated and paid homage to the history of the building. Everything was first class.Excellent hotel and convenient to restaurants and bars. The building was an old cotton warehouse. Hardwood floors and brick in my room. Staff is very friendly. Definitely stay here again. On a side note, my room was very dry. Too dry. Other than that it was great.Our room was very beautiful and we were able to get the river view. The staff was very nice and the room was very clean and orderly. This place is a great location and put us within walking distance of everywhere we wanted to go. In the evenings between 5-6:30pm they serve you free wine, beer, and food in the lounge area. Very nice touch.Historic hotel, close to everything downtown, which is why we chose it.  The rooms are authentically designed, however, don't include some of the standard amenities that other hotels have i.e. coffee pots, mini-fridge, etc.  The bathrooms are nice but water pressure is non-existent.The rooms are moist and humid.  The pages from my books are damp and wavy from the humidity.  There is a distinct smell of mold.5th floor is the place to be & river view is more private than city view.Don't expect to check in early as the rooms will most likely not be available.  They will allow you to store your bags and check into parking ($30 a day in a parking garage a block from the hotel) prior to checking you into your room.So, great location, so so rooms, pleasant staff.It's really hard to rate the River Street Inn. It's a historic hotel with winding hallways and no two rooms are the same. Some are gorgeous with great views, some are in need of a facelift and kind of smell like mildew. How you feel about the hotel will surely be determined by how much the check in guy likes you.We didn't know anything about the geography of Savannah when we checked in and were happy to get a "3rd floor" city view room. What we walked into was an old basement room facing a cobblestone and brick wall, under an overpass. Not exactly charming and scenic. It looked like it had been renovated in the early 90's, with old drapes and a beige tile bathroom. Not dirty necessarily, just in need of some upgrades. We learned that since there is such a steep incline between River Street and Bay Street, you have to be on the 4th floor of River to be on street level of Bay. Therefore, if you request a city view room, you will only actually get a view of the city from the 5th (top) floor. This is kind of misleading on their website, but whatever.We decided we wanted to stay in the central hotel area... hopefully not facing a wall, and were given a water view room on the 3rd floor which was a huge improvement. Or so we thought. The more we looked around, we realized we hadn't just given up our big bathroom and king size bed, we'd also given up our mini-fridge and coffee maker. Le sigh. When we checked in, we were informed that the elevator was "temporarily" out of order, which isn't a big deal for us but could be for other guests. It looked like the paper signs hadn't exactly been put up recently, and showed no signs of being fixed while we were there. So the elderly and lazy might want to stay away.We had mixed experiences with hotel staff, and it seemed that any extra amenities outside the room were conveniently unavailable during our stay (the roof deck was "under construction"...?).The River Street Inn is a historic hotel that overlooks the water. It's unlikely that you'll see a building like this anywhere else. The room's are clean and comfortable. The only downside is that there's no pool vut it makes up fir modern hotel amenities with the charm of walking over a small bridge to get to. I would not recommend it to anyone with vertigo.Also the free hotel wifi is useless.I am a sucker for historic inns so when I tasked the sig-o with finding us a place to stay in Savannah I was delighted when he found the River Street Inn. It would be a waste to stay in downtown Savannah and not spend the night in one of their historic buildings. The prices were also reasonable and just about everything you could want is within walking distance. Check in was quick and efficient and our room was on the fourth floor which is nice since we didn't have to haul our baggage up or down any stairs.Our room was very clean and quite charming. I love wingback chairs and four poster beds (the sig-o likes more modern themes). We didn't end up getting a room with hardwood floors but this was ok. I love how they have a nice selection of books in the room that not only tell about the history of the inn but about Savannah in general. You can easily spend a few hours reading before you leave your room. Wireless internet is provided in case you want to bring your laptop to plan your days. The bathroom was clean but nothing extravagant (although the jet tub was nice). I was extremely thankful that the air conditioning in this place was superb considering the very hot and sticky Savannah summers.  You can use one of the many city owned parking garages near the inn (parking averages around $8/day).Now for the only knock on my experience here. There was an ice machine located outside our room that was perhaps the loudest ice machine I have ever encountered in my life.  If you can imagine the sound of a bleating goat being unwillingly fed into a wood chipper then you can replicate the misery we heard. The second night of our stay I was woken up three separate times by the monstrosity (who the hell needs ice at 3am anyway?). Management either needs to fix this machine or relocate it away from guest rooms. The machine is so infamous I have included a picture of it in the photos section. This place may have approached a five stars (although I still like the Planter's Inn in Charleston better) had it not been for the ice machine. Still overall a beautiful inn with a charming room and a can't miss if you need a place to stay in Savannah.The only thing lacking here is an in-house food supply. However, there are scads of restaurants from which to choose, all within easy walking distance.  However #2: there is a happy hour at 1700 each day with complimentary wine & snacks.  The hotel has been updated & is clean with extremely friendly staff.  Oh, you also get to watch BIG ships going in & out of the harbor.Overall very nice. Very good location on the river with Huey's right down stairs. We were there for a conference so having the water taxi close was a big plus. Staff was very helpful and generally did all they could to make our stay a good one. Hotel has plenty of character and we loved the antiques in the halls.Two significant negatives (and I hope these are anomalies) were:1. No heat the first two nights. This was January, and it was cold. When we asked for at least another blanket or two, all we could get were extras sheets.2. Not sure how well our bathroom was cleaned after the previous guest. There was human (I presume) hair on the wall.Will stay here again, and recommend if you want a place on the river (just make sure to ask about the heat working ahead of time).Excellent place to stay while in Savannah. Great staff and lovely historic inn. No worries when you stay here. Outstanding packages as well, reward yourself.  Stayed there twice and each time we have had exceptional experiences.Nice cozy hotel. It is conveniently located and the staff is friendly. They have a 5:30 wine and cheese reception. Only complaint is the parking. You are on your own to find a place for your car. No valet service.A National Historic Hotel right in the heart of the historic district of Savannah. The building dates from the early 1800's. The rooms are spacious and clean with comfortable beds. Ours had an enormous fireplace in it. The balcony overlooked River Street with ferries and boats docked along the Savannah River. The night life along River Street was filled with music and folks strolling beside the river. Our room felt like a window onto a constantly changing show.  We couldn't have been more in the heart of things if we'd tried.  Right behind  the hotel is Tubby's Tankhouse, Heuy's and Bernie's Oyster Bar.  We were within  walking distance of seafood restaurants, Irish bars and multiple walking ghost tours in the city.  The rooms were a little pricey, but well worth it for the area. I'm sure we even had our own ghosts sharing our room. How many people have slept in those rooms in the last 200 years?  How many cotton deals were made here?  How many lives were changed?A fan I am, Yay!  Yep, there are several places to stay while in Savannah but in my opinion when you visit you want to be somewhere that has some history and also is located centrally.  You will be hard pressed to find a better suitable hotel than River Street Inn, in that case.  Antique furnishings and moderately large rooms would best describe the accommodations.  The service staff is great and yummy local handmade chocolates will be found bedside every night :)  The front desk staff was very gracious and was quick to upgrade if possible.  Smooth checking in and equally as smooth checking out make me a happy camper.  In terms of location this Inn is located directly over Huey's (see my review) and also in the heart of the very active nightlife on River Street.We checked in around 4:00pm. They encouraged us to attend the wine/snacks at 5:30. So we went in the room, got settled, changed (lookin hot), and had ourselves a loaded glass of champagne. I'm here with my friend and her son. The location is great! Right on River Street, thus the name. The rooms are gorgeously furnished with more antiquish furniture. We have a nice canopy bed. . .  (Better if I were here on a romantic getaway, but even so...) I am definitely coming back with a guy.I gave the place a 4 out of 5 because they could be a little more customer service oriented, two girls and a baby checking into a queen bedroom ... C'mon, at least offer the option of  a double bed room??My husband and I stayed here on our little getaway. I love historic inns because they are so charming. RSI is very quaint and located on River Street with all the local restaurants and bars. It is also facing the Savannah River so def get a room where you can see the river and watch the boats go by. It is located within walking distance to many attractions, restaurants, and shops. Our room was small and the longer we stayed in it, the more I didn't like it. I didn't think it was very clean. There was a ring around the toilet and the sink didn't look clean either. Also, on the sheets there were some stains. I know they were clean, but just to see them grossed me out. We asked for new sheets and they were nice about it. My husband found some lube in the nightstand drawer so we knew what the previous guests before us did. They turn your sheets down for you and give you a special treat from a local candy store. I thought the staff was helpful and answered all our questions about where to go. Overall 2.5 stars rounded up to 3. If we were to come to Savannah again, we wouldn't stay here.Likes- It was clean, had good character and was in a great location. The cleaning staff was friendly whenever we encountered them.Dislikes- Air conditioning was mediocre, had it on full blast the whole time and was barely adequate. The wireless internet only worked sometimes and very very poorly when it did-- I was on the top floor which must have been very far from the router. The bed was super uncomfortable and they only had 3 pillows. The mattress and box spring also had special bedbug covers on them which was a little concerning. The television was supposed to have HBO, but did not. The advertised 8 dollars for parking was a couple blocks away and actually cost twice as much. The ladies at the front desk made it seem as if we were a nuisance while checking in and checking out.So all in all the hotel was okay but had far more wrong with it than good. I spent two nights there then spent a third at the Hampton Inn down the street. My biggest regret during this vacation is not spending the whole time at the Hampton.  Would definitely not visit the River Street Inn again, but others may like that kind of experience.
review_content_40: Came here for a weekend getaway last Spring on my first trip to Savannah and was very pleased! A very charming, historical hotel right on the water in the heart of the city.At check-in I was told that my queen room wasn't available, but the staff were very nice and upgraded me to a King room on the water side, no complaints here! Staff was also very helpful in finding places to go in the city and where to eat. After reading a few of the other reviews, maybe I just lucked out and got the one really helpful front desk person? ;o)My room was clean and the bed was comfortable, the bathroom was a good size as well. I didn't have a balcony, but a good-sized window to look out over the water.As mentioned before, there is a parking garage fairly close to the hotel, I just wound up leaving the car there and walking to everything I wanted to see since the hotel is in such a great spot. I would definitely stay here again on my next trip to Savannah!Catching up on reviews from a trip earlier this year - I've been way behind - and I wanted to share this magical place. I have a soft spot for historic places, having grown up in an old house, and I wanted to share this.We arrived fairly late and tired from a long day of driving but the check in process was quick and painless. The building is arranged in a few stories with a grand central staircase with a somewhat precipitous drop from the upper stories to the basement, but that's part of the charm. Beautiful hardwood floors throughout, and we were lucky enough to get a room looking out on the river. On our arrival, there was someone singing down by the river (not a song, but literally singing next to the river) and a large shipping barge going by. You truly get a sense of being in the middle of a historic shipping thoroughfare that has seen centuries of commerce. It was a magical moment.Don't arrive expecting all the amenities, power outlets, technology, and creature comforts of an upscale hotel in Vegas, for example, and you'll be very pleasantly surprised by the charm of this place. Not to say that there aren't amenities - nice robes, etc. - but you're staying here for the charm, the ambiance, and the history, and a touch of Old Savannah.Planned kind of a last minute trip to Savannah for St. Patricks Day and unbelievably found this Inn RIGHT on River Street available. This is an old historic hotel that still holds all of the charm of history. You almost feel as if you could go to sleep and find yourself awaking in another time! The rooms are large and clean. The refurbishment to bring the establishment to modern standards is excellent. The bed was very comfortable.The location of this establishment in relationship to River Street is one of it's GREATEST assets. Of course when River Street is loud and hopping, so is the room. Especially during St.Patty's Day, if you are not staying at RSI to BE part of the party, you'd likely be frustrated by the noise. We LOVED it and will be visiting again.Great location, friendly staff, lovely room. I have read previously reviews, and believe the staff are listening. Room was clean with great turn down service with local chocolates on your pillow. Staff was friendly and helpful. They do now have valet service at least at check in time. Enjoyed my stay.I was wavering between 3 and 4 stars, but went with three for one reason: the staff. They're atrocious. Rude, short, acting like they have something better to do. Just nothing but attitude all the way. I don't understand how these people got a job working in a customer service industry.Aside from that, this is actually a pretty decent place to stay. The rooms are quiet & clean, furnished with antiques, and quite charming. The location is hard to beat. And the prices are pretty fair for what you get.If they fired everyone who worked here and hired an entire new (professional) team to run this place, it would be a solid 4-star establishment.Great location for a first time trip to Savannah, right on the river with River Street and its odd collection of tchotchke shops, candy shops, restaurants, and dive bars. On the city side it's adjacent to Bull and Abercorn Streets, with all their parks and historic action. The hotel itself also has that Savannah charm, being a converted warehouse (as are pretty much all the buildings on River Street). We had a city view room on the 4th floor (due to the big incline between River and Bay Streets, the 4th floor is actually street level on Bay Street, while the 1st floor is street level on River Street - so any rooms below the 4th floor on the city side will be staring at a brick wall...river side rooms don't have that issue, but some of the 3rd floor rooms may be uncomfortably close to the live music of some of the bars/restaurants on River Street). Our room itself was nice, with plantation shutters, four poster king bed, and more than adequate AC (nice since it was 90+ F and 90%+ relative humidity while we were there). The only knock was our room's proximity to what must be the loudest ice machine in the known world. Otherwise, totally worth the money. A tip, the hotel itself has no parking, but a city of Savannah parking garage is a block away. You can buy two or single day visitor parking passes that are good at the city garages. The two day pass is almost as much as one day in the garage without it, so I'd snag one of passes instead. The single day pass is worth it too, if you're just staying for one night. See the city of Savannah website for more details on those bad boys.They turn your sheets down for you and give you a special treat from a local candy store. I thought the staff was helpful and answered all our questions about where to go. The room was clean and we had an awesome view of the river. I love this place. Will come back here if I am in Savannah!A nice hotel right in the heart of Savannah! It was clean enough and easy walking distance to all of historic Savannah. The parking is a bit tricky for loading and unloading but if you are a little patient you will be fine. The rooms are large enough overlooking the water and overall the experience was A-OK!We booked this hotel on Hotels.com, kind of based on what we read on yelp and kind of just on a whim and based on the sale they were having. All I can say is, if I go back to Savannah, I am staying at this hotel. You simply can't beat this location. The lobby (4th floor) walks right onto Bay Street, and into the historical district, the first floor dumps you right in the middle of River Street and all the night life there. Amazing location, couldn't beat it. We even could see the fireworks on the river (it was Oktoberfest) right from our room. Amazing.The rooms are big but cozy, the bed was incredibly comfortable, and bathroom was clean and had plenty of linens, and the room had bathrobes, both funny and awesome. I found the staff incredibly helpful, both with directions, watching our luggage, accomodating a late check out, restaurant suggestions, and just getting our loads of luggage down to our room.There is a rooftop porch as well, but frankly, the view is blocked by some other buildings and isn't really anything special. It is fenced in, too, so you can't even get to the edge and really see anything. The setting is romantic, but would be great for a friends get away as well. Oh, and they hooked us up with a free River view...awesome for our weekend. If you get to Savannah, this is the hotel.I've visited Savannah several times and almost always stay at this hotel. When I haven't, I've felt regret. It is so charming, has a bed and breakfast feel, and is in a fantastic location. On one side is the river, where all of the night action is and the other side leads you to the historical part of Savannah. The hotel holds a nightly wine and cheese happy hour and the staff is very friendly and accommodating. I'd recommend this for a trip with that special someone or even a girfriend's getaway - perfect for either!We went to Savannah for a day trip and decided to stay the night. After looking online we thought we would try this place. I checked availability and it looked like there were several rooms available. My husband called to book a room and was told they were sold out. I sensed this was wrong and made a reservation online. Fifteen minutes later we arrived to the hotel and we had a 5th floor river view. Maybe they save a few rooms for online booking, but it seemed odd. The room was nice. Nothing special no mini fridge or coffee even. We enjoyed the location, and the free wine in the evening.I picked this hotel based on Yelp reviews - thanks guys! I spent a total of 4 nights here (was supposed to be 3 but my flights got cancelled). The hotel itself is perfectly located - its on the Savannah river, backs up to the river walk area. I really liked the style, it wasn't like a major chain rent-a-box. The first three nights I spent in a room on the street side, 4th floor. It was super quiet and very comfortable. I think I paid around $125 a night. The 4th night I had a room on the river side. That was especially cool as the huge container ships sail down the river in the evening and you can watch them go by. Another bonus - you get two chocolate "gophers" from the Savannah Candy Co. placed on your bed every day. I had to visit the place just to buy more candy. Yum!I stayed here for a wedding. The downside is that they do not do room blocks so we were all spread all over the hotel which was a little stressful when the fire alarm went off in the middle of the night and I was in a wing by myself. The location is great, easy access to River Street and within walking distance from many sites downtown. They don't serve breakfast in the hotel, but there are several places located nearby. The decorations in the room were great and the beds were comfortable although my pillows were very flat. Front desk service was ok, I felt the late night people were more friendly than the daytime people. I'd definitely stay there again though.Stayed here when the boyfriend and I were scoping out places to live before we moved down that summer. Let's just say, this is about as nice as Savannah gets, and we were spoiled. There are fancier hotels (ie: the Mansion) but to be right on River street on the Factor's Walk was amazing. The room was beautiful: gorgeous old wood floors, comfy beds, and the nicest people ever work there!We're back up in Boston 2 years later, but we still plan on visiting... and staying at the River Street Inn. One thing though... make sure you request a room ground floor or above. The folks stayed here during a visit once and the lower level rooms are a little less fabulous. Kind of dark and a little dinghy. Stay on the first floor or above though, and you'll be glad that you didMy husband and I stayed in Savannah 6/17-6/19 for a wedding. After reading several reviews, I made my reservations for the River Street Inn. At first the hotel was difficult to spot from the street, and having never been to Savannah, I was not aware of the parking restrictions (though the hotel staff seemed more than willing to help with that.) The interiors of the hotel were also beautiful and clean. I loved the decor, especially the hard wood floors. Our room on the 5th floor had a lovely view of the city. However, despite the beauty of it, this hotel only gets 3 stars from me. Each time my husband or I had an issue, we had to bring it up three times for it to be addressed. I'll explain. The day before we left Louisville, I called the RSI to inquire about the earliest possible check-in time. I was informed that there was no concrete time, and that I should just call when we were in the vicinity and our room would be ready. On the way to Savannah, around 11:45am, I made another call to the RSI to inform them that we would be arriving within the hour. At this point, I was informed that the earliest time we could check in would be 3:00pm because there was a full house. I ask why that wasn't mentioned yesterday, to which the person on the other end responded, 'I don't know.' We arrive at the RSI just before 1:00, and we speak to a young lady at the desk, who again tells us that they can try to get us in earlier, but guarantees no earlier than 3:00. My husband explains our situation a bit (our situation being that we're headed to a wedding in 5 hours) and suddenly, management finds a room available for us. The 3:00 check in time would've never been a problem if I had been informed of it from the get-go. Secondly, my husband calls down for an ironing board and an iron at 3:30. He asks that it be brought to the room at or before 4:15. At 4:30, still no ironing board. At 5:00, still no ironing board. After his 3rd call, the ironing board was finally brought to the room.Thirdly, after getting caught in an apocalyptic downpour Saturday evening, I called down Sunday morning to see if some of my still-damp garments could be put in a dryer. No one ever came to pick up my clothes, and after the issues with service, I just used the blow-dryer to dry my clothes since I didn't care to have to call someone three times.With that being said, the hotel is very nice and has a great location. Despite the issues with service, I would stay here again. However, the next time I'm in Savannah, I would prefer somewhere that provides parking for their patrons.Really fun hotel to stay at.
