Perfect location. Smack dab in the middle of everything. The rooms, and hotel look very historic. We really enjoyed to complimentary cocktail hour every day for all guests from 500-630. I think more hotels should do that. We will definetly be back.Can't give this a 3 star because I wouldn't go back to this hotel. Giving you the good details first: Very charming and great proximity to everything in the historic part of Savannah. Once we parked our vehicle we never saw it again until the day we left as this is a walking town and that's what we did. Being located on the 5th floor felt very safe since in order to take the elevator to the 5th floor, one has to use the room key to get up there. We were also on the riverside with a great view of the action on the river and down below on River Street, with a balcony which I will comment on below. Bathroom was very clean, roomy, and decorated to perfection with warm colors and plenty of towels, and a shower head that sprayed as you would want from your own at home. Beautiful dark hardwood flooring in the room with a fireplace for decoration. The room was also decorated with antique furniture making it quite homey. The AC was more than substantial, keeping up with the unseasonably warm temps.Price wise, we got a pretty good deal because we purchased the "Just the Two of Us" deal and added a few more nights to it, bringing the price down a bit from the norm for the extra nights.Now for the cons:As said by others previously, employees were nice to a point but yet quite sarcastic in how they spoke to us and too quick in how parking was explained and taking us to our room. Felt quite rushed yet there were no other customers waiting when we were being taken up to the room. With the parking thing, we were told to go left out of the temporary parking, impossible due to the amount of traffic. The parking garage was a couple of blocks away off of 1 way roads taking it double the time to park then it would have had the explanation bee more clear or even written out for us and other customers. We were also not given a card or some sort of pass for parking, allowing a deal for the hotel stay, as we learned later when we were leaving, because when asked about the cost, a card or something was quickly shown to us along with another sarcastic comment not understood. Parking was $11.00 per day, not the $8.00 advertised. It's also prorated on partial days. The cost from parking from Tuesday at 4pm to Saturday at 11am was $48.00, twice as much as we thought.My reservation was for a deluxe King. I don't even think it was a queen but yet a double bed. Very uncomfortable too! When I read about the comfort of the bed before going there I thought it would be great. No better than a cheap hotel. Next time I stay at any hotel, before I go to the room I will make sure it is a King room. It was our 10th Anniversary if that says anything.The room smelled......really bad. It was musty like an old beach house which would have been fine at the beach but not in our location. Even though the bathroom was clean, the floors under the bed and furniture were not so. One morning after coming back and after the maid had cleaned, there was a dirty, dusty, nasty men's sock placed on one of the chairs as if it were ours. The maid didn't know it wasn't but "yuck!" anyway.The balcony was plain scary! Not a problem that it was a French balcony being 3ft by 4ft. It just didn't seem safe! If you go, don't let your kids out on it! You can't see how secure it is from the bottom side but as for the rail connected into the brick by the door, once side was not secure enough to be safe. Looked like it was coming out of the brick. And when I did go out on it, I felt a strange feeling to go back into the room and did.With the package we were also to have a Private horse and carriage ride. The ticket said to take down to the carriage loading at the Hyatt for a ride. When showing the check in person the ticket she said it was for a general public ride and that this usually wasn't done for the hotels. We told her we wanted the private ride but was told the ticket was not for that. Okay, back to the hotel. When I explained the situation, we were told that someone was supposed to tell us to line up the private ride ahead of time because a reservation was needed for the private coach; sarcastically explained to us again like we were the idiots. Okay, how am I supposed to know this on my own? I read the ticket and followed instructions. Once again this was for our anniversary and I wanted the ride on that day. We did luck out in that we were able to get a carriage at 10pm for a night ride which was plenty of time away from our dinner reservation time. So all in all that did work out by why the issues with everything and the sarcastic attitudes? The people here really need to be more welcoming, which would make for a much more pleasant stay.In that, we have already decided that we will try a competing hotel on River Street next time. I would love to stay here again if my reservations were correct, King bed included, and not being talked down to with sarcastic attitudes.A terrific historic hotel right on the river in Savannah. Classic southern hospitality and charming rooms.My girlfriend and I planned a trip celebrating 2 years together and decided on Savannah, where she had gone for college (SCAD). She used to pass by this hotel all the time and always wanted to stay here so we did, 3 days total. The place looks great, it's a historic building beside the old Savannah Cotton Exchange (now a Freemasons hall), very cozy, and in tip top shape. We were on the 5th floor and originally booked a room facing the street cause it was a little cheaper. Once we arrived and saw what the river looked like from the 5th level, I went to the lobby alone and spoke to the check in girl (a real sweetheart) about what it would cost to switch to the river view. She told me what the normal room upgrade costs but before i could fetch for my wallet she said she would upgrade us complimentary, money we instead spent on the fantastic restaurants in the area. I read a couple of reviews here where people were afforded the same complimentary room upgrade and it probably happens when there is plenty of vacancy and they want you to have a memorable stay. Good business tactic. We stayed there a week after New Years so maybe the city had cleared out some. Room was excellent, great view of the river and passing boats, very cozy with appropriate historic/woody/rustic feel, plushy comfortable bed, no problems with wi-fi or heating, and the staff was very friendly. Complimentary chocolate pecan candies from a nearby candy store on our pillows and cotton bath robes. We figured we'd have to tack on $10 extra per day for parking as we'd read before booking but we found an hourly parking spot right in front of the entrance and the check-in lady told us it was free on weekends (we stayed fri-sun) so that was a plus.In all, the place was incredible as was it's staff. For charm and location, it can't be beat.The rooms are nice but the bathrooms are a little out dated. They also have free wine and cheese from 5-630. Make sure you add $10 a night for parking to the cost of the room. The staff is friendly especially the house keepers. They were very nice. It's a very old hotel and you can easily get lost if your not careful but if you follow the emergency exit sign you'll be ok. I recommend staying there once just to say you did but there are nicer hotels on river street.
review_content_60: Old, Beautiful inn. Polite Staff. Fantastic restaurants all around.my wife & I go to Savanah several times a year, this is the first time we stayed at the River Street Inn...it was the best stay we ever had. The Staff was VERY NICE.. The hotel was beautiful. the location was awesome. we do not have a single complaint about this place. River Street Inn is now our new place to stay when we visit Savanah. The view from our room was amazing. We got a room with a view of River St and the river..we just loved loved loved everything about our stay..A++++++This place was A-MA-ZING.  The guy checking us in was one of the nicest people ever.  He asked if we were there for any special occasion, and we mentioned we were on our honeymoon- so he upgraded us to a riverview queen suite on the top floor.  The room was AWESOME, it had recently been redone, the colors were gorgeous, the bed was awesome, the bathroom was fancy.  Did I mention the top floor can only be reached with certain room-keys in the fancy gold elevator? Niiiice.  The room also had a balcony overlooking the river. Gorgeous.The turndown service with the chocolates was so cute- and I love free chocolate :D And they wrote a little weather forecast on there too- nice!There is also a "guest reception" every afternoon, with free drinks and hors d'oeuvres in the downstairs bar area.  It included cheese, crackers, fruit, veggies, shrimp and chicken when we were there.  In that same area, they have a menu from every single area restaurant laid out so you can look around and plan dinner. Very cool!This is one of the best hotel experiences I've ever had- next time we're in Savannah, I know where we're staying!A fun place to stay while visiting the city.  Rooms are nice and clean with a great view of the river.  You definitely pay for the atmosphere so weigh the experience versus staying at one of the less expensive hotels across the street.Love RSI. It's our second time and staff is just as nice as the hotel.  Get a river view room. Worth the money.Every things was great,location,location,location. The young desk receptionist could had been more helpfull. But I guess this is the new generation. Yes I would go back if I could.Almost a 5 star, but not quite.  We had a river side room with a balcony - it was plenty big with a great view.  The girl behind the desk said to park in the parking garage by the Holiday Inn, but while we unloading one of the bellhops said we could leave it out front.  That saved me some parking money and earned him a bigger tip.  When we first entered the room - tremendous bleach smell.  I guess that's good if you wonder if they clean the bathroom for mold.  Fortunately since it was great weather we could open the outside door and let it air out.  After a couple hours it was fine.  Just in case you're not aware, the river walk on a weekend night is loud and late - things didn't get quite until ~3 am and then the street sweeper comes rumbling through.  We didn't mind, it added to a festive feel.  But if you are looking for a quiet, peaceful evening, stay on the other side or find a hotel further inland.Beautiful historic hotel.  It is located overlooking River Street.  The view is lovely.  The beds here are quite comfortable too.  Rooms are decorated nicely and offer a charming touch.  The staff here is friendly and accommodating.  I will be sure to go back next time I am in Savannah!Just returned from a two night groupon stay at River City Inn.  We were unexpectedly surprised to be given a room with a waterfront view and king bed.  Staff was very friendly and accommodating, although we did not know about the coffee service in the mornings in the lobby until the last day-after we had been making coffee in our room.  We watched huge container ships, colorful tenders, and tugs going through the river right from our window and were impressed.  It is an older building but the original floors and rock walls under the skylight in the atrium added to the charm.  We took advantage of the free wine and snack service in the late afternoon where we talked with other guests.  We did miss a swimming pool though.One of the best hotels I've stayed at.  The location was perfect.   Nice little touches such as free wine every night and chocolates on the pillows.  The building itself looks great.  Highly recommended.This hotel, near the historic Cotton Exchange, a commerce center dating back to 1887.  It certainly holds its fair share of southern charm, along with a hefty dose of gothic southern creepiness. My room was large and comfy, but also held a slight resemblance to the room that holds John Cusak hostage in "1408." The portrait of the anonymous plantation owner hanging ominously over the four-poster bed was a nice touch. His eyes followed me all Disneyland Haunted Mansion-style. Spooky...The hotel offers an evening social hour with free wine, which I didn't get a chance to try. It also has a pool table in the lounge, which I also did not try. One night I decided to take a self-guided tour of the building looking for the roof-top patio. I ended up, through a number of twists and turns, on the uninhabited fifth floor. I think these rooms were at one time offices for the gentlemen doing business at the Cotton Exchange. The floor definitely had the feel of yesteryear, and the unnerving silence to go with it. I made the skeedadle to the rooftop patio door, only to find myself outdoors all by my lonesome. I had propped the door open behind me, but have to admit, I lost all nerve when I looked back and saw it slowly closing on its own. Was it a ghost trying to lock me out of the building to freeze to death outside, unbeknownst to the hotel staff? My overactive imagination got the best of me and I high-tailed it back inside, skittering my way to the elevator and back down to the lobby, where I strolled out trying to act all cool and casual. Aside from all the spooky stuff, the staff here was super helpful and gracious, and each night I received free turn-down service and chocolates on my pillow. If you stay here, know that river-view rooms on the 3rd floor can get noisy. My room apparently was right over a bar with nightly karaoke. Folks singing there really seem to love the Doobie Brothers. I got to hear a rendition of  "Long Train Runnin'" pretty much every night. That was really the only downside. But now that I think of it, maybe it was that ghost's way of trying to get me the hell outa there again...A friend and I stayed here after visiting some old friends at Southern. It is such an amazing hotel. Right on the river, clean rooms, and its HISTORIC, which is great to add to that down-south charm. Don't be surprised if you see a ghost roaming the halls :) The staff was nice and friendly and the hotel overall was just beautiful. Plus, you can walk to any of the places on riverstreet, and it wasn't too unresonably priced.Awesome stay in this river facing charming inn.  Service was very friendly and rooms were appropriate and clean.  The location can't be beat, and it is nice to stay in an authentic inn vs. the larger chains in the area.  Parking is terrible of course, but the room is highly recommended if staying in this part of Savannah.

review_content: I stayed here over Valentines weekend with my boyfriend. We had a very amazing weekend. The hot tub roof was absolutely amazing and we think it's the only hotel in the area that has one (my only complaint would be that I wish the water got hotter but may have just been because of how chilly out it was).Everyone we encountered that worked at this hotel was extremely pleasant, helpful and genuinely seemed like they enjoyed their job.We really liked our room. good size and comfortable bed. This is an amazing location. We got lucky and got a spot to park right in front of the hotel and were able to stay there most of the weekend but generally its $22 a day for valet so keep that in mind. Everything in town is walkable from this hotel.We will defenently be coming back to this location. Can't say enough nice things about it.If I could give this place 3-1/2 stars, I would; unfortunately, they lean more on the 3- than the 4-.For the price vs. the location, it's a fairly good deal. It's right on Bay St, which parallels the Savannah River, adjacent historic river district, and Rousakis Riverfront Plaza. On the other side of the hotel, you are really close to historic downtown - restaurants, lots of mainstream retail chains, and quite a few of the park-like historic squares - all very pedestrian friendly.Rooms were clean and functional. Though it looks like the facility could've had a minor superficial upgrade a few years back, I wouldn't be surprised if it was due for a more major overhaul in a few years. Definitely, the hotel looks better on the web than it did in real life - not bad, though if you look hard enough at the nitty/gritty details, it might be starting to show minimal age/wear/tear.Free continental breakfast with standard pre-packaged items - bagels/toast, hot/cold cereal, yogurt, fruit, pastries. They also had  along with an "automatic pancake machine", which, at the press of a button, pre-pours some pre-set amount of batter; then out comes a pancake! Not spectacular, but all OK if you set your expectations accordingly.They have a rooftop pool with a city/river view, which is cool.Quite frankly, the workout room sucked. They squeezed like three treadmills, one elliptical, PT balls, AND one weight machine into a super small space. I am not so sure they had a very good consultant/process when they looked into "designing" the workout room. Though it looked like the weight machine was practically new, it's a cheaper quality all-in-one unit with a rope/pulley system that potentially needs more space for your workout than they actually provide. Not only that, if you get something that is not intuitive to use and needs instructions (vs. the normal free weights or weight machines that one is used to), then it really isn't worth the time/money/use. They are better off providing a bunch of smaller size free weights. All-in-all, though, for my stopover of a day and night, it was OK, and worth the money.I give it a 3 stars A plus.Modest looking, same with rooms But I was surprised on how comfortable and quiet it was.The room had a little "funny smell" but not to bad.Restaurants are near, Public parking is next to the hotel, you could save money by parking there, I did.Gym is very small,Pool is nice, good views.Very odd room service. I found a gold hair and a brown hair on each beds on the first night, thought it might be from the room service. Next day, we left when the room service doing her work , how ever when we are back. There is a red blood ish dots on top of the bed and a dirt foot print next to it. One of the towels is wore out, like someone tore it. Front desk is really helpful and room service respond quickly. But what is going on during we were away?! Someone has a fight or injured in my room?Can't not say it is a good hotel. Strange and scary. Nice top view and pool, also the gym is functional. And the beds are comfortable, hope the bad feeling will go away later.Could have been on of my few 5 star hotels except for 2 things.1) After our second night, we returned in midafteroon to discover our room had not bin cleaned,  no fresh towels, etc.  I called down to the front desk to let them know and was told "our policy is to clean only the rooms that the guest has specifically requested ".  HUH????  So why was the room cleaned yesterday?  "That must have been a mistake sir, I will find out who entered your room to clean it without your permission".  In my former job I traveled extensively throughout the US, stayed at pretty much every chain, and never heard of this before.  If this truly is their policy it should be changed. But I suspect the real cause was the clerk covering for an error in housekeeping.The other issue I encountered was when I asked about storing luggage after checkout. Check out time was 11 a.m., an hour flight was not until 6 p.m. we wanted to spend some time visiting attractions we have not gotten to. The woman at the front desk did not seem pleased about our request. She said "I guess we could do that for a couple of hours".  When we did check luggage, I saw why se was hesitant.  They do not have a storage room, closet, or any space for storing luggage. Instead, you wield your luggage into an area that was used for Office, and put it against any available wall or space. Rather than discouraging visitors to store a suitcase or two, the hotel could take some space and dedicated just for storage.As for location, complimentary breakfast, and the rooms, we could not have asked for more. When they solve the luggage storage issue, and start giving a daily maid service without it being requested, this will be a five star hotelWe stayed for one night in this hotel. Valet parking available and the way to go if you have to drive to other places. It's $20 a day or you have to pay every time you leave which could add up. If you're going to park once and tour on foot during your stay skip valet. The room was clean and this room was on the sixth floor with a view of the river. There were lots of outlets to plug in electronics, a small Keurig, a microwave, and a small refrigerator. Our mattress was was really comfortable. We'll go back!Great hotel in Historic Savannah! They are in a great location that is very close to all the historic attractions and riverfront. The concierge was great about helping us schedule tours and recommending local places to eat. The room was very clean and well kept. The breakfast was also very good. It is worth the money and is a nice place to stay.This  hotel  was clean and well  maintained.  The staff was helpful and courteous and very personable.  Upon arrival,  we were  greeted by smiling valets ready to  help. I will say that parking is not cheap (20.00) but we knew our car was in a safe spot and was accessible anytime.  Be sure ro enjoy the  pool  on the roof . The view is to die for.Great location. Very clean and modern. We have been very happy with our three night stay. Great staff, nice breakfast, close to everything.Inattentive staff rude and abrasive. We moved to Marriott and loved historic Savannah.Even though it's a Holiday Inn Express, don't let the name fool you. This place is so nice!  Lobby, bar, breakfast areas all have an updated look. Rooms are also updated and have a clean feel. Free breakfast in the morning, with lots of 'to go' items is a great way to save $. Coffee, tea, and fruit available all day. Oh and the rooftop pool was a pretty nice plus. Only downfall is the fitness center-2 treadmills, 1 elliptical, 1 weight machine.The location is great and the staff is very friendly and helpful. You would think when you make a reservation 10 months in advance and check in first thing in the morning, you would get a room with a better view than staring straight at the parking garage.The hotel was under construction when I went with a friend. There was not any issues with dust or noise. The hotel has a great location. Everything in the historic district is a walkable distance. The concierge was helpful, and gave me some great recommendations of places to go and when to go. There is not a parking lot, so if you cannot find a spot of the street (difficult on weekends) you have to pay for valet parking.This hotel was a great deal for being right smack in the middle of everything. I couldn't pick a better location. All of the hotels downtown do not offer free parking, so be prepared to pay $15-20/a day to park your car. The rooftop pool was really nice, and the gym was perfect for getting our treadmill time in the morning :) I like how the hotel offered fresh fruit infused water in the lobby. The continental breakfast was pretty good too. Lots of table space. River street was like a block away. The beds were nice and comfy and the rooms nice and modern looking. There was a little hotel work going on but that didn't bother us at all.I stayed for 2 nights while in town for a conference. Booked with rewards points, which was a plus for me.  I was able to check in with out issue, the room was nice and clean, spacious and has a microwave.  Standard breakfast in the morning if you don't want to pay for breakfast elsewhere.  Within walking distance to the historic distance and to Bay St. and the River.Valet Parking is $15 a day if you're a platinum member, $20 if not.  I will say though, that booking with points shouldn't be an excuse to not give you a receipt when you check out though!We stayed here for 3 nights during a recent trip to Savannah. It is a very clean and comfortable hotel. The staff are very courteous and attentive. They were working on the elevators during this trip and kept apologizing for the wait while one elevator was down.The room was clean and comfortable with a few of the river. The kitchenette was very clean and convenient. The bathroom is updated and spotless with plenty of towels. The breakfast is one of the best I've seen for a continental breakfast. I had the biscuits and sausage gravy as that is my favorite food ever...it was really good!The bar , the Port Royal Tavern, has a great happy hour. Our bartenders- Rocky and Ken, were super nice and very friendly with a lot of suggestions for sights and dining. They do close pretty early which is unfortunate as I would probably have ended most nights there.The parking is the only downside really. You can park for $20 a day with the valet (unlimited in/out). The garage is always full for private parking. There is on-street parking availbable (free after 5) but be mindful of the sweeping hours and such. We went cheap this time but next time I would probably just use the valet.This is our new go-to hotel in Savannah.Talk about Southern hospitality!  This hotel was such a perfect location to see all of historic Savannah.  The hotel was clean, comfortable and inviting and the customer service was beyond excellent.  From our first encounter at check-in, to our welcome cocktail served by the lovely "Rocky" and our numerous interactions with Mackenzie (who constantly asked us what he could do for us) to the wonderful concierge services offered by Ed and Don, we were just overwhelmed.  We did so much in the 4 and 1/2 days we were there and this hotel makes it all so easy.  The free breakfast was a nice start to our day.  Nothing fancy but what is served tastes good and there is a fair variety.  Coffee was awesome.  Cocktails at the bar were very reasonably priced and just delicious.  Don't miss the pool, hot-tub and cabana area on the top floor because the views are seriously breathtaking.  The rooms were clean, comfortable and well-appointed.  The big plus at this location is just that...."LOCATION!!"  This place affords easy walking to River Street, all 23 squares, historic landmarks, City Market, Paula Deens....anything you want to find.  The other big draw here is the hospitality and customer service.  My friends and I have never been treated so well.  Next girl's trip to Savannah, this will definitely be our home.  If I had to make one suggestion, it would be nice to have a restaurant on premises or at least room service from a nearby restaurant.One of the best parts of Savannah!!  The staff at this hotel are unbelievable!  Cleanest rooms I've ever seen at a hotel!  If you plan to stay here, there is no need to have a rental car while you stay; it is within walking distance from everything.  We had a great balcony room overlooking Bay Street for the remarkable fireworks on the 4th of July.   Even though Bay is a busy street until 3am or 4am, we couldn't hear any of the folks getting smashed below.  Continental breakfast and fruit infused water throughout the day along with a complimentary concierge!  I do need to do a shout out to the ladies working the continental breakfast, "Our little guy misses your smiles"!They accepted the Gov Rate. Woo Hoo!  The location was good.  The room was clean.  The concierge was nice.  Probably one of the nicest holiday inns I have ever stayed at.  The valet parking is a little pricey, and the breakfast is not free, but otherwise this place was pretty good for the amount we were paying.  If I go back for business again, I will stay again.My wife and I stayed here for four nights while visiting Savannah. The hotel location is great for visiting the historic district, though it is on one edge so about a 20 minute walk to the Savannah Visitor Center or to places like Mrs Wilkes. There is self-parking as well as valet, expect to use the valet as the self-parking lot is often full. The valet staff was excellent, we never waited more than five minutes for our car to be brought around, and we almost never needed the car anyway. Check-in was fast and the lobby and lounge areas are very comfortable. They have free breakfast available which is convenient and can save you a few $$$ compared to the local restaurants.The room was nice, though a bit small and slightly outdated in terms of available outlets. So many hotels now have USB charging connections, but they haven't yet installed them in this hotel. They offered free wi-fi, but the signal was very poor and nearly unusable which is why I gave 4 instead of 5 stars. There were just two elevators and they were a bit slow, so sometimes we had to wait to get up or down, and most of the time we just walked down the stairs (we were on the second floor). The street noise was minimal, though one evening there were some guests that arrived in the early AM on motorcycle and they spent a few minutes idling below our room. There is an outdoor pool on the roof which was small and usually occupied with children.The location was great for us, several area restaurants were within a five minute walk including B Matthews (great for any meal, but make reservations) and Vic's (wonderful). It's only a few minute walk to the riverfront, though we found that area to be too much of a tourist trap as our tastes lean towards historic homes. Highly recommended as a great option if you want to stay economically in the historic district.
review_content_20: Stayed here with my husband in October 2013.  Like many other people have said, the location is AWESOME.  It's a short walk down to the Riverwalk and to multiple restaurant districts.  We had a spacious corner room facing the river.  The furnishings were still nice and the bed was comfy.  The amenities were pretty nice.  The rooftop pool and hot tub are awesome.  They weren't overly crowded and there are plenty of chaise chairs.  The gym was pretty standard for a HIE - two treadmills and an elliptical.  Breakfast was typical for a HIE - eggs, biscuits and gravy, sausage, breads, cereals, instant oatmeal, and fruit.  It was pretty busy when we arrived but by the time we had our food, a table had opened up.   Coffee, tea, and cocoa are available all day. The only drawback is the cost.  The rooms are expensive plus it's $20 to valet park the car.  Fortunately, in-and-out privileges are included!This hotel is in a great location, close to all and right across the street from the river where there are a lot of shops and restaurants. It is a large hotel with free breakfast, it's clean and has a concierge and a bar. You don't need a car to get around to see the sights. The WIFI was not very dependable and our cell phones didn't always work unless we stood by the window. We had a king corner room which was very large with a nice view. We could hear the traffic below, but got used to it quickly. Keep in mind it's a 3 star hotel, but for the price it's a great value.This is one of my favorite Holiday Inn Express locations. It feels like a much more expensive hotel when you walk into the lobby, but still offers all the great pricing and amenities of the Holiday Inn Express chain. They even validate your parking at the public garage next door.Location is awesome and you are in walking distance of almost anything in the Historic District. For example, River Street (with it's heavenly smelling candy shops) is just across the street and down the cobblestone steps. Many of the Squares are close by and of course you just have to go to Paula Deen's or Mrs. Wilkes!!! The Pink House and Telfair Museum are also nearby.They have a rooftop pool with great views of the harbor, suspension bridge and a nice exercise room just inside from the pool. Breakfast is nothing to get excited about, but it's free and a good variety of hot and cold items. Very attractive building, comfy beds, VERY CLEAN facilities & rooms, and really nice staff make this an ideal central hub to visiting this charming city.Awesome location across from river st. Trolley stop across street.  Free wifi.  Free hot breakfast. Fridge and microwave. Concierge knowledgeable. Front desk staff attentive and friendly. Valet parking $20 per day and slow service. Public parking next door but always full. Bar was not open late and very limited drink offerings.  Slow elevator. Not enough luggage carts.I would recommend.Love this hotel! Friendly, clean and perfect size room for two people. Love the location. We walk just about everywhere. Parking is a breeze with valet and I feel safe leaving my car in their hands. Only once did we encounter a rude staff member, but I think she was having a bad day.. It happens! Oh, the breakfast is pretty good and their concierge is the nicest lady you might ever meet! :) See you soon Holiday Inn Express!We are currently in Savannah for the Rock n Roll Marathon and we've been blown away with the friendly, attentive, and conscientious staff. We just got a phone call regarding a hit and run with our car-- the valet staff (Alfont) noticed a ding, reviewed video, and are working on reporting the incident for us. This situation is out of the hotel staff and our control-- but they are doing their best to reconcile the situation with the utmost courtesy and care. Any hotel can have clean bathrooms and comfortable beds-- but quality and genuine customer care is hard to come by. We are by far impressed and will remain loyal because of our consistent excellent experiences with the Holiday Inn chain. Thank you for taking care of us and keep up the good work!We chose this hotel because it is in the heart of downtown Savannah and within walking distance of all points of interest. If we had paid a *normal* rate per night, we would've been satisfied with the *normal* stay we had.  But, being that we paid an upwards of $300 for one night (including taxes and their $20 a day parking fee) we felt like the stay left much to be desired. Starting with the positives:The room and bathroom are nice to look at. The bed and pillows were comfortable. The front desk staff (when present) were friendly and helpful.Now, with the negatives:We spent a good amount of time looking for ... Just water. To drink. There was a vending machine available that offered snacks and an ice machine. We improvised and filled our bucket with ice and waited for it to melt so we could have drinking water available. The shower head: in need of a change. Water spraying EVERYWHERE. The pillows were soft and squishy, and there are two per person. If you're anything like my husband, though, you like a lot of pillows and there were no extras in the closet.There is a strange smell lurking in all the hallways and rooms that is reminiscent of what a smoker's morning breath would smell like. The smell was so prominent that it woke me up in the middle of the night.  I'm wondering if there is a floor that allows smoking?Housekeeping knocked on our door three times before 10 am.  We overheard the valet complaining about us as we got into our car that he got the "thank you very much" tip from us. I understand that these guys look forward to making tips, but when you charge every guest $20 a day just to park the car, isn't it part of the job description of the valet to park and retrieve your car?  Maybe if we'd been happy patrons, we would've given more of an effort to tip.I agree with all of the previous positive feedback on this hotel.  Very convenient to most of the "must see" attractions.  Friendly staff and clean, comfortable rooms.  A tad pricey, and the King room was kind of small in regard to other similar plaves I've stayed, buy it's all about location location location.  Despite being street side on the very busy Bay St., the room was very quiet as street noise.  Good windows I guess.Been on the road now for a couple of weeks, good as it gets, only the check in time ? 4.00pm, Walk up town for a look and a beer. Great part of the old town.Happy and friendly staff on checking in, free breakfast and internet no complaints from me.I honestly can't say anything new or different about this hotel. You can't beat the convenience or the free breakfast. I was overjoyed when I saw gluten free bagels! What a nice touch! I loved staying here.One thing that knocked down my rating--I paid $20 for Valet parking only to find out later that their go-to spot is the roof of the parking garage. The rest of the floor was empty. Why not move my car 10 spots so that it's not in the 100 degree sun during the summer? I was horrified and promptly moved it. Beware if you are valet parking!This hotel is a really good deal. Its location is great-- right across the street from the river and in the middle of the historic district. We also got a really good rate compared to the competition, and the room was really nice and clean. I feel like you don't always know what you're going to get with a Holiday Inn, but I have no complaints.Provided toiletries included shampoo, conditioner, bath gel, lotion and bar soap. Also, if you need any other basic toiletries (toothpaste, toothbrush, shaving cream, razor, etc.) they will provide them for free. My boyfriend called the front door to request shaving cream, and the manager showed up at our door with a whole box. The rooms have hair dryers as well.Wifi is free (I hate when hotels charge extra).For parking, you can pay $12 a day to park in the public garage immediately next door or $20 for hotel valet. The valet parks you in the reserved monthly spots in the same garage, so it's only worth it when the public spots are full.The breakfast is standard hot hotel fare, so it's good if you're looking for a quick bite early in the morning but otherwise I'd definitely recommend heading to local restaurants.Downtown Savannah equals FUN. If you want a nicer hotel without the high price, this is the place for you. There's a free breakfast from 6am - 10am. It's nothing fancy, but is fairly decent for free (eggs, bacon, cinnamon rolls, cereal, fruit, etc). There's a rooftop bar with a pool & hot tub, and it's worth going up just for the views. This hotel is within walking distance to many of Savannah's top restaurants (The Olde Pink House), shopping, & city tours. I would stay here again when visiting Savannah.Clean, Super Friendly Staff, quiet for being on Bay Street. Large breakfast area, which is a plus, no waiting on a table, or having to share with a stranger. Rooms are nicely appointed, mine had a queen and a sofa bed. Microwave and a small refrigerator in the room, nice for leftovers, or a snack. Close to everything downtown. Walking distance to River Street, Bay Street and the City Market area. Did I mention the Super Friendly Staff? All of them are pleasant and willing to help. I didn't have any special requests, but if I did you can bet that the staff would accommodate it for you. One of the nicer places I have stayed at in a while.My family and I really enjoyed our stay here. It's in a great location, walkable to anything and everything in the historic district, near the river. The rooms were nice and clean, with ample space, and the staff was very friendly. Our room overlooked the river which was just lovely. There is a $20 overnight parking charge but it seems that all the hotels in the area charge the same rate. Breakfast is included which is a nice bonus.  It's nothing fancy but it offers the basics. If you're looking for a more hearty or gourmet type breakfast, you're better off eating at a restaurant in the area. If we were to come back to Savannah, we would, without a doubt, stay here again!We were pleasantly surprised by the quality of our stay. The hotel is pretty old but appeared to be recently renovated. We had a room with a king bed, non-smoking, with a view. The view was amazing! The service in this hotel was pretty great too!We didn't utilize the free continental breakfast during our stay, so can't comment on it. The elevators were having issues while we were there, but worked nonetheless.I would definitely recommend this hotel. It's in a great location, close to everything in the historic district to walk to except maybe a much desired Waffle House.Excellent hotel. Stayed in Savannah one extra night and needed a place to stay so we moved here from a few doors down. Nice staff and very clean room. This will be our primary hotel the next time we're in Savannah. The AC is very quiet too, and we kept the room very cold. Good for light sleepers. The biggest takeaways are (1) very clean, (2) modern fittings, and (3) quiet.Lovely location...you can walk to almost everything.  Staff is welcoming and helpful.  We got a great upgrade because of our Priority Club membership, to a deluxe river view room, which made the stay even better.  The room is spacious and comfortable, scrupulously clean, with plenty of outlets and lights, and convenient switches.  We would definitely stay here again.Wonderful location!  The woman who checked us in was a little rude.  The nearby public parking garage was full, but we quickly realized we could overnight park at a meter right out front, which was a steal (free parking 5pm-8am, $1/hr thereafter).  We stayed on the 7th floor, and the ice machine was broken, which was a small inconvenience.  Clean, quiet room.  Nice hotel overall, especially for the price.  Paid $159 through kayak.The hotel is in a good spot across River St. Its also near a lot of restaurants & bars. The bathroom wasn't totally spotless, but thats ok. We did notice what looked like a blood stain on the mattress under one of the pillows.The staff was nice & helpful. Apparently the bartender's mother passed away so nobody was tending it. One of the front desk clerks quickly hopped over and served us beer.Clean, friendly staff, and great location! Continental breakfast has wide selection. Easy one block walk to River Street. I would definitely stay here again. Nice view from room. No complaints!
review_content_40: Very nice hotel. Didn't expect too much from a holiday inn express. The front desk staff overall was friendly although when I checked in, a guy assuming is the manager on staff was sort of strange in the sense that he didn't speak up. Not unfriendly but not the customer service I was expecting. I had a king sized bed room on the 2nd floor sort of overlooking the river walk. Expect for the street light shining in my window as well as the crosswalk light flashing constantly in the dark, it was fine. I would rec to request a higher level though. I didn't have them clean my room daily but when I did, they didn't bother replenishing the styrofoam cups. The breakfast was ok. Plenty of options but again didn't expect too much for a free meal. Very close proximity to everything!Very nice room. Nice roof top pool and fitness center. Nothing really bad to say. we decided to stay a second night. We didn't book ahead so I asked if she would match the online Hotels.com price and they did.One of our favorite HIE on our recent vacation. Great location, small but clean room, and friendly staff.First of all, the location is the main reason for 3 stars but there are a lot of other hotels with just as good of a location. The valet staff and the breakfast staff are awesome and are another reason for the three stars. If it was left up to the front desk it would be one star. ThSavannah is known as the Hostess city. This hotel lives up to that. We loved this place. This hotel is in a perfect location at the corner of Bay Street and Abercorn Street. It's just down the street from Reynolds Square and across the street from River Street and the River front shops, restaurants and bars. Our room was amazing. It was on the eighth floor (top floor) and it had a sitting area with a pull out couch, a small flat screen TV (that could face the couch or the bed), a "bar" area with a sink, refrigerator and microwave with a large mirror. The bed was very comfy with both firm and soft pillows. There was adequate black out curtains in the windows. Speaking of windows our view was of the river facing east and the Hampton Hotel pool. There was also a desk with a large mirror on the wall in front of that. The bathroom was large and great. Adequate lighting a large mirror, a magnified shaving mirror, and a large shower (big enough for two). The towels were soft and plentiful. There was also a full length mirror in the room and a mirrored large closet for clothing as well as a 4 drawer dresser. The hotel is lovely. They serve only breakfast. It is continental with eggs, pancakes (they have a cool machine that makes them), cereal, cinnamon buns, bacon, ham, toast, bagels and more. It is complimentary with your stay. There is a smallish rooftop pool with a hot tub as well as a fitness room. The staff is also great. They left us a gift bag with a bottle of wine and some snacks for his birthday in our room with a lovely note. I highly recommend this hotel. The prices are comparable with others in the area.Stayed in early March, 2012 for 3 nights Wonderful experience! Great location, clean hotel, nice rooms, very comfortable beds, friendly staff, nice breakfast selection, wonderful roof top pool. I will definitely be back!Nice hotel. Comfortable beds. Great location with a short walk to the river and other nearby attractions. I hate places that charge $20 for you to park your car. There is a parking garage next door, but I'm unsure how much it cost. Nice continental breakfast.Very clean for a holiday Inn. Free wifi, breakfast, and walking distance to shops. The staff is very friendly. I would come back again. It's walking distance to moon River breweryTHANKS Yelpers - I wouldn't have stayed at a Holiday Inn Express if not for your recommendations. This hotel is upscale and should consider a name change as it's better than its brand. The corner room, bed and breakfast were terrific value. Located right in the heart of the historic district it's within easy walking district of many parks, restaurants and museums. Why pay $100 a night more to stay at Marriott and Hyatt brands a block away? Stay at this excellent hotel and invest the savings in a very good dinner at the Olde Pink House restaurant only a few blocks away.We really loved our stay!! The room was huge, and really clean and we had a balcony overlooking Bay Street. We'd had all the walking we could do, so we stayed in, but it was really nice....There was a fantastic bartender in the downstairs bar, who let us take our drinks up to the rooftop patio & pool area. That was a gorgeous view of the river!! And the breeze was amazing. There's a semi-enclosed area that made it seem private, even though it was still pretty wide open. The parking and concierge were fantastic, too. Such a great value for the location and amenities!!!LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION!!!!This hotel is a great value for a stay in Historic Savannah. My husband and I had no idea even where to go our first night there...we set out to explore. We stumbled upon River Street and had a wonderful time. THis hotel is beautiful...we had a wonderful view of the historic district and they gave us a free voucher for parking on the street when the lot was full. The rooms are spotlessly clean and neat and tidy. I wouldn't ever consider staying anywhere else in Savannah.My wife and I stayed here several years ago and were very impressed with it. I even wrote a very glowing review of it. We stayed here for three days recently and I dont know what happened but the hotel's standards have slipped. There were three main issues that concerned me.One was that the wifi was spotty at best. We had an ipad and and iphone with us. Half the time the wifi was not working. We checked with another couple who were with us and were staying nearby and they experienced the same issues.Two was that our room was not cleaned the first day that we were there. We left at 10 am and saw a maid in the room next door. We got back at about 4 and a maid said that she forgot to give us towels. She gave us the towels, but when we got into the room, the bed was not made, nor was the room cleaned.Finally was the attitude of one of the valet parking attendants. We dropped off our car yesterday afternoon and when we got to our room, we realized that we had left something in our car. My wife called front desk. They transferred and she explained the problem to them. They said that they would bring the car around again so we could retrieve the item. I went down expecting the car to be there. When I got there it wasnt and the valet had such an attitude that I would up getting the keys from him, and going to where the car was parked in the adjacent garage and then getting the item myself. If you are going to charge me for valet parking, dont give me an attitude when something like this happens. We would have brought these issues to the managers attention, however we had a long drive home today and checked out at 5 am. We did not feel like bringing it the issues up then.Overall this stay was a disappointment. There are a lot of other hotels in the same price range as this one in Savannah. We will be staying at one of them the next time that we are in town.Overall a very pleasant stay and hotel. Reasonably priced and the location is perfect. My group was a walk up after another hotel lost our reservation. Room was a little small for 4 people, but we made do just fine. I would totally recommend this place!You won't find a better location than this Holiday Inn Express, which is an easy walk to downtown eateries and attractions, and is just across the cobblestone arteries that lead to River Street.Valet parking is worth the $14 per day, as parking in that area is cumbersome, and everything in downtown Savannah is walkable from the hotel. The rooms were clean minus a few stains on the carpet and another on the wall under the window we couldn't discern what it might have been, but then again, maybe we didn't want to know. Aside from that, we were assigned to an adjoining room, even though I requested one without connecting doors on the web reservation, because my husband abhors them. We forgot to confirm it when we checked in, and by the time we had hauled our kids and our stuff up to the room after an almost four hour drive, he decided to overlook it this time.From our seventh floor windows, we had a lovely view of the Savannah River and Bridge,but we could still hear some noise from the road. It didn't end up being a problem, but I was concerned about it because the only place big enough to set up the Pack N' Play for our 18-month-old was between one of the beds and the window. Since we booked this hotel in part because of the allure of the rooftop pool described on their website the evening before, we were disappointed when we arrived to hear that it was closed for repairs. We were told we could use the pool across the street at the Best Western, which is not a rooftop pool. The idea of dragging our small kids and our pool gear across the street in our bathing suits was less than enticing, so we passed. Breakfast was the typical cereals, bagels, muffins, toast yogurt, coffee and juices; the standouts were the bacon and sausage, which were better than one would expect. There are high chairs, but they don't have barriers that go between the legs of children that will keep smaller babies from falling through the openings. I also left my purse at the breakfast table when we were rounding up the children, and didn't realize it until several minutes after I had returned to my room. When I returned for it, a staff member had rescued it and stored it safely, and all contents were intact.If you are traveling to Savannah for a raucous St. Patrick's Day weekend, this certainly a place to consider.Fantastic stay at this hotel. The young lady at the front desk was incredibly friendly and the location simply cannot be beat. We could walk to all of the wonderful restaurants and sites in the historic district from the hotel. The room itself was in great condition. Now I like my beds a bit softer, but the hotel has to do what the brand tells them to do! Free, hot breakfast as well. I'd definitely stay here again.Great for a business trip or St. Patty's Weekend.I have never stayed in the rooms, but I have stayed in the suite/apartments that are behind the Hotel and owned by whoever owns the Holiday Inn/Hampton Inn/Mulberry Inn. If you call the Holiday Inn they can give you more info.Had I only stayed here once I'd probably give it 3 stars. But I've come to Savannah a billion times for business, and after long term stays at several places, this is my preference. You have a nice sized kitchen, large beds, large televisions, huge bathrooms, and privacy. You also have your own parking space (although random people park in your designated spot and you have to get the staff to take care of it).You are within walking distance of quite a few restaurants, for a variety of tastes.The staff is very friendly and will go out of their way to make you comfortable. Is everything here perfect? No. But you can tell that the front desk associates are really trying to make a difference and raise the bar. Breakfast? Meh. Bar? Meh. Location and Friendliness? TWO THUMBS UP.LOVED this hotel and will never stay anywhere else in Savannah! Clean, nice, updated room. Service was fantastic. One of the valet ladies gave us coupons and great suggestions for places to eat. Breakfast was the BEST continental breakfast I've ever seen at a hotel- pancakes, bacon, eggs, biscuits and gravy, cinnamon rolls (my favorite!), bagels, toast, juice, coffee. Yum, yum, yum! Front desk was quick and helpful. Pool was great. Seriously- no complaints. In my opinion, it WAY outranks the Hyatt!!We pricelined this hotel for Columbus Day weekend - and were happy about the rate we received (which was about $50 less a night than the hotel itself and other sites advertised.) Score. The hotel is in a great location - East Bay Street is one up from River Street - and thus, we had a pretty cool view of the barges going down the river. (We didn't select the room on priceline, but did get a water view.) The hotel was clean, had a nice quiet bar downstairs, and also features a hot breakfast until 10am (late, by most standards.) We were happy with how clean it was - and it was a sold-out weekend from what we were told, but the other patrons weren't loud. The staff was reasonably friendly - though not as much as I anticipated for southerners (I'm a northeastern girl.) The first night, my boyfriend and I turned in early. We were both up at unreasonable hours (traveling) - and needed some rest for the rest of the weekend. Housekeeping banged (and opened) the door at 9PM! Have no idea why - thankfully, the bolt was on. I went to the door - and he acknowledged it was the wrong room. Saturday rolled around - we had no replacement bath towels. Called twice to get some so we should shower for dinner. Saturday night, our microwave started beeping at 5am - no idea why. We actually had to unplug it from the wall. We were up on Monday morning (Columbus Day) - and had housekeeping knocking on the door AGAIN at 930am. Why ? No clue. Again, we had the door bolted with the"privacy" sign on. Check out is at 11am. My lord - I regretted not calling management Friday night.Push came to shove - we were getting our car from the valet (35 minutes to get the car - we thought it broke down, but they just forgot where they put it) - I had a discussion with a lovely manager about our experience. They ended up crediting 2 nights of our stay and our parking fee.Advice: contact management if you find an issue - regardless if it is an isolated event. I truthfully - wanted a happy weekend with someone I hadn't seen in 3 months - not a credit to my card. I am giving the hotel 4 stars based on the cleanliness, location, view, and ease of booking. The attention from management is really what saved this review. I would recommend this hotel to others - but would advice the hotel that the housekeeping staff need some manners and additional training. I am sure that they will work to resolve these issues. (And hopefully - they were isolated to a 'holiday' weekend, with a full roster of guests.)You really can't ask for a better location than this - truly the perfect place to be! You can walk everywhere, but you're enough of a distance from the bars on Bay Street that you don't hear the raucous drunks. We stayed in a suite, and I thought the rooms were a little small for the rate, but everything was impeccably clean and the staff was very polite.This place is GREAT! We found this place without knowing how good it would be, just because we stay at Holiday Inns a lot. It seemed we were staying in an upscale hotel. The room was very nice and clean, bed was very comfortable and everyone was friendly. The location was perfect!
review_content_60: We onyl stayed one night and we were literally only there at night to sleep. However, we were VERY pleased with out room and we had a spectacular view of the River, without requesting it ahead of time. I reserved the room on Hotels.com and had researched A LOT of places. Our room was beautiful, well designed and decorated. The mini-fridge buzzed a little but we took care of that with just a little tap on the door. The bed was comfortable and we slept wonderfully. The staff at the front desk were very helpful and knowledgable. I didn't get a chance to talk with the concierge, but he seemed like the old-skool story-telling type, maybe a local who has lived in Savannah for 30+ years. I would recommend this hotel.Stayed here after reading yelp reviews. We were not disappointed! Nice rooms, comfy beds, clean and the employees were friendly and helpful. Loved the rooftop deck, the pool, views, exercise room. Breakfast was decent. Great location. And the price was right! Would definitely stay here again.

review_content: I signed up on yelp to give the east bay inn a review. I returned to my hometown to find the hospitality and comfort I expect. Well done to the staff. A quiet, lovely evening in a perfect location.I got this reservation the night before we spent an overnight in Savannah one our way back home from Holden Beach. I must have got really lucky, because our rickshaw driver told us that the East Bay Inn is usually booked month out and we probably got a canceled room.This has to be one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed at. When we got back to the room the bed was turned down, that was a great surprise after a night of eating, drinking, and sightseeing.The rooms are gorgeous and the bed is really, really comfortable. Real hardwood floors and the original brick wall, which is really cool. I would gladly stay here again anytime.They also had complementary cheese and wine, and the best pink lemonade.The only down side, was that I didn't get to see Charlie, their resident ghost. Maybe better luck next time.Outstanding location, everyone is overly nice and the rooms are stunning. We were on the 3rd floor and had 18 foot ceilings. Within walking distance to all of the squares, river street and night life. Mrs. Sheila at the front desk was amazing and very knowledgeable on the area. The wine, cheese and snack from 5:30-7:30 every day was low key and great please to gather with others and plan your night. We hope to return and would stay no other place.I stayed here for 3 nights in January. The location is phenomenal. The staff was also very, very friendly and accommodating. However, the bathroom was not the cleanest (hair in the shower floor before we used it and the ceiling over the shower looked a bit damaged), the walls were very thin, and the pillows were lumpy. The room did have character, but if you're in Savannah to check out the history, I would recommend you spend your money elsewhere, such as the Marshall House, Olde Pink House, or 17hundred90. All of those are around the same price, but have historical significance and more amenities (such as wonderful restaurants, 200 year old basement bars with live music, and/or historic happenings and tails of hauntings).Way over priced, you are paying for location.  Breakfast was nothing remarkable, comparable to staying at a motel six.  Staff didn't answer the phone when i called ahead.  There is no mini fridge in your room even thou on their website it says they do. It is pet friendly and they give you a nice doggy bag for your dog.  Overall I was expecting more for what i paidWe came here for my wife's birthday.  We wanted something in walking distance from all Savannah has to offer and had some charm.East Bay is clean, has parking, HUGE rooms, and is in walking distance of everything good.Basically, perfect.  We would never go anywhere else.For our first trip to Savannah we wanted to stay in an old hotel with history. We stumble upon and were immediately taken by this beauty. We were given a tour by Melvin the Bell Man before even considering our stay and our breath was taken away by the stunning rooms. Not only is the location centric but got the cheapest price and an AAA discount in addition. The folks are super nice and the amenities top notch. Complementary breakfast was the best I've had in a hotel since I don't remember when. All in all an excellent choice, next time in Savannah we will be staying there for sure. Plus a repeat visit card guarantees a super discount after a few visits. And its pet friendly!!! Enough said, loved this place.This was mine and my husband's first trip to Savannah.  I researched many online sites before choosing The East Bay Inn. We were so pleased, and would absolutely stay there again. On trips to other cities we've opted for larger chain hotels. Savannah seemed like a place to try something different. EBI was charming and beautiful.   We were given a third floor corner room facing Bay Street. Some reviews mention excessive noise, however coming from a large, urban area we hardly noticed. Everything was just right. Lovely exposed brick, mile high ceilings, pleasant colors, comfortable bed and seating area.   The wine and cheese reception in the afternoon was not crowded and gave us the opportunity to meet other guests and compare notes about restaurants and attractions in the historic district.  Excellent location. Close enough to walk to historic sites and along the river, but just enough steps away from the center of activity so that it felt as though you were leaving the party behind and taking a breather.   Each and every staff member was friendly and courteous and helpful. When we left each morning there were good recommendations and when we returned each evening we were asked about our day.Cindy even recalculated my bill after I remembered that I had a AAA card.   I would definitely encourage friends to choose The East Bay Inn. I hope to return to Savannah soon. It would be fun to go with a group next time.What an amazing inn. If you are looking for the perfect southern experience; look no further. Everyone is so nice and polite (even around town). The rooms are simply stunning and historic. Free breakfast every day and there's a wine and cheese event that happens around 5 PM. A short walk to the river and a perfect location to walk to the historic squares and downtown Savannah. We came for New Years and the parking was insane. They don't have that many spots available as it is. The staff gave is a 2-day parking pass ($12) for the parking garage across the street. Again, what an amazing place. We are definitely coming back to stay here next time we come visit!I booked this hotel for my boyfriend's birthday. I didn't want to stay at a corporate hotel (Hilton or Marriot) because I wanted to experience Savannah's southern charm and make it a special weekend. I had heard great reviews of East Bay Inn from a coworker. I booked the cozy queen. I was worried it would be very small, but it was the perfect size for two people. I did book early so I requested the 2nd or 3rd floor. We got a corner room, with a good view of the surrounding area. The ceilings are SO HIGH, which may have been my favorite feature. We needed to park in a parking garage nearby because the lot was full, but this wasn't a problem because we were not using our car while we were in Savannah. The hotel is decorated perfectly to accentuate the old southern charm, exposed brick, and hardwood floor. It seemed to be kept up very well considering how old it was. Every staff member was extremely friendly and accommodating. My parents surprised us with champagne, which the hotel set up to be waiting for us when we arrived (and we got to keep the champagne glasses!). The location is PERFECT for hanging out in historic Savannah. I recommend visiting in October when the weather is cool and the ghost tours are in full force! While the hotel is pricy, I feel it is worth the money, and I would definitely stay here again.The East Bay Inn has a very good location for seeing the city and has a very friendly and helpful staff.The room was fine but overlooked the small parking lot. The bed was comfortable and the flat screen TV was good sized. One caveat, there aren't many electrical outlets so if you have lots of gadgets that need charging, you'll have to be creative.As you might expect in an old hotel, the bathroom was tiny.The lobby and breakfast area was a bit run-down but the breakfast was substantial although not gourmet.PROS - location & staffCONS - small bathroom; somewhat worn interiorsI am not one to post on yelp but our stay was so enjoyable that I had to.  For one, the rooms are absolutely beautiful with high ceilings, exposed brick and beautiful drapes and bedding.  The complimentary breakfast was excellent, with a wide range of choices and very fresh ingredients.  The most amazing part of it all was when my husband left his phone plugged in in the lobby while we were waiting for our cab.  We made it all the way to the airport and then he noticed.  Sheila from the front desk called me and the manager drove to the airport and dropped it off for us! I was so touched at how they went above and beyond to help us. Amazing.I've stayed here twice now, and this is the cheapest and best hotel that's still close to everything in Savannah. When I go back I will be staying here again. Nice staff, clean beautifully furnished rooms, and great location.You know, some hotels in America are so over consumed with the "In times" and all the state of the art crap that they forget the actual art of hospitality. Not this place. The concierge was lovely and the first question they ask you, is if its your first trip to Savannah. If it is, they give you some great tourist pamphlets (not the cheesy kind) and then give you their recommendations. After you check in, they give you actual old keys (not some electronic slide key)...I mean its brass...like made from the 1800s. Fo realz. The rooms are so cute. Four poster bed, with floral comforters. At first glance your like...um ew. However, its actually really sweet and works perfectly with the whole atmosphere of the hotel. The room is very large, complete with sitting area, large TV and a very luxurious shower. It's in a perfect location to the river and great shops and dare I say...fudge shops. Mmmmm. Everything is within walking distance and the places are one of kind....good luck trying to find any shop like this in LA, NYC or Dallas for that matter. Ok, back to the hotel. Obviously I'm not going to stay anywhere but here. There are honestly a ton of hotels in Savannah, but I think this is the best. Not because its the only place Ive stayed there, but because I cant imagine staying anywhere else....it's that perfect. Enjoy!We stayed her because we wanted to be by the river.  It got good recommendations, but it wasn't as nice as we thought it was going to be.  We had a queen room on the first floor. The only room that was available at the time of booking. It had a private patio with french doors. What they don't tell you is they don't clean out there. It was very dark and dirty. Couldn't sit on the chair out there and leaves everywhere.The walls are paper thin and you can hear everyone else in their rooms watching TV and talking.  The place was clean, but not great. They offered a breakfast buffet included in the stay. It is served till 10AM. At 9:50AM I went to get up to have another cup of coffee and noticed that they had already taken away the coffee and most of the food.I had to ask for a cup which they did bring me and my husband had to ask for more cereal, which they did bring him. Honestly, they should wait till a few minutes after 10AM to start cleaning up.I wouldn't go back.It's amazing how some people treat you when you're out with your dog, even at "dog-friendly" places; You'd think that I was walking around shirtless and shoeless, spitting on babies or my (extremely sweet and well-behaved) pup was pooping on everything everywhere. Likewise, getting a clean, decent hotel in downtown Savannah that accepts pets without some obnoxious $100+ pet fee is no easy feat, as I have learned.I'm happy to report that pup and I received no such treatment at the East Bay Inn. On the contrary, the staff was very warm and friendly, our room was small but cute and intimate in all its old-fashion-y Southern 'Rococo' splendor, and OMG, BF and I almost died when we were told about "the complimentary cordials served in the evening." (Unfortunately, we were only staying one night and didn't make it in time for that, but next time, East Bay Inn!)The staff is SO HELPFUL. They know that you're from out of town and need a little guidance :) The rooms are lovely and clean with gorgeous high ceilings and pretty Southern decor.I didn't get to do two things I would have loved to do: bring my dogs and eat breakfast. Pretty silly, since those two things seem to be at the crux of East Bay Inn's appeal!I slept through check-out by accident and I didn't get ANY flack from the staff. Thank you, and again...sorry!The ONLY thing I would change has nothing to do with my stay, but with the reservation system. It is efficient and easy, but I emailed twice with no response. Everything worked out great, obviously, but that system does not reflect the personal touch that the Inn has.We've been staying here for years and wouldn't change a single thing about it. They're pet-friendly, personable, and the rooms are uh-mazing -- decorated to the nines with a southern Victorian style that wholeheartedly represents Savannah and its southern charm. Customer service has always been pleasant and prompt. The wine and cheese hour is always a treat to indulge in before your evening plans and their breakfasts are sufficient. Is it haunted? That's up for debate. But I will say that I've gotten the chills more than once when I turned out the lights for beddy-bye time. Just ask the front-desk attendant about Charlotte. Oh and I forgot to mention the location. Placed on Bay Street and Market, East Bay Inn is the perfect local between River Street and the historic district. You can walk anywhere and leave your car parked throughout your stay, which is huge for us because we feel like what better way to see gorgeous Savannah than walking it?!My husband and I stayed here for a long weekend to celebrate our anniversary.  We had always wanted to check out Savannah, and decided to stay here during our visit because of the good reviews and the fact that they are pet friendly!  The inn did not disappoint.  There were a lot of good things about the place:1) Very friendly staff- also very helpful!2) Dog frienfly!  We travel with our dachshund and it can be hard to find decent places that allow dogs for a reasonable price.  I believe there was a $40 fee for this Inn.3) Great location- walking distance to everything. 4) Free wifi! There were some things that could be improved as well...1) Breakfast.  YUCK.  For a "bed and breakfast" type place, the breakfast was dissapointing.  No healthy options... all they had were sausage biscuits, bagels, and some fresh fruit soaked in some kind of really sweet syrup or juice.  There is a good breakfast place nearby though (B. Matthews Eatery- go there!) Anyways, it could be improved a ton!2) Tiny rooms- not a huge deal, but we barely had room to walk around! ALSO- FYI- if you are traveling with a dog. Savannah beaches are NOT dog friendly! Even in the evenings!! Ridiculous.  Anyways... we learned the hard way.  All in all- great place to stay.  :)Spent 3 nights at this wonderful hotel. The staff was wonderful. The rooms were roomy and cozy. My only complaint is that there wasn't a refrigerator in the room, but as long as you have a cooler, you will be fine. Parking is limited, but they will provide an all day parking pass to a parking deck a block away. Was unexpectedly quiet, especially being near River/Bay Streets. Highly recommended!
review_content_20: Had a lovely visit w/ a friend for a girls weekend in Savannah.  The rooms were very nicely decorated but one of the lamps in our room didn't work.  We left a note and told the front desk and it was just gone the next day.  The cocktail hour is a nice touch and we had fun getting to know our fellow guests.The cons of the stay were the staff who were either super friendly and nice, or cold and apathetic.  I was locked out for a good 10 minutes one night because the woman on duty at the front desk took a break and didn't respond to the bell or my frantic knocking.  Another guest actually came down from her room to let me in.  When the hotel staffer finally showed up, I asked for her name and she refused to tell me and then replied, "You'll find out in the morning." w/ major attitude and went back behind the front desk staff only area.  I was furious.  The other con was the continental breakfast, which was worse than a Holiday Inn Express.We loved the location, the rooms were HUGE and gorgeous, we even had a Ghost Encounter w/ Charlie, their resident spook.  I would normally give only 1 or 2 stars for such horrible service, but most of the rest of the staff were nice.  They had 2 problem children that shouldn't be in the hospitality industry.Stayed here in April and loved it. One of the nicest rooms I have ever stayed in. We had a great time. The wine and cheese in the afternoon was a great touch. Breakfast was good, the layout was a bit congested, but it worked out. Great location, very close to everything. The staff was helpful. One of the desk staff went above and beyond when we had trouble with our TV. A great choice!The exceptional hospitality was so refreshing! Beautiful rooms, and we loved our stay.We stayed At this charming Inn during the Savannah Music Festival.  The service was great!  From the time we checked in till the time we checked out.  Everybody was very friendly and helpful.  We found the rooms very clean. We will be staying at this Inn next time we are in Savannah!i get to splurge every now and then and this is it for me. decent room prices for a splurge (not 400/night, but i felt like a high roller dropping 200/night here). charming rooms, 4poster bed with 2 seating areas, plasma tv. we had the breakfast there both mornings, evening cocktail reception, and chocolate turn-down service. the staff was exceptionally friendly with the exception of the night concierge whom was a real jerk-off. the place is beautiful and located within a 2 minute walk of the lively riverwalk area, and 5 minutes of any other cool, touristy spot (and local flavor) of savannah. best of all, they allowed dogs for only 35 bucks.Next time I stay in Savannah this is where I will stay.  The staff are amazing, the rooms are plush & decorated in a romantic fashion, and  it's close to shopping & Riverstreet..  My boyfriend & I attended a cocktail hour in the evening with some of the other guests and were treated to a lovely breakfast in the morning.  I loved our bellhop Melvin.  He was an absolute delight!  Very informative too telling us all about the room & cool places to go.  We enjoyed a night out on the town and when we returned chocolates on the pillows and the CD player playing romantic music!  I enjoyed my experience here.  My only problem would have to have been the parking situation...there is not much parking outside the door however, they do have a parking deck near by.  Our stay was definitely amazing and I will go back next time I'm in Savannah.Holy cow.  20 foot ceilings in our lovely, very comfortable 3rd floor room.  We were a bit amazed when we walked in. The personnel were all extremely friendly and capable.  Outstanding location, allowing a lot of entering and exiting, which was mandatory in the hellish heat of July.No pool, but a wine and cheese reception at 5:30 and a breakfast (nothing special, but complementary and appreciated).The Inn was nice and had much character. They did a nice job with the breakfast and cordials in the afternoon. Everything to my surprise tasted quite good. The employees were very nice and helpful. I really wanted to give a four star rating however I felt the rooms were dirty. We had a large group so we had three rooms. One on the first floor which was a pet room and two others on the second floor. All three rooms had bathtubs that not drain so you bath in a pool of water and the tubs had a lot of mildew. The floors appeared as if they had not been washed in some time. The first day we got there we had dropped water on the floor and I cleaned it up with a towel and the towel was black. Gross!  Then we noticed items left from the persons in the rooms before us. One room had a cork under the table the other had a sock on the floor.This was consistent in all three rooms. We had the pet room and was told that you would not get maid service unless you took the dog out of the room. We did this and put the please service sign on the door, we were we gone the morning and most of the afternoon but, no one serviced the room.  The next day we left the dog in the room with the privacy sign and when we returned there was a sign saying they could not service the room but they were leaving clean towels, etc, for us to use. However there was nothing left by the room. I am going to let the Inn know of this maybe it's just a need of meeting or change with their cleaning staff. Location was very good too. It would have almost been perfect if not for the dirtiness.

hotel_name: Best Western Plus Savannah Historic District
review_content: We enjoyed our stay. The staff was helpful and polite, with one exception. This is a tour bus stop so the breakfast room is packed and all of the newspapers are taken by this early crowd. The same breakfast is served daily; if you stay for an extended period of time this gets old.It's right in the middle of the city it's a nice small hotel the staff was extremely friendly the rooms are nice size well-kept it's a nice place to spend a night or two right in the middle of all the action parking lot is small and it's a $15 charge for parkingTheir mottos: Best Western Cares. NOT!The minute we entered the hotel, I start counting how much they cared:1. Customer Service, not friendly.2. Parking lot VERY DIRTY. Can't they even sweep the litters found under the cars?  I'm not talking about leaves!3. The towel holder in our bathroom, screws loose. When a maid put in new towels, neatly folded them like baskets, doesn't she know the towel holder MOVES & CREEKS?4. We have shutters in our bedroom windows, and double wooden doors in our bathroom, Savannah style. I like that!  So, they care a little bit!Wi-Fi slow!
