I should make it 2 stars, but wait until I update after we've had breakfast.UPDATE:  Breakfast not enough fruits to choose from.  They have fresh apples & oranges.  The bathroom, I keep forgetting there's a small fridge under the bathroom counter, and I keep stabbing my toes there!  Ouch!Having never been to Savannah before I didn't really know what to expect. But I would compare this Best Western location to one we stayed at in   New Orleans. Which, because of the price point (which isn't cheap by any means but lower priced than many other hotels in the area) it attracts those that are in town to party it up. I didn't realize that Savannah had that same New Orleans vibe. That party and drink until you are falling down drunk, releaving yourself in public, barfing at the street corner and yelling at the top of your lungs kind of place.They give you a welcome letter that basically states it gets loud and rowdy late into the night and you just have to live with it. And we did experience just that kind of a night. I think the guys in the hotel room just above us were holding  WWE wrestling match in the room all night. I swear I thought the ceiling was going to give way and they were going to land on top of me any minute. So it is what it is, they tell you right up front what to expect (which is not much) when you stay there. Having said that I felt our room was clean and neat. The bathroom was large and spacious. The attendant in the breakfast area kept up with everyone and the area was super clean, food restocked and tables were cleared very fast.  We did take advantage of keeping our car in the hotel parking lot after we checked out until 4:00pm like the policy states that you can. We booked the white trolley bus tour at the front desk and they picked us up right out front. Spent the day touring Savannah and saw a totally different view of the area unlike our previous night's experience, which was nice.We recently stayed at Best Western Plus and were impressed. The staff was friendly and helpful and the room clean and spacious. My only complaint was being able to hear too much street noise as the pub crawlers walked by all night long. We had an end room, so that probably did not help. The beds were comfortable though and I really liked the nice bathrooms as well. Breakfast was more than just continental, offering hot items such as eggs and sausage and make your own waffles. I would definitely consider staying at Best Western Plus next time I am in Savannah.Upon  check in, this hotel appears clean and appealing.  The desk staff was nice and accommodating  but it spirals downhill after that.1. The room was clean except for small details like a hanger and a nail polish  cap under the bed.2.  Garbage  was all over the stairs leading up to the  room, cigarette  butts and dog droppings all in the  bushes.3. Loud outside all night and thin walls= NO SLEEP.4. Security was inside at 12 midnight when we walked by in the lobby in a chair NOT patrolling 5. 15.00 parking PER CARThe hotel is a nice, normal hotel. It's not super fancy, but the rooms are nice and very clean. The location is perfect. You can walk to everywhere you want to be.The highlight of our stay was the concierge, Mary. She told us everything we should see, where it was and the best game plan for seeing it all. We took a trolley tour and she had them pick us up right in front of the hotel. Without her recommendations, our trip probably wouldn't have been as nice.Don't go to the gas station across the street, just don't haha we went and the chocolate milk was expired and it was definitely an interesting environment.Don't let the "plus" tacked on at the end of the name fool you here...this place is a motel. While it wasn't all bad, there were a few things that really bugged me (not literally) about my stay here. So here we go.The Good: The staff I interacted with was very friendly and helpful. I called housekeeping twice, and both times they responded quickly and were very courteous about it. The guy at the front desk also seemed nice. The room was also very clean, so no complaints there. It's also in a great location, within walking distance of most things in the historic district of Savannah. This was awesome, as it saved a lot of hassle trying to track down parking spaces in a city setting, which is one of my least favorite things.The Bad: Speaking of parking, if you book here, be aware that they are going to charge you $15 A DAY to park in the private lot that Best Western owns and is exclusively marked for guests' use only. I could understand if it was a public parking deck or metered or something like that, but it wasn't. Never in my life have I heard of something so ridiculous. And the more I think about it, the more annoyed I get. So let's move on. Also, if you book here, be prepared that it is going to be noisy. In fact, at check in, they pass out a little letter from the general manager, talking about how due to the hotel being on a "party street", they can't offer refunds if you are displeased with the noise level. Which, again, is pretty ridiculous. Welcome to Savannah...they'll give you a refund if your room is "haunted", but not if you don't like a bunch of noisy drunks creating a ruckus outside your room at 3 AM. I almost would have preferred loud drunks to what I ended up with...which was a room on the end beside the pool. As I mentioned before, this is a motel, as in it has no interior walkways and the doors open directly out onto the parking lot. This meant that from about lunchtime until dinner, I was treated to the constant, melodic screaming of children in the pool right outside my room. I don't know if the walls are just made out of paper, or if those particular children were just specially gifted in the lung department, but it was constant, and it was loud. Also, there is a gate that leads into the pool area which apparently has no sort of spring mechanism to keep it from slamming. So it was slammed, repeatedly, throughout the day. And when I say slammed, I mean like it's a good thing I don't suffer from some kind of PTSD, because every time it sounded like a rifle shot.So, in other words, forget being able to nap or relax in any way in your room on your vacation.The Ugly: That's really it. The rooms were actually decorated very nicely, so that's something at least. But you may have to specially request a shower curtain, for some baffling reason.Anyway, for the price point and the location, this is probably a good deal, as long as you are aware of the few caveats beforehand (which I wasn't, but now you are). I doubt I'll be returning.I spent several days at the Best Western Plus during my trip to Savannah. Overall I thought it was great. The location is awesome - it's right on Bay St on the western edge of the Historic District and a block from River St. It's a quick walk to City Market, River St, Lulu's Chocolate Bar, and City Hall. There are several trolley stops within a couple of blocks of the hotel as well. The staff is really nice and accommodating - some more than others but that's anywhere. They have a really nice breakfast with fresh waffles, eggs, sausage, pastries, breads, cereals, oatmeal, grits, fruit, and yogurt. Parking was tight but I never had trouble finding a spot. The hotel is older and the amenities aren't exactly top of the line - but it was fine for me. The pool is small and so is the deck around it. If 6-7 people are there it starts to feel cramped.  I know others have commented on the noise level - but I didn't notice anything overt. Our room was facing the river. The air conditioner struggled to keep the room cool - and at night we usually slept with just sheets because of that. None of these things had a significant impact on my stay and I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Savannah.Stayed here on a quick trip to Savannah with my sister. The location of the hotel is decent. Pretty much walking distance to everything we wanted to see in town. But that's about all there is to this hotel. The complimentary breakfast is worth skipping unless you like cold eggs and hockey puck sausage. The shower water takes forever to get warm. Careful while exiting the shower, there's probably a pool of water on the floor. The room is ok. However I requested to have my sheets changed and they were replaced with sheets with three small yellow stains on them (gross!) The view from your room (if facing the water) is some weird industrial plant, so don't plan on a nice river view. I definitely don't recommend staying here if you're coming with children or looking for a peaceful trip. The other people staying here are noisy and not so friendly. One "gentleman" even urinated in the parking lot right in front of us. Pay the extra money and stay in one of the historic inns. We cancelled our last night here and are staying at the 17hundred90.Meh in between on Best Western.  I find it hard to believe there's no early check in at noon for the place.  I purchased my room on priceline for 2 nights because it was cheaper and because it was on Bay St in the historic district.  It was a room and all I really needed was a bed.  The bathrooms were more up to date than the bedrooms I felt like.  There was a fridge which was appreciated, although in the bathroom, a fitness center and a pool.  Staff was pleasant Cons: $15 for parking a night when you're parking by yourself, they only put one night one my parking pass when I was there for 2, doesn't fit in with the rest of Historic District and looks run down from the outside.  $15 for over priced for parking.Great location.  This was our first time in Savannah we were just driving through and had our dalmatian with us.  This was one of the only hotels we found.  The room was clean and breakfast had a good selection of food.  The downside is that it is a little loud since the street it is on is somewhat busy.  But that was only around the 1am time.  The staff was very friendly.  If you have a dog with you this is a great place.I stayed here recently while visiting Savannah and while the city is fantastic, this hotel could use some work. The location is good, although there are plenty of other hotels in the historic district that are a little bit closer to most of the action. That is, however, a minor gripe that doesn't really affect the 2* rating. The main issue is that the hotel itself feels somewhat run down: the decor in the rooms is pretty awful, the lighting is poor, and worst of all, there is virtually no soundproofing. I stayed on the third floor and could hear almost everything that happened on the street, in the parking lot, and obviously right outside the room. Every time housekeeping came by with a cart, it was like somebody was bowling right outside the room. Also, I was woken up after 1am each night by drunk people stumbling home to their rooms. It was so loud that it sounded like they were standing outside the room with the door open. This was incredibly annoying. I've never stayed anywhere with such poor insulation between the room and the outside world. On a positive note, the staff was very friendly and accommodating with regard to early check in and late check out. Overall, I wouldn't even consider staying here again, as there seem to be plenty of other hotels in the area. They may be a little more expensive (or maybe not), but it's definitely worth spending the little bit of extra money to stay somewhere else if you can afford to do so.The beds are awful. Like sleeping on a bag of lumpy bricks. The beds were not comfortable at all so we could not really sleep. If they put some money into updating their old lumpy mattresses this place could be better. Spent money and was disappointed!Everything was great about the place...UNTIL I left! And noticed that I was covered head to toe in BED BUG BITES!! Not cool. Now I have to make sure I didn't bring any home with me..after I go to the doctor. Can't believe I paid them to leave with a huge problem on my hands and red bites all over my body. And their response when I called to inform them of it, "we'll look into it." Thanks a lot, Best Western. :-(ALSO..my friend stayed in the room next door and suffered the same thing! These were not outdoor bugs, and the doctor confirmed that they were indeed bed bug bites.Terrible experience !  The staff was rude and put false charges on my account.  No manager available to speak to nor did he/she ever return my phone calls.  Lots of homeless people walking the street near this hotel asking for me and/or making noise late into the evening. Pool was dirty.  Will NEVER return.Had a horrible experience here.  The room was dirty and  there were  mosquitos and insect carcasses in the bathroom.  It was quite the necropolis.  The staff was unpleasant.   The area is also sketchy at night.  No security guards in the parking lot and I actually had to tell an unsavory character to buzz off after looking inside my car.We got this deal through groupon.  When we first arrived it took forever to check in.  Parking sucks!  We parked the car and some homeless lady came up to us saying she was hungry so we offered her our leftovers which she denied and asked for cash.We finally got to our room where we had no toilet paper and when we called the front desk they told us to go get it from them.  I'll give them a star because the room was tidy but the horrible customer service!!Stayed here for four nights over Christmas. We arrived at 1pm on Christmas and a room was ready. I requested a room on a high floor on the back side of the hotel, and we only got the high floor part. Luckily we had ear plugs as we knew in advance that noise could be an issue. Our room had 2 double beds, both were springy and small and not that comfy. The bathroom was large, clean, and well lighted. The entire room was clean and kept clean by housekeeping the entire stay. Our room was decorated in a style that matched the area and ours had exposed brick walls and ceiling beams, so that added to the feel. The breakfast in the morning isn't great (coffee, juice, sausage, "eggs," toast, bagels, pastries) and ends at 9:30a, you're better off going to a nearby restaurant. Parking isn't a problem, we always found a spot day or night. It is in the historic district, but it's on the edge close to City Market. Overall the hotel is a great value.Not bad for a holiday weekend. It's not the nicest of the ones available, but it was also not haunted (good or bad, depending what you are looking for). It is still quite walkable to the downtown life, even to the riverfront. It was clean though a little older. I wasn't a fan of the closet like double doors for the bathroom, which offered very little privacy. The bathtub drain was very slow and even after maintenance was called, there wasn't a large improvement. The parking was tight, but there were adequate spaces. Saw the tow truck come and remove at least one vehicle so they're serious about displaying your hotel parking permit. The rooms in the back are still quite noisy when horse drawn carriage routes through the back alley. You can hear pretty much any voice walking by, and the walls are thin (bring ear plugs, or just make sure you have a fun night out so you're so exhausted you can sleep through it all). Never made it to the breakfast- seemed like the hours were quite limited 7-10am and the coffee in the room was fairly terrible (sorry wolfgang puck coffee pods aren't that great)
review_content_20: This hotel is in a great location so you can really walk to everywhere. The rooms are not large but are clean and pleasant. They charge an additional $15 a day for parking. Breakfast was fine and all the staff were helpful and friendly - good value for the price.During my stay at this hotel I saw with my own eyes a bed bug! Please do not stay at this hotel, it has bed bugs, despite what the hotel manager will tell you! Also, our room was extremely dirty when we got there. Thankfully, we were only staying one night, and as soon as I saw the bed bug we left. I had to throw away my suitcases and get my clothes professionally cleaned.Way better than I expected. AMAZING location, super easy for walking. A good amount of parking. The room was pretty large, had a wonderful bathroom, and was still a bit cute and fit with the historic Savannah area. Also there was a fridge, breakfast, and the pet fees weren't too hefty. Staff was friendly and helpful. Room was clean and updated a bit. Great hotel for the price, especially around a busy July 4th.Positives-Friendly, helpful front desk-Mini fridge in room-Complimentary breakfast (although I never woke up in time - ends at 10am)-Location (we were able to walk everywhere)-Free wi-fi-Best price we could find for location ($130/night for Friday/Saturday)Negatives-NOISY (my room was on the back side/facing River St, so maybe the front is better)-Entire fitness center was out of order-Could have been cleaner (there was still an empty Bud Light bottle in the room when we arrived)-$10/day parking (although, I'll take that charge for the location since we never had to move the car)Overall, my experience was fine here. We didn't spend a great deal of time in the room, nor did we want to break the bank, so I felt this place served its purpose.This place was great! Stayed here this past weekend as part of my 24-hour trip to Savannah, GA. The location was great, near city market, and right smack in between congress and river street - everything was in walking distance so we didn't have to use our car once! The room was clean, the beds comfortable and there was free coffee, wifi and a continental breakfast! Definitely worth the $115 we paid - also the parking was cheaper than anywhere else we could find in the area. I have to say that the best part of this hotel is the STAFF. Everyone was so wonderful and friendly, going out of their way to help make sure we had a blast. Kyle M. was such a great, funny host - we had never been to Savannah before so he made sure we had all the information we needed, helped us schedule the trolley tour (and you get a discount!) and gave us information on where the best nightlife/pub crawls are along with the best coffee shop/candy shops in the area. Kudos to Kyle, you made our weekend awesome! Thanks!!!The only downside was how noisy it was at night but then again, it was the weekend before halloween and there were a TON of people out - I was up until about 4am with how loud the street noise. That's the only reason this review gets 4 stars instead of 5.We stayed in a first floor room facing Bay Street for 3 nights. The free internet, continental breakfast and location are all great - but it was SO noisy. I see this (ie: noisiness) is a frequent complaint in reviews for this hotel. Let me extrapolate... every morning around 2-3 AM - it was as if we were on the set of Fast and the Furious - engines being gunned, tires squealing... all that was missing was Vin Diesel and Paul Walker (and then maybe it would've been worth it!).Where to begin.....well, the $12 a day parking fee (soon to be $15) that we weren't made aware of until we got home and checked our bank account. Paper thin walls, lots of noise from the people on either side of us. Room wasn't properly cleaned, there were used tissues under the bathroom countertop visible as soon as we walked into the room. Morning breakfast was dominated by a bus load of students on a tour, no room to sit. We won't be back. It is true...you get what you pay for. We were on a romantic weekend getaway, this experience didn't help.Great place, great location near city market, good price, friendly helpful staff, cleanI stayed here for four nights while in Savannah over Christmas of 2011. FIrst, I'll talk about the bright points. The hotel included a complimentary continental breakfast. The bathroom was awesome and the location could not be beat. However, despite an the excellent bathroom, the room was very dated (circa 1987). It just looked cheap (as the bathroom looked expensive).The staff was friendly but inflexible. We requested a standard room unaware that it would include 2 beds. Myself and my partner do not need two beds, but they told us that a change was non-negotiable. The hotel has not interior stairs which leaves your room vulnerable to a bugs (even at Christmas!). They charged $10 per day for parking which seems odd given that the hotel is designed like a traditional motel (no interior walls, low rise, surrounded by a parking lot). Motels always have free parking (motel = "motor hotel"). I am of the opinion that you shouldn't charge for parking if you don't have interior hallways. I don't like the moniker Best Western "Plus" as there were more minuses than pluses. It wasn't a bad experience, but I didn't feel like I got a premium quality stay.I was expecting a cheap beat up motel. That was not the case at all with this place. The room was spacious and very clean. The bathroom was great as well. All in all the price was right and the place was nice. We also got our Shih Tzu with us, he was able to stay in the room for only $20 (per stay) unlike the Marriott which charges $70 for my little tiny pooch to come along!Free wi-fi and coffee in the room. Oh and they also have breakfast (I didn't wake up for it)NOTE: If you're looking for a place with a big "Promenade" on the front, you may be confused at first. This is actually a Best Western, so look for that and you're golden. The word "Promenade" is on a mini wall at the Southwest corner of the parking lot.That said, this is a very nice, clean, and friendly place to stay if you're in Savannah's Historic District. I can't say I'm a fan of the price range, but then again it's in the middle of everything and right near the City Market area.Be warned though - the walls between rooms are VERY thin and not at all soundproof. You can hear low-key conversations, let alone yelling (and if you're unfortunate as I was, loud, bad sex). I had to call the front desk numerous times to get the people next door to quiet the hell down at 2 in the morning. At least the receptionist was sweet and prompt about it. So keep that in mind if you don't want people to overhear your conversations (or sex).It's a bit of a walk if you want to visit the South and Eastern parts of the city like Forsyth Park, but there's a nice walk along River Street just a hop North from the hotel where you can find a bunch of neat (though tourist-focused) shops. I wouldn't walk around the city at night though...many of the streets are dark and kinda creepy, and very few people are out. I'd be extra careful, just in case.Back on topic: Overall I'd say the staff certainly made a good impression. I'd recommend the place to someone who doesn't mind the price. And thin walls. :pOh, and they get extra points because you can keep your car in the parking lot until 5pm on the day you check out, in case you want to do any last minute sightseeing.Service: 9Condition: 9 (best under $100.00 in Savannah)Atmosphere: 8 (easy walk to river st. and ellis sq.)Value: 9I wish there was a way to place 0 stars for this hotel. Rooms smell like wet dog and moved to another room, same smell and not very clean. Beds are old and disgusting. This is not worthy for the plus hotel they advertise. I've never paid for parking at a BW. The price was the same as the Westin that is a 5 star resort hotel I had to cancel the rest of my stay and move to the Westin. Staff acted like they didn't care but, at least the manager comped the room and followed up by email. Just don't stay here....Yelp find!!!Erica R. and I were in Florida and at the last minute we decided we wanted to stay the night in Savannah instead of driving all day to North Carolina. I went on yelp and found this little beauty. Booked it on the spot. The Good:-great price-great location, right in the historic district near the river front. -easy to find-newly remodeled rooms with flat screen tv and comfortable beds-nice big bathroom- friendly staff... got to love that southern hospitality!-very good contiental breakfastThe Bad:-noisy -small hotel rooms (not really a bad nor a good thing)-big spider on my pillow (not a fan of spiders!)Overall, I would stay here again if ever in Savannah, Georgia!Excellent customer  service ! Good price most of all Pet Friendly!This is a very nice hotel!! I am impressed with the service and the hospitality of this place. It also is just minutes walking to River Street!! I definitely recommend this hotel!!We picked this place from a billboard on I-75. We lucked out. The price was right, the bed was king-sized, the tv a flat-panel 30". The renovations must be finished because we saw no trace of that. The room was typical size, but the bathroom was nice and roomy, with a huge mirror, marble on the floor and tub wall, and fancy maroon wallpaper; the overall effect looked '5-star', even if it is structurally a motel. Nice fluffy white towels and lots of 'em. I agree about the ugly beige fake brick walls in the bedroom, but the lamps were way cool, with on-off rocker switches and a grounded outlet on the base. I didn't have to search for an outlet to plug in my laptop or phone charger, usually the case in other motels.The Promenade is in the northwest corner of town, a short walk from the River Street / Bay Avenue attractions. The wi-fi was a little slow but it worked better than my DSL at home, go figure. Very friendly, helpful staff. Unlike a previous reviewer, we were not charged to park our car, but given a notice that a fee would be charged for more than one car per room. I would stay at The Promenade again. Savannah itself is a bit seedier in general that I would have thought. Granted, it is a very old city, so most of the buildings in town are not new. Some are renovated, some not. In the River Street area there were several men who appeared to be homeless, just sitting around quietly. You could tell they had not bathed, had a haircut, changed clothes nor had regular meals in a while. That kind of thing is unfortunate for those people, and never makes a city 'inviting', but then what city doesn't have that nowadays, sadly.The bottom of the bunch... they try their best but it's an old 'open balcony' style motel with updated furnishings. Someone drops something in one room and it's felt and heard in EVERY adjoining room. And the doors to the room leak air allowing small 'flat-winged' flying insect to get in... and annoyingly  fly around all the lamps. But the price is slightly lower than all of the much newer hotels nearby. and guaranteed they will be fill- up, so if you thought you'd want to stay here call beforehand.They're currently renovating, which means rates are cheaper, the outside is uglier, and between about 10am and 5pm there's some construction noise. For the actual room, it was not an issue.One thing that really impressed me was how damn soft the towels were. Maybe i stayed in Motel 6 too much in my road tripping days, but Promenade's towels were lovely and very white and soft.My room was clean, the beds were soft but not saggy, the pillows were fluffy, and housekeeping respected my 'Do Not Disturb' tag. The only weird thing was the plastic fake brick on one of the walls in the room, i'm not sure why they wasted money on it because it looked pretty bad. There's free wi-fi, but it's slow.Supposedly there's also a free hot breakfast buffet, but due to construction they were offering a cold brown-bag breakfast that contained a muffin, a little tub of yogurt, and an apple. This was especially unappetizing, as the bags were not refrigerated, so by 9am the yogurt was probably pretty nasty.The yogurt knocks a quarter star off, the fake brick is another quarter star deduction, and the remaining half star deduction is for the fact that when i woke up at 7:something each morning, i had to leave the faucet in the tub running for 10 minutes before the water got remotely hot. It was especially uncool the morning i overslept.I was surprised by the quality of this hotel. From the outside it has the look of the old motor inns that dot the highways but the room was as well appointed as the higher quality brands that surround it. The rate was a remarkable bargain compared to surrounding hotels (well under $100 even with the additional $10 fee for parking) and the location in Savannah's historic district was stellar with easy access to a welth of great places to eat.A NOTE TO BEST WESTERN: It's time to create a premium brand. This is twice that I have been surprised by the quality of one of your properties. I was hesitant to drive into the parking lot because I expected the old Best Western but found instead a new product. Holiday Inn Express? W by Westin? You are a new brand. Time to reflect it.
review_content_40: Awful, we could not sleep because of several drunk guests.  Not the friendly kind of drinking, but the angry aggressive kind.  The hotel says it has security but they must have called in sick that night because there were several arguments in the parking lot, and in the rooms. It was the most disturbing experience.  In the morning I did see that the room came with a white noise machine, so apparently this happens often, but we should have been told to use it.  Don't waste your money there are much better places to stay. Also, the room smelled like mold.Somewhat bleak but very well located, clean and cheapwell I think I got a good price....maybe i didn't....who knows....i thought i did...that's what matters!!!lovely place, bland exterior but cozy inside with fake plants and typical hotel furnishing.  nicely organized nonetheless and really quite pleasant lobby.the rooms too are very pleasant and clean and amenities great. shit did I forget to leave a tip. I just remember now.....i am so ashamed!!! but that's what happen when you had a sleepless night before getting up at 5am to catch bus to airport....i couldn't even remember my mom's name....at that time...anyway, very nice people. lovely place. you should go there!!I enjoyed my experience at the Promenade, except I thought it was weird that they charged us extra to park our car there while we were paying to stay in a room. I THINK THAT IS LAME! Otherwise, its reasonablly priced, especially for the location. Its just around the corner from W. River St, and near City Market. One of our nightly walks consisted of crusing down to Wet Willies, getting a Call a Cab to go and then sitting on a bench on the waterfront, drinking and listening to bluegrass street performers.   Back to the hotel. The rooms are very clean and well decorated, it was recently renovated.  We had a giant king size bed with lots of pillows and a big flat screen tv. Also the bathrooms are very nice, with alot of counter space and big mirrors.  I appreciated the refrigerator in the room so we could have cold water.  We enjoyed the complimentary breakfast and the pool was fun to jump in after a morning walk around downtown Savannah. We walked to all the different squares, and admired the trees and beautiful houses. Savannah is so pretty. There is alot to explore.yes there is still construction going on, and when we checked in and went up to our room they were ripping the molding off the windows, so we went back down and they sent us up to another room so we get there and someone was working in there! tired, after our trip down we kind of kicked the guy out. The hotel is nice and their renovations are coming along well. this hotel is located right by the other 4-5 star hotels in town and is about a 2-3 minute walk to the river front which really comes in handy if you've been hitting up all the bars there. you can pretty much walk all of the historic district from this hotel and we didn't use our car the whole time besides to go over to Tybee Island the concierge was more than helpful and such a sweet sweet southern lady! ( YAY Mrs. Mary!!!), and they have a computer in the lobby as well for people without computer access who need to look up directions. This hotel is great for it location to river street as well as the historic district.Horrible motel.  Housekeeping was the worst!  "making the bed" consisted of throwing the bedspred up.. not straightening it or really making the bed.  Towels were not replenished. One day they picked up the towels off the floor and rolled them back up and put them in the bathroom like they were new but they were damp and wrinkled from our morning showers.  Another day there were no towels at all in the room!.. When we called down to the desk to find out why they just said "oh, we're doing laundry.. we'll get some to you later".  Front desk also thought it was a riduculous request that we wanted an ice bucket liner when they threw the old one out.  Customer service was very lacking and the worst housekeeping I've ever seen.  The only nice thing about the place is the location.. and they new-er furniture.  I don't even mind the exterior doors (although they don't really point that out on their site).  The place has potential but it is run so poorly it's ridiculous.  There are plenty of other hotels (and motels) in the same area (same block even) that are much better from the looks of them.  I have also stayed at the Courtyard in that same area.. it was a million times better!

review_content: All I can say is WOW!  This is one of the nicest hotels I have had the pleasure of staying with.  So many plus points here.  The hotel is beautiful and seems very new.  The staff is super nice, everyone welcomes you and works hard to make sure you are happy.  Value - our stay was $189 a night and well worth every penny.  As many have reviewed there are two great extras for the value - breakfast buffet is awesome with the eggs made to order a huge win and the daily happy hour from 5:30-7:30 includes free beer, wine and well drinks.  The sangria was excellent.  Also included in the happy hour was snacks which included cheese & crackers, multiple chips and dips and fresh veggies.  Amenities at the hotel were also top notch from the outdoor heated pool, excellent gym equipment and a nice outdoor gas powered fire pit.  Free on-site parking garage is also a huge plus and then there's the location, on the western side of the historic district you are now more than a 20 minute walk from all the restaurants, clubs and shops.  The visitor center is a couple blocks away as well as all the trolley tours which you can get picked up right at the hotel and dropped off at the end.  Concierge was very helpful, booked trolley tour right at the front desk and answered all my questions.  The front desk staff knew our names and greeted me, my wife and son every time we walked past.  So friendly and professional.  I feel we got a tremendous value for our 3 night stay and we will be back again, hopefully soon!!Embassy suites Savannah historical districtThis Embassy suites was a friendly place to stay in this friendly city. The people at the front desk were so nice. We started out in room 544, but left the next morning because of the noisy air compressor on the roof above our room. Adeina was so helpful in getting us moved to a fabulous room, 337, very quiet and the biggest living room I've ever seen in a hotel suite.In the course of moving from one room to another, we left behind a cushion we had brought from home. It took four calls to the front desk to try to locate it, but Ginny was the one who finally solve the problem.When it came time to check out, I chatted with Ro, who is so nice, and Adeina again. I told I told them my favorite traveling pants had also gone missing in the move. (Adeina called me a few hours later to tell me that my pants had been found and that the hotel would mail them to my house. She made my day!)As we packed up the car in front of the hotel, Blue, the valet, came out to chat with us. What a nice guy!The hotel suite was lovely. In addition to the large living room, there was also a very large bathroom, with the toilet in the separate alcove. The shower has fabulous water pressure.Shower safety tip: once you soap up, the tub gets super slippery, so put a hand towel on the floor of the tub after you get wet but before you pick up the soap. The towel remains in place and provides traction.Happy Hour in the lobby included veggies, homemade-tasting potato chips and an open bar. After a big day of sightseeing, it was nice to go downstairs for a drink and a snack and not have to go out to dinner. For those tired travelers who want dinner, there's a French restaurant off the lobby.It's also worth mentioning that this hotel is well located. We were able to walk everywhere from the hotels -- Oglethorpe square to start our architectural walking tour with Jonathan Stalcup, the Owens-Thomas house, the Jepson Center, Leopold's Ice Cream on Braughten Street, the riverfront, Telfair academy, and the Collins Quarter Restaurant on Bull Street and Bella Napoli Italian Bistro across from Oglethorpe Square.The location of the hotel is right on the edge of the historic district, but still conveniently located. The service was very friendly, both at check-in and at the bar/restaurant. The room was clean and roomy enough. The WiFi also worked well.LOVED this ES. Seriously gorgeous and has a parking garage as well. Close to Riverwalk, downtown and the freeway. While we were just passing through, I could picture staying here for a girls weekend or little family getaway. It's a great value - lots of space for everyone, breakfast (pretty good - omelets to order, etc) and service was wonderful.If you're looking for a suite with a little more room to spread out then you can definitely do worse than this place. First, the location. While it says 'Historic District', please note that this place is at the very outer edge of the historic district. You can still walk to most destinations and the extra distance and additional calories burned may be a good thing when in Savannah. The room was clean and quiet and had everything you'd expect for a hotel chain. The free breakfast was better than average, but the free drinks/snacks in the evening were a bit disappointing. Oh and the floor in the food area was ALWAYS STICKY.Great hotel in an even better location. The staff was friendly and the property was nice.We arrived at the hotel around midday, where we were efficiently checked in by Wendy, who also proved to be most helpful and courteous throughout our stay. The room itself is as advertised, with a small but adequate fridge and microwave oven.  Our room was freshly decorated, clean and tidy. My only slight gripe was the somewhat noisy a/c fan. Fortunately the bathroom fan could be switched on/off independently from the light.  The weekday manager's nightly special is a nice touch and safety deposit boxes are available at reception. The hotel itself is situated on the edge of town but within easy walking distance of all the main touristy areas and restaurants (The Grey is just round the corner). The Old Savannah tour bus also stops at the hotel which makes it much easier to get around if you are feeling lazy or its raining cats and dogs. I would most definitely stay here again.I am Embassy Suites loyal and whenever I get the chance to visit one of their hotels, I jump at it.  I knew that this location would be nice, based on how new it was.  I can honestly say that this was the nicest Embassy Suites that I have ever been to.The sprawling lobby is very welcoming.  The valet and check in staff were extremely friendly and they allowed me to check in hours before the normal check in time.  Our room was pretty standard for an ES room.The happy hour was fabulous (5:30 - 7:30).  Free beer, wine, liquor, and snacks.  Normally the snacks consist of gold fish or chips and salsa.  This location had nachos with chili cheese and even some cole slaw to feast on.  There was a roaring fire in the lobby, which was nice to relax near.The breakfast was great, as well, with all of the normal breakfast offerings.  This hotel was a bit more expensive than some of the other local chain hotels, but it was worth every penny!This Embassy is one of the newest and by far a superior choice when staying in Savannah. Here is a breakdown of the overall quality of this stunning property.Service: Staff is superb! Becki in the bar is one of the most friendly and attentive bartenders I have ever experienced. The front desk staff is super efficient and all pitch in to help out.Housekeeping/Cleanliness- fresh, clean, spotless. Staff is friendly and attentive the upmost detail.Internet: Great speedBreakfast: made to order/chef prepared omelette, sliced fruits, fresh Danish.Thank you for the amazing time!Managers reception had some decent selections on snacks. Beer on tap was Dos Equis Amber or Miller Lite. They had some sangria but it was a little weak. The breakfast was great, good omelet, and plenty of options. Coffee was slightly weak. Kids running around unsupervised is my biggest pet peeve but that's something the hotel can't handle. Room was spacious and clean. Comfortable bed. Directv in the room. Soap was super moisturizing. Not the biggest fan of the decor but it's standard for all Savannah hotels. Parking was $15 but super easy and convenient. Location in relation to downtown wasn't bad. Our longest walk was 15mins to Rocks off the Bohemian. Tl;dr: would recommend.I had an unfortunate experience at an Embassy Suites in Nashville Tennessee 1 year ago (January 2015).   I was traveling for 30 days on business.  The bottom line is the room was very dirty, and moldy, it was bad.  They tried 2 more rooms, more of the same, so I left after 5 days of my 30 day stay and found a clean hotel.  For the inconvenience, I was sent a Be My Guest certificate for one complimentary stay at an Embassy Suites.  Fast forward to today, January 2016 (1 year later) I wanted to use the Be My Guest Certificate, not for myself but for my close friends, who are celebrating their 25th wedding anniversary.  We all live in Tampa, but they wanted to go to Savannah Georgia (the Oglethorpe location).  I offered them the Be My Guest certificate for one night, and they were going to PAY for the second night.  Unfortunately, after I called the hotel in Savannah, I called the central reservation number, I called the corporate office, I was transferred over 4 times, told several times that the person I was speaking to was unfamiliar with a Be My Guest certificate and was finally told the ONLY person that can use the certificate is me.  I found this ridiculous. I called customer service, I was told the same thing.  I made as many calls as I possibly could, and I was told by Necholle Brown in corporate "You accepted the certificate!"  I am just confused as to why I could not give this to my friends, who were going to also pay for an additional night.  I talked to Jennifer Reeves at the Savannah Embassy Suites, she was so kind, trying everything to make this work for us, but she was also told no by her manager Wendy.   Unfortunately, this has created a second negative experience.  I have only had 2 experiences with Embassy Suites, but they will be my last.  I do not want any more free night certificates or tokens of any kind, since my situation clearly shows that customer service in not a priority.  I am writing this so that maybe it will inspire Embassy Suites to put the customer back on top.    It seems penny wise, and pound foolish from a business perspective.A terrific, albeit pricey 4 night stay in a comfortable suite that's walking distance to everything in the historic district.  I was a little surprised to have to pay extra for parking considering I had already paid a very hefty price for the room.  The pillows leave a lot to be desired - too soft and just flatten to a pancake, otherwise, the bed is fairly comfortable, even for someone who is used to an adjustable sleep number bed.The manager's reception is a refreshing welcome to the hotel each late afternoon/early evening, drinks on the house and light snacks to munch on while chatting with the staff, management, family or simply watching some football at the bar.  The staff is friendly but may sometimes be a little overzealous when it comes time to clear half empty glasses from a table.  More than once I looked up to watch the game to later look down and find my beverage had been cleared from the table without my knowing it.The "made to order" breakfast is simply a buffet with an option to ask the cooks to make specific omelettes or eggs done a specific way.  Get there either very early or sometime after 9:30 AM because from 8ish to 9:30ish it's almost impossible to find a place to sit down and eat.Overall, a nice stay.We had a great experience here. Pros: nice large suitesComplimentary breakfast barComplimentary happy hour! And light snacksNice and quietCons: hotel hallway and musty smellTrash cans in parking deck had huge trail of ants Breakfast was kinda cold Can't walk to historic downtown.This hotel was amazing!  The breakfast was great, the evening reception included all drinks and yummy hoes-d'ouerves.  The room service was awesome, the staff was friendly, and the concierge was very information for our first trip to Georgia.  I will stay here again for sure.  And shout out to the amazing wait staff and bartender.By far 5 stars! I've stayed in a lot of hotels and this was by far the best. Registration was seamless, the room was excellent. First hotel stay where I wasn't awakened at 2am by slamming doors or people giggling in the hall. Complementary breakfast was great and had a wide variety, happy hour with complementary beer, wine and light snacks. Parking was a bit much $15 per day, but in a downtown location you can almost expect it. A+This hotel deserves 4.5 stars. The only things missing are safes in the room, along with being one block away from MLK Blvd. In spite of those two items, this is unlike any Embassy Suites I've ever seen--it's a first-class hotel barely in a less-than-desirable neighborhood. Having said that, we didn't feel the least bit uncomfortable walking to/from our hotel, even after dark.The suites are large, newly appointed, and clean. There are two large-screen (48"?) HDTV's in each suite. The bedding is very comfortable.Free breakfast is included in the price of the room, and it includes just about anything you could want. Free self-parking is about 25' from the hotel, with limited access by room card. In short, you get a lot for your money at this hotel.We picked this hotel due to its location relative to the Savannah historic district and due to the fact that it was an Embassy Suites. When I used to travel on business - I frequently stayed at Embassy Suites and always found them to be exceptionally nice hotels.  This hotel is relatively new, very clean, very quiet and very well maintained.  The complimentary breakfast at an Embassy Suites is not only hot but includes eggs and omelets cooked to order, bacon, sausage, pastries, oatmeal and cereal and selection of juices.  And there's an evening reception (5:30 - 7:30) that includes complimentary beer and wine with a selection of light appetizers.The hotel is about  1/2 mile from the historic River Street district and you can easily walk from River St to the hotel in 15-20 minutes.  The City of Savannah also runs a free shuttle (there is a boarding stop in the transit center across from the hotel and another at the visitor's center which is only a block away). The only downside to the shuttle is that it only runs until 9:00 - so if you want to have dinner down by the River District - you may need to walk back.This was the worse experience at a hotel one could ever have. It has taken me over a week since we've left to type this review because I was so upset. Upon checking in, Jessie was superb! Thereafter, just awful. We're not familiar with the area so you depend on the staff for directions to venues and restaurants. When asked where a restaurant was, the response was, over there down the street. Wait a minute, what? Then we asked how to get to Savannah Riverboat? The reply, across the street at the Dot. What is a Dot?? At this point, my expectations of this hotel hit rock bottom. We decided to drive. Savannah Riverboat made me feel a whole lot better. I was extremely satisfied with them!! We get back to the hotel to rest a bit, but then became hungry so we called room service. It was 10:50pm. The reply, room service is close. On their menu, it says close at 11pm. It was 10:50pm. So they close before 11pm. So now, I can't wait to check out!! They tried to apologize, but the damage was already done!! Never again Embassy!!Clean, close to City Market (about a 5-10 minute walk). Pricey but we had points to cover the entire price. The managers reception was awesome, the breakfast was amazing, they let us do a late check out since it was our anniversary.  I have no regrets staying here....and would stay again for a special occasion!Very friendly staff and clean rooms.  It was my husband's  birthday and they went out of their way make sure that his stay was special!
review_content_20: Overall, this was a good place for us, tucked away from the hustle of the city, which is great with a toddler.  The walls were probably nice and thick, too, as there were other kids staying on our floor and we only saw (and heard) them in the hallways and not from our room.  That said, you really gotta work hard to earn those stars, people...3 stars for: good for kids and family, quiet area, friendly and helpful front desk staff.Not 5 stars because: not a "short walk" from the main Savannah Historic District.  You really are on the outskirts.  I'm sure in a few years this neighborhood will provide more for the traveler, as there was a lot of construction going on nearby.Really NOT 5 stars because: the restaurant "opened" for the evening at 5pm.  Meaning, you could order from the menu at that time.  Expect, however, to wait up to 45 minutes for the cook to actually cook your food.  It was difficult to find wait staff in their restaurant.  One day we inquired about the lunch hours for the restaurant and were told "the gas ovens are being worked on right now so there's no lunch today."  Um... okay.  No sign, no letting guests know, nothing?  We didn't mind heading out for our meals and greatly appreciated daily breakfast, but they shouldn't have the only restaurant in the hotel closed (nevermind cooking later than published dinner hours) without notice.  This was the biggest thing for us.Super nice rooms and common areas.  Close to everything.  Parking is very close, so self-park is not a problem.  The room is beautiful.  Had a few problems with tv and shower rod on checkin, but fixed immediately.  Sometimes slow to answer the phone at the desk, but no matter.  Concierge is very informative.  Totally recommend this place.Breakfast as advertised all week long for us.  No issues.Firstly, the breakfast sucked. They were out of ham for omelets, sugar, ketchup, and orange juice. The breakfast is free, but there is a reason. They said they were waiting on the truck to arrive. The chef personally told us he didn't know how to make oatmeal (thick as a brick). My omelet was so greasy that after one bite, I couldn't eat it. I swear it must have been made with margarine or something because I have never had that taste. Rooms were very clean. There is an extensive room service menu. There is a downstairs bar and restaurant (get a free drink from 4-5pm for happy hour). Location was right on the border of ghetto and Savannah. It is a hard hotel to find for sure (had to use a GPS every time). Be wary of walking around outside at night. Bed is not a foam mattress, so not awesome. It is very clean just not the best bed. Because of the location, we would not come back.This review sums up 3 or more stays at this hotel.  First, the hotel just opened in early 2014 I believe, so the common areas are a modern design with open large entrances, a spacious bar and nice leather seating areas.  Second, the pool area, while I did not use it, I did make a close examination and it is well executed in courtyard mode on the ground floor.  Also stationed around the corner from the pool is a cozy open raised fire-pit which takes the chill off those cozy days and nights when perhaps you want to be outside and read a book or just relax and absorb the warmth on your feet.  Third, the rooms are a well designed suite configuration with a small bar area, built in college-style fridge, sink and storage.   The small fridge seems to be one of the newer frost-free models which means no caked ice from the prior occupant but the downside is these did not seem to chill as well as I'm accustom to.  I like my beverages COLD and I'd say these were chilled.  The rooms I've hit also have a large desk and comfortable couch separated from the bedroom areas with doors that block the noise and light if the kids perhaps want to stay up while you crash.  Your configuration may vary.  The bathroom is also separated from the bedroom and seating areas by SOLID doors, so no issues there.  The bathrooms have twin sinks, and a walk-in roomie glass-walled shower.  The tidiness level is spotless. As for the included accommodations, the wi-fi worked well, no issues were noted on any trip with pickup or speeds.  The included HOT breakfast has been awesome almost every time.  Full service omelets if you like or self-serve eggs, bacon, ham, oatmeal, flaky biscuits, fresh melon or seasonal fruits, bagels, cereals, gravy, milk, OJ, beverages and fresh hot brewed coffee. Easily, THIS is one of the BEST hot breakfast meals I've ever had included with the room fee.  My guess, if you buy this locally, a breakfast of this caliber will easily set you back $15 per person so that helps when traveling with families!  The only breakfast issue I've ever had, which was in September, and is summed up as a matter of bacon preference - wiggly or crispy?   One morning ALL the bacon was "uber limpy" and there was not a crispy piece to be found anywhere.  But to the staff's credit, they realized that no one was actually taking the bacon and replaced the entire tray promptly with another pan with much better selections!  The wait staff has always been prompt to clear the used plates and deliver the special order omelets.  My suggestion would be to place the staff tip jar in a more visible location rather than way over in the bar area because there it is missed more often than it should based on the great services. There is also a multi-level parking deck adjacent to the hotel so you do not have to fight the street parking.  The charge is $15 / day which is not out of line compared to comparable and larger metro areas.  Overall, this is my favorite hotel to stay at in Savannah if you want a bit quieter location and do want to be caught up in the more touristy riverfront crowds.   However, it is a quick cab ride or not an impossible walk (plot it beforehand) to reach the riverfront area or the main downdown.  This is also an ideal hotel to stay in when delivering studens to SCAD as it is close to campus with several of the major lower-classmen dorms only a couple of blocks away.  The room pricing is high-moderate depending on how much you value and use the included amenities, especially that awesome breakfast!  Overall 4.5 with the benefit of the doubt for the excellent staffing. Cheers.950 bucks for 5 days.  With that you get free breakfast.  This is not some lame breakfast.  You have your choice of 30 items, coffee, fruit, soda and juice.  ALL FRESHLY COOKED.  If that is not enough for you , they will make you an omelet...Whatever you want.  All you have to do is ask.  Every night from 5 to 7    FREE drinks at the bar.  On top of all this it is clean, fancy, the people that work there are OVER THE TOP NICE AND PROFESSIONAL.  Who ever manages this place needs a raise and bonus.  I am still here right now, leaving Tuesday.  I wish I was staying for 2 weeks.  What a great place.My Family and I enjoyed 3 wonderful nights at the Embassy Suites,Our home away from home!!!I'm glad we stayed here.It was quiet; being a few blocks away from Bay Street was well worth being able to sleep past 6AM, which is when the big trucks start rumbling to and from the docks. We were still close enough to everything that we walked exclusively, though our legs did get a little sore from the exercise.The room was comfortable. The bed was fantastic and the second room useful as my husband likes to wake earlier, whereas I'd prefer to sleep in a little.It was clean. No odors, nothing old or dated. The little details, including the upscale furniture and granite counter-tops, made me feel like I was truly on vacation.  Even the shampoo and conditioner were great, and I bring my own because I'm picky.The breakfast was nice, but slightly limiting as a vegetarian. My only source of protein was eggs, and while cooked-to-order eggs and omelettes is really nice, I got sick of eggs after a few days. Other than eggs, it was fried potatoes, biscuits, and a plethora of other starches. I'd have been over-the-moon if they had anything veggie-specific. Even just a frozen veggie-sausage pattie that they threw on the griddle for me instead of an egg.The evening reception was nice, even though we only hit it up once. All-you-can-drink well drinks, plus pretzels, vegetables, tortilla chips and dips. Not a bad way to spend a few hours. My husband and I sat on the couches and read, and the manager (Justin, I believe), was unbelievably attentive. He swung past asking if we wanted more drinks, and after that he automatically brought us new drinks as we finished ours.The pool was clean, but small. No swimming laps, or even really swimming at all. It was a nice place to sit outside and read, though. A hot-tub would have been dynamite, especially after our sore legs from hours of walking, but you can't get everything you want.After walking around and seeing countless other hotels and inns, I'm very happy with the Embassy Suites and would stay here again in a heartbeat if ever I find myself back in Savannah.Great suits for families. Clean and plenty of room.  Bfest was hit and offered more than most.  Good access to downtown. About a mile to middle if historic area.  But here is why they get five stars.  When we had the do not disturb sign hung on the door they put clean towels on the door.  Whoever thought of that needs a raise.I gave this place only two stars for a variety of reasons.  First, the location is deceiving.   It's on the fringe of downtown.  It borders the projects which might not be comfortable for everyone.   Second, they seemed more interested in keeping riff-raff out than keeping customers in.  We have 3 kids and we needed a roll away bed for one of our kids.  They apparently don't have those.  REALLY!!!  Every other hotel we've been to has had rollaway beds.  Its my opinion they're afraid of people packing mass amounts of people in their rooms.  Third, they only had one valet who also did room deliveries,  so you never could get your car when you needed it.The positives include a really nice gym and an overall clean facility.This is a beaituful hotel. Good location. Quiet and comfortable. Very good complimentary breakfast. We requested no perfume or air freshener in our room and it was pretty whiffy. They swore up and down it hadn't been sprayed so perhaps this was leftover from the day before, but it bothered my allergies a lot, I coughed and wheezed all night. Windows didn't open, no way to air it out.We got in late after a long day driving so ordered room service. Not very good, really pricey for what it was and there was a service charge on top of that. Ventilation blew right onto the bed. Couldn't get out of the draft. Noisy too. The next day when we got up I had 15 flea bites on my feet and ankles. I had taken off my socks and shoes because my feet were puffy from sitting in the car for many hours and spent about an hour on the couch, that's when it happened. I complained and they said they'd call their bug man. No offer of any kind of compensation. Not going back here!We stayed here for a 3 day getaway in savannah and we were delighted with this hotel! The ambiance is lush. The style is beach chic. Everything from the plush towels to the granite counters in the bathroom really make you feel like you're staying in luxury. You are within walking distance to everything! But the trolley tours start right next to the hotel if you'd rather ride. The complimentary reception was fun! An array of house drinks was offered and the house red was tasty.We had dinner in the restaurant. Fried green tomatoes were very well seasoned and crispy. The tomato bisque, however,  was bitter. The Baja fish tacos were very good. Spicy with fresh cilantro. My husbands mahi mahi was cooked perfectly. The cook to order breakfast is spot on and the staff are very friendly.We couldn't recommend this hotel more!This place was wonderful! It is beautiful and clean! Loved the location and the southern hospitality. They go above and beyond to help you get anywhere you need to go. The food and snacks for the manager's reception were exceptional and better than  any embassy suites that I have been to nationwide. You can't beat a free breakfast with southern delicacies. Thank youThis Embassy Suites was awesome! The staff are so kind and helpful and the rooms are spacious, clean, and beautiful. We were there for a wedding weekend. The whole experience was made even better by this wonderful hotel. Keep up the great work!!Good hotel to stay at. The staff were great. The room was nice. Our fridge didn't work, and we called but to no avail they didn't come fix it. They were having problems with the ac unit as well. Maybe just a bad day. They offer free appetizers and drinks for a couple hours each day in the evening. Their breakfast is killer as well. Besides maintenance, our stay was delightful.The Embassy Suites in Savannah was amazing. We stayed here one night as part of a 3 day road trip. It was perfect location to walk to dinner and shopping. The parking was in a garage, and easy to access. The room was HUGE! So comfortable and beyond clean. The staff at the Embassy Suites deserves 5 stars too! Everyone was incredibly polite, helpful, and extremely assertive. It's a bit pricey, but worth it! The breakfast was fresh and had lots of variety. The evening reception was great, very spacious environment, so you could enjoy the company of those you sat with, verse other hotels where its very crowded.Fantastic new hotel. Seems they are really bending over backwards to be top notch. Facilities very pretty and brand new. Large suites. Walk in showers. Delicious huge breakfast. I usually never eat free breakfast in these hotels but this was exceptional. Made to order omelets that we're better than I've had in expensive restaurants. Fantastic place worth the money.The nicest and most well kept hotel that I've ever stayed at. Everything about it was top notch. But, it was the hotel staff that made all the difference. Mindy was the one who took my reservation for the group of people who were going to come there for our reunion. She worked with me on everything from March until the end of September when we had the reunion. I was very pleased with the way that Mindy took care of me. There were several people who I want to mention who really made me and the other people who came to the reunion, feel very welcome and very well taken care of. Justin would be the one who I would say did the most to make sure that I was very well taken care of. Jason, Chris the bartender, Patrice, LaVonda, Ashley, Jeff, Karen, Blue, Maurice, Jasmine the cleaning lady, and John at night were very nice. There were others , but I didn't know their names. I was so impressed that I have told everyone I met and know how wonderful my stay was there.Rob H is my pen name. My name is Greg.I booked a king suite with a sofa bed for the kids. After arriving in Savannah we drove around for a while looking for parking without success. Check in wasn't until 4 pm, but we decided to try anyway. Well we lucked out! They didn't have a room ready, but let us park in the hotel lot (for a daily fee), and took our bags, so we didn't have to worry about leaving them in the rental. They told us the room would be ready in an hour or two, and recommended a good nearby restaurant for lunch, The Distillery. Just as we were finishing lunch we got a call from the hotel that the room was ready. Perfect! When we got there we found that we had been upgraded to the two bedroom suite, with a king bed for me and my wife, and two queen beds for the kids. The room was HUGE, with a living room/kitchenette area, and TWO bathrooms. The beds were comfy with feather pillows. Everything was immaculately clean. The breakfast in the morning was made to order and yummy. We also went to the evening happy hour for free drinks. OK it wasn't top shelf liquor, but they had Dos Equis on tap so I was happy. It was one of our BEST hotel experiences. No one wanted to check out, so they gave us a late checkout. Bonus!All I have to say is this hotel has far exceeded our expectations in every manner. As my husband and I pulled up to the hotel we were a bit worried since it is across the street from a greyhound station but this embassy suites is just jaw dropping. I love the fact that there is a nice parking garage right next to the hotel for us to park into and we could do valet but there seemed to be no point. The hotel front desk let us check in early and we were able to go out immediately and start enjoying Savannah. I was excited to find out that in addition to the free awesome breakfast that embassy suites has, this location also has free drinks and lite food from 530-730pm. This made our day since our dinner reservations are not until 930pm so we will not be starved by the time we go to eat. The rooms are gorgeous and very spacious. We will plan on staying here again I the near future and will be bringing family :)Be careful of what you leave in the room.  I had an iPad stolen out of the room.  When I reported it missing, the housekeeping staff admitted to finding it and said they would mail it to me.  I haven't seen a sign of the iPad nor anyone who will respond to requests of when it would be mailed - multiple calls to the Head Housekeeper, Wendy, and the manager have resulted in no call back.  They even asked me for my password so they could "verify it was mine", after I gave them several pieces of identifying info including the cover color and the room it was left in (how many iPads could they have found in that room).  Of course, they wanted the password so they could keep the use it.
review_content_40: The hotel was beautiful!  The staff was friendly, everything seemed very nice and clean.  I thought it was a bit pricey but it was very nice.  The bed was super comfortable.

review_content: Stayed here for a work event & man, it has high reviews for a reason.  Dog friendly.  Great staff.  Loved the ambiance of the hotel--yes it is a boutique hotel and I enjoyed that.  Wine & snack happy hour.  Great (great!) catered food for our work event.  I enjoyed the room.  The only question that I wasn't sure about was whether the robes in the room were complimentary use or if there was a charge.  I didn't want to use it & find that there was a charge.  The best part of the whole stay was the bed & pillows.  I slept SO WELL both nights and really couldn't be happier.Was unsure what to expect to be honest. I did a little research and ended up getting this one because of the glowing reviews. Cons: Not many....You can tell that it's an older building that has been remodeled, and they did a good job - there are some original features that you just can't upgrade, but that's understandable. The location of our room made the street traffic pretty loud, but not till the morning when the daily hustle and bustle started. Pros: GREAT STAFF, I was blown away with the professionalism and sincere southern hospitality that this place offered! That alone will make me come back and recommend this place to friends. From the moment we pulled up to have the car parked to the moment we got in the car to leave, they were absolutely great! Here are a few things that made our stay so great!-They gave my daughter some sunglasses because she forgot hers and made her day-They  comped our parking-We missed happy hour so they gave us 2 drink vouchers for the restaurant. -We were there to celebrate my brothers 45th birthday (he lives in Savannah) and when we walked out for the evening they offered more drinks for us. -When we first got there, I didn't see the "how to connect to the internet" flyer in the room - and they painstakingly sat with me on the phone while I connected (and were super nice the entire time!) - WiFi is free btw-They had complimentary (good) coffee in the morning (the world around me in the morning thanks you for that!) -And the location was perfect - walking distance to everywhere! -Also the beds were some of the most comfortable I've ever slept in! -Every person said hello and seemed genuinely happy. When I mentioned this at checkout, one of the concierges said that their work environment was happy and that their bosses made it that way, so it was easy for them to be happy to be at work - I loved that statement! So true!   So thank you Brice (a Kimpton Hotel) for making a work atmosphere so pleasant for your staff that it portrays in their interactions with the guests! They were absolutely wonderful!!! Our stay was fabulous and I look forward to staying again on our next trip down which happens 3-4 times a year! Thank you!Small, boutique hotel, main flyer/desk could use some redesigning(my husband and I both felt that it wasn't well layed out), cute,clean, good location, and friendly staff!!      We arrived and the valet immediately brought over a bag of dog treats!! He was friendly and offered his help. Walking into the hotel lobby is a little overwhelming and confusing; it's really loud, compact, and the main desk is actually around the corner. The front desk staff were friendly, but didn't tell us any information about the hotel (cocktail hour, pool, fitness room, anything about the area, etc). We took the 1 elevator up and went into our room which was well decorated and spacious, but laid out oddly. When you enter you have this large hallway and then the bathroom, the bed is directly in front of the large desk that is also the tv stand, so there is limited room at the door of the bed to get around the bed..but then a ton of space on either side of the bed. The only closet space was the armoire. The only drawers were the night stand ones. Cute furniture but definitely only meant for the one or two night stay kind of thing...      The bathroom was your basic hotel bathroom. The bed, pillows, and sheets were comfy.              Cons   1)The street noise    2) The walls were paper thin- was woken up several times through out the night by the toddler next store who kept waking up crying...my husband and I whispered after 8 pm because we didn't want to Wake the kid, that's how thin the walls/door were!! I would ask for a non adjoining room and maybe not on bay st.     I would give this hotel another chance...but wasn't thrilled with our room this time due to the inability to really relax.I love this hotel. First impression: holy shit that's cute. Very modernized hipster feel. Very Abbot Kinney (LA) like. Also dog friendly, so an extra star for that!Second impression: southern hospitality. To the tee. They gave me an early check in, comped my valet (which wasn't even nearly as much as other places), and even upgraded us to a freaking suite! And, the staff greeted us by name any time they saw us. They also had complimentary happy hour between 5-6pm, with Bailey's hot chocolate, red and white wine, and also complimentary coffee and tea in the morning. I gotta say it, this place is the "bee's knees". Had an amazing experience, no one was ever snooty, very friendly and warm. I've already recommended this place to my friends, and will continue to do so for anyone in needing a place to stay in beautiful Savannah!This hotel was a great pick. Right near the river but not river front. They offer valet parking ($25 per night). Happy hour wine and cheese from 6-?. The hotel is dressed with modern decor throughout. My favorite part was the "Grinch Chair" in the guest rooms. Rooms run $150-200ish a night. Beds are very comfortable which is the most important part for me. Unfortunately, the Gym was not available. It's under construction so we would have had to walk to another property. They lose a star for that. We had a minor problem with our room. The front desk quickly fixed it. They offer great customer service . I'd say they definitely go out if the way to make you happy!My husband and I stayed at The Brice during a three night trip to Savannah a few weeks ago.  We really liked this hotel.  The outside is nothing special, kind of warehouse-y, but inside it's very modern and chic.  Cool lobby sitting area with a neat winding bookshelf that separates the couches from the front desk.  Free fruit-infused water.  Even bikes available to take out for a spin.Location was excellent if you want to be close to the water.  Hotel was a quick dash across the street and down the steps to River Street.  If you want to be near the squares, you will have to walk a bit although all the square locations are less than a mile away and walking to them is a breeze.Valet parking is the norm as there is no actual parking lot.  However, you can park along the street for free on the weekends - just pay attention to when the street sweepers will be by; signs are posted about the schedule.Rooms are nicely appointed.  Not too large, but comfy.  Beds were awesome.  We had three great nights of sleeping!  Staff was friendly, on-site restaurant was tasty.  Outdoor courtyard to relax in.  If you are coming to Savannah, definitely give this place a try.This place is amazing! The hotel itself is beautiful; a perfect mix of modern comfort and historic charm. What makes this place truly special, however, is the staff. Everyone went out of their way to make my boyfriend and me feel at home.   The only downside to this hotel is checking out, you really won't want to leave. Between the super comfy bed and the extremely indulgent restaurant on site, you will have no desire to go back to your daily routine.  Beautiful building, badass food and drinks ( do not skip this restaurant), great hospitality ( special thank you to Angela, Kaia, Trent, Rodney, and Mo [in no particular order] for making our trip to Savannah so special and memorable), the Brice is an extraordinary place to stay.I am still thinking about the amazing bachelorette party I enjoyed last weekend at the Brice. Bottom line:1) location is great.  River is two blocks away and there are plenty of less touristy areas and parks within walking distance. 2) staff is amazing, professional, young, and accommodating.  We especially appreciated Rodney, Aaron, and Kaia (spelling?).3) pool was a must in Savannah's heat and we thoroughly enjoyed ourself with the comfy sun beds and cool pool that was never crowded.4) the happy hour is a great bonus and in combination with the "secret garden" we had great cocktail hours catching up!5) We had 7 girls in the adjoining suite room.  Rooms were stylish, beds comfy, and loved the giant modern bath in the shower!One thing that would have made my stay just a bit better would be if the amazing coffee bar was open later and it should include cubes and cups to easily make an iced coffee since it's so dang hot in savannah.I think this hotel is so dang cute!  It has this fun etsy-style, eclectic, hipster, bohemian, trendy decor vibe.  Free bikes, free wifi, free coffee.  Awesome location.  Super cute and nice staff.  We loved it.  It is dog friendly but we didn't find any fur or problems with that, not having a dog.  Plus I am typing this in the lobby on a metal wheeled desk thing next to a vintage typewriter, drinking my free coffee!Great smallish hotel right across from the river, with most of the amenities of a big hotel with a boutique hotel feel. The staff was really fantastic, and the restaurant was great. It's a bit out from the center of town, which helps keep it a bit quieter on that end. The courtyard happy hour and music was a nice touch, I could easily see it being a place that locals would enjoy as well as out of town guest. There wasn't a coffee maker in the room, but I asked for and got one with haste. I'd come back."I love your hair!"... Says the lady at check in. Oh ma'am..  Flattery will get you everywhere. Not only is the staff extremely friendly but the hotel is also a jewel! I mean the rooms are spacious, clean and updated. The bed was fluffy. Loved the extras. I normally Lysol everything down and wear shower shoes, but I questioned this here as everything was clean and neat. My only teeny gripes:1. They are dog friendly but at 8 this morning someone left their dog in the room barking for at least 10-15 min. Maybe you shouldn't allow this as everyone's dogs aren't trained.2. The the showers are nice with a bench inside, roomy... But there's a crack at the bottom which means water is going to be on the floor by the time you're done... Not good. 3. The 5 PM appetizers... Maybe provide enough for all the guests. Definitely enough alcohol but when my dude and I got there at 5:15 there was no food left. I wasnt looking for a meal, but at least the chance to put one thing in my hand to try. Other than that BRAVO Kimpton. Location is excellent along with all the little touches.Ahhhhh...Kimpton has done it again.  Another winner and I was so excited to see a hotel in Savannah.  Right in the Historic District and of course another top notch restaurant / bar attached.  More on Pacci in another review.The arrive offers everything you would expect from a Kimpton Property - Uber friendly staff who know their craft and truly take care of their guests and hip and clean with every detail taken care of.  I was here for my birthday and of course they didn't miss that detail.The rooms and bathrooms are large and very comfortable.  The Courtyard is absolutely spectacular and relaxed.  The service - again everything you would expect from a Kimpton.  Valet, check-In, housekeeping and on and on...they just always get it right.  This is a place where you know people here love working here.This location will soon be a 5 in my book.  They are still a bit new and still working on their setup - no dedicated gym yet, a bit of painting etc...they are well on their way and this is the place to stay in Savannah!!Awesome dog-friendly hotel. The staff was superb and friendly. Hotel was clean and comfy. Decor is adorable and location is perfect in downtown Savannah right by the river. Our dog was in doggy heaven and we only wish we could have stayed longer.Had a fantastic stay at The Brice during my recent trip to Savannah! Located right at the end of Bay St, The Brice is walking distance from many great restaurants and shops in historic downtown Savannah. The decor is super cool, with a mix of old Southern charm (the concierges all wore grey suits and bowties, there are vintage bikes available to borrow right in the lobby!) and modern touches (like a color-coordinated book display and pop art pieces in the hallways.)If you get a room with a balcony, it'll either overlook the pool area or the courtyard in the middle, which is a great place to kick back with a glass of wine during their daily free happy hour from 5 - 6!
