As with all Kimpton Hotels, The Brice is super pet-friendly (and baby-friendly, as we found out since my 2-year-old niece joined me for part of my trip) and if you're a Kimpton Karma Rewards member (which everyone should be, it's FREE!) you get a free $10 to spend at the bar or at the minibar. I would absolutely stay at The Brice again the next time I'm called to Savannah!Stay here. Umm... I guess I should make this more detailed. 1. Super friendly, non uppity staff. 2. Amazing space at the edge of the downtown tourist area. 3. Guest happy hour with wine and flatbreads. 4. Great restaurant. 5. Dog friendly with NO restrictions!!6. Our room was amazing. 7. Since my first visit at a Klimton hotel I got a welcome cheese plate and beer!8. Robes!I really have gotten to an age where I like a bathrobe in the room. I think I wore their comfy robe the whole time I was there. I hadn't been to Savannah in over 10 years but will be back for the Brice!My (now) husband and I got married in Savannah, and had our 'homebase" for ourselves and our family and friends at the Brice. The whole experience was great, the staff was very accommodating (even for a frazzled bride), warm and friendly, and the location was perfect.Highly recommended!This hotel is a fabulous property!  The amenities are great! The staff are stellar.  Dog friendly!  The rooms are gorgeous.  The beds are sooooo comfortable.  It is a must stay if you are in Savannah!  Well done and see you again on our way back and forth from Florida to BrooklynMy husband and I just stayed at The Brice while we were in Savannah for a mini vacation, and it's now one of my top favorite hotels in the U.S! Here are the reasons why:1) The location. It's close to the bustling waterfront, but not close enough to hear all the noise of the crowds and bars at night. It's also walkable to all the best restaurants and sights.2) The restaurant/bar. Pacci is a 5-star establishment (in my opinion), and to have it on site is just amazing. The cocktails are divine, and taking one out to the pool is even more divine.3) The pool. Savannah is hot, hot, hot, so having this clean, well-kept pool at our disposal really made our vacation feel tropical and relaxing.4) The bikes! The Brice has two red bikes that you can "check out" for free. It was a superb way to explore all the squares on a Sunday morning.5) Ice water with lemon and cucumbers is always waiting for you in the lobby and by the pool.6) Tea/coffee in the lobby every morning (and it's the good tea, too. No Lipton for Brice guests!).7) The "secret garden" courtyard. This place is adorable and romantic, and the perfect area to read with your tea every morning. 8) Complimentary wine hour at 5:00 every night.9) The overall design of the hotel. It's modern and sophisticated, yet fun and trendy.10) Our room felt like home. There were fluffy white sheets and towels, a giant tub, and a wonderful balcony overlooking the pool.I'm so glad that we discovered The Brice. I'm now a Kimpton fan for life!I recently visited this Kimpton hotel on a day trip to Savannah, and loved the hotel. The hotel staff was nice and all the bartender Sydney at the in hotel restaurant (Pacci) was the best. I had a great time loved the hotel but finding your way to your room could be a little confusing... i got lost every time lolAwesome pet friendly hotel near the heart of Savannah! No fee for pets too! About a 10 minute walk to Ellis square and the heart of Savannah. The Brice was perfect. Very welcoming and accommodating staff that extrudes southern hospitality. The design and decor of the hotel and rooms are trendy. Everything from the furniture to the wallpaper makes a statement. The outdoor courtyard in the center of the hotel is beautiful; perfect spot for the free wine hour and relaxing with friends. Staff was quick to ask us how our day was going and made recommendations on restaurants/bars along with local attractions. Parking is steep at $25 per night, but that was on par with nearby hotels.
review_content_20: This is by far the coolest family-friendly, pet-friendly hotel we've ever stayed in. The courtyard and pool areas are great, the rooms are simple, but clean, comfortable, and fun. We also had a great experience with the front desk. We arrived late, after a long day of travel, and everyone was so nice and helpful. They gave us a bottle of wine (it was clear we needed it), filled up water bottles, and arranged for me to retrieve my son's bottle from the car after they already parked it, without charging anything or making a fuss - they actually seemed happy to help. The valet desk was busy in the morning, so if you can, call down before you go, and allow plenty of time. They don't charge a pet fee, and actually welcome dogs. There are water bowls in the lobby, and they seem happy to see them. We will definitely be going back!Cute boutique hotel!  The staff is super friendly especially the doormen!  Super dog friendly which was really nice, lots of dogs were staying there, including ours!!  Will definitely stay here again if we go back to Savannah!!We loved our stay at the Brice. It has the quaint charm of Savannah with a modern vibe. Our stay was nice and quiet, but we were there on a Tuesday night in an off season so that may be different than the weekends. My only complaint was the feather pillows, they're not comfortable enough for me. We will definitely come back, but I'll bring my own pillow.Traveling with 5 people is sometimes difficult, but The Brice made it pleasant, a separate living room allowed some to sleep while some watched tv. Lovely patio, pool and community spaces.The staff and management were very accommodating in a storm induced power outage. The wine "hour" was extended so guest stayed in the lobby swapping stories and playing cards, they helped us find a restaurant that had electricity and comped the valet parking for the inconvenience.Absolutely the best. Feels like home, with an incredibly friendly and efficient staff. The hotel goes above and beyond to make this a memorable stay with great personalities throughout;  the wine hour at the beautifully decorated living room lobby is fun and a great way to start the evening before going off to dinner. True feeling of an independent boutique hotel. I typically have a preference for Airbnb over most hotels when traveling but this property really made me reconsider future trips. I will, with out any doubt stay here each and every time I come up to Savannah. Location wise the hotel is on the further side of the historic district, which encourages you to walk around the streets freely and explore beautiful Savannah.  I stayed in room 201, and will make sure to request it every time. Don't think about it anymore-- Just book itLoved this place! From the second we pulled up, the hospitality was just amazing! We brought our pup along and everyone was so welcoming to him as well. This place has such a cool feel to it! The lobby is stylish but comfy and the outdoor patio was perfect to relax. The wine and cheese hour was a nice surprise and a really nice feature. The rooms were well situated and the beds were extremely comfortable. We also checked out the restaurant that was part of the hotel and it was delicious. It was awesome that we could leave our dog in the room and enjoy a night to ourselves. There was not one negative aspect to our stay at this hotel, highly HIGHLY recommend this place!I've stayed at a kimpton before, and loved it. They are a unique brand and I choose to stay there because of the service, free cocktail hours, free bikes, and pet policy.This hotel had all of those things, although the physical structure of the place was very disappointing. When I pulled up to the hotel I said "what is this, a renovated dorm room"? It has that feel. Boxy, with small windows, a fresh coat of paint and new awnings. The lobby was beautiful and welcoming though.As we walked through the hall to our room, it very much feels like your walking through a very old apartment complex that was cheaply renovated. The vinyl butterfly stickers all over the walls didn't help. It looked cheap.The room was a little bit better. Beautifully decorated with a modern style. Although the room was simply a box, with a small window and a wall where they put in a bathroom. There wasn't even a closet.  My dorm room fear was coming true.The kicker was the yappy dog in the room next to us that barked for 18 hour a day.  It was so loud we felt the dog was in our room. I'm all for allowing dogs in your hotel, but if your going to do that, you need to insulate the rooms correctly.The pool was also a disappointment. Take away all the chic outdoor furniture and decorations, and your left with a small rectangle pool no bigger than what would be in the backyard of a small home.We paid $300+ a night to sleep in a small noisy overly decorated cheaply built room.  The location downtown was perfect though, and I guess that's what we were paying for.I stayed at The Brice this week while attending a conference.  The hotel itself is charming and the staff is super-friendly (and gets customer service... I got up too late for breakfast the first day and was looking for just a little something to eat so that I could then go for a run.  Even though technically breakfast was over, they found a leftover scone for me which I greatly appreciated).  The "personality" of the hotel was displayed in many ways from wet paint signs that said "careful, y'all" to witty social media responses.  The Secret Garden is a great little area where you can sit outside and enjoy a cup of coffee, etc.  I definitely enjoyed my stay and would recommend The Brice to those looking for a place to stay in Savannah.  If you join the Karma Rewards program, Wi-Fi is free.One of the most poorly managed hotels I have ever stayed at. If it improves I will revise my review.I wouldn't have expected to stay here, but we were in town for a wedding, and this is where half the bridal party lodged. Location: right across from the river! You're not in the heart of the city, but you are really, because walking across the main, touristy parts of Savannah isn't that long of a walk (comparatively). Close to a lot of restaurants, nightlife, and shops. Parking: Valet. Just suck it up...welcome to Savannah :) On a side note...the valet's were the best customer service we had all weekend! Not that the other staff wasn't great, but these guys (and the one lady who helped) were super helpful, friendly, and overall not what you usually expect from valets. This crew should teach other valets how to do their job. Top notch service! Atmosphere: I got a little lost in the decor. Modern luxe? Funky chic? It's like IKEA developed a luxury line. Definitely had some quirks- strange wallpaper in the hallways (butterfly and horse stall like decals) and mock rock climbing holds on one wall in the rooms. I liked the balance of bold colors on white/gray/natural. They do allow dogs...which is cool, but one of our neighbors had a dog that barked all the time, night or day. The courtyard in the center is very lovely! A nice euro style mix of strung lights, cafe furniture, umbrellas, and some plants. On site food was alright- it's a better place to stop in for a drink (nice bar!)- there are so many really good restaurants in Savannah. Definitely take note of their complimentary wine hour(s?) in the evening! Rooms: Maybe a little bigger than standard size! Comfy setup and the most amazing mattress. Seriously...it was cloud-like sleeping, and I usually prefer a hard mattress. The bathroom was standard- alright shower pressure, although the tub floor was super slick. The complimentary bathing supplies were quality (C.O Bigelow). There is a well stocked mini bar & fridge, but no fridge or microwave for leftovers. I loved the fuchsia armoire! Not only was it design wise a nice fit, but full length mirrors in hotel rooms are a big plus in my book. Would have liked to see a luggage rack since there weren't any dressers. Unique addition to Savannah- definitely a spot for anyone who likes to try boutique hotels! I'd never heard of the Kimpton line, but definitely will be much more likely to check them out in the future for travel!Stars looked to be aligned for me to absolutely love this hotel. The exterior colors (gray, yellow, white) match my home living room.  The interior rooms (gray, lime green) matched my sneakers.  I love hotels, but I was surprised I didn't like this cute one more, until I started writing it all down in a review when it started to make sense.  You know the feeling you sometimes get at fancy joints when you are underdressed or when you're at the airport gate trying to get a first class seat but the gate attendant would rather leave the seat empty than give it to you?  Yeah, I felt a little of that at this hotel...not from everyone, but from some. (BTW, Valets and cleaning crew were great...greeting me each time we passed by and upon entrance/exit of the hotel.)Cranky and hangry from my travels and dressed in yoga wear (since I was on my way to the spa), I arrived to check in.  The upgrade certificate I received was not honored, with the front desk staff saying there were no upgrades available, and there were no king bed rooms clean at my check-in time (which was early), so I got a room with 2 queen beds. Wish they didn't even offer the upgrades...that and the great reviews made my expectations way too high. I had also received an email the day before my arrival, saying that upgrades were still available for purchase as well, so while it is entirely possible that other people with reservations bought all the upgrades the day before, I'm highly skeptical.  Kimpton is very responsive via social media but the flip side is that it gives the illusion of customer service, without actually receiving any benefits or fixes.  While its decor and colors are totally my taste, the Brice remains a regular hotel, with regular rooms and tiny bathrooms. There was a $10 voucher for mini bar items that came with my room rate, but I would have much preferred faster wifi or a quieter room with a king bed over getting $10 of minibar stuff (hoping that the voucher is correctly applied to my bill later...we'll see, otherwise, I would be stuck with an extra $10 of mini bar items). The room was very clean with a big window (mine overlooked the pool and Bay St), with white sun shades and room darkening curtains.  Bathroom with the shower tub and toilet is very small and a bit claustrophobic.  Small sink and vanity is outside the bathroom door in the hallway, which is a good feature especially if you are sharing the room (but didn't matter much if not sharing).  I turned off the room air, since the heat made a lot of noise, but I could still hear the loud vent in the hallway, along with lots of noise from the cleaning staff since there was also a utility room across the hall from my room.  The toilet also kept running for a long period of time each time it was flushed.  Really slow wifi in the rooms.  I got to see one of the suites that friends of mine are staying in...definitely more spacious bath vanity and sitting area, but also in higher traffic locations from some of the rooms that are accessed from outdoor hallways.Yes, there is a happy hour with wine and small snacks in the cute lobby, but it is very crowded. It is probably better in warmer weather when people can move out side to the courtyard.  There are 4 elevators in the square layout hotel, which is good so you don't have to walk far to get to your room, but bad with the incessant dinging sound that is way too close to the rooms.  Lots of positive reviews from dog owners who can bring their pets, but if you're not a pet person like me, it makes me a bit nervous having dogs around food and barking at each other.  Each time the pets passed each other and I was between them, I felt like I was in the middle of a pending duel.  Some owners also left their dogs unattended in their rooms...I could hear some dogs barking in a nearby room for quite some time.Great location on Washington Square at the edge of historic district, and probably one of the reasons I would definitely stay here again.  I valet parked my car (at $25/night) when I arrived and walked around Savannah my entire stay, with easy walks to the riverfront area, through all the squares, and to Forsyth Park.  Great restaurant and bar at the hotel (Pacci), and of course, many options in the surrounding area.  3.5 stars.A typically-excellent Kimpton hotel. Impeccable facilities and warm, welcoming staff. Perfect location at the east end of Bay street. The lack of a self-parking option ($26 a night for valet, although there are unlimited in-out privileges) is annoying but fine.Nice hotel but subpar service.  We got stuck in the pool area in the middle of the day and couldn't get back in as the doors were locked behind us.for the 2nd part of our anniversary I had been dying to come to Savannah and after finding out they had a new Kimpton hotel we had to stay here. of course I was getting over a bad cold which isn't what anyone wants before going on vacation. anyway when we got there really early, they held our bags while we went to have breakfast. it was great after we came back and found we had been upgraded to a suite! also great for my husband to be able to watch tv in the other room while I napped and tried to get over my cold asap lol. they also gave us a nice bottle of prosecco we brought home with us :) we just loved this hotel so much. I'm so happy we came here for our anniversary instead of my birthday because I don't think this was even open when we first planned on coming. just such a great hotel and we love the kimpton brand. the hot chocolate in the morning was delicious and I had no idea they'd have that. I'm a chocolate lover and went nuts lol. I only wish we had brought one of our dogs but that's jetblues fault for being so overpriced, not the hotel! which btw this hotel is beyond dog friendly, they just love dogs and even have treats for those with dogs :) oh and there is a wine happy hour we enjoyed nightly and omg that tub. I want that tub in our house..... also the whole design of the hotel was just so well done. I only wish our last day I wasn't feeling sick and we could have enjoyed Pacci... I see this as just a reason to come back one day lol :)Such a beautiful hotel! The best customer service I've ever experienced by far. The staff is so attentive and helpful and pleasant and competent.  Everyone is so friendly and accomodating. Pets stay free!!! The room and bed and shower pressure are excellent! Room comes fully equipped. Hotel has free bike rentals which is another plus. This great place even has free wine hour daily from 5-6pm. White and red wine with cheese n crackers. You really can't get any better than this place in Savannah. Special shout out to Terell - you deserve recognition for your great customer service and amazing personality. It was an absolute pleasure staying here. Can't wait to come back. Will never stay anywhere else.Awsome experience.   Got a room w/ 2 queen beds.  Huge room, dog bed, dog food bowl w/ treats and water bowl provided.  Clean.  Very happy.  No dogs allowed in the pool area.  Nice courtyard for the pool & the comp wine & appitizers area (dogs allowed here).  Can eat in courtyard w/ dog at the attached restaurant.  W Everyone was super nice and NOT pretentious.   Allowed me to keep my car parked in their parking & hang around in the court yard (with my dog) after check out, no problem.Excellent customer service.  The staff are happy  to help. I was satisfied with the room. I liked that electrical outlet are incorporated into the desk and bed stands.We booked here through A blind Hotwire deal. The lobby and restaurant were nicely decorated. While we were walking to the room we were a little apprehensive however our suite was gorgeous. I would definitely book here againExcellent facility located in the historic district with all the southern hospitality and charm one could ever find. The staff was excellent and the rooms were clean and quaint. Location was superb. The facility is pet friendly and is excited to offer pets treats, bedding and makes the pets feel right at home... Stay here and you will not be disappointed.I love Kimpton hotels. The Brice did not disappoint. It's steps from river street and centrally located to see everything Savannah has to offer. The staff is wonderfully friendly and helpful. Kiah helped us out with reservations and suggestions on where to go and was on point! Parking was one time charge and not pay per day which is awesome. If you're not familiar with Kimpton hotels, they host tea and coffee in the morning, and wine o'clock at 5pm usually with a festival cocktail as well. They are also incredibly dog friendly which makes me elated to see little puppies everywhere.
review_content_40: A fine experience. Good location within the historic district. However, expected more relative to the cost associated with the stay.We have stayed here a few times and last year I would have given it 5 stars but this year it can only be 4 stars but it is on the way to 3.  Why?  First, let me say the the service is excellent and the complimentary wine and cheese hour is very nice.  Location is great too so, what is wrong?  The rooms already seem in need of upkeep.  Our bathroom had paint peeling on the ceiling, wall and the inside of the bathroom door was missing paint along the bottom not to mention the heavily rusted hinges.  This tells me that they are not paying attention to the upkeep and that is inexcusable.  Hopefully  they start to keep up with the place or our next visit might be our last...but I hope not.Everything was as advertised. Very attentive service from front desk to the house keepers. Loved the courtyard. Spent some nice quiet time out there. The wine and conversation and comfy seats and couches stepped this place up. Room was very clean, nicely decorated, great bed. Definitely will come here again.I was so so SO excited to stay here! Savannah is one of my most favorite cities ever and I was so excited when I found this hotel. The pictures online are gorgeous and it looked unlike any hotel I have stayed at before. Also I was traveling with a group of five so it was great that they offered "suites" that could a accommodate five people with their pull out couch. The location was a little bit of a further walk from all the good shopping and what not then I wanted but I figured it'd be worth it. We arrived at The Brice a few hours earlier than check in and the valet was so nice and friendly and walked us inside to check in and introduced us to the front desk. The lobby and connecting restaurant pacci are simply gorgeous and definitely like the pictures. We were luckily able to check in early which was great. Our room was right off the courtyard which is gorgeous and somewhere where I wish I could have spent more time but it was raining. The room however left much to be desired. It just felt like an old motel room they painted and threw a bunch of ikea furniture in. It was set up incredibly weird, and for being a suite style room it wasn't much bigger than a normal hotel room. I was really looking forward to the giant bathtub I kept seeing in pictures but instead we had an incredibly small bathroom that was so close to one of the beds it was hard to get to. The bathroom reminded me of one from a comfort inn I stayed in....they had the same cheap looking shower curtain. When I'm spending 300-400 a night on a hotel room to me it's the little things like that that make a huge difference. Later when we were all getting ready for bed we pulled out the couch and realized there wasn't any sheets for the bed. I called down to the front desk and asked if we could please have some sheets and a blanket for the pull out couch in our room. They arrived with 4 sheets and said they didn't have any blankets. You're a hotel....and you don't have any blankets? Upon check out the computer was down and I had to stand there for 20 minutes until someone else was able to check me out. Overall I wouldn't stay here again. I love the style and look of the hotel but I think there are much nicer hotels in Savannah with a better location and price.Have stayed before and had a great experience. On my most recent trip, my experience was awful. Upon checking in, the receptionist at the front desk was incredibly rude. No bell hop was offered for luggage. The room wasn't clean. You could never get someone on phone for room service, wifi did not work, and the front desk wasn't able to provide assistance with wifi trouble. Overall BAD experience. Won't stay again.Savannah, being a small town with local nuances, offered my wife and I an abundance of boutique hotels to choose from, and The Brice suited us well--a wine happy hour, (albeit a small selection), clean-cut rooms, and a good view of the town.The staff here know how to treat clientele well, and as well, they continue to afford out of town guests some Southern hospitality.In terms of the layout, I found the design to be a little cramped (one elevator, to boot), but with 3 stories in the heart of Savannah, you can't expect it to be the J.W. Marriott, with 10 elevators and hallways the size of a 8-lane highway. At the least, the bellmen and attendants were extremely hospitable and willing to meet needs at the drop of a hat.The Brice offers visitors to this boutique hotel, ready to give a little bonus to your time in Savannah.Well beyond our expectations. From the valet to manager, 1st class all the way. Close to everything Savannah. Don't miss afternoon wine reception or Wednesday night Supper Club at Pacci restaurant. We will return.Stay here! The most enjoyable hotel I have ever stayed at. Great staff! The most amazing lobby and courtyard you could dream up!!Savannah Downtown is small! You can walk end to end in 25 minutes. This hotel is in one corner of the district but it is still PERFECTION. Amazing in house restaurant but it's just the rooms and the staff that will blow you away. Modern, chic, smart.No complaints. Would never stay anywhere else in Savannah. Oh. And easily the greatest shower I've ever had in a hotel room.If I were a Savannah ghost, I'd want to haunt The Brice. Why? Well, I'd never want to leave! Kimpton hotels set the bar pretty high, but The Brice gleams with southern hospitality. I tweeted the Kimpton two weeks earlier telling them that I hoped the staff had great ghosts stories for me. Upon check-in, I found a book of Savannah ghost stories and the ingredients to make a Green Ghost cocktail. Talk about attention to detail! The rooms are nice and the service is excellent. The pool was small, but it is an older hotel. The Kimpton wine hour is a highlight as always, and The Brice brought out complimentary pizza too! All in all, I wouldn't stay anywhere else when I go to Savannah. Splurge a little and stay at The Brice.We paid over $300 for this room and when we asked for a blanket for the pull out couch we got "Unfortunately we don't have extra blankets. Here's three sheets." The room didn't look as pictured. It's cute and modern but not worth the money.Currently staying at the hotel. The staff is very polite and pleasant which always gains points with me. However the rooms and halls are so humid it smells a little moldy which I can also put aside. The room however lacks in cleanliness. When your paying good money for a "4 star" hotel you expect a little more. We checked in and proceeded to our rooms, the floors and hall floors were dirty and there were some hairs on the floor which were not ours since we had not used it yet . I did inform someone at the front desk he told me he would take care of it and walked away before I gave him my room number . I informed someone else and said they would take care of it as well. Unfortunately when we came back to our room hours later , the hall and bathroom floors were still dirty and the hairs were still on the floor. Hopefully that's as bad as it gets and I can give a better update upon check out.Clean and close to a lot of restaurants , shops, river, and bars.  There is a nice courtyard with ample seating for several small groups to sit. It is right on a main road where large 18 wheelers and concrete trucks are CONSTANTLY racing by ( this is very loud the moment you walk out of the door), we didn't hear any of this when in our room. Don't stay near the exit door on the first floor, it has a labelled alarm but people still go out of this door and the Alarm goes off ALL hours due to people exiting. The alarm is VERY loud and could  be heard in our room about five doors down. Oh, also pet friendly which is a plus!I don't think you can find a better or more welcoming place to stay and explore Savannah with your dog. The rooms are lovely and service very friendly and accommodating. We really enjoyed our stay.Little peeved right now. After having had our daughters wedding and reception at the Brice, which was good as indicated in an  earlier review, today we got a $1300.00 charge on our credit card. Here it is three weeks after the event which we thought was done and paid in full. Their explanation was "Oh it is a 22% service charge plus taxes, read your contract."Very disappointing as we had checked prior to leaving/checkout and were told setting everything was closed out.Loved the Brice!!! They are so nice and friendly. They accommodated our last minute extension. They have a lovely happy hour. The Tilley tour picks up right in front, we hopped off and got in the pool and then got back on. The pool is lovely also. I highly recommend staying here!Stayed here 11/5-11/8 for the Rock n Roll Savannah Marathon.  Beautiful hotel, great service, friendly staff and a lovely complimentary happy hour daily from 5-6.  They set up coffee early for the marathon participants and had water and granola bars out.  Not one complaint, looking forward to coming back next year.We stayed here in August on a road trip across the country, and I was obsessed with this hotel! The decor is amazing - steampunk in the lobby and mid-century modern in the rooms. We had booked a standard room but it was huge, with a four-poster king bed (that was so comfortable, I actually pulled up the sheets to try to figure out what kind of mattress it was) and a high-backed armchair in the corner. The hotel surrounds a beautiful courtyard, where you can sit with your (free) morning coffee that they provide in the lobby or your (free) wine that they provide in the early evening. The hotel is also very dog-friendly - they don't charge an extra fee, and they allow you to leave your dog alone in the hotel room. There's also a great park across the street that is perfect for dog walking. We didn't have a chance to eat in the Italian restaurant that's attached to the hotel, but we got a couple appetizers one night that were excellent, and the cocktails were fabulous too. We only had two nights in Savannah, but I'm dying to go back and to stay at this hotel again!The staff are incredible. It is like being home around friends. Five star service at its best.I have never had a more amazing hotel experience than at The Brice. I informed the hotel that my boyfriend and I booked our stay for our anniversary. Not only were we upgraded to a premium room, there was champagne and cake waiting for us when when arrived. This made the start of our evening so romantic, especially since since he popped "the question" after dinner! The room itself was gorgeous; the huge canopy bed, the gigantic tub, and the beautiful balcony were to die for. There were plenty of plugs for all our devices and a wall-sized mirror perfect for checking my outfit before strolling the squares. The rest of the hotel was so pretty and modern, I felt the need to Instagram everything from the swing in the lobby to the "secret garden" where I drank my morning coffee (available in the lobby each morning). Valet parking was convenient and $26 a day, which I found pretty standard. The staff itself was so friendly that we felt like old friends. Rodney showed us all the features of our room and took great care of us from arrival to departure. The wine happy hour each evening was a lovely touch. The hotel was located right across from River St. and had a few DOT shuttle stops conveniently nearby. I would absolutely recommend The Brice to any and all.Overall great experience. The courtyard was great during wine hour to mingle and make new friends. Pet friendly also.
review_content_60: Love Love Love this hotel. I just stayed here for a work conference and was so pleased. From the food to the meeting room to my room to great customer service, all were top notch. The manager at the hotel was beyond friendly and remembered guests names as they walked through the lobby. The secret garden was beautiful and calming, great place to just chill at night. I highly recommend this hotel to any one whether single, with a loved one or a family.  Elizabeth ZarateGreat trendy vibe, fantastic service, and good rooms.  It's an old building so expect a few less outlets overall and small bathroom space.  Great location.The Brice has smoothed out the opening bumps and my most recent visit was truly dreamy. The pool still isn't completed and the rooms haven't gotten any bigger, but those are the only quibbles. Every staff member I encountered greeted me so affectionately, I wanted to claim them as relatives. I ate 3 meals at Pacci. Could have gone elsewhere. Didn't want to.This hotel is marketed as a boutique hotel and has boutique-hotel prices, but is actually an old Holiday Inn or HoJos or other downmarket hotel, given a surface renovation. The bathrooms are not redone, the layout is not redone, the pool is not redone. The bathrooms in the suite are especially bad, as they are tiny and the door is stuck right next to the bed, in a corner. Also the rooms were damp and frigid with the arctic AC effect. The rest is standard boutique-hotel, and nice enough. I would have been happy at a lower price.Great hotel and nice service!The suite is well worth the cost and the place is sooo clean.I would give it 5 stars but there was a weird pipe noise all day and night.Since we are heavy sleepers, I did not ask for a room change.Also they should add another towel bar.  We had to hang our wet towels in the closet.We love Kimpton and thanks for the wonderful stay!!!Beautiful rooms, truly friendly staff and great service. Love this place! Would definitely recommend it to others visiting Savannah!Such an enjoyable stay. The rooms were clean and had a modern feel. If you are looking for a southern vibe this wouldn't be your place to stay. Great pool area. The valet men are all so wonderful and truly care about their guests. My only complaint would be: there is no breakfast that comes with booking..only hot coffee and tea in the AM..and you have to pay for wifi unless you sign up for their rewards program. Otherwise this place is great and the location is amazing! Right in downtown Savannah within walking distance to River Street.Great hotel as expected from Kimpton lines.  Well appointed room and luxury amenities.  The valet staff are friendly and helpful.  The front desk staff are not friendly and has a bit of an attitude. I get it, you work at a very nice hotel but, should not treat your guests with a condescending attitude when asked a simple question.  Maybe it's a new hotel excitement thing but that needs to improve.  It takes away the other positive aspects of this beautiful property.We throughly enjoyed our stay at The Brice, we were in town for our daughter's wedding, which was actually in the courtyard of the hotel. Service was excellent with a friendly and helpful staff. The newlyweds had a complimentary suite for their wedding night which they loved. Would recommend this hotel for anyone.Best hotel chain ever. 5 stars for service, they always try to accommodate their guest. I always stop at the Brice on my way down to Florida. Love everything about the hotel.Disregard any negative reviews you read about this hotel, my recent stay exceeded my expectations! This hotel is modern in its decor without being pretentious. The hotel staff is professional and exude southern hospitality.  I contacted the staff via email while in route from Ohio with some questions about my stay and was promptly contacted by phone by a hotel administrator with answers. Our room, which was lovely and very clean, was ready early.  The staff had already been informed we were possibly arriving early and I was impressed that the gentleman at the front desk said they were awaiting us.The happy hour with complimentary wine and appetizers was an unexpected treat!  The gym and pool are not completed yet, but arrive knowing you will be working out at another local gym, for free, if working out is of importance to you.Thank you to the entire staff at The Brice, I look forward to returning to your hotel & staying at other Kipton Hotels in the future.Amazing place, just opened in June after joining the Kimpton network, they did a fantastic job on a beautiful and historic property. Like the rest of the Kimpton network, they really put a priority on great staff.There is an evening reception with wine and flatbread which is always pleasant. In the morning there is decent coffee and a nice assortment of teas.  Free wifi. Expensive parking (but par for the course). Friendly valets who get to know guests during their stay. Delicious attached restaurant.The rooms are very comfortable, I highly recommend it and plan to always return to this hotel when visiting Savannah! Also, wonderful hotel if you're traveling with pets. They don't upcharge for pets, and are very welcoming to your pets.A brand-new renovation of a previously run down Savannah property at the east edge of downtown, this is an excellent place to stay in town.I have stayed at a lot of Kimptons and other nice hotels, and in terms of quality of the inside, this is as good as any.  it's in a quit part of downtown at its east edge, but since Savannah is so compact, you can still get around pretty easily. It is very close to Water street. There's a very nice inner courtyard which is quiet and relaxing.The thing that set this place apart was the service. I usually get good service at Kimptons but mixing in the Savannah niceness really took it to the next level. Will definitely plan on staying here again when in town.This was our first stay at a Kimpton hotel. Kudos! First impressions are key, and the valet staff were friendly and helpful. Our check in process was smooth, even though I'd just booked our room through Orbitz less than 24 hours ago. Our room was a King with separate living room area, divided by a hallway, closet and bath (with TVs in both rooms). We'd previously stayed at the Marriott riverfront, but found the open atrium with pool design too noisy. Our room at the Brice, though right on Bay St., was super quiet. The bartenders at Pacci were great, but this is probably biased because they had my favorite Sav Blanc. The best part is the location, a brief walk to the best restaurants in town. My one complaint is that there should be a fan in the bathroom - it gets pretty humid in there, and shower floor/towels weren't really drying between use.The Skinny: check in at 4, free wine happy hour in the lobby at 5 PM plus coffee & (mighty leaf) tea in the AM, snacks and a minibar fridge (very mini) in room. Best Tip: if you sign up online for the Kimpton rewards program you get decent free Internet access.This hotel is absolutely amazing!! The decor is beautiful, the location is perfect, and the staff... outstanding!!! Everyone that I came into contact with was so friendly and helpful! The room service was delicious! I came here for a special event and the staff made it even more special! Upon checking in they upgraded my room to a suite and they helped me bring my luggage up... everyone was more than willing to help in any way they could! This restaurant is sure to be gem in the heart of historic savannah!!! I will definitely recommend this hotel to anyone I can and I will be back!!We decided to take a last minute trip to Savannah and found The Brice online while looking for a pet friendly hotel that would allow our 2 large dogs. Having the dogs stay free was amazing! I'm so glad we chose this hotel! Every single member of their staff was so friendly! Everyone stopped to see our pups, say hi and ask how we were doing and wish us a nice day. They let us check in a few hours early which was fantastic. Everything was so clean and the whole place has a very cool,funky vibe. The bed was comfortable and the hotel was very quiet. We will definitely be looking into other Kimpton hotels for future trips.Love this property...they really did a nice job with the remodel.  From the rooms, courtyard (amazing to sit and relax), and 'family room', the decor is stylish, sophisticated, and right up my alley.  Service was fantastic too.  Front desk team, valets, housekeeping...everyone was friendly and very helpful.  Complimentary coffee in the AMs, wine hour in the evening is an added bonus.  We didn't bring our pooch along, but the hotel is pet friendly and saw several dogs...and a bird.Note, the pool doesn't open until July...I guess that just means we will have to make a return trip soon.Stay here. It's a lovely boutique hotel.I booked The Brice on a whim and was so happy. The concierge to the restaurant, everyone was so nice and friendly. Mostly everyone seemed happy to be there and that's such a great sign. Dinner was amazing. I would recommend having a bite in house. The whole hotel was really clean and super nice. I would definitely stay here again.If you like dogs this is the place to be. We love Kimptons, they are always fun and unique. We especially liked the handwritten note by the maid with chocolate. So many fun colors and patterns... The happy hour was fun, lots of dogs and good conversation. The only issue we had with the happy hour was that they quickly ran out of snacks and these were not frequently replenished. The parking is expensive. We found other alternatives. The best part was that it was easy to get to the main areas within 10 minutes on foot.Excellent property! Wonderful and attentive service from the front desk to the valet and bell service. A special shout out to the 3 Ts at the door. You guys were great. The beds were well appointed and the rooms comfortable. The courtyard was beautiful as well. Complimentary wine social was very nice. Though not particularly a kid hotel, my 7 year old loved it and the staff.A request to change our reservation from a king to 2 queens was met without any hesitation, and though we were held up by traffic and weather until 10pm, the front desk staff checked us in with a smile and steered us to the on site restaurant for a good late night meal. Highly recommended.
review_content_80: Updating this to 4 stars, the GM followed up with the problem we experienced and I have to say- he is extremely professional and genuinely cares about customer service. I work at a 4 diamond resort in the spa at a tourist beach similar to Savannah and I was thoroughly impressed at how he handled the situation. Thank you.Great place to stop! The people were so nice and kind to us. The rooms were nice and spacious, great for the dog. The hotel is right in town, making it easy to walk anywhere. Glass of wine during complimentary happy hour was just what we needed after the long trip.While moving across the country with my husband with his Military orders I contacted the Brice Hotel to make reservations as we would be passing through savannah for the night. When I asked the rude reservation girl why the website was telling the the rooms were sold out when I tried to enter the military code but there were clearly still rooms available,  her nasty response was that it was first come first serve and once the block was gone that's it. We travel the country with Kimpton hotel brand regularly and have never found this to be the policy nor been treated so rudely! Stay somewhere else!Another chic new Kimpton hotel. Cozy clean rooms, friendly staff and amazing pool."Don't be fooled by the outside"...This hotel is Fabulous! It looked ok from the outside. My wife and I stay at Kimptons quite a bit because of our 4 legged son who is just pampered at this awesome boutique hotel. We knew it was going to be gorgeous inside. The outstanding service and presentation begins from the time you book your reservation all the way from the checkout with the valet guys! The rooms and decor throughout were artistically well done. It was the little things like when the complimentary coffee was out; a staff member would run back and grab a cup for you from the kitchen while the main pot was being prepared...EVERY STAFF member was THE BEST!!!Just checked out of the hotel, as this was a pit stop on our Miami-DC road trip with my boyfriend and our 5 month puppy. What a great choice we made. Located right in historic savannah, we were able to walk everywhere. Even to dinner, although we took a street peddler for the ride home. The facilities (with exception to the pool) and rooms are newly renovated which was a huge plus. Everything felt very clean (and I'm a germ freak). The service was EXCEPTIONAL. Our valet/bell boy Rodney was a character and so helpful. His welcome upon arrival and check out really made us feel welcome at the Brice. Their pet friendly policy is something to make note of. If you travel with your pet (or would like to) you know how inconvenient non-pet friendly places can be. The staff loved our puppy and never complained despite his playful barking in the courtyard occasionally. They have a beautiful courtyard in the center of the hotel. Having a view into the court yard would have been the only thing I would have changed about our stay. We looked at the un-renovated pool which didn't impact our short stay- but if that's a deciding factor for you, that's something to consider. They have complimentary wine hour from 5-6 pm with flatbreads to pick at, and a red or white wine to enjoy in their courtyard patio. We also came here at night after dinner to wind down with our puppy, and it was even more beautiful in the evening with all the string lights lit up. The Brice is decorated beautifully too- contemporary modern while still retaining that authentic southern feel. We ate at pacci on our last night and the hostess was kind enough to let us sit in the courtyard area (although their tables were right next to the courtyard but not lit as nicely) and the servers were very kind too. We were the only ones outside, so we brought our puppy and iPod speakers as there isn't any music outside, and had a great dinner. Would also note that the Brice is right in between Washington Square and another park. That was a big plus for someone who needs to make frequent walks with their four legged friend. We joined the Kimpton "karma rewards" to start accumulating stays and got free wifi! Definitely coming back to the beautiful Brice next time in Savannah, and very impressed with my first Kimpton experience. Will definitely look into their other properties whenever traveling.The hotel, location and amenities (aside from the pool which is still under construction) were amazing, but what really made our stay was the friendly, attentive and helpful staff. We've stayed at a lot of boutique hotels across the US, and I would put this one at the top of our list. When we arrived they immediately had a luggage cart which was whisked off to our room, and glasses of wine for us while we checked in.  We also had our Great Dane puppy with us, who the entire staff adored and had plenty of treats for; they even had a huge dog bed waiting for him in our room.  We didn't arrange it in time, but they also offer doggy daycare and other pet services. Just an awesome experience all around, I would definitely recommend this to anyone traveling to savannah.My husband and I stopped in here for one night at the tail end of our southern US road trip. Of the 4 4-star hotels we stayed in, this was the nicest. We were happy to find affordable street parking close to the hotel when we arrived. There is also valet parking available.  The lobby of this place is very well designed and interesting to look at. It's an interesting combination of traditional antique southern decor and chic modern design.  When we arrived they were serving the nightly complimentary wine and chips. We did not partake, but it looked very nice. We checked in with the helpful fellows at the front desk and made our way to our room, past the friendly wall paper designs, and got settled in for the night. The beds were extremely comfortable with down pillows and matress.  The modern lighting was a nice change from dimly lit rooms I've had in the past. The room also featured nice fluffy robes and better-than-average soaps/toiletries.  My only complaints about this hotel were the bed frames and the smallness off the bathroom. The bed frame stuck out several inches from the actual bed, and I tripped over it several times and stubbed some toes. My husband also tripped and bruised his ankle.  The downside of the bathroom was that I had no place to set my belongings. A small shelf (besides the one IN the shower) would have made all the difference.  All in all, this is a lovely hotel and I'd love to stay there again on future trips to Savannah! I just recommend watching your feet around those bed frames!We loved this hotel! First and foremost, the staff (clad in seersucker) was warm and helpful at all times. The rooms were clean, comfortable, and cool on a very hot weekend in Savannah. The wine hour in the afternoon, with flatbread from the adjacent restaurant, was a welcome bonus. Coffee in the morning was great, too. The lobby and common areas are very inviting and comfortable for visiting. The patio outside is a great place to enjoy your morning coffee or afternoon wine. The only improvement I would have made would be to make the bathrooms bigger. We had a delicious brunch in the restaurant on Sunday mornings. I recommend the buckwheat crepes!Absolutely beautiful and the service was immaculateSimilar to another review below, I think the stars simply weren't aligned. I sound silly but it was just a small number of things that left a slightly meh vibe. (Let me say I love the Kimpton properties and think they train staff really well. They also have great aesthetic, this is no exception. The property is beautiful and people were polite and courteous. However, when we arrived at check in time we were unable to check in. We have a dog so this is problematic as we had a planned bike ride. However, our room wasn't ready for another two hours.  This meant we couldn't do much since we can't abandon the pup. When we asked for a late check out the next day, it wasn't honored--making our planned bike trip from the day before-undoable. We got "two free" drink tickets to compensate for the late check in, but actually only one.  The person next to us complained excessively and got a free upgrade and bottle of champagne, which is great for him, but makes you feel a little cranky when you are checking in simultaneously.  They also accidentally called our room a few times trying to deal with a host of problems. Which didn't matter, because we were up, but it all felt a bit chaotic.  Wouldn't normally care. 50 room, great--but when you're paying between 300 and 400$ you just want more.Haven't written a Yelp review in ages but I feel compelled to post a glowing review for The Brice! We didn't know anything about this place, but we saw they welcome dogs and offered a AAA discount, so we took a risk. Wow -- it so paid off! One of our best hotel stays in a while. The staff was EXCEPTIONAL, friendly and welcoming. The hotel itself was lovely, elegant but not too stuffy. We ended up getting upgrade to a suite and were welcomed with a wonderful selection of crostini, hummus and tapenade. Every detail of the room was perfect, from the  luxurious bed, to the beautiful decor to the brilliantly located electrical and USB plugs. Wi-fi was included and easy to access. Will definitely be back again soon!We just came back from Savannah staying at The Brice, a member of the Kimpton family. The hotel just opened is is not ready for prime time. First of all, the pool did not open with the hotel and they neglected to let us know. The notification  was buried on the website. Since they could not get the big thing right they should have focussed more on the small things, not so much unfortunately. Here is a brief list, the morning coffee did not go smoothly, no one to mind the coffee. They ran out and were just not attentive. They did not clean up the dishes and glasses from the wine social hour outside, and we're late setting up one night. Also, no dishes, etc. for the nosh. It is a dog friendly hotel so be aware that dogs sometimes don't get along and that might pose a problem. You can only park your car using their valet service, sometimes had to hunt for them. And the managers just did not seem to care enough to make it all better. Oh well, maybe in a few months they will get their act together.

review_content: Great hotel that is located perfectly in the historic area.  Across the street from Leopold's.  I was in room 402 and had a haunted experience!!  I was asleep next to my husband.  Had one hand under my face and the other up over my head.   Around 4am my covers got pulled DOWN about 6 inches.  I opened my eyes in fright and my husband didn't move and was snoring.  I woke him up to hold me.  The room was clean and the staff was excellent.  Parking is $12 in the garage behind the hotel.Beautiful place! Inside out pure historical luxury.  Our room was just absolutely stunning.  I loved the historical feel to it.  Cozy and quaint.  I was very satisfied with the customer service and it was worth the stay.  I would definitely come stay the next time I visit.  My kids very much enjoyed its uniqueness.  It's walking distance from River St. And right along the path to all the shops, bars and restaurants.  Love it!Today is my last day staying at this beautiful hotel and I wish I didn't have to go! This hotel is not only gorgeous but also welcoming and historical and perfectly located we didn't have to use our car once, we could easily walk anywhere we wanted to go. Upon checking is the clerk was very helpful and friendly, we got up to our room and though it's a little small it is just beautiful! Within about 5 minutes of being upstairs our hotel phone rang and it was the sweet concierge Charlotte checking to make sure the room was fine and asking if they could bring us anything :)The little touches like this are what made the Marshall house really exceed our expectations. Things like having a paper at our door every morning and the wine and cheese reception at night make this place feel truly special. I think the only thing about this place that wasn't completely perfect was the complimentary breakfast it was just so so bagels, yogurt, biscuits nothing super exciting, so if you love breakfast as much as I do, I'd probably just go out and get it, but for something more grab and go theirs will do. I will definitely be staying here again, I was very impressed with this hotel and all of the staff we had the pleasure of meeting!Check the room before you take it.  Second floor inside is the room I was given and it looked fine, oh wait they should clean the toilet before a new guest checks in! Now the other problem is that the Windows face a dining courtyard.  You hear the kitchen banging pots & pans, and the night I was there was a private party, loud, in the courtyard.  Needed to change rooms.Nice hotel, but I'll never stay here again.My boyfriend and I stayed at the Marshall House this weekend to celebrate our 2 year anniversary. The location is great!  We were in walking distance of everything we came to see in Savannah. We didn't get back in the car until we were leaving Savannah. The room: It was charming, the balcony outside of the window was delightful and the GORGEOUS claw-foot bath-tub was exactly what I wanted/needed for this weekend getaway. The staff was so friendly, as well! While we were checking in, we mentioned that it was our anniversary and when we came back to the room from walking around the city, there was a bottle of champagne and a card signed by the staff! So perfect! The hotel itself was clean, and neat, no signs of filth. At 5:30 they offered the guests complimentary cheese and wine in the lobby which was a sweet touch. I absolutely loved our stay here and would definitely come back again!We've stayed in Savannah before, but for my birthday I wanted to travel back and stay at the Marshall house. It was a good call! From the moment we arrived every staff member was friendly and courteous!! If they walked past you, they said hello! I mentioned to the nice girl checking us in that it was my birthday so I was hoping the room was fabo. The asst hotel manager Jerry stepped in and upgraded us to a king room with a fireplace on the forth floor! Love it! The second day (which was my b-day) we arrived back at the hotel after being out all day and the staff sang me happy birthday and we had champagne and a card (signed by all of the staff) waiting for us in our room!We enjoy the history of Savannah and the Marshall house is a must! We will be back! Great job Marshall house staff!Beautiful!  It was like stepping back in time.  Totally enjoyable for a weekend in Savannah. Location was perfect for sightseeing & local restaurants.It's a cool & somewhat creepy hotel It reminds you of hotels that you would see in an Alfred Hitchcock movie.... Very creepy But it's cute at the same time. There are things in the room or hall ways, that absolutely make no architectural sense! Like the fire place that's not a a fireplace and stair case that leads to nowhere It's just an old building that want to look fancy but it's not! For what it is, it's way tooooooooo expensive! 259$ for a lousy room ! What a rip off but hey! They deserve it! Bc I'm a touristOverall great experience! Would definitely recommend if you're looking for a fun and romantic place to stay.I came here with my girlfriend to visit and explore Savannah for Labor Day weekend. The location is very central and within walking distance to anywhere  you'd like to visit in the historic district. We parked in the garage behind the hotel ourselves.  It ended up being $6 for about 24 hours, with a 3 minute walk with our bags to the hotel.The rooms are comfortably large and charming. The 100+ year old hotel has the old timey feel with creaky hardwood floors, large furniture, and high ceilings. We stayed in it because we heard it was haunted. Besides a couple of incidents which I attributed to my forgetfulness (Door was apparently left open all day, lights were turned off sometime in the night) we had no creepy ghostly encounters.Service, as far as we used it, was great. The staff followed up with a phone all an hour into our stay to make sure everything was ok. They held our bags while we ate breakfast, and there was a doorman.Continental breakfast was filling! The breakfast room has a glass ceiling over what seems to have been a courtyard and and plenty of tables. Breakfast consisted of bacon, eggs,  toast, juices, muffins, coffee, and everything we wanted. The food was warm even as we got there with 30 minutes before it ended.Stayed here for our annual weekend getaway. Excellent service!  We received a warm welcome the second we stepped in the door. Valet was prompt and friendly. Our room was quaint and cozy. The fridge did have food in it from the previous guestsm, which was gross but not intentional. The roof in the hallway leaked so we woke up to a constant dripping sound; again, not intentional. As a previous guest mentioned, the money under the baskets in the breakfast area is tacky and I would recommend stopping that. Our room faced the dining area which woke us up every morning with the moving of chairs and music. I would stay again, just request street view. We did not see any ghosts, but still had a pleasant experience. Centrally located.Review 100% based on bar/dining experience, did not stay at hotel. If you are a foodie, you will never forgive yourself if you don't come see James and Alfredo. James (bar) is world class and has so much knowledge it will make your head spin. Alfredo's dishes are the best in Savannah, even the "hand foods/apps"!! Trust me, we ate 3 apps and "custom ordered" the 4th, but only because we're lucky...James had our back! Crab Cake, Beef Carpaccio, Escargot, and pan seared Foie Gras - apps! Had the duck and three way pork for dinner....insanely good!Beautiful hotel. Great location. Room was small but still comfortable. The room was well decorated. The biggest con of the room was the way the floor creaked.The continental breakfast was the best we've ever had. The bacon was out of this worlds The staff was friendly to us during check in and check out. They even do a courtesy call which was really nice.We didn't valet park, instead we used the garage behind the hotel and it worked out! It was cheaper and the hotel was located well so we could walk everywhere we wanted to.The closest to a ghostly experience we got was a turned off tv in the morning and a turned off lamp. Will definitely stay at again!This hotel rocks! Awesome location, right in downtown. The staff were all so sweet and so helpful. We stayed in one of the suites with access to the balcony and it was beautiful!Stayed here for 5 nights for my sisters wedding. I travel to Savannah regularly and have stayed at many different hotels in the historic district, my first stay at The Marshall House.  First the good:Beautiful hotel, I like the historic look and feel.  Valet/door men, awesome!  Front desk staff, very nice.  (one female 'manager' was a little pissy) Now why 3 stars.  We booked a balcony suite and paid a premium.  The balcony looks like it was last cleaned after St Patty's day.  There is a layer of black soot from car/diesel exhaust on everything.  I went out there with my daughter and she was covered in soot. After the first night, I put a generous tip in the provided "tip" envelope for the maid with a note for extra towels and an extra blanket.  NO extra blanket & no extra towels. But tip was gone of course.By day three we ran out of soap and shampoo, never was restocked.  Also, ran out of TP.  I called down to the front desk for at least the TP, didn't get it until I asked again several hours later. Breakfast: so-so, quiche on most days that was probably previously frozen and heated up.  Plus the standard American continental fare. blah. Okay for one day, booooring for more than one.  (NEVER HAD ANY BACON, it is un-American to not offer a salty pig product in the morning)Whatever, this is not what peeved me the most.  On every table, there was a basket with fake peaches and a crisp "dollar bill" tucked neatly underneath it.  FRIGGIN TACKY!  Seriously?!?!?  This tactic to get 'tips' is offensive and appalling.We all had a very nice time in Savannah for my sisters wedding.  Overall the stay was not that bad.  However, I will not stay at The Marshall House again, would rather just stay at a Hilton property, at least they are clean and I can get some damn TP.I am currently seated in the library portion of this "esteemed" Savannah hotel, and I can honestly say that I am overall disappointed with my stay. If you want the hospitality the south is known for, you won't find it here! The staff come off as very standoff-ish and when they do approach you, it is evident it's painful for them to interact with guests. One bartender in particular was extremely rude to me by ignoring me and my friend and making sarcastic comments when he finally did decide to grace us with his presence. I gave this place two stars because the overall hotel is beautiful! I was very satisfied with my room and found it quaint and charming. I knew the hotel was advertised as being haunted, I totally believe it! It was hard to sleep the two nights I was there, I suggest ear plugs . There is definitely a creepy vibe to it which I feel adds to its charm. When you come here, you're paying for the hotel building itself, that's it. Do not expect out of this world hospitality, but mediocre at best. I doubt I will stay here if I decide to journey back to this beautiful historic city...My boyfriend and I recently stayed at The Marshall House for two nights.  We were very happy with this hotel.  It's old, boutiquey, and we even had some weird experiences occur during our stay in Room 217.  A few times, items were knocked off shelves or the back of the toilet, even with no one around.  This was nothing compared to the colorless and odorless wet spot that appeared on the bed out of nowhere at 1 am.  Yes, the boyfriend had been out drinking, but this was not because he wet the bed.  Google "ectoplasm" and be prepared to be freaked out as well as grossed out.  Weird, ghostly bodily fluids aside, we had a great time.  The location is perfect as we literally walked everywhere the entire weekend and didn't complain.  The hotel is gorgeous, the staff friendly, and overall, we enjoyed it here.The hotel was nice and had a colonial style to it. It was in a good location and walking distance to everything. The only thing I didn't understand was the price for the room. Seemed very expensive for a basic room.We had such a wonderful time at The Marshall House. The front desk staff and bell boys were amazing. We didn't see any ghosts, probably because we were so exhausted from a full day of flying so we fell asleep quickly and didn't wake up until the morning. The breakfast in the morning was top notch. Great eggs, biscuits, fresh fruit, oatmeal etc. However, one of the cooks left a sour taste in our mouth. He came over once we sat down and told us he and the other cooks were working hard in the back and asked us to leave a tip under the "bucket" which was a basket of fake peaches on our table. We didn't mind at all and smiled and nodded. He was nice enough and the food was great. A few minutes later he came back by and was a little pushier than before. He mentioned the tip again. Then he came by a THIRD time and said you better be leaving me a tip under that bucket. It just felt very awkward. We were planning to all along but he made us feel like children being scolded and warned. There's nothing worse than someone constantly reminding you that they're working hard while you're on vacation living it up. You start to feel guilty for enjoying a vacation you worked hard for. We ended up leaving a tip but felt like he could back off a bit about it. Not sure if everyone else has had the same experience.  Other than that, we loved the place. We'd stay there again in a heartbeat. Can't beat the location and architecture of the hotel!My husband and I stayed for our two year belated honeymoon. We were treated with five star service the moment we pulled up to the curb for valet parking. The room was beautiful (and haunted! We had our own paranormal experience while staying) and the staff are amazing. Anything we needed or asked about was promptly delivered. The hotel is within walking distance of anywhere you'd like to go in Savannah. I can't wait to stay again!Centrally located, very clean rooms, nice old charm. Staff was beyond friendly and helpful. Highly recommend getting a balcony room. We will return!
review_content_20: Very nice hotel with great amenities, central location, and all the ghosts you could ever want. We stayed in the Joseph Gordon Levitt (?) suite on the second floor. We checked in during a particularly ominous thunderstorm, which definitely added to creepiness. The lights would dim every time the thunder struck and the falling rain was rattling the window panes. As far as ghostly activity goes, we had a few weird experiences. The first was an odd smell in the hallway that seemed to disappear as quickly as it arrived. We were standing in the hallway talking to other members of our party who were staying in a different room when a disgusting smell overwhelmed us. It smelled like rotting ass. But then it was gone, just like that. I'm sure we just got a whiff of the two hundred year old building's plumbing issues, but it had an unsettling effect. The other "ghost" experience I had was a bit creepier. We had a party of ten, staying in four different rooms (2 suites and 2 norms). The entire party was hanging out in one of the suites when nature called and I excused myself back to my room to politely answer. I was minding my own business dropping a deuce when someone (something?) banged on the hotel door very loudly twice in quick succession. It's a good thing I was already on a toilet because I'm not ashamed to say that scared the crap out of me . I paused and waited for something else to happen. Nothing. I figured it was my brother-in-law or wife messing with me, but seeing as how I had been quite literally caught with my pants down I couldn't really investigate. So I set to finishing what I started, when it happened again. Two loud bangs, very quick. My heart was starting to beat faster and I decided that should today be the day I'm finally murdered by a vengeful ghost, it's not going to happen in the bathroom. So I finished up, went out into the room, and looked through the peephole...nothing. I opened the door and walked out into the hall...nothing. I went back in the room and called my wife and asked who was messing with me. She said they've all been in the suite since I left and no one has parted from the group except me. So, figuring I was going crazy, I sat on the couch in the room and started looking for local restaurants to eat at for dinner. One last time, two loud bangs from the front door. This time I could see the door move with each bang, like it was being hit from the outside. I ran to the door and--because I'm super brave--sheepishly looked through the peephole. Nothing was there. I opened the door and looked down the hall. Nothing was there. My wife still claims no one was messing with me. Either she's lying or there's a ghost in the Marshall House that gets his jollies from scaring people when they're at their most vulnerable. Also, free continental breakfast.I stayed at the Marshall House about a year ago after taking a last second long weekend trip to Savannah.  My girlfriend and I could not have been happier with the hotel.  We loved its historic charm, the location in the heart of Savannah, and the friendly/helpful staff.  The free wine & cheese in the afternoon was a nice, unexpected bonus as well. We heard the haunted stories about the hotel prior to staying here but no ghosts accompanied us during our stay. :)Overall this is a great hotel and we will stay here again next time we visit Savannah.Charming location!!This place exudes southern charm! The staff is very friendly and makes you feel very welcome! The breakfast is nothing special, but it definitely has something for everyone to feel full. Our room was small, but again, checked all the boxes. The location cannot be beat, it's wonderful and always something to do!! Can't go wrong!Excellent place to stay while in Savannah. The staff is great! They are very helpful and friendly. The breakfast was not bad at all. Now from 5-7pm. They have wine and cheese complimentary to all hotel guest. You can have as many glasses of wine as you like. Now that was awesome. Hotel and rooms are super clean. Beds where very comfortable and room was cosy. The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 was because it was not as historic as the pictures show on there website. But the rooms do look like they are from the 1920'sWhat a lovely hotel! We were traveling with a toddler and know she awakens easily with sudden noises. We requested a room away from ice machines and elevators and they were happy to oblige. The Sunday breakfast was delicious with eggs and bacon and the Monday breakfast had hot quiche. The breakfast workers were very busy, they probably could use another person in there helping to refill small stuff (like the strawberry jelly and ketchup for instance) but overall our stay was amazing, the staff was soooo pleasant! We were greeted by everyone, doors were held open for us, staff took a real interest in us. There was a real southern charm to the place. And you can't beat it's central location! Unless you want to be on River Street, but that night scene isn't for us. We much preferred City Market and the historical sites which are VERY close to the Marshall House. Thanks for a great stay!Everyone is so nice here, the staff has gone out of there way to make sure we enjoyed our weekend.  Great location.and decor.  Next time I won't be so close to the elevator and ice machine though.Stayed here on business for three days. Staff were very welcoming and helpful.  The house is in the middle of town and convenient to everything. The locals love the restaurant adjacent to the hotel. You can sit in the lobby and listen to the accents to your hearts delight.  I stayed in a room on the 4th floor named after a journalist and writer, Joel Chandler Harris.  Honestly, didn't sleep too good. Heavy footsteps and children up and down the hall made it a little too eerie for me. Beautiful room and hotel if that unexplained stuff doesn't bug you.The Marshall House is a historic hotel on Broughton Street. Extremely well located for tourists who want to experience downtown. The rooms are quaint and some overlook Broughton Street. There is valet parking and bell hops who open the door for you all day long with a smile. There's wine and cheese hour around 3, if you're getting the munchies before dinner. Service is friendly. The attached restaurant (45) is very very good. They even make gourmet small pizzas which are an explosion of flavor. The only thing I didn't like was the noise. Our room was next to the elevator and you can hear people come in and out. Choose a room further down if they're available.Stayed their for one night last week, and it was outstanding!! The Marshall House location is perfectly suited to walk anywhere you want to go in downtown Savannah. But, the MH has some of the most courteous and professional staff. They go out of there way to make sure you are enjoying yourself and have everything you need. They even kept our bags until later in the afternoon (as our flight did not leave until later in the evening). We had the pleasure of having a room on the 2nd floor, where you can open your window to step out onto a massive, beautiful, wrought iron porch, with rocking chairs. They encourage touring the floors of it's artwork. They offered complimentary evening wine, hors d'oeuvres, desserts inside the main parlor, along with a huge variety breakfast served in a cheerful, sun lit, courtyard. Definitely put the Marshall House on your to do list!!!Wonderful place to stay in Savannah. Staff is extremely helpful. We definitely plan on staying here on future trips. They have wine and cheese during the week and are central to everything in historic areaMy wife and I lodged at The Marshall House because of its location and history.  It is the oldest hotel in Savannah, having been opened in 1851, and has undergone several renovations.  It is in Savannah's famous historic district and about one quarter mile to the riverfront.  This hotel has retained many of its original nineteen-century architectural features but has been updated with modern amenities, including wireless Internet and HD TVs.Our street-side room was very small, and the furniture, which was eclectic, had a bit of a worn-out look rather than being antique. Although it was clean and fairly comfortable, noise occasionally intruded from the street and from inside the hotel.  The inclusive continental breakfast that included quiches along with the usual collection of cereals, pastries, fruit, and drinks was fine.The hotel staff was friendly and accommodating.  Charles who acted as a receptionist/concierge was especially obliging.  He provided us with an assortment of dinner recommendations, called to make reservations for us, and helped us navigate around town. Because The Marshall Hotel is well situated, fairly comfortable, and reasonably priced, I would definitely consider lodging there again.The Marshall house is definitely a historic building,  the rooms are Nice, and clean.  I was a little freaked out after reading about the Haunting but thank God i did not hear or see anything.  I love the customer service,  it's definitely a friendly crew.  I would visit againEnjoyed our weekend at the Marshall House. The location was central and super convenient for sightseeing (and just a block for Leopold's famous ice creamery!) and the room's were clean and nicely decorated. Our king room on the 2nd floor had a shared terrace with rocking chairs that was accessible by climbing out our window. I loved that feature and thought it was super charming.Fun fact: Evidently, there used to be a tax based on the number of doors that hotels had, so this was a workaround back in the day. Also loved the complementary wine and cheese in the evenings. Only thing I didn't love was the old (antique-ish) tub with the wrap around curtain. Seemed a bit odd but didn't leak water. Just not my cup of tea, I suppose. All in all a great stay!This really is an ideal spot to explore Savannah from - right in the heart of the historic district and steps away from the river. We spent a long weekend here and were super impressed with the quality of service. Every employee we encountered was friendly and professional and really seemed invested in making sure we enjoyed our stay. We had a king room on the third floor. I asked for a quiet room and that is exactly what we got - all the way on the end, we heard minimal noise at night. It was blissful. Room is well-appointed (including a safe and fridge) and charming (they've kept the fireplaces even though they no longer work). Bed was very comfortable and the bedding was of good quality. The continental breakfast wasn't terribly hardy (it would have been nice to see some protein besides just eggs), but it was sufficient (and really, you should be checking out Savannah's breakfast joints instead). We took full advantage of the valet service. At $15 a day, it was well worth it not to deal with the hassle of trying to find some place to park the car (streets and lots fill up fast - especially during high season and on weekends). If you're there in the off-season though, there is a parking lot right behind the hotel and you can purchase super cheap parking passes for 1 or 2 days.I've been wanting to stay here for years now due to the fact it's an old, historic property and it comes with it's share of ghost stories.  On a whim we were able to get a room for our one night in town and we chose a superior queen room.  It was small but perfect for me and my husband.  The furniture was cute, the tv was nice, bathroom was small and only had a shower but it was fine.  We were on the second floor and tucked away in a corner so we didn't have anyone walking by our room which cut down on any noise.  Some street noise came in but not too much to be annoying.  The hotel itself was beautiful.  The hardwood floors were definitely old and creaky but it added character.  The free breakfast was good and was a served in a nice room.  Hotel staff all seemed friendly and helpful, and the valet guys were very nice as well.
