Bathroom was on a par with the Westin in Ft. Lauderdale - which is to say, outstanding.  Staff is friendly and the turn-down service exceptionally so. No sweeter smile exists on the planet.Location combined with appointments make this worth every  penny.Single gripe - in a city that boasts being the second to have a Coca-Cola bottling plant, there wasn't a bottle of coke to be had anywhere. Unless you're happy with cans, the front desk suggests you walk to the nearest Kroger.  NOT what I expected to hear. Still, a very nice couple of days.Manager apologized and brought out sunflower bread. I would give them a second chanceVery nice place.  Room was great, service was excellent.  Location was top notch.I would stay here again without question.Southern hospitality at its finest, right down to the sweet tea and oatmeal raisin cookies in the lobby. The decor was grandiose and in some ways over the top. However, it fits with the mansion. The proximity to Forsyth Park was nice, but it is still a drive from the waterfront. Great place for a girls' weekend.Nice bathtub.  Nice decor. Poor on fundamentals of guest service. Just couldn't  keep up with the flow of guests, getting rooms turned, housekeeping, providing responsive, positive guest experience. Understaffed where they need it. Overstaffed on the fluffery. Could be a nice property, but just not well managed.Now this is a beautiful hotel.  So we pulled up and handed the car over to the valet.  Check-in is at 4pm, but the room wasn't ready until almost 5pm.  That's why I gave them four and not five stars.  While waiting for my room to be cleaned, they took my luggage, and I went exploring the hotel.  There is an outside marble area near the pool.  I walked out there it was a little humid, so I didn't stay in that area long.  I went back inside and walked around.  The walls are covered with really beautiful artwork.  There is a nice bar to have a few drinks.  Past the bar, I thought was a gift shop, but it was where they sell the art pieces and other miscellaneous art items.Okay, so now on to the rooms.  I get into my room, and it was really nice.  I didn't get a room with the nice view of the park, so that kind of sucked.  Not a big deal since I really didn't spend that much time in the hotel room besides sleeping.  I had a king size bed that was very comfortable, and a nice size bathroom.  My shower had three shower heads.  It was the best shower ever.  It felt so fancy.  (ha, best way to describe it)    The area surrounding the hotel is gorgeous.  It's located next to park and walking distance to a lot of bars and stores.  The hotel offers free shuttle service within the historic district when you value your car.  I liked this place a lot.  If I visit Savannah again, I'll definitely stay here again.Beautiful hotel, perhaps the prettiest place we have stayed.  Great bath tub in room.  Wish they supplied bath supplies instead of trying to sell it.  Bed was comfortable and room was beautifully furnished.  Surprisingly, this beautiful hotel is dog friendly for $150 fee.  We brought our dog and walked him on the Forsyth park.  Wish we could have enjoyed the pool as it looked great.  Enjoyed a late dinner in their restaurant.3.5  The outside of the hotel is beautiful. The artwork in the hallway is unique, a little different, but not necessarily bad.  Although the decor was very different, I enjoyed it.  We were away celebrating our anniversary, so I think the uniqueness was a great reminder this wasn't a family vacation for us. The room atmosphere  was great, very romantic. The bed was awesome, super comfortable. There were a couple of service issues.  The bathroom didn't seem very clean, The snacks/fridge weren't fully stocked, the fridge was actually opened with an interior lock broken when we arrived.  It made me a bit nervous we would be charged for something since drinks and snacks were missing, still waiting to make sure.  We called down to the front desk to let them know.  The toilet was broken, but they were up within 15 minutes to fix it, but left water drops all over the bathroom.  The next morning, even though we had requested privacy they knocked on the door twice to come clean it, thinking we were leaving, which was partly our fault since we decided to stay another two days.  They were knocking before checkout time though.  Then for the next two days they didn't clean our room, evidently we left our room too late, even though both times we left before 12.  When we called for fresh towels they were quick to bring them up, and then sent someone to clean the room.  When they did, they didn't replace any toiletries, which by this day we were out of shampoo and conditioner.  And they left the cleaning spray.  When we decided to stay another two days, the only room that was supposedly available was the concierge floor.  We took it, thinking this was the only thing available, but after reading other reviews discovered that the concierge lounge is in a different section of the building, not a particular floor, and was receiving horrible reviews.  We asked to take that portion off our bill, and they removed it.  Room service was quick, and the food was good.  They add on a 22% tip, and an additional fee that I can't remember--but we had arrived very late, just ordering before the 11 pm cutoff, and didn't want to head out to eat.  The outdoor patio by the pool was beautiful.  The pool is very small.There was daily wifi charge of $10.  They have valet parking, but we parked on the street for free, just watch for the street sweeping times.The positive was it's a very romantic room, the furnishings and bedding were great.Mansion on Forsyth Park is incredible. GOOD: - Right by Forsyth Park, which is beautiful - Walking distance to lots of things- A nice outdoor pool with lounge chairs to, well, lounge- Spacious rooms- Beautiful decor- A ridiculously comfortable bed- Awesome jacuzzi in the roomNOT SO GOOD: - There seemed to be a lot of random alarms going offOverall though, this is a wonderful place to stay. It's an escape and peaceful (when the alarms aren't going off), whether you're lounging by the pool, napping in the room, chilling in the jacuzzi, or going for a stroll in Forsyth Park. Front desk service is top notch with that southern charm. The Mansion on Forsyth feels like quintessential Savannah. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.
review_content_80: I love it.Lovely hotel clean and quiet. Very cool artwork throughout . Concierge was missing in action????? Helpful valet staff. Parking pretty pricey when there was parking available on street. Complimentary champagne in lobby in pm but no coffee in the lobby in the morning--weird!!!! Appreciate the sparkling clean linens but Clorox smell was super strong.This place is too weird. Not very clean, and burn holes in the curtains. Floor tile grout is black with grime. Their "" Bohemian Art looks like a five-year-old would do it on a bad day. MARRIOT, what are you thinking being associated with this. You must be in financial trouble and this is scary.You've got lots of reviews to read through if you're considering staying at the Mansion on Forsyth Park, so I'll just add a few thoughts:1. The location across from the park worked beautifully for me. Having my dog with me, it was PERFECTLY situated. Plus, the healthy walk to the waterfront took us through some lovely neighborhoods. Just walk down Drayton and bring your camera to shoot some wonderful facades.2. The decor is a bit over the top, and I wouldn't want to live with it on a daily basis, but it is quite fun and interesting for a hotel stay. Nicely done!3. Our room had a few issues, such as the lack of an in-room amenities book (which never came from Guest Services as promised), some mildew on the clear silicone surrounding the shower, and a CD that wouldn't play in the Bose system. Overall, small things. On the plus side, the bed was delightful and the staff very friendly, even to Lucy our dog. As for Casimir's Lounge, read my other review to get more on that. Be forewarned! I would venture out to Local 11 Ten for a cocktail and meal which is just at the end of Forsyth Park vs. staying in the hotel.We usually stay at their sister hotel but wanted to change it up. We had a wonderful room that did not disappoint what we expected. Everything looked amazing and was completely spot on. Outstanding service by all (from the valet on up). Great location but we liked being on river street just a bit more...if only because its closer to everything on a rainy weekend..lol. we shall return and its nice to have another "go to" hotel!My husband and I stayed at Mansion in March, on a mini getaway. I cannot say enough about how great it was!The location -- right on Forsyth park, within walking distance of most of the sights -- was perfect. Quiet in the evenings (not by any loud bars!), beautiful in the daytime. The rooms were great. The highlight of my stay was the giant bathtub (you can watch TV from the bathtub!), and the beautiful furnishings. Service was great and it the whole place had a cute boutique-y vibe. Do NOT park in the lot -- you can park on the street, right next to the lot, for free! Also, if you're looking to save money on food or need to pick up some essentials, its about 2 blocks from a Harris Teeter.We cannot wait to go back again, and we've told everyone we know that they should stay there if they visit Savannah!We wanted a martini in the hotel's bar next door but it was closed for a private party so we had drinks in the hotel's lounge - the Bosendorfer. Average drinks but nice ambience. Quiet and reserved with nice views of artwork and Forsyth Park.I found this place while on a business trip.I began looking for a hotel at all of big name places down toward the river- places that I have points at too. No matter where i went I couldn't find a rate for less than $175 a night. I finally decided to go on priceline to see what came up. Some place called "The Mansion" showed up for $144 a night. So I said whatever let's go.I thought I made a mistake when I drove up to the hotel. The building itself looks like something out of an old murder/mystery novel (sort of like most of the town). Walking in the door is like getting slapped in the face with a combination of hand picked architectural elements, hanging light fixtures and pieces of art. The thing that I found to be odd was that the general setup had sort of a tasteful gaudiness to it. The people at the front desk were nice enough and accomodating despite the slow computer system that they were dealing with. No big deal. I enjoyed some nice water with fresh oranges while I waited.When I got up to my room it felt as if I stepped into a different world. The room itself had a feel of Victorian, old southern feel with a hint of modern design. In any case, this place far exceeded my expectations for accommodation when I'm on the road. The beds were super comfy, and the bathroom had a massive tub with doors that opened up to the rest of the room. The setup seems like it would be ideal for a small get together with the lady. I was staying alone and the ambiance was giving me devient thoughts. My only complaint is that the front desk messed up my wake up call and taxi ride to the airport. Granted I had a 5:30 AM flight and I spent my last evening out on the town.....but still. However, in the rush of waking up late I left some of my dress shirts in the closet. I called to tell them and they shipped them back to LA for me in less than 5 days. That meant something to me.The location is pretty cool. Right next to a huge park. However it is a little out of the way for the more 'happening' area down toward the river. A late night out will more than likely require a taxi ride.If I ever need a old time southern getaway, Savannah will be my city and The Mansion will more than likely be where I'd stay.I have been wanting to stay at The Mansion for about 2 years now since a visit we made previously to Savannah. We have recently moved to the area and decided for our anniversary we would do a little Staycation and treat ourselves to a night here. The hotel is gorgeous. Lots to see. Room was very romantic and the view of Forsyth was so nice. Stayed on a Saturday so everyone was out enjoying the day at the park. I will say be prepared for noise if you choose a Forsyth Park view room. The walls didn't block much especially the people hanging outside at night. We think they were guests at the wedding that was being held there that night. The bed was very comfy and they sure didn't short us on pillows. There were five! My main complaint with the room is the bathroom situation. The area where the toilet is has only a glass door and it doesn't really close. Soooooo....yeah, you can hear all the business that is being done in there. So while the room is romantic, it kiiinnnddaaa puts a damper on things when you can hear your significant other, well...you know. Overall though, we had a very nice stay. Only other hotel we have stayed at to compare in the area was the Andaz and we really LOVED our stay there."Heaven In the Form of a Business Trip"Y'all. This is one of my most favorite hotels - ever. And I've done more than my share of traveling. I'm feeling a bit . . . succinct tonight (for me), so let me tell you why I so adore the Mansion - in bullet-point form:1 Great location near fun restaurants in the downtown-ish area. If I didn't have dinner plans with customers when Savannah was part of my territory, I could easily check in/park my car/get out for a lovely meal without much ado at all.2 The. Coolest. Rooms. The style is what I think of as "art-deco-y" and all the rooms are a little different. But the second you walk in the lobby, you just feel like you are in a really neat place. Great art on the walls, fantastic appointments in every room where I ever stayed.3 Ok . . . this is a personal "love" of mine: huge bathtub (and I always asked for/usually got a room where the "soaking tub" was accented by a large "cut-out" window that gave me a direct view of the TV). And....the Mansion always has great movies-on-demand-plus . . . 4 . . . Great, and speedy (and not too hotel-over-priced) room service. So, after a long day of sales calls, I could order a yummmmy hamburger and bottle of bubbly (yes, a bottle!) and nestle into the tub with bubbles, and get a movie I'd been wanting to see. Life = gooood!5 Fast, reliable wireless. Always. So nice, and not the case in all hotels!I wish I still had business to do in Savannah - but I'd totally stay there for a getaway weekend. Did I mention that you can get special rates from travelocity and such sites??Don't bother staying here, unless your going to be playing in the park everyday. Location sucks, if you go the wrong way out of the hotel you will be in the GHETTO.Hotel staff is not helpful and they are understaffed. So plan on waiting forever to check in and out; also if you have a question.Oh yea if they have a wedding going on, then you will not be able to use the pool or courtyard. Never again...Loved this place!! - Beautiful property- Beautiful Rooms / clean- Hotel Restaurant had amazing food- Friendly staffMy only complaint was the Bath would only heat the water to luke warm, so no relaxing bath. Other then that, we had an amazing time.The name says it all. The Mansion will make you feel like a celebrity, from the minute their attentive little bellboys open the door for you. We arrived at the Mansion after a hellish travel day, and didn't make it to our room until 1am, but it was definitely a sight for our sore eyes. The feel of the entire property is decadent, plush, and beckons indulgence. It's a little glitzy, but in a romantic-gothic sort of way, which totally fits the theme (The Mansion was once a mortuary, after all). I hear that each room is slightly different - ours had a big tub with half-doors that opened up to the bedroom area, so you could carry on a conversation while one person is having a bubble bath and the other is lounging on the bed...an odd, but interesting detail. The shower and toilet are separated by a slightly-opaque glass wall, so once again...one person can shower while the other's on the pot and you can still have a face-to-face chat. An interesting way to "bond" with your travel partner or get over your stage fright...Service was wonderful. No overkill, just very attentive and polished with a hint of southern charm. For example, we went swimming in the hotel pool in the middle of a thunderstorm and instead of telling us we couldn't because of those silly pool rules, they offered to bring us dry towels when we were finished. Customer service, baby. That's what it's all about. Room service was yummy and overpriced, but you're at the Mansion, c'mon, live a little. The bar is a fun place to start or end your night too, especially if you're in the mood for more expensive grub and fancy drinks. Great location overlooking Forsyth Park and a 10 minute walk to downtown. If splurging is your game, the Mansion is waiting for you.A WARNING TO BRIDES.My bridesmaids and I stayed at the Mansion the night before my wedding. My mother in law booked the room and my sister in law called to confirm that we could take all of our photos there the day of the wedding.So my photographer and I planned to shoot the getting ready shots in the hotel room and then do a mini bridal session around the Mansion the morning of my wedding. Afterward, we'd head across the street to Forsyth Square for bridal party photos (the main reason for booking this gorgeous yet VERY expensive hotel was for its backdrop and convenience). As we were walking around, a staff member (I believe she identified herself as the on-site coordinator) asked if I was getting married at the Mansion. Giddy about my impending nuptials, I gushed about our ceremony details and how we were actually getting married at Whitfield Square.Well I guess I should have lied because she told us we couldn't shoot photos there unless I was a bride getting married on their property! Um, heeello?!? We stayed there the night before and made them well-aware of my intentions to take photos when we reserved the room!I was extremely upset about this and since then I've seen countless brides on photographers' websites who've taken portraits at the Mansion but had their ceremony elsewhere. Heck, I even saw tourists taking photos inside but since there was a professional camera involved, we were targeted!In hindsight, I would have skipped staying there the night before the wedding because they made everything a hassle and only seem to care about in-house brides and not their paying overnight guests.I gave them 2 stars because I did have a blast at their bar the night before with my girls and because the decor/rooms really are lovely.I spend over 100 days annually in hotels and this hotel was one of the worst experiences. We checked in after a long day and at 2 am the fire alarm went off. The asked everyone to wait outside while the fire department comes (here is the video of all guests outside at 3 am youtube.com/watch?v=gmWp...). I understand fire alarms can go off, but there was no communication by the hotel. They basically just threw everyone out and bathrobes for an hour without any communication. Then the fire department arrived and gave the ok to go back around 3 am. They then had a faulty alarm, meaning false alarms continually going off until 4 am. I called to speak to the general manager, Mr Kelly, in the morning he said it was a minor inconvenience and all he would do is give us a free breakfast. Is this a joke????? I never look for any hand outs, but this was unacceptable. I paid for a nights rest, instead I got a horrible nightmare. (The valet told us they have some club at night and they didn't realize that they were setting off the fire alarm while they were making some late night food).It didn't end here, the sheets were very old and the elastic was worn. Therefore, every night the sheets would slide off the mattress and we would wake up on the mattress (neither of us has this ever happened to). We asked the maid to change the sheets and explained this situation. She said "honey, the sheets are too old, there is nothing we can do". To make maters worse the mattress was disgusting. The final straw was our toilet ran all night. We tried to have it fixed, but no one did anything. On a positive note, the valets and cleaning staff was very pleasant and helpful. The cookies were also tasty. All and all I will never return to this place. I am sure there are plenty of spots that value their customers in Savannah and Mr Kelly demonstrated that Mansion is not one of them.A good hotel! I am a huge fan of the decor which is really funky and modern with a wide variety of art which I really enjoy. I really enjoyed staying next to the park instead of the more touristy riverfront. All of the staff here were great especially the valet staff. The rooms were so comfortable with a great bathtub and snugly robes. They also have a pool which is kinda small but still nice in the summer time. The spa here was also really incredible. I had a wonderful facial and would highly recommend a visit. Overall, a good bet for a nice hotel in Savannah!The Mansion on Forsyth is where we celebrated the night our engagement, and also celebrated there for our wedding reception. The restaurant, 700 Drayton, is absolutely exquisite. Every dish is carefully planned and selected for the season's most interesting fare. Dishes include southern favorites such as their twist on Shrimp and Grits, filets of fish and beef, and delectable desserts. Their banquet service was executed to the highest standard. Each selection was fresh, hot, and served to impress. Rooms are upscale, funky, and very Savannah. The place has history, art, architecture, and style. Your eye will be pleased with the interesting pieces and collections making each room different. Guest rooms are beyond luxe. Bedding is plush, but the garden bath tubs surrounded by sheer curtains (and closable doors/windows) really make the experience worthy of a four-star rating.Very enjoyable stay, valet and bell men were quite good. Front desk was good...not great. Overall a bit pricey relative to service levels. Art throughout the hotel, hanging in front of curtained walls was really neat. Bed was lousy for me (super duper soft and marshmallowy). I like firm beds, this was the opposite. Very well designed, can't say I love the lack of a bathroom/toilet door. Location was really nice. I'd go back.I'm a big fan of any of the Kessler hotels & The Mansion on Forsyth is no exception! I am so lucky that my BFF opted to have her December '10 wedding reception in the hotel's FABULOUS ball room/marble courtyard because there was no excuse for me & the Hubs, as well as some other lucky family members not to stay here :-) Especially when I located an excellent room rate, even lower than the reserved wedding rate via TravelZoo! From the moment one pulls up & is greeted by the friendly valets and bellhops, you know you're somewhere a little extra special... The small-ish yet tastefully appointed lobby is welcoming and there's so much to satisfy the senses! My favorite being sight, as the hotel's artwork collection is wonderful!We booked a standard king room & were pleasantly surprised with the room's spacious feeling (large by boutique hotel standards) and fun open bathroom, with a nice big tub and separate tiled shower. The colors, textures and textiles used throughout the hotel are magnificent - anything from crystal and mirror to green velvet...wowza!The Mansion offers free shuttle service to anywhere in historic Savannah between about 8am and 11pm & we certainly took advantage of it! The shuttle drivers were friendly and offered great suggestions on the best places to go out in Savannah.The only negative - the high price for parking. I believe it was aprox. $30/car/day. A little steep, even for Savannah standards, however with the great deal we got through TravelZoo, we were a-ok with it :-)I'll let my friend post about her wedding experience - but as a guest and wedding party member, I was extremely pleased with the ballroom setup, food (although the shrimp 'n grits could have been replenished a bit more often on the buffet) and overall service. It was a great experience that I know many of the guests continue to gush about!I wanted my 95th review to be someplace special. (Saving the 100th for somewhere special in my hometown)This is one of the grandest, most beautiful, hotels that I have ever stayed at in my whole life!We stayed here the night of my daughter's wedding. The small reception was held at the hotel's outstanding restaurant, 700 Drayton, and the ceremony was held across the street in Forsyth Park (see review).This hotel is the definition of EXQUISITE!!!Top notch, high end, impeccable.The service, the rooms, the staff, the lobby, the food, beyond outstanding!From the moment you check-in at the front desk to the morning that you leave, you are treated like a celebrity.Velvet upholstery, crystal chandeliers, fine artwork, marble floors and tubs, complete class. Not a detail missed.Laying my head on the fluffy, soft, top of the line, pillows and linens was the perfect end to a perfect day!Just a side note...the groom forgot his dress socks, my husband gave him his, and the concierge actually had a bellhop run a new pair (who knows where they bought them) over to the park where the men were lining up before the ceremony started!

hotel_name: The Bohemian Hotel Savannah Riverfront, Autograph Collection
review_content: A totally chill place to relax and have a glass of wine and a lite bite with family and friends!Service was great along with excellent views. There is a nice amount of space to sit and stand. Decent by the glass wine selection. Lite bites are above average and of average price. There two nights in a row and have enjoyed both visits. Great river view! And lots of people!!I did not stay at this hotel but we had dinner at their restaurant. The kitchen was backed up and we waited over an hour to get our food. We all ordered the filet cooked medium. When they came out all three steaks were charred and all three were Med-well, I'd say closer to the well side. The server got the manager for us and when we showed him our steaks he argued that they were in fact medium. My friend pressed her fork into the steak to show him how dry it was and there was no juice coming out of it, as there should be in a medium steak. He still argued that they were cooked appropriately. Two of us did not eat more than a few bites of our steak. Even steak sauce didn't help much. For nearly $40/steak, you want something that at least taste good. The manager handled the situation very poorly. I understand it was a rough night for them but he should not have argued with us when it was clearly overcooked. He did offer to comp our side items and drinks, which for me may was no more than $15, I only had one drink and one side. If I had thought about it, I would have taken pictures to share in this review. The server wasn't great because my friends drink went empty and stayed that way for awhile. However, I chalk that up to the server going back to the kitchen to find out where our food was. The bar upstairs is nice. We went there a few nights before. The view was wonderful and they have a great fireplace. I wouldn't go back because of the awful expensive dinner experience. But other people seemed to have much better experiences, we may have just caught a bad night with a poor manager.What a gorgeous hotel with a perfect location.....we stayed here for a few days over my birthday and Gloria helped us so much at check-in and made our visit perfect. Gloria is a gem!The rooms are gorgeous and the bathrooms are very modern. I really liked the nice touches throughout the room, especially the sitting bench in front of the window overlooking Bay Street. I also liked the dark hallways....not sure why, but I thought they were cool.A wonderful location right on Bay so you are right in the mix. They also gave a wonderful upstairs bar overlooking Bay Street and the water to the rear. It's a big space, but fills up quickly due to their location. The exercise room is a closet...literally a closet so don't expect much of a workout...but boo hoo...you are in Savannah (a beautiful walking city) so you can miss a day or two.....Oh so very Savannah! This was the last stop for us on our mini-moon, and after a slight booking glitch at our condo in Tybee, we were more than ok to snag a last minute room at the Bohemian, so we could adventure around Savannah for a day. I drove past it once, as the building really blends in with the historic scene of the city. After a U-turn (I'm the queen of U-turns y'all) there we were: The valet was on top of it and a bell hop (are they still called bell hops?) helped us with our luggage up to our room. And to take the customer service to the next level... we had quite a bit of beer with us that we didn't finish at the beach, so he offered to go get us ice, and knowing the little ice bucket wasn't going to cut it (ok, we had a lot of beer left) he actually filled a waste basket full for us. A++!!! The layout of this hotel is a little strange, but in a good/cool way. The lobby is on the 4th floor (but street level) and it's filled with dark wood, leather and some very cool lighting. The hallways feel dark and mysterious.... and I was secretly hoping Jim Williams would jump out to greet us. The room was clean, and what you would expect from a Bohemian hotel. Very cool walk in shower with a sitting area, and private commode area with it's own glass door (just watch out for the bottom of the doors... they are sharp and I cut my foot. (I'm a little clumsy in the morning before coffee thou...) We had a riverfront view, and you see HUGE cargo ships, that look so unreal in the seemingly tiny river.... I see reviews here for the rooftop bar, which we did hit up when we were they, but I left the review on the bar's own Yelp page: yelp.com/biz/rocks-on-th... (Great views, if you are staying here, check it out.) All in all, it was a great stay, just cost an arm and a leg, but that could have been due to last min booking/peak season.Stayed Feb. 19th and 20th. Room 405 if I recall correctly. Arrived at night so it's a little hard to find. My navigation app had trouble finding it too and the valet area is counter-intuitive and not obviously marked. Valet is $30 a day (I believe) and they request a 20 min. warning to retrieve your car. Savannah parking can be difficult so, this was an expense I was willing to bear. Check-in was a breeze and friendly.The room: It was lovely. Not too large. Plush furnishings but when we arrived there were no lamps in the room and it was very dark. I notified the desk and they resupplied one of the two lamps fairly quickly and explained that there had been an accident with a lamp somewhere else in the hotel and they appropriated the lamps from our room. The second lamp never materialized but it was no big deal.The historic view from the 4th floor room was of the valet area which was also near the entrance so it could get noisy. Ask for an upper level or river view if you can.The CD player never worked longer that 20 seconds. I informed the desk and it was never fixed. (they supply a CD for your pleasure but I couldn't enjoy it)The door would also not deadbolt which is a major security/privacy issue for me. I also informed the desk of this and it was not remedied. Overall: it's a cute hotel but the service needs to match the price.Had drinks on the rooftop after a late dinner. Really nice with firepits which keep you warm when the weather drops. We have to come back and enjoy the restaurant as well as stay here. If it's as good as the Castle in Orlando, then we're in for a treat!This place is amazing. Every single staff member was extremely nice, they have lots of people working here as well. Our room was so nice, I love the decor. The shower was nice, the bed was nice, there is music playing in your room when you enter. Love it here and will continue to stay here every time we visit Savannah. A+++.Stayed here the weekend before Christmas. Was not sure what to expect, as I wasn't the one to book it. It was the perfect, romantic getaway. I enjoyed the unique, "dark" decor. The paintings throughout the hotel were magnificent, especially the one in our room. Very eclectic taste. Rooftop bar was the hotspot. We enjoyed some tapas and cocktails before heading out to dinner. Give the ginger infused bourbon a try ;) Centrally located to everything you need to see in Savannah.If I could give this place less than one star I would. When we checked in to this five star priced hotel, the desk clerk, Alexander, assured us we had been given a "great room." When we returned to our eighth floor room after dinner that night we learned it was anything but. No one bothered to warn us that a full band was playing directly above us in a night club jammed with no less than 300 people. The pounding music and partying went on until 1 am. When we complained the desk staff was incredulous that we didn't appreciate our "great room." The manager Jeremy offered us an insultingly small discount and free breakfast for our inconvenience but made no commitment that his staff would warn the next unwitting guests. We won't be returning. There are some great hotels in Savannah. The Bohemian isn't one of them.Update: Eight months later. We were just telling a friend about our horrible experience at the Bohemian and warning her not to stay there. I noticed that my review got a "PR" response from management expressing "concern" and saying they were "looking into it." For the record, I never heard back. Except for their public statement on Yelp there was zero follow up. Trust me, unless you're happy with a drunken out of control brawl, this hotel is not for you.This place is exquisite. My favorite part is the roof top bar, where you experience breath-taking views of the city, including the bridge. The only reason I did not rate this a five star is because the band was kind of a buzz kill. They were not upbeat at all, and seemed to be singing 80's sad songs. It didn't match the crowd or the atmosphere. It brought the overall mood of the place down. The drinks are a little pricey on the rooftop as well, but it's worth it for the view. Our server was very attentive and fun, and was very accommodating. I wouldn't visit Savannah without at least stopping here.Only reviewing for their rooftop service. We ordered two drinks. The Bloody Mary was delicious. My cobbler cocktail was not. We ordered a small appetizer, pretzel bites that took longer to be served, than to make, they sat in the window for a good 10 mins before being brought to us. When we tasted them, they were dry and topped with a heavy amount of mustard and some kind of cheese on bottom. We turned them away and the bartender laughed at us. He laughed in my face and just walked away. We visited Wednesday the 8th around 10pm. It was a young gentleman working. For such a nice place, their customer service needs work. Pretty view though.The hotel sets off on the side street as if its a brick office building, but as you drive up you see the door porters waiting to open the door for you as you walk into this beautiful bohemian styled lobby. One thing that stands out as you walk through the looby looking at the decoration there's no traditional countertop for check in. As you pass the elevators you notice two desk on both sides of the lobby where you are greeted by an hotel associate. Each desk has two chairs in front of it to relax as you give them your name and information. I thought this was very different, very unique, hotels should really do away with the countertop this makes it more personalized. Somewhat relaxing.The room that we reserved was absolutely beautiful, except for the chandelier over the bed and the two lights in the bathroom area over the sink. They were hideous. They were made out of seashells. In some weird way it seemed as if somebody dipped the lights in seashells and glue. They actually look somewhat scary. But the sitting area had a large chair for two people to cuddle up in and look out over the river through our large picture view window, you can't get any more romantic than that. The walk in shower that was very nice. I would rate the room 9 out of 10. The restaurant was nice we ate right beside one of their many openings to watch everyone walk up the cobblestone Road. Not to leave out we also enjoy the boats on the river as they passed us for the Thanksgiving Christmas parade. They were about 30 some old boats with Christmas lights going back and forth up and down the river. Another added romantic treat.We spent one night here, and found this hotel to be charming, although a bit pricey. I guess the great location can demand that, though.We found the staff to be very guest-attentive and very service-oriented. The room was very comfortable and spacious, although I've got to admit having a room with the toilet just a foot from the outside wall is a rather unusual layout, especially when you have a view of the riverfront, and people walking along it have a view of you. Oh well, if you're not bashful, it's not a problem.The only fault I could find with the hotel is the rooftop bar, where it is very difficult to find seating, especially for four. The entire bar area is very noisy, and as someone else noted, the music does not really flow well--it's almost like the DJ is switching from '80's to R&B to C&W to Grunge (not really that bad, but you get the idea).The location is truly great--get off the elevator at the 1st level, and you're at the riverfront, or get off at the Lobby Level (4th floor), and you're right on West Bay St. one block from Bull.The art throughout the hotel is very interesting, although it won't appeal to everyone. Reservations can be made through Marriott, FWIW.Nice hotel, just not quite as cool as it thinks it is. Although at random intervals you will see Forest Gump sitting in lobby waiting for a tour bus. Everyone on the staff was excellent. Very friendly, courteous, helpful. The restaurant wait staff was really great especially at breakfast.The room is very nice but just a bit overdone like every other Bohemian I've stayed at. The bathroom is very nice and the bed was comfortable. I don't know who made the call on the crustacean light fixtures but someone should have stopped them. I kept waiting for some damn sea creature to crawl out of the one above the bed. The room was also really humid even with the AC running colder than ideal.We had drinks at the roof top which was a pretty cool area. We ate several meals at the restaurant and they were all good but not amazing.The main downside is you pretty much have to valet your car and they park it off site. So on top of valets driving your car, something I'm not a fan of, it takes about 20 minutes to get the car brought around. It's also $30 a day which seems quite high for the area. Maybe it was bad timing but every time we tried to park in the nearby public garage it was full.Loved this hotel. Very friendly staff, good restaurant, cool rooftop bar. Huge bathrooms in room, very comfortable beds. Good location on the river. Love the way this hotel is decorated- beautiful paintings hang all over. Would definitely stay here again.The five star review is based solely on the front desk employee Heather, who literally saved our trip. I did not stay at this location, but rather stayed at their sister property The Mansion on Forsyth. When I arrived at The Mansion on a Sunday morning there was no concierge on duty, and would not be one available until Tuesday (the last day of my stay). I took a short trip to Savannah with my sister for quick birthday getaway. I arrived in Savannah with no set plans, except planning on working with the concierge to book tours and restaurant reservations. The front desk employee at The Mansion offered to help in the concierge's absence, but to be honest did not provide very helpful tips. On a whim, I approached Heather at the front desk of The Bohemian and explained my dilemma. She sat down with us for 20 minutes and planned an awesome trip. She used to work at The Olde Pink House and gave us a few tips, and filled us in on the folklore of the historic location. She picked great restaurants, and booked us some really enjoyable tours. Her recommendations completely turned our trip around. If I return to Savannah, I would stay at this location. Aside from the awesome staff (Heather), the location is in the middle of the action. While The Mansion is gorgeous it is an older, more conservative vibe. The Bohemian is funky and hip, and dare I say bohemian? We also enjoyed dinner one night at the restaurant, which is right on the riverwalk. The food was very good, and scenery was great. If you stay at this hotel, be sure to ask for Heather when looking for restaurant or tour recommendations.We really wanted to love this place but it just didn't happen. Based on the reviews and the price we were looking forward to a luxuriousness long weekend but were disappointed.We were traveling with another couple and we both arrived to the hotel late morning. It's complacently expected that arriving that early that rooms wouldn't be ready. The other couple had upgraded to a suite and we had a standard king room on the river front. What was disappointing about check in was that while our room was ready by 2:30 the other couple's wasn't until about 4:30. This was really unfortunate for two reasons..1. one the other couple was ill and really needed to lie down and 2. there is precious little seating in the lobby so we couldn't all sit together and wait for the suite.Now let's talk service, while friendly it certainly isn't exceptional as one would expect for a hotel of level. Not only did housekeeping fail us with check in they continued to fail the three days that we were there. They consistently got to the suite so late in the day that we were already back from sightseeing for the day and looking for a little rest before heading out to dinner and the suite wasn't made up yet. On top of that when we phoned down to the desk and asked that have housekeeping come make up the room, housekeeping never got the message.The views from the riverside are fantastic and it's really cool to watch the huge barges go by. The standard rooms are pretty typical hotel rooms with comfortable beds and good TVs. They are not exceptional by any means though. The bathrooms again are nice but nothing really special. FYI no tub just a shower. The layout in the suite is strange and though on the river side did not have a balcony. All in all we were happier that we had the balcony than the bit of extra square footage that the suite provided without the balcony.Wasn't impressed with the rooftop bar. Waited forever to get a drink and she never asked if I wanted to see a menu. The gentleman next to me asked for glass of cab and how long it had been open. She said a few days ago but it is still good. He said since there isn't much left would you mid opening a new bottle. Little did she know I would have asked for the same glass after that bottle was opened. She would not open it. Horrible service. She had no idea way was going on and who was next in line etc.. Not sure of this falls under the hotel or the bar. The hotel should be responsible for making all guest experiences awesome. There are way to many other choices. The only reason I came to check this out is because my best friend wants to get married and this hotel was on her list. All I can say is NEXT!Reviewing the rooftop bar/club. Crowded as hell on a Saturday night, and very little organization amongst the bartenders. The DJ was terrible, and could not mix two songs together if he tried. Train wreck after train wreck. And what was up with his wedding party DJ setup? The music can barely be heard outside of the bar area. Wack.Drinks were over-priced and service was insanely slow. No bargains to be had here.The hotel staff outside of the rooftop bar were very friendly, and extremely helpful when we enlisted them to help us find La Chica's missing cell phone, so because of that, I'm adding an extra star. Otherwise, this would have been a 'meh' experience.Long overdue in writing this review, but just signed up for Yelp and am still so unhappy over our experience at the hotel in July 2015. We were traveling with our one year old on this trip so a crib was crucial. Due to this we requested a crib at the time of our reservation, called a week before to ensure we would have a crib, and it was the first thing we mentioned upon check in. At check in we were told a crib was not on hand but they were calling around to sister properties and would have one up to us within an hour. Six hours later (and multiple trips and calls to the front desk), we came back to the room with a message from Alex saying they were unable to obtain a crib for us and that was about it. They offered no alternative options and no apology. My husband is a platinum Marriott customer and immediately called the Platinum customer service line in front of the front desk staff. Magically, a crib appeared from behind a door in literally one minute (an hour after our daughters bedtime). The fact that we had to complain up the corporate ladder and my husband had to threaten to take his 100+ nights a year of business elsewhere to get minimal customer service was appalling. We have always had positive experiences with Marriott, but were majorly unimpressed with this location based on customer service alone.
review_content_20: We just returned from Savannah and our second stay at The Bohemian Hotel. I still love this hotel, but I have to say I was a bit turned off by the fact that the make up mirror was so filthy - full of the previous guest's zits. Disgusting. I had called housekeeping and asked them to clean it. When I returned after our day out, it was still dirty eventhough our room had been serviced. I called them again, reported this and left for a walk. Upon our return, it had been cleaned to the best of their ability. I cannot for the life of me understand someone that can afford 300 to 500 per room, how they do not wipe the mirror when done with it and how housekeeping could have missed this multiple times. I love The Bohemian and the proximity to everything, but this really grossed me out. This time we averaged about $300 per night. Is it too much to ask for cleanliness? The water pressure was better this time around and the view of the river and watching the cargo ships was amazing. I am debating whether The Bohemian gets a return visit from me or if I am moving on... with a couple of new boutique hotels that have recently opened, I have choices to make.Stayed here over the last week of Dec 2014 through Jan 2 2015. This hotel is in an excellent location and the service was superb. Yes the room decor is eclectic but it's a hotel not something you are going to live with forever. We had a corner room overlooking the historic district. Being a corner room it was quite large it had a couple club chairs and ottoman. The shower had excellent water pressure and the sink area was super spacious. We had breakfast daily in River Rock and lunch once. Went up to Rocks on the Roof a couple times. Make sure you enjoy the views from all sides. Food was very good. We walked everywhere from this location. It was a great hotel to be in New Years Eve. Easy to walk to the celebration but not too noisy when the thousands continued to leave around. 2 AM.Beautiful location, great views, absolutely atrocious service.  ATROCIOUS.  We came for pre-dinner drinks and again for a night cap after a party for a wedding.  Service was slow/sluggish and orders were wrong.  Little did we know that this was just the tip of the iceberg.  We asked for our tab 3 times, then when our waitress showed no desire to bring them after so many requests (she kept walking past our table without making eye contact), we went outside to find our waitress (Ranay) flapping her gums to plead for our tab, then we waited another 25 minutes for our server (who charged us 18 percent gratuity and thus didn't give a damn).  We were given wrong tabs almost an hour after we requested them.  One of them had a previous customer's bill with $11 cash in it.  We kindly pointed this out instead of pocketing it, and then had to wait another 15 minutes to wait on her to fix it (no apologies).  Won't be back, wish it had even remotely competent service because it has a lot I potential.  Can't remember the last time I saw this much lethargy and apathy.   Lamps are gorgeous (oyster shells) but nothing else is any good.  Go to any other place nearby instead!(this experience was in July 2012 but neglected to post until now)This is our third time staying at the hotel, and I hate to say it but the service during this stay was substandard. Service at the restaurant was horrifically slow. Housekeeping did not clean our room the first night we stayed and so expected a cleaned room the following day but sadly we were mistaken. nope.nothing...really? I called down and they said that we had to allow them until 6:00 to get the rooms cleaned. Um, No! I used to love this hotel but I'm afraid the love affair might be over.We were looking forward to a comfortable stay but were quickly disappointed. The carpet in our room had so much "freshener" in it that it gave me a headache. My dog refused to even set a paw on it. Must have had even a worse headache! Noise in the room from some mechanical equipment and the hallways were dark and musty. Our room felt less than clean, and the bathroom was separated from the room with a curtain! Would not stay there again.What better way to celebrate a birthday than a roadtrip! It was my first visit to the historic city of Savannah. We cashed in some hard-earned Marriott points for two nights at the lovely Bohemian Hotel. The corner suite featured floor-to-ceiling windows on two walls, plush leather armchairs and cool accents like an oyster shell chandelier over the bed and a driftwood floor-lamp. When we entered, there was a jazz CD playing, Bohemian branded and available for sale. Great musical selections.Staff was professional and courteous at all times. They are well-trained, and do their best to make guests feel comfortable and welcome. I agree with another reviewer that the Platinum credit of $10 per day per room comes up short in comparison with other properties that don't have a concierge level.My husband and I stayed a different hotel - the Andaz- which was great but were steered here by our bartender at our hotel. He guided us to the cotton sail for an AMAZING sunset and then suggested going to the Bohemian for dinner and drinks.... He was right. The food at the Bohemian was amazing and our server Grant did a GREAT JOB. VERY attentive and answered all of our  questions. He was a great guy- great service. Nice place, great view. We would def return for their amazing shrimp dish- we ordered a second plate it was so good. Getting a couple of their apps to share was a perfect dinner for us!This is the only the second Autograph collection property I've experienced. The first was the Cosmopolitan in Vegas. I can officially say that 100% of the Autograph Collection properties I've stayed at are exceptional. Pros: - Fantastic bathrooms; Jacuzzi tub is ridiculous (get the corner room) - Exceptional decor in the rooms - Great location - Excellent service - Solid rooftopCons: - Weak water pressure in the bathroom sinks - Gym is tiny - Platinum benefit: $10 room credit per day (for 2 guests) for breakfast is a bit lameRooftop bar is great, dancing, good drinks and apps.The views are great, nice to be able to walk outside and get away from the music, crowd etc. at times.  Went there three times during our stay in SavannahI plan on going back next time in town, maybe stay at the hotel.This place definitely has a great bar on top. Take the elevator to the roof and enter the best view of Savannah's night scene. Cocktail dresses and bonfires on a roof! What more can a single man ask for? The river's sparkling lights stretch out over the panoramic view with a breeze that can't be felt street level. Drinks are made with a smile and poured just right; no skimping at this fine establishment. Check it out!This was a great place to hang-out...definitely a fun place in Savannah.The hotel itself is chic and modern, but still very relaxed and casual.  The rooftop area was lively...I will say that it seemed to try to be all things to all people: there was a live band, a cool setting and a TV for watching sports...I guess whatever you're into, you'll find it here.My wife and I spent our honeymoon in Savannah and stayed here. We couldn't have been happier. The rooms were very nice, uniquely designed and service was great. You couldn't ask for a better location if you want access to everything in the historic district. It's located right in the middle of river and bay streets so it's a short walk to just about anything you'd want to see or do downtown. Definitely recommended for anyone wanting to stay in the area.I attended the bar expecting a wonderful roof top experience. However, I was assaulted by some rowdy patrons and I asked for the ones responsible to be kicked out. Instead, they were allowed to stay. The food and environment are amazing but I never expected the general manger to allow me to be accosted and the person responsible to stay at the establishment. I will never return!The two stars are for the location and the fabulous decor. The valet, room service and rooftop bar staffs were wonderful and attentive - and we would give them 5 stars. But the lack of more stars are for the generally pathetic service - which I will qualify up front. There are two staff (concierge) that were incredibly friendly, knowledgeable and made an effort to follow through on questions/requests. I wish I could remember the women's names. But the other rotating concierge were so lackluster, so seemingly apathetic - or perhaps untrained, that we just had to laugh at the constant comedy of poor customer service. The best description we could come up with is that the concierge staff felt like kids whose parents were out of town for the weekend, and they just really didn't care what happened.But thank you to the staff that was friendly, courteous and attentive. We loved Savannah and will definitely be back - but not at the Bohemian.When walking into the hotel there was no one to greet us or open the door. I hadn't driven to the hotel as I live in Savannah and was out for the evening and on a whim decided to check out the hullabaloo of the Bohemian as I have stayed at the Mansion of Forsyth Park and just fell in love. My partner and I meandered into the lobby looking for someone to help us. I was told that the computer system wasn't working and that if i wanted to reserve a room I should call this 1-800 number that was given to me on the brochure. There were two people in the lobby both seemingly perplexed by the computer system error.  I called the 1-800 number provided still a little unsure why one of the people in the lobby couldn't have just called the number and made the reservation for me as was the service I feel would have been exemplified the Kessler brand. Nonetheless, I called the line, made the reservation for a room that had a tub in it, river view, king sized bed. When I realize where our room is we have to take the elevator down from the lobby as our room was on the second floor. Upon arriving in the room was excited by the decor and the layout of the room. Enjoyed the decor and the bedding,  really loved that you could access your Netflix account via room television. Paying more for a river view room that you can't enjoy because the windows need to stay pulled unless you want EVERYONE on the street to see you certainly felt like a rip off though.When my partner got into the tub for a relaxing soak she turned the jets on only to be SPRAYED with water, the jets are set to start on the highest level of power compared to starting on the lowest level and then you can gradually adjust the jets to be stronger if you desire. At this point we were laughing but honestly, I felt extremely frustrated. As I got out of the tub I realized that one of the light bulbs in the bathroom chandelier was MISSING. not burnt out, not dim but completely MISSING. Once again, at a price point of a fine hotel, that was not what I was expecting nor what I had experienced with other fine hotels.Perhaps the most nit picky, but alas most inconvenient aspect of our room was that all the light fixtures in the main room, less one desk lamp, were all connected to a SINGLE light switch with no dimmer! The halogen light for the painting in our room on the same light switch as the chandelier as the same as the wall sconces. What a horrible oversight! There are so many things that I enjoy about fine hotels and one of them is how in tune the builders and designers are when making the rooms, they give all the thought to details. Care for how the guest would interact in the room seemed not to be a forethought. Overall the room was completely unsatisfying. I left in the morning after being awoken by the house keeping staff who apparently had a hub right next to my room because at 7 AM there were a group of voices talking loud enough to wake me.My partner and I enjoy staying at fine hotels and have stayed at many fine hotels throughout the country and none, NONE were as disappointing as The Bohemian in Savannah.Just stay at the Mansion on Forsyth Park and forget all about the Bohemian.Hands down best hotel I've ever stayed at. Amazing customer service, food, and location. If you're staying in Savannah this is it. Second is the other Kessler property, Mansion on Forsyth. Stellar.Bonus:  Both are two of the FEW pet friendly hotels in historic Savannah.The staff is exceptional   The housekeepers did a wonderful job and the bell men were most helpful. Dan, a transplant from Maine, was very helpful. Room service was quick and brought by a very cheerful young lady.BUT. The decor was quite different. Perhaps the decorator was trying to replicate a pirate's ship. The velvet headboard was a little too much and glass bathroom door awkward.This is for the rooftop bar. Food is delicious and drinks are priced accordingly but this is a bit pricey in general. However it is a very nice and chic place. They even have an outdoor area to hang and look over savannah. Service is good and they are very quick. Enjoyed our time here.WOWWWWWWW!So super ultra extra swanky!The Man-Friend and I had decided to take a random day trip from New Orleans and see where we wound up. 10ish hours later we had made it to Jacksonville, and not being particularly fond of North Florida, decided to head toward Savannah, a city with which I have had a fairly consistent love affair for quite a few years.We scrambled to find a room at the last minute, late at night, and we were looking for something a few steps above a Holiday Inn....Holy Crap did we get lucky. The Bohemian Hotel is easily the swankiest most luxurious and decadent hotel I have EVER stayed in. We checked in around 11pm and met Lavernitra, who was so gracious. With a few magic keystrokes she upgraded us to the super ultra fancy pants corner room, and sent up a bottle of wine and a cheese plate. The room itself is almost overwhelming. Floor to ceiling windows overlooking the river, flat screen TV with Netflix and internet, soft jazz playing when we walked in,  Jacuzzi tub for 2, velvet headboard, and a CHANDELIER MADE OUT OF OYSTER SHELLS! We slept like ageing decadent rockstars. Woke up in the morning to the most delicious Eggs Benedict I have ever had, delivered to my bed, and the wonderful room service lady who helped me make math on the check as I cannot count past 3 before I have coffee.We spent the day exploring Savannah like tourists, which was wonderful, and returned to the Bohemian determined to find somewhere special for dinner.Lo and behold, the ever helpful, always friendly Lavernitra is at the desk again! She recommended restaurants, made us reservations and sent us on our way.Dinner (Vic's on the River) and adventures after, were awesome y'all, but that's a totally different review. Lavernitra (seriously, does she ever sleep?) checked us out in the morning and sent us on our way.Stay at this hotel. It is GORGEOUS. clean, friendly, accommodating and luxurious. And when you check in, see if Lavernitra is working during your stay, because she is MAGIC.This hotel is by far the best hotel I've stayed at.  Great river view - apparently Savannah river is a very active commerce waterway with huge container ships floating by.  As mentioned by others, staff is professional, courteous and extremely helpful.  Other than its great location, hotel itself is several steps above what you'll typically find at other Marriott hotels.  Everything from toiletries to room deco... it was just outstanding.  I hear people complaining about price but honestly, the same type of hotel in NYC would cost at least $600/night.  IMO its a great value for what you get.
review_content_40: Very nice, eclectic vibe in a town notable for historic preservation. The rooms are big, clean and super comfortable. Free wifi and very close to everything that you want to walk too. The staff re very helpful too. I left my wedding ring behind and they found and shipped it to me. The river is primarily commercial and also houses many tourist water holes. Rooms along this side have the potential to get noisy from drunks and ship traffic, caution when booking.It was our anniversary week and my husband surprised me with a trip full of activities.  He chose this hotel based on the level but think we would have been happier at a holiday inn.  We arrived early and called for an early check-in (early as in 2pm) and said "they could not promise an early check-in."  An odd response but no big deal at that point.  We chose to walk around and shop until our room was ready after four.    Upon arriving, frustration set in. Parking was a nightmare which proved quite convenient for the wallets of the valet workers.  Check-in took a very long time and we were denied a king bed.  We paid full price, it was our anniversary and reservations were made well in advance.  I did not understand this.  Again they said, they couldn't guarantee bed types.  Really?  I'd like to know what you couldGuarantee.  Yeah, that's what I wanted to know! To compensate for the bed, they decided to move us up a floor..  Ok, that would make sense if we had a view of the river - but we didn't.  We moved up to have a better view of the street.  Cool.  After getting ready for the night we went downstairs to receive our car to make our dinner reservations.  We waited 30 minutes for valet to get our car which caused us to be late to dinner that was .5 miles away. Because we were late to dinner we were also late to the musical in which we had tickets.  None of that would have even made me that upset had the valet worker not blamed the tardiness on me.  After waiting for 25 minutes I remembered something in the room I could grab - not a necessity but something to pass the time because we knew the worker was nowhere near having our car ready.  When I came back down, his boss was there watching.  He said to us, "I know you have been waiting on her so now I will go get your car."  Wow.  Most of this could have been overlooked on its own, but these mistakes combined with the price you pay to stay at this hotel seem unforgivable.  It got two stars for unique decor and lighting but that isn't even amazing.We will not be going back and if you decide to try it for the bohemian experience, be prepared to be denied lot of service for a high price.Location, location, location.  This is the place to stay!  The back of the hotel is on West Bay Street where you leave your car with valet and enter the hotel lobby, the front is on River Street.  The front desk is in need of a shape up.  They have two desks with cozy chairs where they are supposed to sit on their behinds.  When we arrived, only one was occupied.  And there was a line waiting for some attention.  Apparently, their check in procedure is a bit too complicated to be handled like a normal hotel.  When we finally got our turn, we didn't realize it, but we crowded in front of some gentlemen who were patiently waiting.  Shouldn't the desk person know who is next?  Well, and of course our room was not ready for our 4 pm check in.  Bumbling along, we were told that the bell hop would temporarily hold our luggage and the bags would be transported to our room as soon as it was available.  And we would receive a magic phone call to say that our room was ready.  Also, we could not have our key until after the room was ready.  That's okay, we want to stop by and visit the inefficient front desk again.  Time is wasting, you fool and we have lots to see and do in Savannah.  We don't want to spend any more time here with you!We spent some time in the amazing hotel roof top bar.  We then spent time walking and shopping along River Street.  Yes, it took that long to get our room ready.  And of course, when we got to our room, no bags.The hotel is not for everyone.  My bf thought the hotel hallways were dark and spooky.  I loved the dimmed halls and the crazy beads strung on dim light fixtures.  Our room was awesome, huge, really big, lots of room to move.  Trendy furnishings, the bed had an 8 foot tall headboard, partially clad in tufted velvet  The bath was open to the room and the shower was probably more than 8 feet deep.  The tiling inside it is beautiful, kind of like wood-look slats.  The water closet was in a closet.  With beautiful dark wood big slats plantation shutters.  The bath sink scones were seashell covered as was the huge chandelier about the bed.  Our room was a corner room, so we had a river view lounging area complete with a monster chaise with leather look covering.  You could close the area off when not in use by pulling closed heavy red crushed velvet drapes.Although our room was across the hall from the gym, also near the crushed ice machine and facing the party atmosphere of River Street, the room was very quiet.  When we entered our room, the Bose was playing good tunes.  Loved all the special touches of our room.  I can't say enough about how great our room was.  Another thing I liked, you need your hotel room key to use the hotel elevator.  That was a much appreciated security feature.  However, I have to say, I think Savannah is a safe and welcoming city.Another great thing about this hotel is the valet staff.  They seemed to double team us when we arrived and were so welcoming and friendly.  And they happily readied our car to send us off, getting us bottled water for our road trip.Why just three stars?  The check in is not really forgivable.  I would think that most hotel check-in's occur around 4 pm.  And they weren't staffed properly for that.  This Kessler Hotel is now under the Marriott umbrella of hotels and they should function as that.  The front desk was not only inefficient, they were also not friendly.  Plus, our room wasn't ready.  Mr. Marriott, please stop by and teach these people how to serve and treat the guests.  Another missing star for billing.  We were overcharged for our room.  Breakfast was included with our stay and of course, they charged us for our breakfast.  I even noted on our receipt that breakfast was included.  In over ten years of staying pretty much exclusively with Marriott, I have never had a billing issue of any sort.  Congrats to this team for being the first.  Sure, calling to get the credit took less that a few minutes.  But, I will have to follow up to double check my statement.  But I should not have to worry about such nonsense.  Would I stay here, again?  As much as I love this place, probably not.We selected the Bohemian for our birthday weekend in Savannah as I love all things eclectic/bohemian  - and I found the website images enticing.  I usually stay across the river at the Westin - but chose to try a different venue and the Bohemian Hotel is relatively new to the area.Even though we knew it was a boutique hotel, hence the limited amenities, we were hoping for a much better overall experience.Positive Attributes:  I love the decor in the rooms and the jacuzzi that opens up to the bedroom is a nice touch.  It is also well located on River Street and the Rocks on the Roof bar is a popular hangout for young partygoers. HOWEVER, we were a trifle disappointed with the speed and quality of service and the cleanliness of the room (I had to ask for an item to be replaced immediately upon arrival as it obviously had not been cleaned) was below par for a hotel of this caliber. My husband, who hardly ever complains, was not happy that you have to personally join Netflix in order to watch any new releases and was less than impressed with the food service.Unfortunately, the lovely jacuzzi was not enough to make us pay those rates to return to this hotel.Checked into the Bohemian hotel on a Sat evening and stayed three nights. The 5 star rating is for the level of service. It was excellent - from the valet, to the bellman, the front desk staff and guest services. The decor is not luxurious - more fun and eclectic. Be aware - the rooms are rather dark, which is great for sleeping. I only wish the bathroom was brighter - important for applying make up. The king size bed was comfortable and we had a river view room. It was fun seeing the massive cargo ships go right by our window. The location can't be beat. It's right on the river and close to City Market. TIP: save the $25 daily valet rate and park  in the public garage directly across the street for $10 a day. Better yet, go to the visitor's center and get a parking pass and pay just $7 a day. We learned this on our last day. Gym is small, but adequate. Has a treadmill, an elliptical, bike and free weights.Highly recommended. Clean and modern rooms. Friendly and courteous service. Loved everything about this place. I can't wait to come back!Gorgeous. I could have moved into my room. Better yet, the bathroom. I kept finding excuses to go in. Seriously. Was that beautiful. Rooftop bar was great. Nice vibe, perfect weather the night I went. Beer and cheese plate were spot on...sugar/clove covered grapes anyone? Mmmm...Breakfast the next morning, eggs Benedict with crab and asparagus - and a side of grits- was amazing. It wouldn't have killed our server to smile - or attempt it- though. I guess she felt differently. Upon checkout, the valet handed each of us a chilled bottle of water for our drive. Nice touch. If you appreciate great decor and architectural finishes, stay here!I like this hotel!  I travel on business quite a bit and saved all my Fairfield Inn points to stay at this property.  We got a river front room and the view is fantastic.  Like a previous reviewer said, I could move into the bathroom, oyster shell chandeliers are too cool.  The valet parking here is a bit pricey at $25 per night so remember you can park free at the meters on the weekends.A lot of the poor reviews seem to come from the service at the Rocks, the lounge on the roof top.  It's a typical noisy yet pricey bar and doesn't have the elegant atmosphere of the hotel or its rooms.  We were up there for sunset and the place was pretty busy, not many seats and the wait staff was running to keep up with the clientele.  I think if you go just expecting a bar with a nice view rather than an elegant retreat you won't be disappointed.Very pretty hotel and a lovely spot for pictures on the roof top.  Decorated beautifully and romantically!!  Friendly staff. Perfect location for convenience to restaurants and shopping.  Didn't care for the restaurant, but liked the rooftop bar. Dog friendly.My husband and I went to the rooftop restaurant to bring in the new year we had a blast, but it got off to a little rocky start. We were starving because we waited to just eat a late dinner there. The bartender gave me a menu and asked for a CC, then refused to take the order and told me a server would do it (which a bouncer said was unusual) we got there about 930 and there were no seats. Finally about an hr later we stumbled on seats and ordered. Happy we didn't leave because the food was amazing! My hubby had chicken and waffles and I had quesadilla and both were not typical, they exceeded expectations. Would def return on a visit back to savannah.Had to leave after we got seated as nobody greeted us, brought us waters, or gave us a full number of menus in 20 minutes!  This is not what you would expect from a Kessler Hotel.  My wife and I got married at their other hotel and always held them in high regard. This spot had worse service than a Best Western buffet. I haven't had a worse experience in 10 plus years.Great hotel, nice bathrooms .... Right at the river... The room was clean, the bed were comfortable, our room has the view of the river and it was pretty... Right at the historical area of the town ... We walked to the olde pink house ... Great restaurant to visit.Not terribly welcoming upon arrival, but room and hotel itself were great.  Very interesting design in and out of the room.  Rooftop is nice feature.  Staff up there were very good.  Few food items were as well.This is, like the Mansion at Forsyth Park, a Kessler property. That goes a long way in explaining a lot: the interior, while sleek and modern, suffers from the unique Kessler/Savannah aesthetic (which you'll also find in SCAD's Gryphon Tea Room--so it is not limited to Kessler alone). This approach to interior design aims for chic but, with its ample use of the color orange, moody low-light, and organic yet often dead botanical matter (like the giant ball of thorns in the dining room), winds up looking like a Martha Stewart Living magazine's Halloween issue. Seriously. If you want something not exactly goth but playfully dark, you might like it . . .  kinda. My main concern is that this motif will seem dated in less than a decade (700 Drayton and the Gryphon Tea Room both already are screaming that they were decorated circa 2005). The location is loud, yes. It is in walking distance from many of River Street and Bay Street's bars, which will be great for some guests. The front street, Bay Street, is very busy at all hours and where Bay Street and MLK intersect is one of Savannah's most dangerous corners for traffic accidents, so be forewarned. Also, this is a touristy neighborhood but once you go west of MLK down Bay and onto either West Bay or Indian Street you get into a sketchy, industrial, neighborhood. You need to keep your wits about you and stay well to the eastern side of MLK at night. I add this due to the other reviews talking about safe places to park one's car and due to the general security concerns in Savannah, and I say this as someone who lived in the city for a number of years.The building itself is nice, and the Kessler Group is trying to do clearly innovative things so that should be admired, but the results are lackluster. This is not to say it's not a cute or fun place, but your happiness here will be predicated on what you expect of Savannah in the first place. Take a long look at the Bohemian and other options.Unique decor, beautiful rooms, great costumer service, great people watching, convenient to about everything ....  Roof top bar is an awesome view of the river and amazing sunsets. Loved our experience.We stayed at the Bohemian for just one night. It was a bit hard to find the entrance to the front of the hotel when you're driving since you will probably pass it the first time, it's not readily marked.When you first walk into the hotel you know you're not in a typical hotel. The people checking you in are behind desks, not "hotel" desks but big wooden office type desks. We checked in at 3:30 but couldn't get into our room because they said they were still cleaning. We could have checked out bags and roamed the area but we wanted to freshen up first so we waited. On or about 4 PM the clerk said our room was ready and we went up.There are three elevators in the hotel however only two of them go the floors with rooms and you need your room card to get onto the floor. We were on the top floor. The whole place looked very posh which mean dark lighting, dark carpets and some funky stained glass wall decorations.When we first got into the room there was a crib in the room, yikes! Not for us so we pushed it into the hallway.The room was big enough, king size bed, large bathroom with HUGE tub and a separate shower and toilet that was separated by glass doors (more on this later). There was a window that separated the bathroom to the bed area but you could close the shutters so you had more privacy in the bathroom.The bed area consisted of a bed a desk that made up almost one side of the room and a padded bench which was in front of the window. The bed was very comfortable except we could hear a vibrating/humming noise when we were on it. We couldn't tell if it was coming from another room (filling up the Jacuzzi?) or the roof. The TV was also connected via some sort of computer system that you could use the remote as a mouse and scan channels or websites.I was a bit creeped out by the ceiling light fixtures in the room. Both in the bathroom and the bedroom there were chandeliers but the light fixtures were encrusted with oyster shells, I mean, totally covered. While at first interesting, it sort of became creepy.Back to the bathroom, the toilet was in its own room/closet which had a glass door. If you were sitting on the toilet or in the shower for that matter, anyone else in the room (if you didn't close the shutters between the bathroom and bed area) could see you.The products they provided were really nice and I really enjoyed the shampoo and conditioner. They had a gym here but we didn't get to try it out however, they didn't have wifi in the rooms, or at least we didn't. We could access the wifi in the restaurant or near the front desks.The location of the hotel was excellent too. It was along the water and the hotel had a restaurant in the bottom and a roof top bar. You were in close walking distant to other restaurants too.While we only stayed one night, we would definitely stay here again if we return to Savannah.Nice room, very Funky (As in hip gran-pa) nice bar both top and bottom. River view bot OMG are they proud !!!!  Thank goodness I was on business.My bad...this is a brand new hotel. Guess I wasn't paying attention to the construction after too many dirty martinis at Rocks bar last night.Fantastic rooftop bar with great drink selection. Cool vibe and decor. Would definitely recommend this spot and will stay here on our next trip to savannah !Very nice hotel with a great view of the river, well-located and cool interior decorating. The room was really nice with a fantastic shower. I really liked the small sitting room with a view of the river (the room is one room with a alcove for a sitting area and another for the bathroom fixtures).I used Marriott points and did not have to pay, but I may have a slightly different opinion if I had to fork up $700+ for the room. It was great, but not that great.
review_content_60: The hotel is beautiful.  It is very trendy and in a great location if you want to enjoy walking around the city.  The rooms are spacious and clean.
