I'm giving the Bohemian 3 stars because of the service.  There is absolutely no guest service.  I don't think one staff member spoke a word to us during our stay at this hotel which I found really surprising.  I expected at least a hello?  We did have a few staff members brush past us as if we were in their way and annoying them but that was the only interaction.  I would try the Planters Inn for a historic stay and the Westin for a large hotel with a lot of amenities.My husband and I went for the weekend and I was extremely disappointed since the arrival to the Bohemian Hotel. HATE the decor looks very cheap, never saw an ice maker with white Christmas light, service is very bad, view nothing to comment about I wanted to leave the hotel immediately after our arrival. Menu both "restaurants" limited and nothing exceptional. I will never come back.Let me preface this review with the fact that I have not stayed at the hotel itself. My love for this hotel is the public rooftop bar that overlooks the river. It's one of my favorite places to take a friend in Savannah for a quiet conversation and a good cocktail. It's bohemian-chic decor and top notch view make this a 5 star for me!Stayed here with my friend at the end of august.  it's a very cool hotel and the technology aspect is the best i have ever experienced... there is wi-fi and a tv that hooks up to the internet and netflix... it's very cool.the location of the hotel is stellar... the only negative is that it's VERY loud at night, so unless you are planning on bar hoping till late at night, you will probably be annoyed by the noise.speaking of bars, the hotel roof bar is apparently the place to be at night... which means a million of people coming in and out of your hotel- it was a zoo. you need a room key to get onto the hotel floors, but still, doesn't seem 100% safe.the decor is very different, very cool and definitely was luxurious.Amazing interior and rad staff! From Gavin at the rooftop bar, Lauren at the reception and Dan, who will greet you. Riverfront rooms have amazing sunrises and the room service breakfast was still hot when hit my mouth. Would recommend this to any hip friends.Not kid friendly or worth the high cost of double the other hotels we stayed at in the area.  Over $400/night, ouch.  Was not worth that.There's a few basic things I require of hotels I stay at, one of them being providing the type of room that guests reserve before they arrive, if you cannot handle this one basic tenet of hospitality, then you have no business being in business.Our rooms were confirmed via email, and when we actually arrived at the hotel we were told that the rooms we paid for were unavailable and that we would have to take a downgrade in accommodations, thankfully my father and brother got the room I reserved for them, however,The room I reserved was not the suite with balcony I had reserved, it was a much smaller, corner room with no balcony.When we tried to explain how ludicrous it was that we were not being provided with the rooms we had reserved and paid for, the staff took a very nonchalant attitude to the entire affair, calmly explaining to my family that the 'hotel was booked and these were the only rooms available."What? I'm sorry but are we in some alternate dimension where hotel guests are given the wrong room and no refund? With absolutely no apology or visit from management to explain why the hotel changed our accommodations without alerting us before we arrived?There are so many wonderful bed and breakfasts and hotels in Savannah that it's easy to recommend pretty much anything else, including the Hyatt, which is located right next door.Unless you like arriving at your hotel without any confidence that the rooms you reserved are going to be the rooms provided to you then i recommend you stay away. Far away.I just got home from a wonderful girls trip to Savannah and I'm already thinking about when I can go back! We stayed at The Bohemian and had a lovely time. The hotel and rooms were absolutely beautiful and the staff was incredibly friendly. We were right in the middle of it all with Broughton Street, shopping and restaurants right around the corner. I would recommend a river view room. We got to open the drapes and watch the ships come in while we were getting ready to head out. I would also say that the hotel has not 1 but 2 great places to eat and have a few drinks. Rocks on the Roof was great at night - I loved sitting outside around the fire overlooking the river. And Rocks on the River became our place to grab some pre-dinner drinks. The bartenders were awesome. I'm not sure if this is a good thing (on my part), but after the first day they already remembered our drinks as soon as we walked in the door. All in all, we were extremely happy with our stay here.We received excellent service from the time the valet service directed us off the street, through check-in and luggage delivery. The rooms are chic, with all the amenities you'd expect for $300 per night. Mostly, I enjoyed the fact that the bed was comfortable and the room is clean. Easy access to all historic district sites and an attentive staff makes this hotel a winner for me. Like other reviewers, I'm top tier at other chains (Marriott, Hyatt, and Starwood). This hotels is right in line with W Hotels.Two star for the atmosphere and design. That's it. Overall I was not impressed in the least. I was actually let down compared to other hotels. I called guest services and asked if they had aspirin. Jessie said yes. I arrive at the front desk where another man tells me no they are out and if I want I can walk to the Marriott next door. Really? I guess I should've stayed there then!! Not only that but when I went to the Marriott to get some aspirin from their mini shop , I was told it closed at 10. Seriously guys! You sent me to a closed store. One that I shouldn't have had to go to open or closed. I was told if I was a guest that room service could have gotten it for me at the Marriott. Funny thing is I had a choice between the two and the price difference for the weekend was hundreds but I chose the bohemian because it was St Patrick's day and I wanted true luxury. Turns out I paid hundreds more for a loud ass roof top bar and some cheeky decorations. Fabulous.Absolutely loved this hotel. While it wasn't a traditional suite, the bathroom was GORGEOUS. We went to the bar upstairs for a drink and dessert, and I was very impressed. Would definitely recommend this hotel and will return.The hotel is pretty nice itself, the rooms are big and the beds are comfortable.  Having said that, when I pay for a expensive "boutique" hotel I expect SERVICE.  There's a cool rooftop bar and a decent restaurant on the first level.  Both are called "Rocks".  The atmosphere on the roof is very cool with nice views, and we went there 3 times, and 2 of the 3 times we waited at least 15 minutes before a server came to us.  As for the downstairs restaurant, the food is good, but again, the service sucked.  Every time we went to get a table, there was no host/hostess at the front. Wait 5 minutes for someone to notice you.  Then sit, wait another 5 minutes for someone to come to the table.  The thing that sets a hotel apart is service, and it is lacking at the Bohemian.As a final note, you have to valet park.  They park your car in their "secure" parking garage across the street, plus it costs $21 a night.  The valet attendant told me the garage was secured, when we checked out and they brought us our car, it had been broken into.  They stole a GPS unit, and messed up everything inside.  When I went to the front desk to complain, I received a comment "oh, I'm sorry, but we're not responsible for the parking garage".   Yet, they give you no other parking option.  Plus, they didn't even offer to pay for the parking fee.  This place tries to be nicer then they are.  Granted, it's a fairly new hotel, but overall I rate these guys are amateurs.I have enjoyed a meal at Rocks and drinks upstairs on the rooftop.  GREAT Happy Hour location for snacks and drinks.  The view is amazing and the service is great.  The food is wonderful at Rocks as well.  enjoy!Blew away my expectations.  This is a funky, hip hotel for people who appreciate high end design concepts, great service, and attention to details.  From the champagne check in to the bottled water check out, the staff should be commended on really taking service to the "next level.". The room was spacious and modern, and the whole feel of the place was "bohemian cool.". Perfectly located, although not easy to find by car (it's set back off the road).  We saw cargo ships cruising right past our widows.  Awesome.  Beds were comfy and the blackout curtains let us sleep.  Overall, my pick for Savannah in style.nice rooftop views but the upstairs kinda smelled like stale beer...The reservation said we could have two queens and a folding bed. Come to find after we arrive they cannot add the folding bed. Then we want a vending machine to purchase a soda and they send us next door to the Hyatt. Huh???? Room was comfortable and l liked the trendy tunes piped throughout...For our first time in Savannah we were very pleased with our choice of hotel.  We were considering the sister property, the Mansion on Forsyth, but we definitely were happy we chose this one based on the location.  We much preferred being on the river and so very close to City Market and walked to all of our restaurants and took turns strolling through town and along the river.   Plus, we took the free shuttle to the other property to explore beautiful Forsyth Park which was a bonus!  We had room # 600 which was a corner with a (VERY small balcony (they all are) as it is a boutique hotel.  Our room was quiet and just far enough away from the Roof top bar which was only noisy on Saturday but not too bad (we always bring earplugs on trips).  Again, our room was generally quiet.  Staff was very friendly but busy at times.  Don't rely on room service..so many walkable places for good food..especially breakfast.   We had breakfast in room one morning and it was mediocre at best. Decor is artsy..we thought it was chic.  Coffee maker in room features starbucks and it was good!  PS it is pet friendly but I have to say we NEVER ONCE even heard an animal let alone saw one.  We would definitely go back and try to get same room!Love the room and location...great view. The lounge is cool but pricey. Restraunt downstairs is nice for lunch or a brick oven pizza on the riverfront. As happy as I am with the rooms, they really are amazing, I am mystified on how the valet service can be so god awful. First time we went they brought our brand new BMW back with a door ding. They appologized but only after I pointed it out. The last time we were there the floor mat on the passenger side (again in the BMW) had standing water in it! I dumped it out of the car and the carpet was soaked. We brought this to their attention and they initially denied any responsibility. After getting a bit "persistant" they finaly admitted a valet had spilled an entire drink in our car! They ate the valet cost for our entire stay, and awarded us additional points to our account. Nice by the hotel staff, but I am not going to valet our car here next time. Ill pay to park at a city lot on my own.Wow! The food here is amazing this is definitely a m-u-s-t for any foodie visiting savannah!The absolute worst ... Should be called "The Barbarian"  Loud music next door until 5 in the morning and security is like the Keystone Cop. Called front desk five times and never got resolved.  All the glitzy "in" carpet and BS doesn't mean squat if you're up all night. After all this, a really nice girl called the next day and adjusted our room rate for that night. Other than the sub-humans next door with their loud music and intolerable attitude, the hotel itself was very nice.
review_content_80: I stay in quite a few hotels and I'm tough to impress, but the Bohemian is definitely one of the nicer hotels in Savannah, and given the choice I would stay here again.  I also like the sister property the Mansion on Forsyth Park, but it's in nowhere as good of location as the Bohemian.  Everything in town is easily with in walking distance of the Bohemian where as you'll have a long walk (not fun in Savannah's hot summers) or you'll have to drive and try to find parking to go to places downtown if you stay at the Mansion.  I also like that both of these are part of Marriott Rewards.I was torn between a four and five start rating, but like I said I'm tough to impress.  I ended up in a great corner room with huge windows that let in tons of light.  They also let in a fair amount of noise from the street and parking lot, but that's probably not the fault of the hotel.  The room has some very unusual furnishings like two tall driftwood lamps and a chandelier made of stuck together seashells which are pretty cool for a hotel.  The shower and bathroom are also very cool and spacious.  I came back to my room to a cool CD playing in the Bose alarm clock.  The CD was for sale of course if you wanted to buy it and I seriously thought about it.  The rocks bar on the roof is very cool and definitely worth a visit even if you don't stay in the hotel.  The staff is very nice and very helpful.  I wanted to find a better gym (more on this later) and the staff tried hard to find one.  One other thing that I like about this hotel over the Weston is there is no hidden "resort fee."Now for what I wasn't impressed by.  The workout room here is tiny, with only a couple of treadmills, an elliptical, and exercise bike, and a small rack of dumbbells.  I went to two local gyms in town to work out and the best one I've found is Lava Fitness.  The TV had plenty of stations, but one annoying thing is this Roomlink box that sat on the desk.  It's kind of noisy and the staff's solution was to unplug it at night.  It's louder than my laptop and sounds like it has a hard drive and fan that run constantly.  Of course if you unplug it you have no TV, but then if you're watching TV you're probably not worried about the noise.  Turning the TV off with the remote or pushing the power button on the front will not turn it off.  The power button only turns it on once you plug it back in.  I found myself unplugging it each night or I had to listen to the thing run while I was laying in bed.I think I have a new favorite hotel in Savannah and like I said if given the chance, I'd gladly stay here again.UNBELIEVABLE five star service! Great prices on drinks, food, etc. Rooftop bar ROCKS! Rooms so comfy, only wish there was a tub. Tv operates horribly but didn't really care. Awesome hotel! MAKE SURE CONSTRUCTION IS FINISHED BEFORE RESERVING A RIVER FRONT ROOM. LOUD LOUD LOUD!!! Choose city view, it's much prettier anyway.Being from NY and staying in manhattan often I felt like I was at a boutique hotel. I Have to say that this hotel is clean and real nice.  The hotel is in the right location to see all of Savannah. Walking distance to it all. We where given a room on the river with a balcony. The service is impeccable,(chris never forgot our names) the roof top bar is really nice. The restaurant is really good as well. We where here to visit SCAD, and if my son is excepted this will be our hotel of choiceWe had a girls night out at the Bohemian. All seven of us had a fabulous, fun filled time  The food at the restaurant was good.  I had cheese fries, filet migon, and a very nice red wine. My filet came with a blue cheese sauce, it was delicious.  I tried the calamari and it was really good.  It was extremely tender, and was not greasy.  The calamari was the best I've ever had. The wine was full of flavor.  Our waiter was wonderful. He recommended the wine that I ordered.  We ordered creme brulee as a dessert.  I would have to give the creme brulee just an average rating. I didn't personally try any of the other desserts, but they looked really good.  Two of my friends ordered filet migon.  When they got their order it was undercooked, but our waiter quickly fixed the problem. The service was excellent. We made reservations in advance, and they put us in a wonderful spot for a group our size.  We had plenty of room to eat, but we weren't to spread out.  After our meal we headed up stairs to soak in the view and a few more drinks.  The view was great.   The drinks were good. And the service upstairs was wonderful.  I think this would also be a great spot for a romantic night out.This hotel was a disappointment.  Though it's highly rated, I just don't know why.  The service in the roof top bar is sad.  It took forever to get waited on.  And the bar on the bottom floor was so cold, we had to wear winter coats to stay comfortable (yes, really ... two other guests complained about the cold air in the bar, and took their food away so they, and their food, wouldn't freeze).  Oh -- if you want noise -- stay at this hotel.  If we had known about the noisy streets that sandwich the hotel, we would have picked another place.  Too bad you couldn't run the room A/C fan continuously to mask the outside noise.  The hotel decor is nice -- but it doesn't make up for the rest.  I won't stay here again.I have stayed previously at the Mansion on Forsyth Park and it is amazing.  This sister property get's about the same level of review for comfort and luxury.  It is a great location on the river and the room was quite comfortable.  Service was excellent, although a late checkout was only good until noon, I guess I can't complain about that.  Restaurant was very good and rooftop bar was very cool!!!  Awesome view!!!Very pet friendly!great hotel, great rooms, great location, friendly staff, all in all what you'd expect from this type of place.why 1 star?  they billed me twice.  i got two receipts on checkout, asked the front desk why, they said it was an error and not to worry.  i worried and checked my cc bill, and they billed me twice.  had to call them to get a refund.  un freakin acceptable.  in fact, may even be illegal.  if it wasn't for that, they would get 5 stars.  this is something you dont even expect from motel 6.  the manager was very nice when i called, fixed the problem right away, but again, not acceptable.Great Staff, Comfortable quiet room, Good Location, only complaint was Parking. (20 min to get your car and pricey). We stayed on the street side, sounds like the river side is noisey. We will be back.Gorgeous hotel.  Nice helpful staff.  Very creative decor and the rooms are exquisite.  The bathroom is gorgeous.  They have computer access from your flatscreen, sound system in the rooms, and comfy gorgeous beds.  Can't ask for much more.  On the riverfront, and walking distance to downtown.  Can't wait to return.We liked this hotel enough to go back for an unscheduled 2nd night on our return trip through Savannah. It's very modern, comfortable, a little goth (or is it Bohemian?) and to be specific, sexy. The beds are comfortable and the rooms are clean. Unusual nice bathrooms. Very weird art and light fixtures. Door to balcony in our room w/nice view. We stayed on the river view side which is great. We didn't have as nice an experience the 2nd stay but I'd still go back. We were very disappointed that the room we liked so much and we reserved with a credit card was not available when we got back. Huh? After about 15 minutes of negotiations, we were provided a comparable nice room. We would NOT have gotten it though if we did not balk so that left us feeling irritated. Unfortunately, the air conditioner in the 2nd room (room 600) is as loud as a jet engine so we did not sleep well at all that night. The fan is set to blow too hard and it's crazy loud. We should have complained but after the lengthy negotiation just to get the room, we didn't have it in us, and we didn't notice until late that night after returning from dinner out. Get that AC fixed Bohemian! You have a nice place there but you tested our patience. And one last tip: I'm 6'1" and the king bed was too short. How could that be? Turns out, the head board is 5 inches thick which makes the bed shorter! Just pull it away from the wall and you're set.Bathroom lights are nice but not functional for a man trying to shave or a woman trying to put on make up.  Room service was not good and screwed up an easy continental breakfast order- my wife's order was perfect though.  Also, for some reason hotel was filled with cousin eddie and his fam - I thought we were in the wrong hotel for a while.  The roof top bar is nice and great views but the DJ type of music is a total dis-service to the bar and the patrons.  They really should close it to non-hotel guests to maintain integrity.  The location of the hotel is nice and the furnishings and decorations are superb, they just need to work on the above things.  Will stay somewhere different next time for the amount of money I paid.

hotel_name: The Westin Savannah Harbor Golf Resort & Spa
review_content: My Wife and I were in Savannah for one night as we drove to North Carolina.  As an SPG member we decided to give The Westin a try and we are extremely happy we did. To start the staff was fantastic.  I was a walking with no reservations and they went thru a lot of discount codes and even recommended I use the app to reserve a room.  I did end up using the app and was thrilled that the room was 10000 points. The location was great if you are looking for a convention hotel the convention center is walking distance as is the free ferry.  The ferry runs till midnight and takes you from the hotel to the center of downtown Savannah,  The room itself was great we had a golf side view.  The bed and room were very clean and it had a great rain shower.  We would definitely come back.The only thing we were not impressed by was the breakfast at the aqua star which was just ok and a little too expensive i think.Before coming into town, I called to make sure that the hotel had recieved my StarHot form and that everything was good to go for my reservation. Kieatta was a great help and she assured me that everything is good to go. She even asked me to revise my form and she printed it out for me. I was coming in from Atlanta, a 4 hour drive, in the snowy weather. I wanted to make sure that I was good to go when I got there. After speaking with her, I was so excited to visited a fellow SPG hotel.I love SPG. However, this hotel in particular is interesting. For me, its all about service. I used to work for a SPG hotel and still work in the hospitality business. I feel like I understand the ins and outs but still was very disappointed. I drove in through bad weather on Saturday from Atlanta, GA. I was tired, and just wanted to check into my room. I self-parked but in the cold weather, that walk seemed too long. When walking up the front door, the bell staff was outside. They did not smile, greet me, or anything. I was not acknowledged at all. I kept walking inside. I arrived at 1pm and was prepared for my room not to be ready. After waiting in line for 20 minutes, I was ignored by a gentleman at the front desk. No one was standing in front of him, but I did not want to be rude and walk up to him. I was waiting for him to greet me. He looked up, then looked back down and ignored me. I wish I could remember his name, he was an older white male.  Finally, the next front desk agent assisted me. I also do not remember her name, but she is an African American female. She was nice, but not welcoming. Not warm. She just sounded like she was reading her lines from a book. Which stood out to me and set the tone for the stay. I do not expect her to be a cheerleader and be very excited to have me. However, a sense of warmth would have helped. I asked if a room with a river view was available. She said yes, for a $30 up charge. She asked me to sign some paper work for the up charge. Which basically set the charge in stone. No problem. Seems like normal protocol. However, the guest next to me asked the same thing and her attendant told her it would be $20. So now, Im not very pleased that I have not been welcomed to the hotel, and I'm being up-charged by $10. Then of course, there were a few issues with my reservation but my attendant was patient and let me check in while I figured things out. I had booked a StarHot rate and had booked the reservation incorrectly. I didn't want to complain more about the up-charge, I was already stressed out about my reservation. A StarHot rate allows a sibling or family member of a SPG employee to stay at any SPG hotel on a discounted rate, if available. A lot of people try to trick the system and make fake discounts. I know how frustrating that can be. But that was not what I was trying to do. I felt like the front desk attendant was treating me as if that was the case. I understand that I got a good deal on the hotel, but that is no way to be treated. I am just as capable paying full price for a hotel like the Westin. I came back downstairs to let the front desk know that I was able to fix my reservation.The female that helped me earlier was not there. She was in the back. The gentleman who ignored me at first was the only one available. His manager was next to him and was watching him. This time he was overly nice. It made me feel like he was doing that only because his manager was next to him. The manager walked away. I told him that when I went upstairs, I noticed a puddle of water on the window sill. I asked what it could be. Is it because its been raining and snowing? He said he doesn't know. And proceeded to fix my reservation. He did not acknowledge my complaint. I didn't want to switch rooms, I wasn't looking for a discount. I simply wanted him to see if anything could be done. The room smelled moldy and damp. That's never a good sign. I just left it alone and went back to my room. I was only staying there for one night. I didn't to be a pest. I went back upstairs and turned the air down and left the door open to hopefully let it air out. That moldy smell. I noticed other things along the way. The furniture is beat up, the carpet is gross, and the lighting is awful. 2/3 lamps in the room were out. It was not up to Westin standards. The next morning, Antonio was the attendant that helped with my check out process. He was nice. He was helping and asked if we need help with our luggage, and if we wanted a printed folio. He was trying to make small talk and made us feel welcome. If the stay would have started in that spirit, then maybe the stay would not have been that bad. I favor SPG. Westin Savannah did not live up to the reviews and to the name. Very disappointing stay.Hotel was nice but house keeping stole some of my things they maybe thought I wouldn't notice! They took my apple headphones,($30) a phone case($60), and some of my brand new Mac lipsticks($20ea). I had a lot of the stuff on the table maybe they thought since it was so much I wouldn't notice the little things but I did. It was new, in boxes, and was taken.I told the desk and they said they'd look into it but never did. I stay at the Westin all the time and this is the first negative thing and it is just so irritating.Everything else was fine. It's not an extravagant hotel but a nice standard.This hotel is good.  Room was clean.  Staff was friendly.  Service was good.  Location is good too.  Don't worry about being across the river.  It's easy access to the action via the free water taxi and the views if you're on the river facing side are really great.One of the best hotels I have ever stay at. So nice  and clean and friendly staff. A must to return. Thank u for the great experience.What an amazing property!  It's 20 minutes from the beach, the golf course is immaculate, and the staff is polite and well trained.  Our families favorite part of the day was enjoying the Amazing breakfast buffet.  I highly recommend this hotel, I will definitely be back.This is the location of the annual Christmas in the South . Although this event has been taking place here years, this was my first time attending. I'm not much of a Christmas person at all ( and no my childhood was just fine) but I finally decided to give it a go. I must admit I was a bit taken back because it's not what I expected at all . Instead of a bunch of name branded retailers pushing their products , to my surprise there were none at all just regular local people. It was actually refreshing to see local mom and pops from the surrounding area selling their goods. Did it make my heart grow 10 sizes no that only in the movies but it did put a smile on my face and that's a start :-DAmazing rooms with a variety of breakfast, lunch and dinner. Also has a free ferry transportation and the staff is so nice.No one showed me southern hospitality more than the folks at this hotel did. Anything I wanted, whether it be simple requests like microwaving some food or large requests like being drive across to get to the gym on a misty morning, these folks always made me feel welcome.The hotel itself was very clean and very nicely decorated. It's right across the river and you can take the ferry across and walk down their river walk strip. I bought souvenirs here and recommend the ice cream shop right on the corner. I can't remember the name but it was delicious.The hotel was beautiful overall. Beds were super comfy and our view was amazing. However when we checked in, we were given no info on the ferry from this particular staff agent, just given a room key and that was it. He seemed slightly annoyed about any questions we had asked. Also in the morning at 8 am we were woken up by loud banging and slamming on doors and it was housekeeping. I was curious as to why it was so early and housekeeping was trying to get into our room. Also as we left our room and made out way to the elevators, a housekeeper followed us down and asked if we were done in our room. We told her no as checkout is at noon, and she then walked away. For such a beautiful hotel, the staff doesn't seem up to par.Stayed here 3 nights for a conference in a room with two double beds. I thought the pillows and blankets were real comfortable and the bathroom had a great shower with good water pressure which is important to me. The conference was at this hotel and all the Westin staff were very helpful when asked a question and the food we ate during our meals was good, although lunch one day was a bit cold on the buffet. I had a decent view, but it was above the entrance which was loud at times when groups of rowdy people were coming or going, but no complaints really. I'd stay there again for sure.My wife and I finally got a vacation since our honeymoon and I can say that if you must stay in a hotel, The Westin Harbor Golf Resort is the best.  Upon arriving we were greeted by the valet and he was absolutely wonderful in helping us find where we were going and where the parking was.  When we got to the front desk we were greeted with a warm smile and offered the upgraded river view room for a nominal per night fee.  When we got to the room my wife's eyes grew so large when she saw the view we had.  Everything was great about the room, with the exception of the shower head, it just did not have the normal water pressure we were used to.  The bed was extra comfortable and was very easy to fall asleep in.  We had breakfast the second morning at the resort restaurant, the buffet was amazing and well worth the twenty two dollars per person.  The best thing was the ferry back and forth to River Street,    it was a free ferry and was nice because we did not have to pay for parking downtown.  In closing if you need a nice place to stay this would be the place for you.We arrived on a Sunday late September   night so our checkin was pretty good and got an upgrade to a river facing room. Very nice comfy bed.Room and bathroom are spacious enough for any wheelchair bound person.We got room service for food and it came about 30 minutes as they said it did.You get 5 dollar point for waiving room cleanup and towel change,Ferry ride across river to the town was convenient althought the schedule changes from 2 ferry to 1 ferry .The pool is a saline pool ,I am not sure if its heated but the first 3 days the weather was in  low 80's and muggy ,so its nice in the pool. I wake up pretty early and I see them cleaning the pool in the morning.The gym and the spa is at the golf course facility and the hotel povides a shuttle service there, or you can use their  bicycle  and or walk it in 5 minutes.The hotel is right next to the convention center .The weather chnaged from summer to fall during our stay lol. I do wished  the hotel has walking trails around. Wifi is paid and not . The free is limited but if you got unlimited internet with your phone , then you dont need it.Golf Course Review......OMG the gnats....I've never heard of these small flea-like creatures that made my early morning July round nearly impossible.  That being said I found the course to be in good shape, well laid out and challenging from the whites.  It plays completely different from the tips and is extremely challenging. It's a championship 18 hole par 72 Robert Cupp / Sam Snead designed course.A complete practice facility with a driving range and a chipping and putting area. The clubhouse is fairly standard although the food is a little lacking and tends to be pricey.After spending 4 nights at the Embassy Suites in Orlando, we wanted to slow things down and get Mickey and friends out of our minds by staying at the Westin Savannah Harbor Golf Resort and Spa.  We stayed at Westin Hotels in the past.  We knew what the Westin could offer from our previous stays.We stayed for 2 nights on Father's Day weekend.  We arrived on a Saturday at about 4 PM.  The hotel seemed busy with check ins and also preparations for a wedding.  It took them three tries to get our room correct.  The first time, the put me in a room next to an elevator  With elevators making strange noises at night, I always have difficulty sleeping.  So, I asked for a different room.  The second room was okay, but, the ghosts of Savannah put a shower cap in the toilet.  When my wife saw it, she freaked out and requested a room that was clean.  The third time was a charm.  They gave us a room, exactly as requested.  The room was nice with 2 queen beds.  It had a nice view of the Savannah River.  Everything in the room was perfectly clean, just like what the wife likes.  The only thing thing about the room that my wife didn't like was the televion station choices.  She did not get to watch her favorite TV station, HGTV.  She didn't get to dream of what to do next for our house.The Westin is full of activities, after all, they are a Golf resort.  If you don't golf, they do have a swimming pool with lap swimming hours in the morning.  Unfortunately, I was on vacation, and had no intentions of using their pool.  The landing for the Ferry is right out the back door.  The Ferry is free and will take you across the river to River Street.  Unlike other Westin Hotels, they do not have a Kid's Club at this Westin.  Last year, my daughter was able to go on a Scavenger Hunt at the Westin Kierland.  We visited the Hitlon Head Westin.  They did offer a Kid's Club.  About the only complaint that my wife had was the staff was not friendly enough.  They did their job, and that was it.  They didn't really say "Hi", when you pass by them. Overall, it is a decent Westin property with nice clean quite room, unless it next to an elevator, or if a ghost throws a shower cap in the toilet.  It was a lot nicer than the Emabssy Suites in Orlando.  Overall, 3 1/2 stars, which isn't bad.  But, I have experienced better Westin properties.Okay. First of all I have to say that both times I've been to Savannah I have stayed at this establishment and I still think it's one of the best. They have wonderful views of the river plus a ferry boat that takes you across to River Street and leaves quite often. Might I add that the ferry allows dogs on it which is a MAJOR plus for me and brownie points in the book of Jo.The hotel itself I think is quite beautiful, but frankly, not enough to pay $300 a night during peak season. They have a very quaint little bar on the lobby floor that I LOVE. Very old school and what a lobby bar should be like (even if the drinks are $13 a pop). The rooms are just okay. Nothing to write home about but spacious and clean, which is just fine for me as I'm not super picky. If you get lucky you get a nice view of the grounds and golf course, which are quite nice. Lots of greenery all around which is great if you have a pet (pets are allowed as long as they're small and you can shell out the $100 pet deposit).The reason why I am giving this place three stars and not the four it deserves, is because of the blatant lack of customer service. I hate to say it, but I've been greeted by nicer people at a Days Inn while on the road for a night or two. I called various times in advance to say I was bringing a dog and if there was anything (other than the fee) I needed to know in advance. I was told I did not need anything (not even rabies shots records which I found weird) because I would have to sign a waiver. Upon signing said waiver, I was informed that the dog could not be left unattended at all.EXCUSE ME? "We would not want for the dog to start barking and disturb other guests," was the attendant's reply. And I can appreciate that, trust me, I can. But it's pretty evident this is something I should've been informed of AHEAD OF TIME. For $100 a night I could've boarded my dog at the Ritz Carlton and my boyfriend and I could've had a chance to enjoy the city. There went our dinner plans or anything else we had in mind (it was my birthday, by the way). We tried to find places to board him but of  course on such short notice it was impossible.We snuck out for about an hour for a quick bite and a drink at the bar. I will also confess with no shame whatsoever that we left for breakfast the next morning for a whopping 40 minutes at the hotel's restaurant and left our dog in the bathroom sleeping on his bed. The food was subpar and the service HORRIFIC. I must've shouted at the waitress to please bring us our bill a couple of times after ineffectively trying to flag her down and still she did not come to our table. I can only assume the lady was deaf, in which case, I'm sorry about that. I am still wondering why on earth I left her a 20% tip. Upon leaving, the lady at the front desk looked like she'd rather be at the dentist than say good morning to me, and replied with a faint grunt when I picked up my hotel folio and wished her happy holidays.All in all, we made the best of it, but I think it's only right that a patron should be informed of the rules before going through the trouble of bringing their pet to an unknown place. To me, it simply felt like they wanted to get the $100 non-refundable deposit and could care less what I did with my dog after that, seeing they were not liable once I signed the waiver.I still think this is a beautiful hotel, and no doubt I still would consider coming back, but I have to be honest that I was not pleased whatsoever with this last stay. Also, we spent a good $150 on room service seeing we were bound to our room with our dog on our mini vacation before Christmas. Catastrophic, to say the least.Rooms were clean, and the heavenly beds are comfortable.  We stayed in a room away from the elevators, and it was nice and quiet.  They also offer free WiFi and free parking.There is a free ferry service that runs every 20 min across the river and into historic downtown Savannah.The fitness center is a five min walk away, and it had a few cardio machines, nautilus type machines, and free weights.  The TVs on the cardio machines could have used some more channels.  I think it only had a few local channels, news channels, and ESPN.I've stayed in Savannah a number of times, and this was one of the least impressive experiences I have had. We booked online using my premier member number, not just by some Priceline, you get what you paid for option. We booked a roll away bed in a Premier Room. Upon checking in we were told we couldn't have one due to fire codes. We went to our room ( for a Premier Room, it was small), then decided to call the desk to see about options. We were told about suites that could accommodate our requests, and we're happy to pay the difference, until being transferred to reception to be told that there were no suites available. What a waste of time. We ended up booking an additional room on a different floor. At an additional cost. The concierge desk was never staffed, the reservation staff was barely responsive, and the shuttle to the riverfront doesn't really run on schedule. If you're looking to stay in Savannah, on the Riverfront, stay at the Brice, or the Hyatt. The Brice is across the green, but the rooms, and the staff make up for that.We stayed here for two nights the first weekend in March, thanks to a last minute bid since we had to attend a funeral.  Having never been to Savannah before, we had no idea what to expect, and at first were not overly happy about finding ourselves across the river from the historic area.  After arriving, however, we were immediately enthralled.  Driving up to this resort is very impressive and surprisingly just 12 miles off of I-95.  Check-in was a short wait (lots of people with well-behaved dogs in the lobby...must be a very dog-friendly hotel).  No king rooms were available, so we trotted off to our double bed room and found it to be nice.  Note to previous reviewers who didn't notice the fridge in the room.  We had one (see pic)...which is where his and hers bottles landed (bourbon for him, wine for her).  They give you a brochure with the ferry schedule when you check in, which makes it so easy (and quick) to catch the "free" ferry.  (Okay, so you pay $22.47 per day for a resort charge...we've had to do resort charges before where a ferry wasn't included, just sayin') AND it covers parking & internet. Internet which worked for Husband but not for me. Feel pretty confident it was operator error as a result.    The ferry was way better than expected.  Covered.  Big.  Quick and efficient. And since they give you a schedule of when and where it will be, if you spend a lot of time waiting for it, it's because you didn't plan accordingly.  We DID and it was GREAT!  When we came back to the hotel after dinner in the historic area on that Friday night we were greeted with FIREWORKS.  How awesome is that?  And apparently a first Friday thing.  The hotel was also doing an oyster roast party with a live band. The only minor disappointment to our Friday night was that the Bourbon & Chocolate Lounge that we had looked forward to trying was PACKED.  No room for us to sidle in and try it.   Lesson finally learned after several recent hotels with more than one bed in them.  The bed closest to the bathroom SUCKS.  Use the other bed.  This lesson finally sunk into our teeny tiny pea brains on this trip (but only after an extremely uncomfortable first night).  Second night, switched beds, much better.    Also had a pleasant breakfast in Aqua (see that review).  And I posted a review of the Bourbon & Chocolate Bar that we spent a few (cough) bucks in on Saturday night.  Overall, we loved this resort.  It's beautiful, friendly, and the location is perfect for getting in and out of town without having to mess with city streets.Probably my favorite Hotel so far...View of the river is beautiful, water taxi that brings you to downtown is easy/fast/free, breakfast restaurant is delicious, staff was massively friendly and helpful, and they also had some really cool holiday themed displays throughout the lobby when my wife and I went (first week of December). We went as part of our anniversary weekend, I mentioned this to them and they went out of their way to drop off complimentary champagne and strawberries... just nice little touches like that make all the difference. A+
review_content_20: Were this a tourist hotel, it would be fine, perhaps even recommended. Alas, it is attached the Savannah's conference center, and a conference hotel it is not. But first let me start with the good. The beds were luxuriant, if a bit soft, and included a variety of pillows. The most thoughtful was a long, narrow pillow that I seemed to wake up hugging like a teddy bear every morning. The staff were polite and, outside of the abysmal restaurants, generally attentive. (I reviewed the restaurants separately). The fitness center was really great, and had among the best wet and dry saunas I've encountered.So what's the problem? It starts with the location .The hotel is attractively situated on the Savannah river, overlooking the city. Another way to say that: the hotel is cut off from the city by water. And the only way to get to the city without a car is via a charming, but infrequently run ferry. By car, you must approach and cross a giant bridge. As a result, it is impossible to go anywhere for food and coffee but the hotel's restaurants.Those restaurants are three: a "Starbucks" (not really), a "lounge" with take-out option, and an "upscale" option on the second floor. In addition to being very bad and very expensive, the two take-away options are extremely slow. If you actually want to go to your session, you're just not going to eat. My only solution was to go to town and buy take-out the night before, when I had better things to be doing. And I was forced to eat that food cold, because the rooms don't have microwaves.To add injury to these insults, the hotel wifi was abysmal, greatly limiting my capacity to work during the conference. I simply gave up on accessing the Internet during peak times. I was also mistakenly charged seven times for Internet access, although these charges were removed.Three stars because the stay was so comfortable. For business travel, though, I just can't recommend this hotel. What's more, I might think twice about attending another conference in Savannah.If this review was about our very first stay three years ago, 5 stars. However our stay a week and a half ago was extremely disappointing! We have stayed there before.. It was amazing! Then Westin has a great reputation and thus high expectations. I'll list the problems.. Positives at the end. Fortunately the problems aren't earth shattering, but should not happen at the Westin in my opinion.-The pool. Ew!!! It was NOT even close to clear.. It was clouded and had a very slight color to it of a yellow/brown. We didn't step foot in it! We went over to the kids area where water sprayed and dumped out to cool down.-Outdoor bar staff. She was so overwhelmed we didn't get a single drink from her even after waiting 10-15 minutes multiethnic times. The last time I walked up and there were 8 people including myself. 4 of which had been there a while sitting eating and drinking. She had no clue what she was doing.. If she was new they should have had someone else out there with her.. I actually feel bad if they threw a newbie out there with no one to help her..-Breakfast staff. One word, slow. Well, two words.. Slow and clueless. We had 2 servers actually waiting on us.. We ordered coffee, eggs, hash browns and bacon. Food took about 20 minutes.. Coffee came a second before our food because she forgot. Food was cold.-Filming a movie. You would think this is awesome right!? A movie set at your hotel!? Nope. There were 40-50 people in the lobby waiting to get on the elevator because they blocked it off and this is nice.. Everyone was being "Shhhed." So many people were angry! A couple on our elevator up we're going up to their room to check out and they also had just arrived that day. Hey Westin.. Give your guests a heads up about big things like this. Had we been given a notice there would be an inconvenience like this it wouldn't have been so bad. We would have worked around it..-Balcony door.. It was a workout to open it. Anyone elder or injured wouldn't be able to open it.+A plus, as expected the staff was all extremely nice! I am sure they were getting an ear full from angry guests but they stayed very professional, calm and friendly.+We did request an early checkin and it was ready.. That was awesome.As I said, these problems aren't the end of the world by any means.. But as I said, we stayed here before and none of the problems above happened. It's at if it has gone downhill. I do not think the problems are difficult to fix. Hopefully they have been or are tended to soon. I suppose before your stay be sure that pool was treated.. I promise you wouldn't want to go in it unless you were drunk.Not as good as most Westin's. Staff very surly and not helpful. Room service request required multiple calls.  Unlike any other resorts I've stayed at, this one charges for ice in your drinks. WTF! $30 a day for resort fees and a $1 for ice in a drink. Tried to do the "green" thing that didn't work. Currently they have charged my CC more than the receipts add up to. Having Mastercard looking into that. On the funny side the bathroom mirror/light is falling off the wall. Gonna need to find a different place for my next Savannah trip. Maybe out to Bloody Point.This is a very nice hotel.  I bid it on Priceless for $99 and got it on the first try.  Get a king bed with the view of the Golf course.  Regular rate would have been $259.   Parking is free if your a guest but has a free first 45 minute parking for visitors.  Valet is $23 overnight.  The lobby has a very nice decor and the staff is friendly.This hotel is lovely. The shower is so nice with the rain feature and you can switch to a hand held spray. Lighting in the bathroom is soft and nice. Beds are heavenly! I like the bath robes they provide. Also! You can leave your gym/running clothes at home. You may rent work out attire here for $5/day including shoes! They will deliver this to your room. The hotel lobby is stunning with beautiful water views. We attended a wedding which was spectacular! Dinner and dancing in the Grand Ballroom was perfect. The food was amazing. The service was excellent. The hotel provides a free ferry service to other parts of Savannah. The grounds are perfect, you can walk along the river front, play golf, hang out at the pool. So much to do here! I highly recommend this property.I was a little apprehensive about this hotel when I booked it because of its location. Let me start by saying that taking the ferry is super easy and we enjoyed the ride every time. The hotel itself is beautiful. Rooms are ok. We had the golf course view on the 7th floor. Not bad, not good. If you can get the view of the river its worth it.Would I stay here again? Probably. The price is right. The hotels in the historic district are around $200/night. I'd rather take the ferry and stay in a spacious room in a nice hot3el.Super clean, super friendly, super nice. Would absolutely go back. Played golf and for being a guest at the hotel you can play 18 for $15! Such a deal. Pool is beautiful, hot tub is riverfront, and restaurant with bar was great. Staff so helpful and accommodating.I was registered at this hotel for a conference. I would describe the facility as adequate. Not lacking. Seriously in any particular ways just nothing special either. It would not be a place I would recommend for future events. There ar too many special places available. I'm also not a big fan of Resort Fees. Especially when I don't see any specific value - I have to pay for Internet services and the fitness center is not in the building. However, the reason for my low rating is one specific thing. What I Perceived to be a lack of customer service. On my last day there I requested a delayed check out of one hour. I was told that none were being honored because they had a busy weekend coming. Today is Wednesday!  I asked to speak to the general manager on duty and was give the office manager who was professional but said no. She said what else can is do to please you and I said let me stay in my room one extra hour. No go!  Really ! I'm a SPG member to boot ( their frequent stay club). Anyway So much for Westin's. This story is definitely added to the list of lousy customer service.5 stars. Beautiful hotel. Clean rooms. Great staff. Awesome pool. Located on the other side of the river, secluded, but there is a free ferry that brings you downtown and leaves every 20 min. A great getaway hotel.Well, to start I have stayed at several Westins and have my favorites so there was a standard that Westin Savannah had to meet.  Our day started with a smooth checkin and view of our room and balcony.   Pretty happy with our room and view. Our most anticipated activity was a day at the spa.... Bellevue, Washington is by far the best out of the Westins I've visited. First, the spa is off the hotel grounds in the golf clubhouse which we had to walk to and even though they provide shuttle service no one offered to take us over.  Second, not updated and felt like I was in a school locker room.  I guess the Bellevue Westin is going to be hard to surpass. Once our services were finished we asked for a pick up since well, we were feeling "heavenly"  but after about 15 minutes of waiting we decided to walk back to our room.  Not impressed at all with the Heavenly Spa at Westin Savannah. The hotel and room were very clean and felt up to par for anyone's standards. A tad inconvenient to take the water taxi but it was a fun added entertainment. Totally stinks when there is a monsoon outside.  We had a nice dinner in town and called the hotel for advice on transportation back to the hotel but was told "I used to work at so and so just ask the hostess".  Ummm no as customer service is concerned the front desk only likes to help with checkin and checkout. It was just a normal hotel and for the price I would rather stay in town.My boyfriend and I recently enjoyed a BEAUTIFUL stay at the Westin Savannah Resort & Spa.  As we traveled to Savannah at an off-peak time we were able to stay at this gorgeous hotel for a GREAT rate. This resort is located across the River all the downtown Savannah action which some might see as a hindrance, but we found it perfect! There is a free ferry shuttle that takes you across the river. It runs multiple times an hour until midnight. This allows you to not have to pay for parking and avoids any driving while drinking.  Savannah allows for open containers on the street, which to some might seem great however we enjoyed getting away from this and getting to the calming and peaceful resort. There were a few hiccups: our smoke detector went off EVERY time one of us took a shower. And on the first day we were there, our room was not cleaned until almost 5pm. At that time we wished to be back in our room getting ready for our dinner that night. Those were our only negatives. All in all, we would definitely return on an off peak time for some rest and relaxation. Thanks for a great experience Westin!The walls are paper thin and it's a pain constantly having to take the ferry back and forth to town.. Also the gym is in a completely different building across a busy highway. The food was good. Drinks were not made correctly. Think this place was a 1 and done for me.Amazing place! So cool to take the ferry across to the Historic district. The ferry is free and operates pretty frequently. Waiting is fun too - lots to gaze upon. This hotel has bikes to ride in the front entrance - for free! A cute game room inside one of those semi-permanent tents. The pool is heated (wish I brought my suit).  Has a fire pit for smores but it wasn't going the nights we were there... probably too cold. Beds super comfy - Heavenly as stated on website. Good insulation between walls if you know what I mean :)Two negative things: No Bibles in Hotel rooms! This is the South... maybe in CA but here???? and, I called down to the front desk for a couple of things a couple of times before I got a response.  I wanted step stool for my son who is potty training... weird request right? BUT it was suggested in their Hotel guide book... so I took them up on the offer... kind of... cuz they didn't have one! LOL... whatever - not a break it kind of deal...I was so excited to stay at this hotel for a recent conference. I mean, look at the photos... it really looks like that! No promo witchcraft going on in these photos. It is just as luxurious as it appears. The hotel is gorgeous, the views are wonderful- your pick: river view (YES!), or golf course. I was lucky enough to score a river view and felt like a little kid with my nose pressed against the window of my room, each and every time a cargo ship would go by. These things are huge! How do they fit into the Savannah river?? I digress...My room was immaculate. Everything was spot on. I love that the Starwood line of hotels offers $5.00 vouchers for each day that you decline housekeeping. Since I have another Starwood hotel trip coming up, I went with this option. It wasn't a bad idea since my bathroom was well stocked with towels and toiletries. The only complaint I had was that when I arrived, my shampoo bottle was halfway empty. Seriously? So, basically, the hotel did not replace my shampoo. Lucky that I come prepared with my own shampoo and conditioner. Deduction of star for this.I ordered room service twice, and it was oh so tasty, but of course, overpriced. The hallways were quiet, room temp was to my liking and with an exact temperature adjustable thermostat (which was also quiet, by the way). The hotel has two bar areas, one on the mainfloor in the dining area, and one on the second floor that is devoted to bar only. Both bars were well stocked and had most any drink you could want. In the morning hours, there is a Starbuck's counter in the dining area foyer. Do yourself a favor and venture out onto the courtyard/dock area. It is a gorgeous view of the river while taking in the fresh air from a well-manicured, grassy courtyard area. Even though the Westin is across the river from downtown, there is a free passenger ferry that will take you on a 5-7 minute ride to the downtown side. There is also a spa that has every service imaginable, and of course, it is a golfer's dream. Staying at The Westin is truly how to do a trip to Savannah!I've stayed several places in Savannah, from hotels to B&Bs and this is my favorite. Nice rooms, friendly staff, free water shuttle to downtown Savannah, great dining options and a fantastic spa.Fantastic hotel! Great location away from all of the commotion but close enough to be there. The rooms were nice and clean! Will definitely be visiting again.I stayed here for my birthday everything was Great well that is up until about 8:30 or 9:00 PM some Guy lit up something that smell like a burning tire something that would've triggered a smoke alarm or somethingNice hotel!!! The rooms are clean, and the view my family got was perfect. We were looking at the over view look of the river and the pool. The pool & the hot tub were purely fantastic.we went during Easter and had little activities for the children all day long. (Easter breakfast, pictures with the bunny, egg hunt, etc.)The hotel was very fancy and cool looking. If you a river view, be sure to look at the big barges. They are HUGE. My children loved to look at these and would always get me to look at it.Westin's location on the water was beautiful, with a path along the water, and right next to the dock where the free ferry can take you across the river.  It's obviously a bit further away than being right on or near River St, but you can sense the peacefulness of the location....it was nice to be a bit removed from the hubbub.  Parking is either valet or self-park in a lot off to the right of the hotel, accessed with your room key.  I was here when the hotel was decorated for Christmas, so it was lovely and festive, with the lobby full of gingerbread houses and sculptures to ogle.Room- I booked a standard king with a golf course view, but I was lucky enough to get a corner room, so I had an additional window facing east, so I also had a river view, and a sunrise view, which was GORGEOUS...I couldn't stop taking photos.Excellent view of the river and downtown across the river. Super friendly staff, clean and comfortable rooms. Nice pool area for swimming or just sitting around. The whole resort area was beautiful. Being right next to the conference center was a super plus, and the free ferry that constantly runs to the river walk is great! It was really nice to have that as an option to save gas and parking for the car. Only tried the pool and rooms, didn't try any of the other amenities. (August)
review_content_40: My husband and I went to Savannah and stayed at the Westin for our 1 year wedding anniversary.  I did a LOT of research and I'm SO glad we chose this hotel.  When we arrived, they had upgraded up because it was our anniversary and had champagne and strawberries in our room.  Totally unexpected!  The room was great and the harbor view was perfect!  Most of Savannah's hotels are on the river front, but this hotel faces it, which makes you able to view the riverfront.  The pool was a great place to hang out during the day when it was hot and the bar by the pool is a great feature.  One day we ordered lunch out there and it took a little while, so the bartender gave us free drinks!  Little things like that keep me coming back!  The continental breakfast was pretty pricey for being a continental breakfast, but that was to be expected.GREAT hotel for visiting Savannah!!I requested an early check in for 1 pm and that part was great. The problem started about 30 minuted later my wife and I were getting dressed when a Hotel employee walked into our room without knocking and took about 3 steps into the room before he even looked up. My wife just finished putting her top on and I just got dressed after taking a shower. He apologized and said he went into the wrong room - My question was why didn't you knock he just mumbled and walked out. We decided to go green and not have the room cleaned during our stay so we hung the Do Not Disturb tag and the Going Green tag on the door. On the last day we had another employee enter our room around noon even though we had the proper do not enter signs on the door. We were not in the room at the time they went into our room again - My question was why did they go into our room even though we had a 3pm check out? They came up with some excuse it was an accident again. On another note we had to change rooms after our first night because of excessive noise coming from the adjoining rooms, little kids screaming until after midnight and started back up at 6am plus the Safe did not Lock. Then In the new room we had the same issue with excessive noise not from little kids but from Drunk obnoxious 30-40 year olds until after 2am oh and the safe was also defective. When I checked out the front desk never asked how my stay was and I am sure it is because they already had an idea and did not want to hear it again but it would have been nice if they apologized to my face and that was the biggest fail of the WESTIN SavannahI am a LONG way from five stars for this place, despite its 5-diamond rating from AAA. Facilities  are beautiful and room was most comfortable.  Those earn five stars.  Had breakfast there once, which was MORE than enough for me -- but my wife likes to brush her teeth AFTER breakfast and there was NOWHERE else to eat nearby (had to take the ferry to the mainland for options), so we did it again.  Restaurant gets 2 stars for breakfast -- mediocre food not presented well, less than mediocre service when it was not busy and appeared to be adequately staffed.  Maybe we should not have asked for table service -- but the $23 buffet offends me in principle as well as pocket-book.  The final blow was back at the hotel.  My wife was traveling with jewelry.  We wanted to spend the day across the river in Savannah, so we asked to use a lock box.  The young woman who set it up was VERY nice and walked us through a complex process involving ID and other information -- just what it should have been.  The next day my wife went back to get her jewelry and there was NO process -- just the key -- no ID, no signature, nothing.  Fortunately everything was there -- but it was clear that any plausible-acting person who found the key could have cleaned out the box. It did give me an idea for a mystery story.  The block of boxes into which my wife's jewelry went appeared not to be anchored to anything -- just a box of a dozen or so boxes resting on a cabinet -- easy to steal and not much security.Advice:  stay at one of the chain hotels across the river in the historic area or, perhaps better, in a B&B.  This place actually looks like it is waiting to get a license for a casino boat to float in the pond next to it -- I may be wrong, but it has that character about it.This review is the for the golf course.Went there for a get together during a wedding. We had 20 guys and it could not have gone any smoother. You get access to the driving range which is inculded in your green fee.They have an excellent putting and chipping area.This course was designed by the great Sam Snead. It's a beautful course with not a lot of water but a fair amount of sand.I def recommend taking the FREE water taxi over the river from the Westin; it takes about five minutes and they have a shuttle that will pick you up from the hotel and take you to the course just minutes away.Side trip to Savannah after NC...And what a great trip it was..Room was Clean Staff were friendly and helpful...Loved the upgrade to the 15th floor what an amazing view of Downtown Savannah and South Bank...Great Whirlpool and Pool...Went to the 2nd florr WAY over priced with what I can take a free shuttle boat over and have a much better not so Phoney chain restaurant ambiance.The wife and I loved this hotel and will be back.I normally love Westin hotels but, although the hotel & the room were nice & clean, I was not impressed. Room service took 45 minutes &, when it finally arrived to our room, 1/2 of the order was missing! Then we needed a wine bottle opener & had to wait almost another hour! *tisk, tisk* I expected more!No complaints and a definite recommendation for anyone visiting Savannah.First things first, you are actually across the river and not actually in downtown Savannah which has it's good points as well as some drawbacks. The great thing is that you get a pretty view of the river with all the boats coming in and out, and when it is time to go back to the hotel for the night, you are out of the hustle and bustle and get more of that "resort" feel and the relaxation that comes with it. The hotel offers a free ferry service to get you across the river and into downtown, and the ferry runs very regularly. The only drawback is that it stops running before midnight, so I guess I revoke my statement about having no complaints, because it did impose somewhat of a damper having to be on a curfew or pay for a taxi ride across the bridge if you miss the last boat. However, there isn't too much to be said about Savannah's nightlife, so turning in early isn't going to deprive you of the bitchin party scene going on or anything. In fact, during the two nights I stayed at this hotel, I was back early enough to end the night with a dip in the hot tub... and it was glorious.    During the day, the pool area is definitely family friendly, but they also have a nice pool side bar and enough lounge chairs that you can escape from the pool- noodle fights and viscous splashing going on in the pool. They also have cabanas you can rent which is just ridiculous, but hey, go for it if you like to waste your money. I also really enjoyed the small touches offered at this Westin. Like most things in life, it's the little things that count, and the rosemary lemonade in the lobby during the day was delightful, and the lighted makeup-mirror in the room was super! Onsite Starbucks was great too. They have a little sewing kit in the bathroom along with mouthwash and plenty of lotions and etc., and with all the cuts that I've been seeing in the hotel biz where you are lucky nowadays to get a bar of soap, these extras are definitely appreciated.  The beds were really comfy and the room was very clean and not sketchy in the slightest. So two thumbs up there. We had the breakfast buffet one of the mornings and it was a pretty good deal for what they offered. I believe it was $20 give or take a few bucks and they had an omelet station, pancake station, fruit and yogurt, bagels and other yummy breakfast carbs, breakfast meats, oatmeal, and southern favorites. I tried biscuits and gravy as well as cheese grits for the first time in my life and was please with it. My two friends I was with, one from Alabama and the other from Mississippi, were both less impressed at the authenticity of the southern fare offered, but agreed it was still tasty.  Also note that the Westin will hold your luggage for you if you get there before your room is ready or checkout before it's time to leave, so that's also nice. $20 bucks a day to park your car which falls under the "resort fee."I could never live in Savannah, GA, because then I would have no excuse to come and stay here.  Everything about the Westin Savannah Harbor Golf Resort and Spa is nice. The rooms were nice, the staff was nice, the hotel was nice, the amenities were nice. A few highlights:-Free bike rentals to tour the area on your own.-Gorgeous offsite gym, spa, golf, and tennis club - just a 5 minute walk from the hotel.-Free ferry to/from old town Savannah-Lovely pool-Great kids activities. Speaking of kids' activities, we left our kiddos behind for the weekend, but I kind of regretted that because they catered so much to kids. For instance, they had a craft area by the pool. They also had a poolside hermit crab race in the evening. Our crab won a race, so we received a lovely $25 hotel gift card.Overall, I think this place is lovely. Can't wait to return!I recently had the pleasure of spending 3 nights at the Westin in Savannah. The room was well appointed, modern, and clean and checkin/check out was seamless. I was extended the "green" option of eschewing daily housekeeping and towel changes in exchange for 500 starwoods points per night which was lovely. The complimentary wifi was fast and reliable.My girlfriend had a lovely exfoliating scrub at the heavenly spa, a wonderful experience which included complimentary mimosas. I also noticed the option of renting new balance workout clothes for my stay for only $5 which seems like a great way to cut down on packing if you intend to exercise.The hotel also hosts a memorable jazz brunch on sundays which features an overwhelming array of hot, fresh, and delicious freshly prepared options from a highly renowned local chef.The hotel PR manager, David Moses seems to have made it his personal mission to ensure my stay in not only the Westin, but the city of Savannah, a delight. He had invited me to the hotel a few months prior and even personally drove me to and from the airport and arranged to have chocolate covered strawberries and champagne delivered to my room.I highly recommend staying at the Westin Savannah Harbor Golf Resort & Spa to anyone looking to visit the area.Just leaving the resort now.   Having just recovered from the attitude of the man that checked us in, the lady that checked us out obviously has it in for her boss and hates her job.     Just blah personality from the staff.  If you can deal with that, the rooms are terrific!   I'll stay elsewhere from now on though, just don't want to deal with ANY rudeness when PAYING for a vacation.We are now wondering if because we went through a 3rd party, Priceline, and supposedly got a discounted price for our stay, we bought "discounted" attitude too.  It does seem that whenever we called for service or questions, everyone noted that we went through a 3rd party.We booked this hotel through a fantastic deal available through Travelzoo, which made it incredibly affordable.  I have stayed in several Westin Hotels in the past, and this one mostly lives up to the name.  I truly enjoy the aroma they use throughout the Westin chain (white tea), but here, I didn't smell it very often, which was somewhat disappointing.  The hotel itself is about as modern as you can get in Savannah, as much of the town is either older hotels or Bed and Breakfast type places.  Staying on the other side of the water was no major inconvenience, the ferry boat system seemed to work right on time.  Large boats came through at early hours (4:00 AM) at times, so you have to be aware that it could be a bit noisy.The rooms themselves seemed nice, the bed was comfortable (as most Westin beds are), and it had modern touches with a flat screen TV and Ipod/phone dock alarm clock, and dual shower heads.  The concierge there was more than helpful when we had questions, and the gingerbread display (we stayed during Christmas season) was really cool.One odd part about this hotel is that the fitness facility is over by the golf course clubhouse, which is about a five minute walk outside.  Not so bad when it is warm out, but during winter, it was about 30 degrees, and I'm walking in shorts to the exercise room.  Turns out, you can borrow one of the bikes they have sitting outside and ride over.  That made things much easier, although still quite cold.  Overall, we had a good experience, and would definitely consider coming to stay again.Probably the best place to stay while in Savannah. Extremely convenient location across from the river from River Street. Take the ferry across, and you may never need to drive. On our last day, we ordered room service for dinner. The food was timely, warm, and delicious.I was fortunate enough to win a free stay here, so I got a friend and we headed on down.  I will start with the only negative: you have to cross the bridge for everything.Positives: the place itself is pretty, feels luxurious for the neighborhood, and gives you a great view of the area.  The service was super amazing, with all of the employees acknowledging you when you walk in, walk out, and return.  I do not want to linger on this point, but seriously, I was impressed with everyone's prompt service.  I stay at a lot of hotels, so the fact that it stands out to me says something.I adore sleeping in the Heavenly beds, and thoroughly enjoyed standing on the balcony and watching the giant freight ships passing by on the river.  The place was clean, the room service was tasty, and downtown Savannah is beautiful.  I would happily go back!modern, Bed super comfortable, nice view of the savannah river if you get that view. when i ask for more towels and more body lotion :-)  they immediately sent it to me I really like that  lol.... they had green tea scent products for the bathroom that we enjoyed very much so that was cool.If i ever go back to savannah I will def stay at this place again.the only thing I didnt like is that when i called to find out activities for each day the people at the front desk never knew anything but I just went downstairs and found out my self, that was the only little thing that bother me.Love the Westin Savannah! My wife and I are spending a very nice anniversary weekend here. It's a convenient ferry ride across the river to historic and fun River Street.  Great on property dining and spa.I was so excited when SO booked a night here during our fly by trip earlier this week. The hotel staff is amazing except for one person and I am kicking myself that I did not write down his name! I had prearranged a surprise spa service for hubby and had to bump up our check-in time from 3 p.m. to 2 or 2:30 at the latest in order for us to check in and get settled in. The male staff was very flippant with me on the phone, explaining, well, if you get here and the room is ready you can have it. If not, then you'll have to wait. I was a little taken aback and called the next day and spoke to another person who assured me that everything would be ready for us.I managed to sneak a call to the hotel when hubby was getting gas to confirm we would be ok to check in by 2:00. I spoke to Ashley (who is AMAZING!) and she said that not only was the room ready, but she confirmed the spa appointment too. When we arrived, we learned that our room was a golf facing one, well, hubby wanted to be a diva and requested a room upgrade to river view, and then when we saw that our room didn't have a balcony, we upgraded again for an additional $100. We called and spoke to Ashley who took care of everything for us.The bed was a bit lumpy (I prefer a firmer a bed), but after driving through the rain for hours, my body didn't care anymore!SO said the spa service was amazing as well, and he even fell asleep! I took advantage of the balcony and treated myself to just relaxing in the warm sun and people watching on River Street.We used the ferry (it's actually not free, there is a $19 resort fee that is applied to this) and visited (and got trashed) while bar hopping on River Street. The ferry does offer a real nice way to not even be tempted with drinking and driving. I do agree with a previous post that the valet were less than helpful.The Westin is a very nice hotel, with a pretty view and informative staff. I'm had to dock it one star because the ferry ran quite late a few times, and keep in mind--it is a "family" hotel, so if you're not a fan of small children, it might be best to look elsewhere.An okay hotel, but definitely not up to Westin standards. Arrived at 11 pm, front desk was abandoned, it took some minutes for someone to finally saunter over and get us to our room. Similar experience in the main restaurant. We asked for a slightly extended checkout time, were flatly turned down...only to be kept waiting again trying to check out at the front desk while the clerk failed to make eye contact. Book through Priceline or similar, room rates are much cheaper than the hotel website. Reservations desk lied when asked about lower rates available online.Great location on the river looking across the river at the downtown but easily accessible with a free and frequent water taxi.The rooms are large and well maintained and the staff is gracious and accommodating.Internet fees in business center are excessive.This hotel is just beautiful. It's set right on the river, with a clear view of River Street in downtown Savannah and the Talmadge Bridge from the front. A convenient ferry system visits the 3 major hotels-- the Westin, the Marriott, and the Hyatt, the latter two of which are located on River Street. The room was beautiful and the bed was to die for. The shower was great, and the toiletries are definitely steal-worthy :) The toilet had some issues, but I'm not sure if its due to it being an old toilet, or the water system on Hutchinson Island. There was a convenient drink cooler in the entertainment hutch and a nice big flat screen tv. The wi-fi was dependable.The valets and luggage attendants were soooooo helpful and nice. We have no complaints about them whatsoever. The front desk staff seemed bored and like the last thing they wanted to do was help people. The bar staff in the Midnight Lounge seemed inexperienced and lacked personality (two female bartenders, both with different accents... Did not get their names). One standard drink (a blue Hawaiian) ended up being made with grapefruit juice instead of pineapple juice, and their "sweet tea" was tea sweetened with simple syrup. Ick.
