(That is not the bartender's fault, it's the bar's.)They have complimentary rosemary-infused lemonade in the lobby which was delightfully refreshing. We did not use the pool, but it looked nice. We would definitely stay here again, but we would love to see people more like the valets and baggage attendants in the front desk and bartending positions. Knowing how to do a job is one thing, but it's that extra bit of personality and caring about your customers that takes the whole experience a lot further.
review_content_60: One of the best hotels in all of Savannah... Having stayed all over Savannah, Georgia from the historic district and mid-town all the way out to Pooler and Port Wentworth I can tell you that you will get every penny of what you pay out of your visit at the Westin on Hutchinson Island. Inconspicuously opulent, this hotel and resort has everything you need for a Savannah get-away.Featuring a spa and top-notch golfing this resort caters to everyone on-site and easily facilitates travel across the Savannah river to the historic district via free and convenient ferry shuttles that run every 15 minutes or so throughout the day and night.The property is gorgeous and the rooms very well appointed. Bedding and linens are top notch, no skimping on quality or thread-count here. The rooms are over-sized and spacious offering either views across to the picturesque city or out to the golf-course and the low-country between Savannah and nearby Hilton Head Island. Having stayed here during the holidays I can attest it to me a magical place decorated with perfection and attention to detail...the sort of place that really captures the holiday spirit and embodies it's hospitality well. Stay near the winter holidays and receive a complimentary ticket to the awesome light-show in Hutchinson Island. Well reviewed, well enjoyed and most certainly recommended.My husband and I spent a very fun weekend at the Westin in Savannah. Good points: spacious room, great view of Savannah's River St., and a fun water taxi to take trips across the Harbour. The Westin also has a decent gym and spa within walking.We went on a rainy weekend - which could have been terrible - but wasn't! It was still warm and clear enough Friday and part of Saturday to enjoy the hot tub and pool. The hotel has an oyster roast on Friday night with a bonfire and live music. There is a Starbucks in the lobby bar, which is always a bonus for us.This is a hotel with exceptional service! Friendly greeted the second we pulled up. Our room was even ready an hour and half early! Free parking with the simple swipe of your room key into the parking lot. There is a free ferry that takes you right into the heart of the historic district. This being my first time in Savannah it was the perfect location to be dropped off at, and so easily accessible. The pool is amazing! Even on one of the sunniest days it wasn't overly crowded. There are servers who come around constantly serving from the bar that includes great good. Although, kind of pricey what do you expect from the hotel bar? The hotel service is constantly at your beck and call AND with a smile on their face! I only wish the dinner recommendations by the concierge were better, not good food recommendations outside hotel dinning. Though, one of the front desk woman was so kind to assist she went above and beyond to help. I wish I could remember her name I know it was "Sh---a" (I know, not helpful). Overall it was a great hotel to stay in, reasonably priced thanks to Expedia, and right across the river from the downtown! Definitely will recommend this place and return to it next time I'm in Savannah!This hotel is situated on the Savannah River with views of the river and golf course. It is a high class hotel with plenty of nice amenities and a decent restaurant.The lounge is a great place to enjoy cocktails or a glass of wine just adjacent to the pool.The best thing about this hotel is the location, the heavenly beds, and the golf course is just a few minutes away.It features a ferry ride accross the river (check hotel for times) and late check outs (4 PM) for preffered guests.The bed is simply amazing and once you get into it you do not want to leave or get up. This beds comes with multiple pillows to suit your needs and comfort level.Awesome place with one drawback-parking here is limited and you may need to park in the conference center. The experience here is wonderful from beginning to end.Enjoy.Very nice resort ! Enjoying the nights around the pool! The parking is horrible had to walk several parking lots over to find somewhere! This was tough on the family with kids!I was scheduled to go to Savannah for work and I was dreading it. I just felt like there would be nothing to do and it would just be hot. Boy was I wrong. As for the hotel, this place is awesome. The rooms are clean and staff is amazing. Flat screen TVs and the pool and lounges are spectator. The only reason they don't get 5 stars is because room service is only open until 11. Right across the river is shopping, bars and restaurants. There are free ferry boats that take you across the water to River Street. It's so cool there. Tons to do and the city is beautiful. So much so that I would take a personal trip back here.Great worthy of 4 star hotel. Beautiful pool, hot tub. Workout facilities are not in building. Nice business center. They have a free ferry to go across river every 20-30 minutes. Very clean updated rooms. Aqua restaurant was great. Views of large cargo container barges are unbelievable! Get river view room. Do the self park, it is very close and covered.Nice rooms, wonderful amenities, fantastic landscaping and you are isolated from Savannah on the island. If you need the convention center it is right beside the hotel. There is also a racetrack on Hutchinson Island nearby the hotel Downside: Riding the free ferries to the other side of the river is okay, but you lose time waiting for the ride each way, every time. Also Ferry stops running at 11:30 (bars stay open until 3, cab is $15-20 to get back). It was also cold on our weekend -- too cold to be on the water. Parking was limited - when the hotel was full; several cars were double-parked. The workout room is not in the building- you have to take a shuttle bus to it. Odd. Guess it was really built for the golfers using the course. The course looked great - well maintained. Super nice driving range as well. They do rent clubs and, oddly enough, New Balance workout gear. Beautiful landscaping, a Starbucks inside and pretty good service made the hotel shine.It ok. It was clean and comfortable.The Westin in Savannah is one of the best hotels in Savannah. I should know; I grew up there. It is probably the largest hotel in Savannah, and it is very luxurious. Unlike every other hotel in the downtown area, the Westin has a vast courtyard and pool area. The Westin is actually located in South Carolina (on the North side of the river). All of the other hotels are located in Savannah (on the South Side of the river). The best things about the Westin's location are the following:1. Lots of Room: Since the Westin is located across from River Street and not on River Street, there is not much development. That means that when the Westin was built, they had a vast amount of land to work with. Therefore, unlike other hotels in the area, the space is not cramped. 2. Great Views: Since the hotel is located on the South Carolina side of the river, you have an extensive view of downtown Savannah. 3. Peace and Quiet: The Westin is not a "party" hotel. The party occurs on River Street, so even if you are out on a Saturday night, you will not have partygoers hanging out around your hotel. If you want to partake in the festivities, there is a free ferry that will take you to River Street and back to the hotel. There are two downsides to this, though. The last ferry runs before midnight, so you need to grab a taxi if you stay out late. Also, the ferry comes every 20 minutes. This is fine if the weather is nice. Otherwise, it feels like forever. I would certainly stay at this Westin again. As with all Westin hotels, the rooms and beds are very clean and comfortable.I was not impressed with this Westin. The hotel/resort itself is beautiful, but compared to the Westin standard I am used to in other large cities, the rooms were subpar. The decor was outdated, lumpy beds and extremely low ceilings. Also, despite being pretty high up I could still hear footsteps everywhere and could definitely hear the party in the next room. Also, keep in the mind that the ferry stops running at midnight, so plan to take a cab if you are going to be out late.If your wondering if you should spend the extra money and stay across the river from Savannah, the answer is YES!!!!!!!!!! So pleased with our stay this past memorial day weekend.Beautiful hotel and grounds. Friendly staff. They have free fresh peaches, lemonade and bottled water in the lobby for arriving/departing guests. A small starbucks in the hotel. You can grab a coffee to go! The pool is beautiful. Jacuzzi is great. Chairs are nice. Hammocks and firepits around the property. Plenty of places to hang out outside night/day. Pool closes at 11 pm. The room was really nice too. We had a river view with a balcony. I highly recommend it!!! Great view of Savannah's river street down below. Flat screen TV and coffee maker with starbucks and small fridge. There is a free ferry that leaves every 20 minutes across the river to River Street this added to our vacation, it was a nice 5 min boat ride...we really liked it. It runs from 9 am to midnight!FYI- it's $22/day to valet park at the hotel.Clean, modern with a great view of Savannah ' s historic River street. Offers free convenient ferry into the historic district.The golf course is kind of boring and with any real challenges. The general conditions the course is only fair. This is really a 3-star facility throughout. Should not be paying over $100 for this course.When I stayed in Savannah, I wanted to stay somewhere nice. So I booked (at the time) the only 4Diamond property in the area. I am also a Starwood member so I thought that would help with points too.I ended up staying for 3 nights. I brought my ford escape to be valet parked mind you.The property is beautiful mind you, and the front desk was nice as well.Then I got up to my room. I wanted some coffee and low and behold there was mold and a used filter in the machine. Couldn't use a cup because there was ash in one of them and lipstick all over the other one. Not sure what had happened but I have never experienced that in even a low end hotel.When I left, I handed the valet my card, and I wait about 10 minutes, only for a Cadillac to come up. Would have been wonderful if only I drove a Cadillac!Thankfully after another 10 minutes, I got my car back.I know we all have bad days or whatnot, but this to me just seemed like one thing after another. Unfortunately I have not given it a second chance.I hope other people have had better experiences here because it is such a beautiful property and I am a huge fan of Starwood.I do not recommend staying in this hotel. I stayed here for two nights after spending the four previous nights at the Andaz across the river. I paid less at the Andaz during the week (but, also on Halloween night) than I did at The Westin over the weekend. The Westin is across the river so you have the huge inconvenience of having the wait for the not-so-short ferry ride across the river. While parking may be "free" at the Westin, you do have to pay a resort fee, which isn't cheap, and you don't really get much for it. I wasn't there for the golf or the spa, so maybe if you are, it would make a difference. However, while the rooms have been updated, they do still look dated, however, this place is fairly clean. The employees were not nearly as friendly as those at the Andaz, and while the beds at the Andaz were so comfortable, the beds at The Westin were hard as a rock. I got a kick out of the commercials that kept running on the TV for The Westin, which kept referencing the luxurious comfort of The Westin's beds. Also, if you do have a dog with you, the dog fee is pricey (~$100). Overall, this hotel would not be my first choice for accommodations in Savannah.Went here with my wife after I dropped off my brother at GA southern because he was starting school there. I found a good deal on hotels.com and got the room at $100 a night instead of $159My wife treated me to the spa treatment there where I got massage, first facial and manicure. I fully enjoyed the spa treatment. Ferry runs all day from westin to river st all day. We ate and got drunk on river street after visiting couple of the bars there, but we didn't have to worry about driving anywhere or catching a cab back to the hotel because of the ferry ride back.as for the room....it was up to expectations of any 4 star hotel..loved the moon lounge at the lobby because we came back from river st on the ferry and decided we were not drunk enough and had more drinks at the bar. We stumbled to our room but all in all, it was good stay for a one day getaway trip... it was bitter sweet leaving but I would definitely stay here again.Every day of our three night stay was so very good. This has to be the best place in Savannah to stay for location, view and pool. Only negative was the concierge so by pass him, always seemed to busy but no one was ever there and make your first stop the visitor center for information on where to walk and the free local bus. Can head on over to Savannah via the ferry boat, saw dolphins every day!Had a wonderful stay at The Westin Savannah Harbor over Memorial Day weekend. This is a beautiful hotel right on the river. We were a little hesitant that we would have to take the ferry over to River Street, but it really was quite easy and took no time at all. It's free! The only downfall, they stop running a little before midnight, so cabs might be necessary for the end of the night. The rooms were nice, big and very clean. Decorated in like a traditional Westin with the heavenly beds and contemporary furnishings. The lounge downstairs had a make your own bloody mary bar, and the other drinks were great there, but the food was just so-so for the price. They also have a nicer restaurant on the 2nd floor, the Aqua Star, but I did not eat there during my stay. The concierge was super helpful. I asked her for dinner recommendations, and she made us a reservation at her favorite restaurant, and we were not disappointed. The pool was lovely, and very resort-like. Nice, comfortable lounge chairs, and a few cabanas for rent. Poolside bar, waiters, a hot tub, along with music really added to this feel. Since this was a busy weekend, it was a bit difficult to get a chair if you weren't out there early. There are also fire pits by the pool, and sitting out there at night with a cocktail was beautiful. We saw 3 weddings taking place over the course of our stay, and this would really be a beautiful place to get married in the courtyard, overlooking the river and historic Savannah. Overall, the Westin greatly enhanced our stay in Savannah.From the beautiful Egyptian cotton sheets to the pina coladas next to the saltwater pool overlooking the Savannah River, everything about our stay was amazing. We booked on Hotels.com for a king room and got an incredible deal. This will be my first choice for future trips to Savannah. Only complaint: We couldn't try the room service because I just couldn't justify paying $18 for your basic bacon and eggs breakfast. Maybe next time.
review_content_80: This Westin lives up the normal Westin standard.  The hotel is beautiful and is across the river from Savannah.  At first, I was annoyed, but it allows you to be close and keep the riff raff out.  You simply take the free ferry ride across.The staff was amazing upon check-in, luggage service to housekeeping.  Lauren from South Africa was so friendly.  The concierge was extremely helpful.  Also, room service was really great.  We had the seafood pot pie and seafood special.  Pretty fast and fairly priced.We would definitely recommend this place if staying in Savannah!My only recomendation is that the valet parking be included in the resort fee.  I would gladly justify the resort fee for that.Very nice hotel indeed.  It had the perfect location, right across the river from all the restaurants, bars and historical places to visit.  All we had to do was jump on their free ferry service and they will take us to Savannah.The hotel room was impeccable.  Vary spacious and a great view of the entire Old Town Savannah.  The hotel's grounds are well manicured gardens that lead you to their pool.  We will definitely be back for a longer stay.I would not recommend this hotel. Although this is my  first day here- so far- I am not impressed at all. I came here to celebrate a friends 50th birthday, hoping to do something special for her. Unfortunately this hotel was not a treat and far from what the advertisements present. From the minute we drove up, this hotel was a huge disappointment. Although the lobby was attractive, the staff behind the desk were not welcoming at all. The lobby has the distinct feel of a convention center - not the feel of a 4 star luxury hotel. The first room we were given was dirtier than any hotel room I had ever visited. When we complained, we were moved to another room which was equally as dirty. Dust on all surfaces, dirt underneath the glass on the desk etc. Sounds hard to believe but it's the truth. The evening before we stayed at a Springfield Suites at the RDU airport and the room there was superior to the room here. I begged for my money back for the next two nights only to be told that it was not refundable. I chose this hotel because of the spa- only to be told upon arrival that you have to take a shuttle to the spa. We ordered a movie and it lost the signal throughout the second half of the movie. The only positive things I have to say is the manager, Greg was very apologetic and did get the maids to clean the room. The concierge, Phil was also most helpful. Fool me once- shame on me- fool me twice -well that won't happen. Stay at another hotel- it can't get much worse!I had a pretty disappointing time here. We incurred a $20 a DAY resort charge through Priceline that was not mentioned anywhere. This fee apparently covers complementary services, like the water ferry and coffee. Westin management and corporate gave us the runaround when discussing the mysterious fee for at least an hour. The pool was disgusting. Get a tiny bit in your mouth and enjoy the delicious salt water and sewage flavor.We booked a last minute trip to Savannah and wanted to stay someplace nice. The Westin deemed to be the place, however it was disappointing. More than half of the rooms face downtown Savannah and the harbor yet the placed us in a lower level room overlooking the parking lot. We heard car engines throughout the night. Did I mention this place was NOT booked up and was actually pretty empty--according to the bellhops and bar tender. The bathroom had an unpleasant odor the second we entered the room. The air conditioning was only operating as a fan with the room never fully cooling off to be comfortable. Added to that, they offer workout gear to rent but when requesting a pair of sneakers, an hour later they called to say they didn't have them. The only positive experience were the pleasant and helpful bellhops, the bar tender and the pool. Otherwise, I would do further research into another place to stay upon a return.I love Westin hotels but this location is 3 stars at best.  I wouldn't really call it a spa by southern standards.  We only stayed one night and passed on the 20 dollar extra resort fee that they tried to charge us.  The boat ride was pleasant and it looks like that they went a little on the cheap side with the renovations so that i may have lost some of its older charm.  It is a big place and when you check in you don't get much organized information about what the hotel has to offer.  For example we didn't even know there was a tennis court nearby.  I would love to come here again when things have improved.Views are spectacular and encountered no rude employees like we did at the Andaz......we split our vacation between 2 hotels.  Now we know our favorite:)  The pool is beautiful!I had a horrible experience at this Westin and will not be returning ever. 1. Items went missing from my suitcase. I alerted the hotel over the phone as I realized this once I was unpacking. I left multiple messages and NEVER got a response...just promises that the manager would get back to me. Never did. I finally contacted my Platinum Ambassador and Starwood directly. I finally then got a response from the property, but they basically said there was nothing they could do, and the person I left messages with no longer worked there. Totally unacceptable and they did NOTHING to help me or offer any solutions. The items that I believe we're stolen from my bag were very special to me, and they did not even acknowledge my concern. 2. I used Platinum Suite Nights to upgrade my room.  The 'upgrade' was terrible. It was a room attached to another room. Definitely a joke and certainly was not a Suite. 3. Staff at hotel seemed to care less my guest and I were even there. They were not friendly, not accommodating with our requests, and quite frankly rude. 4. The pool area is not nice. It was bug and insect infested and the water was an odd shade of green. I did not get in. I left with bug bites. Overall, extremely disappointed with The Westin Savannah and Starwood in General for this poor experience and lack of responsiveness. Ruined my vacation.We had a great stay even though we only stayed 3 night nice people. A few pointers Great poolNice roomsGood service Good ferry service Cool view of the golf courseWe pulled in to valet park, & just sat...while to big guys argued and laughed about who's turn it was... And how hot it was...We let ourselves out, carried our own bags in... "wanna valet it!?" the dude barked at me as I walked by... No not now I said.  " then gimme your keys I gotta move it". I ignored him.  We carried our own stuff up after parking our own car... Dinner in aqua-star was good but the place was about empty and they still sat us next to a PA speaker, we couldn't hear ourselves think.  We got up and moved ourselves.Last night  We ordered our breakfast in bead to be delivered. Today it arrived completely wrong.  I called and let them know at the front desk and the woman said  "so what do you want?  Another breakfast?". I give up.... We have one more night here, then I'm going to need a vacation. Much nicer to stay at the HHI Westin.Yes, we live in Savannah but stay here often. Great location to riverstreet...you can take the ferry over. Great prices for this upscale hotel, rooms are great, the bed is to die for, amazing views.My girlfriends and I recently ventured to Savannah for a bachelorette party weekend. Aside from the pretty penny that a night in this hotel costs (let alone 4 nights), we loved everything about the Westin, especially the hotel bar, Midnight Sun Lounge Bar, where they serve up delicious dirty martinis. As far as the amenities, the hotel is situated on it's own private road in the heart of the historic Savannah River District. The rooms were spacious, the beds were comfy, and housekeeping very graciously dealt with all of the penis-themed decor we had strewn across the suite. If you stop by the lobby bar, say hello to our buddy Edgar.Excellent location & service! Hotel and pool are along river across from downtown Savannah. Free shuttle ferry every 20 minutes or so to take you across the river. Fitness room is away from hotel at golf course about 1/4 mile walk away, but it's well equipped.Great location - awesome golf course and spa.  There is a free ferry that quickly transports you to the other side where all the shopping and restaurants are.  They have a great outside pool right on the river and there is pool service.  The loungers are really comfy and plenty of seating areas.  Outside propane fire places that throw enough heat to keep you cosy as you enjoy the gorgeous weather.   Our room was clean and well-appointed.  I found the customer service to be excellent - the staff, especially Leah and Stephanie, were awesome!This hotel saved us after a nightmare experience over at one of the "resorts" on Tybee Island. We managed to get out of our stay over there, and when we called the Westin they were more than happy to accommodate us... even at 99% occupancy on a Saturday night.They assured us that even though there were no more river front rooms available, they did have a room for us. Upon check in, we were given a free upgrade to the 15th floor with a private balcony. Even the non-river-front rooms still have a great view of the river and some golf courses.The staff was friendly, helpful, and truly saved our anniversary weekend.My wife and I stayed here in November 2012.  We planned a last minute anniversary trip to Savannah after Hurrican Sandy ruined our primary plans.  But this alternate trip turned out to be a great one.  My wife suggested The Westin after she stayed here for a work trip.  Even though the hotel is not in town and across the river, we didn't mind taking the free ferry into downtown.  The room rate was much lower than the comparible hotels in downtown and seemed like it had much more to offer.  The gentleman that checked us in gave us a room with an awesome view of the river.  I think we were supposed to be on the other side, but he must have switched us once he heard it was our anniversary.  He also had a bottle champagne sent to our room for free.  What a nice guy.  I wish I remembered his name.We didn't bring our son, but the hotel looks like it caters well to kids as the property has avilable recreational games.The spa service was just as great as the guy that checked us in.  The spa is a short walk from the hotel at the golf club house (less than 1 mile door to door).  The spa was very clean and relaxing.  The hotel has a complimentary shuttle to take you to the spa and other areas of the resort.They also have complimentary bicycles for guests to use.  We took advantage of the bikes and rode around the property and on the racetrack next to the hotel.  Yes, a real racetrack.  If there are no races going on, people can take their cars, motorcycles, even bicycles on them.I would definitely come back to the WestinI always love staying at Westin Resorts and this one is hands down a favorite.Check in was seamless and the customer service was stellar. I had a room overlooking the Savannah River which was a big plus. The bedding and pillows were comfy, fluffy, down filled (a must for Miss Mira) and the room was spot on clean.The hotel is directly next to the convention center which is super convenient as I had to work a booth there all week. Central Savannah is a ferry ride away...not at all inconvenient and was actually quite fun, especially at night after a few pops.If you are the type to work out while on the road, the gym is a little trek down the road located at the golf course. There is also a spa for those who need a little pampering. The hotel bar was a lot of fun and has a decent wine selection.Loved my stay here and did not want to return to Cali.My wife and I opted for a bit of a staycation for our second anniversary and we ended up deciding between the Avia downtown and the Westin across the river. I'm happy that we ended up at the Westin because the view out our window really made the difference.There was a beautiful wedding going on that evening so we got some additional lovely scenery on the house. The pool was inviting as was the hot tub later that night. Expect a mix in clientele, as we were privy to some jackassery upon walking in the door: a couple of frat 'nozzles acting like gay stereotypes because ... honestly, I don't know why. Some people just die without attention I guess.That said, most everything was great but menus were decidedly sparse at their cafe and the waitstaff was slow to take orders. Other than that everyone was friendly and helpful."little slice of heaven"Great getaway nested in Savannah, Ga.  Came here to visit and instantly fell in love with the place.  How can you beat a place where you take water taxi across to River Street~!  If you are planning to stay, request for room with river view ( highly recommended). It was amazing to watch big cargo ships pass by while sitting down in your room.  Staffs are nice and ambiance is just heavenly.  Room:  AStaff: AOverall:  AVery disappointed with the level of service here. We are very familiar with the Westin and its usually our  standby go to for a quality stay. This is our second night: NO turndown service, no replenishment of soap and lotion after first day, towel that was hanging over bathroom door - not picked up. No replenishment of coffee or tea in room. We had to call for more towels today, they didn't restock  us. Very disappointed.

review_content: Location: It can't be beat. It's in the heart of Savannah's historic district and is walkable to everywhere. If you don't want to walk, you can Uber for 5 bucks. Amenities: The gym and pool area are great! The gym had treadmills, elliptical, stationary bikes, free weights, and medicine balls. Everything is in newer condition and clean. The pool goes to 9 feet deep and has ample seating and views.Breakfast: Wow. This breakfast buffet (that comes with your room) has everything. Scrambled eggs, omelette bar, bacon, sausage, turkey sausage, biscuits n' gravy (THE BEST OF MY LIFE), fresh fruit, cheeses, smoked salmon, pastries, bagels, croissants, oatmeal, hard boiled eggs, assorted juices....am I missing anything? Probably. Room: I had to take into account that this is an older hotel. A lot of fixtures are old and rusted. The shower curtain definitely needed to be changed to a new one. The beds weren't made with a fitted sheet but a bed sheet, a comforter, then another bed sheet. We had a leaky toilet the second day we were there but it was fixed within 5 minutes of us calling downstairs. I would have given this hotel 5 stars if they did some updated renovations to the room.Not impressed. I checked in and was told that Hotels.com had booked me a smoking king size room instead of a non-smoking room and they told me they had a double bed room if I would take that so I said fine. I've actually gone back to my Hotels.com booking since then and my reservation said NON-SMOKING. I checked in to the room and it was right by the elevator and was a handicap accessible room so the sink was super tiny and it was a stand up shower where the water went ALL over the floor in the bathroom while/after you showered. I wish they would have mentioned that when asking me if it was okay to switch. Then I left something in my car so I had to get someone to take me down to the parking lot to grab it (under the building). Well this person (a valet) told me three times how hot I was and asked me what I was doing later and told me what time he gets off work. Not appropriate. Lastly, the room was dirty. I dropped my fitbit on the floor one night and it went under the bed and I saw M&M's, someone's earring, trash, etc all under the bed. Also the toilet had black scuff marks all over it and the sink in the bathroom was covered in dirt. I run conventions and was there to check out a convention and their convention work was horrible as well. Water stains all over the ceiling in the ballroom and water glasses were never refreshed when people wanted something to drink in a conference room.Bad on all counts.04/15, 1-night stay.Pros: The location, valet, grand lobby, and views from my corner room. Also, when I arrived late in the evening, although the gift shop was closed, a lady at the front desk opened it to help me purchase some items. (I regret that I've since forgotten her name.) Also, I believe wifi was free.Cons: I wish the decor of the grand lobby was reflected in the room itself. In short, it was old. And not "historic" old, but more like "outdated," "unkept," and "in disrepair." The window curtain was falling off the rail and the bathroom reminded me of something you'd see in an old gym. I wish I'd had shower shoes! (My included photos tell a better story than my words can.) Overall, I believe the quality of the room wasn't commensurate with the price I paid for it.Savannah is easily one of my favorite cities in the country, after having lived there for a year. I decided to stop in for a night (on a long drive from TX to MA) and visit some old friends. This hotel was sufficient for a one night stay.Wish I would have read Alie's review prior to booking. I would recommend reading that before booking...it is very accurate.This hotel is in a great area, really conveniently located. The staff are great. However...The original hotel that stood on this site was a historic masterpiece. They tore that down in the 1960s to make a 60's plain brick hotel...blah. Now the 'new' hotel needs updating. Badly.When I walked into the lobby, I was charmed...when I got to the blah floors/guest rooms, I was disappointed.The hotel has odd artifacts from the original hotel sprinkled in. They do not look like they fit. Example, what is with the lion figure head spewing water out of it's mouth outside the front door onto the sidewalk? And the DeSoto sculpture in the lobby?The rooms look like they tried too hard, but in the 1960's...southern decor meets what? And weird, creepy pictures on the walls. Why are there sketches of girls playing with an early hula hoop? And a sketch of a woman sleeping. Why?The room is dated. The vents are rusty and dirty. I cannot find out how to change the temp in my room (the thermostat won't change). The bathroom has a dated shower, and needs caulking and paint. I can clearly hear my neighbors in the hallway and next door talking about their plans for the day (for hours!).I left the room at noon, and came back around 5pm from sightseeing and my room was not clean. Disappointing. Also, there is no laundry facilities in the hotel, nor nearby. When I asked the front desk for options, they said Mon-Fri they could send out dry cleaning...too bad it was friday night and I was leaving on Monday morning. This hotel is not historic nor is it up to date. I don't know what else to say...the pool was nice, if you like pool decks from 1962. I would stay downtown, by the river, at a full service hotel.The Hilton Savannah DeSoto hotel is old time classic hotel located in the heart of Savannah's Historic District, near dining, shopping and theater districts, and many things to do. I rented a car at the airport. I only had to drive about 20 minutes from the Savannah/Hilton Head (SAV) International Airport to the hotel. The hotel only offers valet parking, which added another $25 to my hotel bill.There was a very nice letter in my room from Kevin B. the hotel's GM recognizing my Hilton Honors membership status and inviting me to the complimentary breakfast buffet. After I checked-in I was able to walk to the Riverfront Plaza, River Street and City Market. I was here for business meetings at the second floor meeting rooms. The service in the meeting rooms was above average. The pool and fitness rooms are located on the second floor.I was only here for one night. My hotel room 1206 had some great views, which you can see from my pics. My room was only $119 or about $136 with the taxes. I really liked this hotel and Savannah the oldest city in the U.S.A. I would recommend and return to this hotel.Check out my other Savannah reviews.The rug doesn't match the curtains.It's an old 'historic' hotel. The lobby has been redone and is quiet nice. The rooms try to be nice but it's kind of lipstick on a pig........the furniture is nice but you can't help notice the old shower, the water dribbled.....felt a bit dusty.Overall it's in a good location and was fine for a 1 night stay.I will say service was great, everyone was super friendly!Older property located in the heart of Savannah. Rooms themselves are a bit dated and the air conditioning was fair. Getting the car from valet can be slow at times during busy hours.We went during Mother's Day weekend so the place was packed. We did eat in the hotel restaurant for a few meals. We had free breakfast which was a standard buffet. One night we had dinner which I enjoyed a lot because the dining room was not crowded. Then finally we had a special Sunday brunch which was good, but felt a bit too much like a wedding.Check in and check out was painless and the staff was very friendly. For overall location, I would probably stay on River St. again instead of this property.The staff was the best part of our stay. Every single person we spoke with was extremely helpful and kind. We left our car at the valet and didn't see it again till we left. We were on the 11th floor corner view, well worth the money. Also had a balcony with a view of the city and we saw the fireworks from there without having to fight the crowds. Bed was comfortable but the pillows left a lot to be desired. The pool is on the 2nd floor and has a view opposite the city. We ordered room service for lunch and it was excellent. Extremely surprised for hotel food. Hotel is in a great location of savannah, not to busy but just enough surrounding to walk to.I liked the location and feel of this hotel. Got a great price from Priceline through "name your own price" of 99.00 per night. They charge $ 25.00 per day for valet..... like everyone else in Savannah. Ask for a higher floor room with a balcony. Our room was clean with Peter Thomas Roth products in the bathroom. I would bring my own pillow and also a small fan to block out sounds coming from the hallway at night etc. For the price, you can't beat it.From the very moment I arrived here at the Hilton Desoto, I felt like I was home. As a HHonors Member I was welcomed by name by the front desk staff. The lobby is beautiful and should, itself, be an exhibit in a museum. The entire staff is so friendly and accommodating. I am required to make a trip to Savannah twice a month. I am happy and proud to say, this is my Savannah home!I'm so happy to be here! This is a beautiful hotel with amazing rooms. The check in process was easy and the concierge was very helpful and sweet! Our room is amazing with breathtaking views! The room is very clean and we love the decor!GREAT front desk service. I wish I remembered the girls name who checked me in because she was fantastic. Gave great advice on local places to dine and explore. The room was beautiful and had a great view from the balcony. However it was a little weird that the balcony didn't have any furniture on it despite being large enough. The concierge was also great as she booked us a haunted pub crawl. My one complaint is that the room got sweltering hot in the middle of the night and none of us could figure out how to change that. Note** parking is expensive ($25 per night)! But there are parking decks within walking distance that are half the price or free!I would like to begin this review by stating that, in terms of the room itself, this is the worst hotel experience I've ever had.With that being said, let me list the reasons:- Upon arrival, we (my fiancee and I) discovered that there were blood stains on our pillow.- The next morning, we discovered a scummy, crusty, gummy substance on the topsheet that happened to be in the general region of my face all night.- Possible blood stain in the basin of the shower.- The very white, white-haired lady that checked me out after breakfast the next morning was snooty and arrogant, as though it was below her station to even look at me.- The shower was extremely difficult to turn on the first time, to the point that we were afraid we were going to break the handle trying to turn it.- The shower temperature fluctuated wildly, ranging from "temperature I wanted it to be" to "literally scalding hot." Luckily for us, the shower made a "FWEEEEE!" sound before it decided to shoot out the boiling hot water, and the shower was spacious enough to avoid it.- There was a nasty, hard, white scum on the front of the sink beside the towel bar.- The wifi was spotty and occasionally ridiculously slow.- Nearly every chair in the entire building was uncomfortable, as though they made a concerted effort to deter lounging/resting.- The front desk tried to charge us for the room that was already paid for, then called us when the bank denied their attempt.- Most of the analog TV channels were fuzzy and nearly unwatchable.- The chairs in the conference areas were absolutely filthy and horrendously stained.- On our final night, we discovered that our down feather blanket was shredded in the corner and was spewing feathers everywhere. We called the front desk and asked if we could get another one. A half hour later, no one arrived. We called down a second time, and after a total of 45 minutes, we were finally able to get another blanket. The guy who delivered it to me was very rude, and acted as though I was inconveniencing him by having a shredded blanket. After we shut the door, we inspected the blanket; it too had a gaping hole in it, all the way at the bottom. At this point, we were too tired to wait another 45 minutes, so we called it a night. we're still picking feathers out of our belongings three days later.- The next day, the only item I ordered from the "Grille" was macaroni and cheese. It was still cold in the middle. I didn't care. I just wanted to get the hell out.Now, for all these grievances, the hotel did do SOME things right: Most of the staff was very polite and helpful, including the Starbucks girls and the valets, and the pool was lovely. That's about it.Hung up on me when I got wrong dept. Then called to ask if they still had great buffet. They said yes unenthusiastically. I figured go see. Went checked buffet . lady was wondering about saying no food on a 22.00 buffet. I made same conclusion . low county boil looked like was sitting for hours. Half the food they used to have. Low end fried seafood instead of fresh. We walked out. No greeter.This Hilton location was satisfactory, although there are some maintenance oversights and thin walls which detract from the experience somewhat.Pros:+ Free Wi-fi.+ Beautiful views of Savannah from almost every room.+ Friendly front desk staff.+ Great location central to Savannah, in walking distance to River street and many other attractions.+ Climate control works well.Cons:- The only parking option is valet for $25 per night.- The gym is relatively nice, with free weights, a large rubber floor mat, elliptical, bike and multiple treadmills. Unfortunately, the machines have not been well maintained (buttons were inoperable on the elliptical), and the air conditioning in the gym doesn't work so be prepared to sweat.- We were woken up many times by the sound of doors slamming down the hallway. Walls are thin here.Just checked in I can't believe my eyePooped in toilet..The glass was greasy and someone's lipst was half wiped...Disappointed! !!!!!!!!!!Five star customer service. Check in, valet, customer service were all very accommodating and friendly. They really go the extra mile. We asked for a roll away at check in and it was in our room when we opened the door. We then received a phone call from the front desk asking if we needed anything. Then when we were down in the lobby again they asked how we were and if we needed a map. Parking is $20 a night and there is valet service. You can request your car as often as you need to. The location of the hotel is good. You are close to a lot of landmarks and small boutiques. The lobby is pretty and well maintained. They serve Starbucks and have a restaurant. We did not eat at the restaurant, so I am not sure how good the food is. The rooms are clean but outdated that is why I gave three stars. Beds are uncomfortable and pillows are too, unless you like really flat pillows. Bathroom is really small and falling apart. The shower has great water pressure with plenty of hot water. But why don't they have a fan? Also room had a great view. I think the room is average but does not seem like a Hilton to me. I have never stayed in a run down Hilton before.This hotel seemed to be very centrally located, a few blocks off the interstate and within walking distance to the river (about 6-7 blocks), civic center (3-4 blocks), oodles of shopping and dining options in every direction, parks and landmarks. Our party was able to comfortably walk to all planned events.The lobby area is quite large and tastefully appointed, with bright elegant chandeliers. The guest room was slightly dated (we had a standard room with two double beds) but a decent size and it was clean and comfortable; the bathroom was also slightly dated and very, very small. We did not visit the pool, fitness center, or any on-site dining.Our room was on the 7th floor and offered a beautiful view of the historic district and the bridge. It was, however, just off the elevator and the alarm went off several times during the night (waking me each time). I think the walls may be a little thin as I could also hear an infant crying in an adjacent room and other guests as they passed outside the room.Well unfortunately I couldn't help but to stay here bcus of the group I'm with. But, as soon as I arrived the front is full with bellman out front. Not ONE attempted to assist with my luggage. But, one did direct me to the pathway to roll my luggage up. Then I get to the desk to check in and it's ladies #guest at the desk complaining that $350.00 was stolen out of their car from someone in the Valet Parking Services. They just arrived as well... LOL! Lord keep me near the cross. I have to be here until Saturday... uhThe guest services / reception was warm and welcoming. Very nice and our room was ready early! The hotel is also in a great location.The bummer parts:1. The room was a little old and dingy, there was paint coming off in the bathroom, etc...2. Very load by the elevator is where our room was and unfortunately at 7:30am we had cleaning crew up there, talking loudly, opening and shutting doors and the elevator going up and down.I would probably stay there again, but not at that price point. There are tons of other hotels in the area with better prices that are quaint.Not a terrible experience, but not the best experience I've had. The hotel staff were all very kind, which was a plus!
review_content_20: We were not given the type of room booked. The room was in need of renovation. One of the pictures in a grouping was missing with one hook and a hole remaining. A lot of rust on metal grate in bathroom. Upholstered chair had a broken leg. Paint was peeling on bathroom door. Carpet was old and dingy.  We have stayed here many times. Staff is always courteous. Some rooms are nice, some bad. Location is great. Overall pricey for quality of rooms. Would not recommend this hotel until rooms are updated, then it would be a great experience.Well, I gotta say, MY experience here was GREAT. From start to finish, everything here was outstanding. The people:  Some of the the nicest hotel staff members I've ever encountered anywhere in all my travels. Consistently helpful and smiling although I didn't have cause to "ask" for anything, much less complain. The housekeeper knocked at one point and said she'd forgotten to bring washcloths. Very nice lady.Speaking of housekeeping: The room was very clean, the bed just beautiful and inviting. Actually the bed was *extremely* comfortable. And I never sleep well (hardly at all, really) in hotels, whether "high-end" or lower-end. Here I slept VERY well -- both nights. Truly amazing. I can hear a twig snap a mile away. Seriously. And I did not hear "noise" through "thin" walls, or anywhere else. The AC was actually cold enough for me, too.View: Stunning views of the historical area and the river for the Fourth of July fireworks. A Starbucks in the the lobby with a very friendly and efficient barista who actually listened to the drink order and made it perfectly every time. Room Location: This was not the "penthouse" or anything, lest you think I paid a top price or something and got a special deal. It was an upper corner room, true. But we didn't ask for that. We are not royalty or with the Hilton management team or anything. Just regular people who booked a room! The check in was easy, fast. So was checkout. Amenities: No problems with the elevators being "slow" or anything else, either. On a crazy-busy holiday weekend, too. Ice machine working, everything working in the room. The water pressure in the shower blasted. Better than mine at home.One tiny gripe: The wi-fi in the room was free but very slow. Perhaps the router was too weak to reach our room, because the wi-fi in the lobby was fine.So. As they say, YMMV. But this was my honest experience at the DeSoto and, based on this experience, I wouldn't hesitate to return. Thanks to all the staff and management. Job well done!Came here for brunch on Sunday morning and the food was delicious! I loved that they offered a good range of breakfast and lunch items including a carving station for prime rib or make to order omelettes. They did have some desserts there, however they were not too appealing after eating breakfast food. The staff was courteous and checked on our party of  more than 50 people numerous times to see if we needed any extra beverages during the course of our meal. It was a nice location right across from one of the squares and easily accessible via horse drawn carriages or walking through the beautiful historic district.Great location- room unimpressed, appeared in need of a serious renovation and "moldy". Did have a Starbucks in lobby, gym sucked. Again great location and that is it . Very "moldy" everywhere in room, gym. Company paid for my room, no way I would ever spend 1.00 to stay there.Stayed here over memorial day and the hotel was not too bad. It's dated and mostly not in a charming way. Rooms need some renovation, because whatever renovations they've undergone previously were done very poorly. The breakfast was excellent and free if you are diamond of course. The dining room for breakfast is gorgeous!It was disappointing to get a downgrade on our room rather than a Diamond upgrade. We had one night booked for corner room and one for regular (don't ask me, hilton reservations department was incapable as always). Upon arrival, they downgraded both nights to a regular as they could not give us a corner room for both nights and I did not want to switch rooms. What a joke!Anyways, this hotel was a great reminder of why I started staying in Starwood now for work. With hilton, you earn up points and status, but rarely get an upgrade or at least a notable upgrade.Not the typical Hilton experience we have grown accustomed to as Hilton Honors members...our room was bare, no fridge, no microwave, small television - when we called to request a fridge and microwave we were informed only certain rooms have them (despite initially being told one could be brought to our room).  This may seem trivial to some, but my family rarely finishes restaurant meals and we had to toss all our leftovers over our three day stay.  The front desk claimed this was because they are a full-service hotel, however, full-service usually means full amenities and convenience.  Definitely not worth the exorbitant price.  The pool was not heated, and in mid October, a heated pool is needed in GA.  The location was convenient.Here I am at the end of my stay at the hotel. I have never been happier to leave somewhere. Let me start off by saying that a room "upgrade" means you get the same room but with a balcony. I had to change rooms because of fleas in the bed. After getting a "upgrade" I noticed the room smelled better. After the flea incident they gave me free breakfast coupons so I decided to jump on the offer. It was decent and had a buffet that was quite nice. Definitely the best thing they had. The new room starting having AC problems and was so hot we couldn't sleep. After the guy came and fixed it it came down slightly and felt better. I would've given this place 0 stars if I could. Please,Don't do it.Great location and the staff is wonderful!Unfortunately the walls are paper thin!!  The first night we were there we got a noise complaint at 8pm.  To say we were SHOCKED would be an understatement because we were only in our room about 15 minutes and were just talking.  The last day we were awoken by our neighbors just before 9am.  Their singing could only be compared to a Rebecca Black impersonation contest.  Apparently another guest in the hotel complained because we could hear their conversation with the front desk over their noise complaint!!!Trying to get an elevator to go down while staying on one of the lower levels is virtually impossible.  We were on the third floor and mostly used the steps.  When trying to check out with our luggage, it took us about half an hour to get down to the lobby.  The best suggestion I have is to go UP in order to go DOWN.  Otherwise, you will sit and wait forever for any room to squeeze in!If you're looking for a convenient place to stay and don't mind being as quiet as a mouse while you're there, this place is for you!Beautiful welcoming lobby. We really enjoyed the convenience of the valet. Staff was friendly, personable, professional, and happy to share their knowledge or the area with us. Savannah tour information is available in the lobby via a representative. Tickets may be purchased there as well. Great location and only about 15 mins waking distance from the river. I really enjoyed the central air system as it has a heat/ cool option whereas other hotels just have varying degrees of cool air. Only cons:  The bathroom could have been a little cleaner and the shower temperature is dangerous going from a set temperature to burning hot for no reason I could find. The  building exterior could really use some love! This building is an eyesore compared to the historically beautiful architecture found around town.Let's just list the points:1) good rooms.  Larger than most in the historic district, clean and comfy.2) elegance, class, and location!! Yes.yes.yes!3) the views.  THE VIEWS.  Best in the HD!Pros: perfect location; great friendly staff.Cons: VERY thin walls, you will hear your next door neighbor sneeze!  Not the most comfortable bed and low pressure shower. We had couple appetizers at the hotel bar...SKIP eating there..food was flavorless!Wonderful location, friendly staff. Great breakfast with omelette station. Rooms need updating, one out of three elevators working with 15 minute wait to get to lobby to check out--disappointing that no Hilton managers stepped up to manage issue.Stayed here one night on the way for vacation to FL. No street parking, unless your lucky. Parking is in the garage and $25 per night. Must be taken in by valet. Room was super small. The beds were comfy, but the pillows were too soft for me. I used 3 and still sunk to the mattress. The TV channels barely worked. Most were fuzzy. The bathroom was super small. The water pressure was horrible. The shower handle was backwards so hot was cold, etc. after walking around we stopped at the hotel shop to pick up some waters....$3.50 each! Wow. Will not stay here again.Great location, not so great hotel.  First, our AC didn't work.  After a few hours of calling the front desk they finally sent a guy up who said "there is so much dust in the vent" that he couldnt get it to work.   So they put us in a new room at 10pm.  Then we saw a roach crawling up the bed, one of those small german roaches.  Also found a dirty fake nail in the bathtub.  The whole place was just dirty.  The breakfast was horrible and over priced. Dont be fooled by the pretty lobby and friendly staff, this place is no good.Not sure why the bad reviews?!  The service here is amazing!!  Check-in took less than 5 minutes, requested a rollaway and it was brought up immediately.  The front desk called 10 minutes after the request to make sure the rollaway made it.  The rooms are super clean, great location, amazing views!   Walking distance from great restaurants and bars and the Savannah museums.  I would highly recommend!  Roof top pool a plus for our 3 year old :). We travel monthly and stay in other Hilton and also SPG hotels; I'm still puzzled as to why people have rated this poorly...Before our stay at the Hilton Savannah DeSoto, we viewed the Hilton as quality. Our last stop at the end of a long trip, we were looking forward to rest and relaxation in a beautiful, somewhat luxurious Hilton room. What we got at this hotel seemed more on par for a hotel less than half what we paid for it and surely something without the Hilton name. Just a few things we encountered during our two night stay:- Too tall for shower. At 5'10" and 6'1", my husband and I hit our heads during every shower. So cramped. - Terrible water pressure that went down to almost nothing several times in one shower. - Just two towels. Just two towels was tight when we wanted to take a second shower before housekeeping came. - Dirty. One of our two washcloths fell on floor and was immediately unusable because it was covered in dust. - No pool towels. We visited the pool Saturday morning to find no pool towels stocked. We checked again at the end of the pool visit and still no towels. Had to walk back to the room to grab our used bath towels. - Seat broken. The lounge chair we chose near the pool was broken (usable but the seat back was wobbly). - Clock 90 minutes off in room. Would expect to not have to change the time right after checking in. - Non stop running toilet. All hours of the day and night, our toilet would loudly run. We had to keep the bathroom door shut so it wouldn't wake us. - Thin walls and constant loud noises.- Elevator takes forever to go anywhere. Don't do it.This hotel is right in line with a city that feels like you're stepping back in time. Service was excellent from start to finish. Our room, 1208, was a nice size, well cared for, and had a balcony. The decor is reminiscent of a boutique hotel and didn't feel like the mass-produced laminate junk at most major chain hotels. Style? Southern colonial. After arriving and settling in, we headed downstairs for a cocktail before walking a few blocks for dinner. I'm not familiar enough with the city to say much on the location, but we were able to make due without a  cab, which was nice.After dinner we had drinks next door at The Public and then headed back to the room. The city noise is clear even on the 12th floor but it didn't bother me. We stayed here for one night to break up a drive to Florida, and I'm very happy with the value we got for the price.I want to start off by saying that this hotel has a perfect location.   Tourists can walk everywhere in the historic district from there.  However, there are some goods and bads, aside from the location, that should be considered.  Goods: city view, clean pool, friendly valet/front desk.  Bads: mildew in shower (wear shower shoes) I dropped my soap and just left it...you don't want to touch the dirty floor,  not friendly bell-hop  (he want even ours!), four people were booked into a double room with only a king sized bed; when addressed, previous to arrival, was told a two bed  room should be available to switch (didn't happen).  Maids left bags of laundry outside of our room all evening and night,  and the walls after very thin. NOT what you'd expect from a Hilton hotel.This hotel is really well situated in the historic district, just a couple of blocks from Oglethorpe Square.  The hotel itself was obviously built in the 60s and doesn't really fit in well with the architecture of tge historic district.  Fortunately the hotel has been remodeled.I met my husband here after he had already been at a conference for a couple of days. This room was not ideal and needed some repairs.  The slider to the balcony was off track; some wallpaper was peeling in the bathroom; and the bed was messed up. We asked them to fix the bed, but it wasn't done properly. The front desk moved us immediately to another room with no fuss. The next room was much better with everything in working order. The people at the front desk remembered my husband and I when we passed through the lobby and asked how our new room was working out. We really appreciated the good customer service.So far, so bad.  To a hotel manager that is reading this:  here's how to accommodate weary guests - be considerate.  When someone checks in, and they tell you they've been on a redeye, it's your job to be mindful of this.  Meaning, yes, we got in earlier than the suggested check-in, but what your protocol should be is to prioritize the order in which the rooms are cleaned.  When I went to the floor that you said our room would be on (an hour later), and I see the maid cleaning OTHER rooms instead of the one you directed us to: you either switch us to one of those cleaned rooms OR YOU HAVE YOIR MAID PRIORITIZE THE ROOM FOR THE PEOPLE THAT HAVE COME IN ON A RED EYE AND ARE WAITING.  To make matters worse, try to wait at the bar and grab a bite and coffee and am told 'the bar opens at 1' when its 12:53?? Really?   I'm usually a Hilton fan, but not here.  Strong dislike.
review_content_40: We got this room as a hatwire hort rate, but the standard price is 239.00.  I would be appalled if we received a room like this one for 239!!  The room itself was horrible.  We were put in a handicap room w/o requesting it which means no tub.  Walls are paper thin and we can hear the elevator ding each time it stops on our floor.  The room smells a bit like smoke too.  The furniture is in bad shape, and the table lamp has a short in it.  Very disappointed.  Room was the only issue.  :(Great rooms, love the views!! The concierge however was not helpful at all and acted as if we were being an inconvenience! But super affordable for the location.Awful !!! I have stayed in $40.00 a night hotel that was cleaner and nicer than this one .. First room we checked into our child complained of bites on his legs and after looking on the bed we spotted what we think was fleas jumping around on the bed . The musty smell of the room should have been a warning sign but what do you expect for $239.00 a night ...after complaining we were offered to move to another room and gladly excepted and even gave us a free breakfast buffet " Lucky Me" .. The next room was a little cleaner and less worn but had issues with air condition ... As for the location I have heard rave reviews of the Historical District which is beautiful but lots of homeless people and sketchy people so was concerned about walking around with the family...Can't wait to get out of here and our bad hotel experience made our trip less enjoyable ..Very nice location. Close to everything.  Clean rooms, comfortable beds, good food in the restaurant,  but the staff made the stay even better. The staff was friendly, accomodating, & very professional. Nice views in every room I went into, & some of the rooms have balconies. Get for cigar smokers like me. The bathrooms inside the guest rooms are very small and so is the swimming pool. The gym facilities had state of the art equipment, but not enough of them. You have to use their valet service because they do not offer self parking, but the valet staff were courteous and fast. In a three day stay, I never waited long for my vehicle...& they didn't rob me of my change in the cup holder!For the business traveler, this hotel is adequate. For a vacationing family, maybe not so much. All around decent hotel for Savannah.The Hilton DeSoto is a tired old hotel with a staff to match.  I am a Marriott Platinum member and only stayed here because we were in town for a wedding and the wedding party was staying here.  I'm used to much better service at Marriott's.  Started off by (valet only parking) valet parking.  The attendant wouldn't help get the luggage out of the car.  She went over the car noting every tiny speck of a paint ding as if I were threatening to take her to court over car damage.  Similar experience on the way out - she stared at my luggage with the trunk opened as if it were a UFO until she finally muttered she wouldn't pick it up.  Has NEVER EVER happened in a Marriott before and I probably have close to 1000 nights in hotels for business and pleasure.  The rooms were clean enough but small, including the bathroom - very small.  The front desk folks normally shook their head one way or the other rather than answering questions with words.  Seemed like we were a bother to them.  Other members of the wedding party were treated rudely by the folks at the front desk.   And there was an issue with being put into rooms that were already occupied.  Bar staff was hit or miss; some good service mixed in with head nods and rude behavior, again, as if we being a bother to them rather than a guest.  Rooms came in at about $200 a night - no way worth it.  I do not recommend the DeSoto and if we had to do it again I'd stay somewhere else, wedding party or not.Old, but... Nice and clean.  Very friendly.  Check in and check out was awesome.  Will come back!Pros: location, super friendly staffCons: almost everything else (for the price)First off, we only paid government rate, so at least we didn't pay as much as some people pay for this hotel room which can only justify charging so much because of its location.The pillow cases were dirty when we arrived. They had make-up stains and other miscellaneous stains, so we got most of them replaced, but we're pretty sure that's where my wife got pink eye.The tub would not drain quickly enough, so we were standing in ankle deep water within three minutes of showering. We asked them to fix it, they said they did, they did not. If anything it got worse after they "fixed" it.They want $10 a day for wifi, even though my reservation said it was included. (Fortunately, there was a super nice lady that gave me a promo code and it got it for free; that's how they earned their second star)And they want $20 a day for vallet parking (no other parking available), and most other people said it took a really long time to get their car. Fortunately, our car had a roof rack so it stayed on the street and we didn't have to wait. Also, the vallet folks were also very nice while they made people wait. Long story short; if you're staying 1-2 nights, don't have a car, and get a drastically reduced rate then it is a great location, as long as you don't spend a ton of time in your room. Otherwise, there are better places to stay for a lot less.Wow.......such a disappointment for this hotel to be a Hilton! I am a loyal Hilton Honors Member and have never stayed at a Hilton with such low standards. No dusting at all was done (must show you a picture of what I found when I lifted the breakfast menu....OMG) on top of all the cleanness need the room is extremely small for which a guest pays. The best part of my stay was when the gentleman help us to our room making us feel welcomed! I will not be returning here and for others who are planning to come here should be aware of misleading pictures.The most ghetto hotel I have ever stayed in..... Had people on my floor all night loud and inconsiderate for who are sleeping. This is also non-smoking hotel who ever it was smoking.....this night has been unbelievable!I absolutely do not recommend this hotel. Upon our arrival we were met by the valet. However no one else arrived to assist us. I had to ask for a Bellman's Cart and they eventually brought me one. I loaded and transported my luggage which  to me not a big deal BUT, I though I had booked a full service hotel. Okay, I am a big boy and can move my families belongings and so I did. Now after we arrived inside I essentially had to break up a lovely conversation between the two ladies behind the counter. Now I was able to get checked in and headed up to our room. Again, no Bellman, not even an offer for one. Okay,so we are in the room and noticed there is no way to close the door without slamming it. Sorry neighbors, you have to slam the door to close it. Speaking of doors the bathroom door will not close fully and always stayed cracked open a bit. Okay, we are not a prudish bunch no big deal. The room was damp really damp. It felt like a sauna but cool if that makes sense. The condensation accumulates over you in the shower giving you quite a thrill when the ice cold water hits your back. Oh and the mold on the curtain was a lovely shade of dark green if not black. The water on the floor under the HVAC vent made for yet another thrill if you are barefoot. Now back to the rest of the good stuff. Pubic hair was found in the tub, on the counter and in a bed. Oh and the beds, Uncle Fester would love them. If you need a firm mattress bring it with you.  I almost forgot the bar is nice and the beer is cold. The coffee shop serves Starbucks but they are not one and it shows. Not the best coffee and certainly not up to the name they display "Starbucks".The balcony was nice and the TV worked well.Checkout was the reverse of checking in. While very nice and polite the counter staff are very lacking in proper training for a full service hotel. I informed the staff I was checking out and yet no one made an offer of assistance. So after paying my bill I asked for a Bellman's Cart.  I found a bellman and eventually asked if I could use his cart. I of course dropped several obvious clues of my pending departure. The lack of intellect perhaps prevented any of them catching on.I loaded up and then went in search of my keys which the Valet had. Finally one person who wanted to do their job.  So if you stay at the Desoto Hilton in Savannah, I can honestly say the Valet service is quite good. The TV has lots of HBO for you to not see while working or out having fun and if you get a balcony you get a great view of the pool, the HVAC roof tops units  (RTU)  Awesome. I would not recommend this hotel and its a shame too. I have been a Hilton member for years and travel a great deal. Maybe motel 6 is more in line with the brand they need to display than Hilton.I know Desoto 6 at least they will leave a light on for you :)I just returned from a very pleasant 2 night stay at the hilton desoto. Great location. An easy walk to the river.  The room was clean, cool and very comfortable.  The bed was perfect.  Beautiful view of the river and city from the 12th floor.  Highly recommend this hotel.We stayed here for a business trip/mini family vacation. Rooms were nice. Beds were comfortable. Pillows left something to be desired, so next time I'd bring my own. The shower was bad - the lever to change the water from coming out of the shower head to the spout was broken so when I gave my son baths u just had to wait and wait while the tub slowly filled via the shower head. And the temp of the water changed a lot during my shower, but maybe that's due to there being people in other rooms showering at the same time. I don't know. Sometimes it would get scorching hot though. The staff however was extremely friendly and helpful. The valet was great. $25/day is crazy expensive though... That's plus tips. I don't mind tipping since I used to wait tables, but it adds up on top of the $25/day fee for parking. The hotel was beautiful and in a great location. Lots of restaurants, parks, shops, etc nearby. We would stay again.I don't have much to say about the Hilton except that I was here as a member of a wedding party.Staff/valet was friendly and attentive, food was excellent, and the room was clean and comfortable with a great city view.Definitely a nice place to stay.  It's not right on the water, but it's all so close because Savannah isn't that big that it doesn't matter.  Stay a little inland here and save some money.This hotel's style isn't exactly my taste. But it's the Hilton's take on the southern comfort style. And it was comfortable. I got the king bedroom with a view of the city. It was a great view. The room was not that big but the gigantic window helped to open the space up. The bathroom was tiny but well decorated. They have all the shower perks but no toothpaste. There's a CVS up Bull Street so you can help yourself. So the room isn't anything impressive. However, there's two great things about this hotel: the location and the service. The hotel is on Bull Street, you get to take a short walk up towards the main shopping area while crossing all the squares. Then south of it you're right across the street from SCAD's admission office where you can take a tour of the school. The service is excellent. I sent a print job of my boarding passes from my computer to the main desk. For somehow reason it didn't print. The guy at the main desk went online and printed them for me himself, which was not something I would expect them to do. I came here on a taxi from the airport. It's a tiny relieve to see there's always taxis waiting outside so you can take off whenever you are ready, without flipping the yellow pages.An excellent stay. The room was spacious and very clean. Great staff that is very professional, courteous and friendly. Walking distance to a lot of Savannah and a great bar in the hotel with a hummus plate that is addicting. The third to last stop in 3 months on the road with the book tour in only Hilton's...This is one of the top ones of the entire tour across the US.The guest services including front desk, valet, and housekeeping deserve 5 stars.  Location is 4.5 stars.  What makes this hotel an overall 3 are the rooms. They are small and dated. Not what I expected for 149 per night. Shower head is poor. Handle was loose and water got cold unless I moved handle back to previous position.  Bed was ok. Not great though. Bathroom small. Rooms are just not upTo date with the lobby or the staff. Overall it's just ok.I wanted to specifically review our dining experience at the DeSoto Grille. We ate the breakfast buffet there for two mornings and I couldn't be happier. It was free (two meal tickets per day for your room) but I would even consider going back if I had to pay. The buffet is $16.00 which is expensive but the buffet contains a full area of fresh fruits (blueberries, blackberries, strawberries, cantaloupe, honeydew melon, and pineapple.) All are delicious and not the typical "fruit like cocktail". Other things like bacon, sausage, eggs (and plain egg whites!) grits, oatmeal, muffins, toast, turkey bacon, corned beef hash, and french toast are included. You can request pancakes, waffles, and custom omelettes and they will bring them to you fresh and to order. A selection of juices, teas and coffee are included and available as well. The best part in my opinion was the smoked salmon that is on the buffet. It was so yummy and definitely something that I have never seen on a breakfast buffet. Our server was very nice and accommodating as well. I recommend this place and will be going back next time I am there.We finally made it to Savannah and decided to crash in our hotel room for a while after a long drive.  Our stay was pleasant and the hotel was accommodating to our needs.  It was convenient and within walking district to almost everything in downtown Savannah.  The room was clean and was supplied with free coffee and water bottles each day of the visit.  If you're one that has to have internet, the wi-fi is complimentary for guests.  They have a restaurant, bar, pool with a tiki bar, and valet parking at the hotel.  It's worth the price to pay for the parking since it can be expensive to park anywhere in the city.  I would definitely stay here again if I return to the area in the future.While I am not sure about the staff's recommendations of local babysitting services, they have only been friendly and cordial while I stayed here.  I have chosen to stay here on each of my visits to Savannah because I enjoy the location of the hotel. . . it is quite, full of small shops/restaurants, and a nice coffee shop across the street.  While river street can be fun, I really like the fact that the hotel is away from all the noise of the touristy river street and paula deans restaurant.  However, the Hilton DeSoto is only about 10 streets (10 minute walk) from the river street if you really need to get back there after a nap. The hotel itself seems to be quite old.  The lobby is in fairly good shape, but obviously an old design.  As mentioned above, the staff were great and always said hello as we walked by and made sure we were having a good time.  Be forewarned that they do charge $16 for self-parking and I would imagine several dollars more if you chose to use their valet service.  In terms of the rooms, I have stayed in a room with a king size bed each time which has been extremely comfortable.  The bathroom is outdated, however, the shower pressure was some of the best I have ever experienced (almost knocked me over at first).  Overall I am a fan of the hotel, but will knock it down to 2 stars for the $16 parking fee and outdated rooms, but bump it up to 4 stars for the quiet location and friendly staff.Nice hotel in a quiet, almost residential location.  Property has a bit of character and is very clean.  Staff friendly and helpful.  I personally liked the room decor, done in cool blues rather than standard hotel beige.  Bed and pillows not as comfortable as ones we enjoyed at the Hyatt though.Location wasn't my favorite.  If this hotel was on or closer to the river, it may have been at least one more star, possibly two.  It's a doable walk (13 blocks) to the river and the more touristy things to do.  Not much in the hotel neighborhood itself in terms of bars or restaurants, just one or two of each.  We did have some difficulty getting a cab one night that caused us to be late for and almost miss a birthday dinner reservation.Valet service (an additional $20 per night - ouch!) distinguished themselves though.  We stayed for three nights.  On the second day, we took the car out to go exploring and the valets noticed that something had dripped on the car during its time in their garage.  By the time we checked out (it took some coordination as we wanted to use the car while we were there), valet staff had the car detailed and pristine.Would I stay there again?  Likely yes.Perfect location! Walking distance to just about everything. Stayed here for Thanksgiving weekend. When we arrived the room we chose wasn't available so they gave us an upgraded larger room. We had a balcony with a great city view of the bridge. The rooms were clean. Great soap products and I usually hate them all. They were so good I didn't need to use my own. This NEVER happens. The staff was fantastic! Southern hospitality at it's best. Great restaurants within walking distance along with a market one block away that has anything you could possibly need. No need to stay on River street. My husband and I liked this neighborhood much better than the crowded River street hotels.
review_content_60: Expected more from a Hilton. On the positive: Staff was very good but very small. On the negative: Little things are annoying: The mandatory valet. My complaint is not due to the cost, which is competitive at $20, but the necessity. I like having easy access to my vehicle, valet service makes this difficult. The Bell hop brought an empty luggage cart into a crowded elevator, generally not something you see in a proper hotel. Air Freshener smell in the lobby is quite bad.
